Review_Text: Beautifully presented very helpful hosts and staff impeccable service. Just can't fault this lovely Riad. Well located for walking to the square. Lovely (although small) pool. Absolutely spotless. Would go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jan N wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: I can't give enough accolades to this riad and its staff. I loved the whole experience and I look forward to a return visit in the near future. Every single one of the staff was accommodating friendly and ever helpful. The public spaces including the courtyard library and pool area were perfect and I loved my room with a little private courtyard. The bar was fab and the restaurant was lovely with wonderful breakfasts and excellent evening fare. In my opinion this is THE place to book for your stay in Marrakech.    Jan Nix

Being met by the friendly helpful Nora the manager with mint tea in the oasis that is Les Borgs de la Kasbah set the tone for a fantastic visit to Marrakech! It is a haven set away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The staff are all extremely helpful and very friendly. Nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast is amazing and sets you up for the day! The rooms are perfect comfortable and have all that you need. Great to relax around the heated pool late afternoon. The spa facilities are great and the hammam and massage were a real treat. But it will be the friendliness of the management and staff that stand out. Will definitely be back to Morocco and be staying in Les Borgs de la Kasbah again. Thank you

Review_Date: Jan L wrote a review Mar 8
Review_Title: A Fantastic Riad with a Great Restaurant
Review_Text: Fabulous! We last visited Borjs de la Kasbah in 2008 and were delighted to find the Riad as good as we remember it 15 years ago!    The director/owners Tom and Nora were delightful and a mine of information. The staff were fantastic always cheerful and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble.    We decided to go half board this time (we ate street food during the day on our walks around Marrakesh) and were very glad that we did as all the food we had in the restaurant was delicious. We would definitely recommend it. Breakfast was also great with a lovely selection of bread cereals and made to order pancakes omelettes etc.    The Riad arranged a walking guide for us and we also did a cookery course in the kitchens which was great fun. I will be trying out the menu on my friends next week!  I must also mention the spa where I had one of the best facials I've ever had.    The room was very comfortable. Our only (minor) complaint would be that the lights were a bit gloomy but apart from that it was great.    Overall a 5 out of 5 week and we would not hesitate to recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cheryl M wrote a review Mar 5
Review_Title: A warm and welcoming stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Although the weather was not great we had a wonderful 5 days in Marrakech. The hotel and all its staff were so welcoming the room spectacular. All the outdoor areas were beautiful and beautifully kept but we also enjoyed the TV space and the library. The highlight for me was the cooking experience- chef was brilliant we learnt a lot about Moroccan cooking and then got to eat it too! Would recommend to anyone

Review_Date: Tim S wrote a review Mar 5
Review_Title: Quiet peaceful spot to explore the chaos of the medina
Review_Text: We had a lovely couple of days at les borjs. It’s a lovely peaceful setting with a great breakfast heated pool friendly and helpful staff.    Felt very safe for our toddler and a great launchpad to explore Marakech. We’ll definitely be back!!

Review_Title: The perfect hotel. Marrakech at its best.
Review_Text: I’ve stayed here five times and will again. It’s beautiful. Everywhere you look is attractive immaculate clean a joy.    The staff are welcoming and appear to genuinely want to help. My son leaving at 5.30 am? How about coffee brought to your room and a bag of food for the journey? We want lunch at 11.30 am? Of course - what would you like? My husband’s birthday? A special table setting cake candles and staff singing happy birthday.    The food is freshly prepared and delicious. The spa a haven. We love sitting by the pool or in the flower filled courtyard lit by candles and lanterns at night.    Thank you Tom and Nora for helping us create more happy memories.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pam M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Calm in madness of the medina.
Review_Text: We booked this Riad based on TA reviews. It is everything I expected and more. From arrival to departure I don’t think the staff under the watchful eye of Nora could do anything more to make our stay comfortable.    The Riad itself is beautifully decorated rooms very comfortable and exceptionally clean. The spa which I used on many occasions was fabulous. Hadisha is the most amazing therapist.    I cannot thank Nora enough for making us feel welcome and for going above and beyond. Nothing was too much trouble. A shout out to the wonderful Rabi on reception also he always greeted us with a smile.    I cannot recommend Les Borjs de La Kasbah enough.

Review_Title: A 'Second Home' I call it. Coming Home to High End Hospitality.
Review_Text: My first visit to this Boutique Hotel was 2009 and my last was last week.    In-between I must have stayed over 20 times hence the title of this current review. Before pandemic I would bring 15 people each year to a Wellness Breathwork Retreat I led in the Conference space at Les Borjs as well as visiting for leisure so I am familiar with what is on offer. Every time I visit it looks pristine with regular refurbishments. Tom & Nora do not rest on their laurels ( and laurels in terms of professional accolades are aplenty ) they constantly aim for top notch upgrading of rooms and public areas.    I haven't been back since 2019 held back by health and pandemic but last week felt like they are in constant refresh and observation exactly how a high end boutique hotel continues to succeed. I particularly loved the new courtyards seating painted pots and cushions with the Nora touch of welcome. Nothing lacked attention. Fresh as a daisy.    This includes superb long standing staff always on top of things welcoming helpful at Reception always available for the smallest request. We ate in the hotel some nights highly recommended fine dining at ease with impeccable service. Plus being greeted by the familiar face of Sharif at Marrakech Airport and swiftly taken to our hotel in 15 mins was truly 'coming home' to high end hospitality.    Having been back so many times and recommended so many friends to try Les Borjs ( I took 2 this visit and they were bowled over first day! ) we are already planning our return so 5 Stars all round to Les Borjs de la Kasbah.

Review_Date: Leo F wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: I travelled to marrakech for a few nights to experience their food culture hospitality and I certainly wasn't left disappointedI was staying in a gem of a hotel and that's why I'm on tripadvisor.com to be honestI had the pleasure of staying in Les borjs de la kasbah a five star gem of a hotel with its location perfect only minutes walk from the main square The hotel is owned by a beautiful couple Tom and Nora and from the minute I checked in from reception restaurant loungeout door facilities spabedroom's are as five star as you will get Tom and Nora lead from The top down their attention to detail in their magnificent hotel is to be admired front of house couldn't do enough for you restaurant breakfast lobbylounge areas executive lounge for a little night capis high end five star as you will receive in any city around this beautiful world we live inTom and Nora main objective is for their guests to receive the best five star service facilities accommodation hospitality at its very best and their team of staff seems like one happy familyye made my experience in beautiful marrakech very special and I hope if people read this or see this if ye are travelling to marrakech check this place outits an absolute gem and the owner's have travelled the world and brought all their experience from different countries and put it all together in this beautiful piece of heaven sorry if I've gone on but gems like this don't come round that offen and I'll promise you it will make you and yours a trip and memories you shall never forget last but not least a big thank you Tom and Nora and your wonderful team for making my trip so special can't wait to go back kindest regards leo finngalway Ireland 🇮🇪

Review_Date: Lobster J wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: BK Les Borjs de la Kesbah
Review_Text: My first visit to Marrakech and what an amazing time it was! My stay at BK Les Borjs de la Kesbah was simply outstanding. Beautiful hotel staffed by such friendly helpful and genuinely kind people. It's a unique magical place to stay....the interior is a holiday in itself! Pure luxury! Look forward to another stay. Thank you!    Patrick.

Review_Date: Laura G wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: A wonderful experience at this beautiful hotel. Ideally located for exploring the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh but magically becoming a tranquil retreat on entry to the hotel. Amazing friendly staff.

Review_Date: Lia Gieling wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Les Borjs was just a small paradise/oasis in crowded Marrakech, with fantastic staff, wonderful breakfast and much more
Review_Text: After a warm welcome with tea and cookies we saw our room that was fantastic with rose leaves on the bed and floor and much more. Host/Manager Nora explained us a lot about Marrakech and surroundings and was more than helpful after having a medical issue. We had diner twice in the riad and the food like breakfast in the morning was really delicious. I just can write in superlatives about this riad.

Review_Date: Ben C wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Our favorite stay in Marrakech by far!
Review_Text: This hotel is a major reason we keep coming back to Marrakech! The attention to detail is not only reflected in the beautiful rooms courtyards and lounges of the hotel but also the superb staff who go above and beyond to ensure the most memorable experience. We thoroughly enjoyed the Moroccan-style New Years Eve bash (which we have attended before) and found the entertainment and food to be excellent. The highlight was all of the guests dancing in the main courtyard as the clock struck midnight. We also recommend taking advantage of the spa offerings especially the famous hammam! The various day trips organized by the hotel are also fantastic if you want to escape the chaos of Marrakech. We loved our trip to the Ourika Valley! All in all it is always a treat coming to Les Borjs De La Kasbah and we could not recommend it enough to anyone seeking a luxury stay within walking distance to all major attractions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As always a brilliant time was had by all in this delightful oasis. The ambiance at the Borjs is unique where you’re welcomed and immediately feel like family. Can’t wait to come back again. Highly recommend! Merci Nora and Tom!

Review_Date: Virginie C wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Brilliant New Year's Eve celebration. Wonderful entertainment : fire eater belly dancers local  musicians and mesmerizing musician.  The staff were very attentive and bravo to Tom and Nora for organizing a very special event.

Review_Title: Faultless hotel and service in a perfect location.
Review_Text: If you're wanting a warm welcome from wonderful staff and helpful and considerate owners... this is the place. If you're wanting to stay in a gentle peaceful oasis within the real vibrant colourful Marrakech... this is the place. Beautiful hotel perfect service comfortable rooms calm and pleasant atmosphere. They have a gorgeous bijou spa a pool a restaurant with lovely food a courtyard to relax in at any time under the orange trees (where you will probably be accompanied by their lovely house buntings!). You can walk 5 minutes from the quiet location into the busy bustle you came to see - good coffee houses and some great little rooftop restaurants are tucked away nearby the main square is 15-20 minutes meander but here you can come back and feel you're away from it all - the sound of the city seems to slip away completely the minute you step through the doors. We felt completely at home here and are planning to return. Seriously don't miss this boutique hotel - it is charming well situated and faultlessly managed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elfi B wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: What can I say after visiting for the fourth time: the Borsj team has absolutely become our family in Marrakech and we are always more than happy to return. The Riad radiates peace and calmness in a vivid city the staff is just exquisite and - honestly - we know every single name of these kind people owners Tom and Nora are close to their customers and care deeply about taking maximum care of your trip. The guided tours as the spa & hammam are top and so is the food! Thank you team BK!

Review_Date: Peter R wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Elegant, Intimate, 5-Star Experience in the Heart of the Medina
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah delivers an intimate five-star experience in the heart of the Medina of Marrakech. Everything about the riad is tasteful and elegant. The multi-lingual staff are over-the-top friendly and accommodating. Our room was very large and well-appointed with a King-sized bed and spacious bathroom. Breakfast was wonderful and the riad’s restaurant turned out to be an excellent choice for lunch and dinner as well. You can’t go wrong with Les Borjs: the location staff and elegant setting fulfills every visitor’s need.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: clare s wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Les Borjs is utter perfection. From the mint tea and interesting conversation on arrival to the 'nothing is too much trouble' attitude throughout our stay we felt valued cared for and relaxed the entire time. Its position is perfect the decor stunning the pool perfect and the courtyard like a slice of heaven.

Review_Date: Stella K wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Dear Nora & Tom thank you so much for a wonderful stay at Les Borjs de Kasbah. This Riad is stunning! It has been designed and decorated to reflect a true sense of the place. The furnishings and decor are simply amazing. It is a feast for the senses.  Thank you both for being so wonderful and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. The Riad serves an amazing breakfast and dinner. It has a lovely swimming pool hamman & massage facilities. This is very welcoming after a long day in the medina or sight seeing.  All of the staff are friendly courteous and professional. The rooms are amazing and decorated to a very high standard.  I would love to return to this place. It has a wonderful sense of peace and tranquility. It is so comfortable it is home from home.  Thanks again for everything and hope to see you all soon again!  Chokrane  Love & Blessings 🙏💖  Stella ✨️

Review_Date: Gareth N wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: A Fantastic haven in a city that touches all the senses!
Review_Text: Les Borjs is a superb Riad in the heart of the old Kasbah of Marrakesh offering a peaceful and tranquil haven for all guests with lovely rooms great facilities helpful staff and delicious food. The staff could not do enough for us and were on hand throughout to make our stay as special as possible. The excursions were good value and well organised and the on site Spa was a lovely touch. The sights sounds and smells of Marrakesh excite all the senses and the well appointed Riad of Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a welcome oasis in such a chaotic and exciting city. Many thanks to Tom Nora and the team for a great way to spend our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We will be back....A superb trip highly recommended....

Review_Date: Anke S wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: This was an amazing hotel with friendly personel and very good food on a perfect place.  I recommend it to everyone Specially for couples.  The hotel is very good renovated with beuatiful rooms and is very quiet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here last week of November. The riad was the perfect place to come back to after the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. V peaceful. Tom and (especially) Nora looked after us extremely well together with the rest of the staff.    Thoroughly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristof D wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Dear Nora Dear Tom    Last sunday Belgium was competing Morocco at the world cup football in Qatar. It reminded us again at our stay in Marrakesh the first two weeks of March this year.    We would like to thank you for taking so good care of us after the terrible quad accident in the Agafay desert where Inge got injured.    It took several months to completely recover and contrary to what people expect we are able to think back with great pleasure at our stay in your hotel.    In our opinion that’s completely your merit!    We appreciated your help with transport arranging an appointment with the pulmonologist providing pillows everywhere serving the most wonderful and delicious breakfast the good music the talks and kind words …    Thank you from the bottom of our heart!!    Inge and Kristof  Belgium

Review_Date: Bruce H wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Very warm  And friendly staff. The food was amazing as well. I would highly recommend this hotel . The architecture alone is stunning. The owners are amazing and talk to all the guests. Very personal touch. The courtyard is beautiful with chirping birds everywhere.

Review_Date: Pedroza O wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Borjs after a recommendation from friends - what a great recommendation!  The riad itself has been beautifully restored and is so relaxing. The staff were amazing and we were made to feel so welcome. Tom and Nora checked in with us periodically. Our room was splendid - mini-bar and decent shower.  Breakfast was really good - omelettes cooked to order - and the restaurant is excellent.  The pool was fab - I could swim lengths - heated too which was soooo nice.  It's about 15 to 20 minutes walk to the main square but there are other shops nearby.  We'll be back!

Exceptionally gracious and personal service from every member of the staff is what I will remember most about my stay at Les Borjs. They made our group feel welcome on arrival and taken care of while there. This was my favorite place to stay during a two week tour of Morocco. If in Marrakech you should experience Les Borjs hospitality as well as its beautiful rooms. It is a special place.

I usually don't leave comments unless very disappointed or as in this case extremely satisfied.  The place is clean cosy and offer everything you might expect from a nice riad. I have used all of their services and I was happy with them.  What really makes it special is the people working there.  Hamza Naoufel Nora...and I do not mention all the other people working at the restaurant breakfast and so on...so kind and so adorable that will make me come back to this riad even just to say hi. They have helped me out to sort some issues orientated me....a full 5 stars to them and a big big THANK YOU!

Review_Date: Judy O wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Fabulous Riad for our Extended Family Group Trip
Review_Text: This is our 3rd stay at Les Borgs which speaks for itself . The hotel is a small/medium sized Traditional Riad in the Medina .  It is perfect for a couple  family or small group trip . The Riad is within walking distance of the Main Square and Souks .  Once inside there is peace and tranquility and the Pool and Courtyard are perfect for relaxing and chilling after a hectic day sightseeing .The relaxing spa treatments were reasonably priced and also we ate at the hotel not only for breakfast and some lunches but also on two evenings and enjoyed super local dishes ( international also available ) with great service  The Moroccan Evening with dancers and music was especially fun .  The rooms are traditionally furnished and each one is different .  The Owners Tom and Noria and all the staff are fantastic and cannot do enough to make your stay enjoyable and stress free  they will organise trips  transfers and taxis on request .  We would certainly hope to return again next year

This is a beautiful quiet Riad situated a short stroll from all the sights sounds and smells of downtown Marrakech. All members of staff were incredibly helpful kind and friendly the breakfast was excellent and the swimming pool cool and relaxing to come back to after a day in the hustle and bustle of the city. The rooms were beautifully furnished and immaculately clean. Definitely to be recommended!

We were lucky enough to stay here for a week and what a truly special place it is.    First things first the owners Tom and Nora are two of the nicest most accommodating people you could meet - and their team are equally welcoming. Friendly professional warm - lovely people who make this place significantly more than just a fabulous Riad.    And if you want trips organised or taxis to and from the airport - no problem at all.    My teenage son had a premium room. My wife and I took a suite. The rooms are spotlessly clean large tastefully in character. Beds are supremely comfortable.    Breakfast is wonderful and full of local produce (as well as Yorkshire tea!). The restaurant which sprawls across the  courtyard of this oasis of calm serves excellent bar food local higher end offerings and homely comforts.    The pool is heated and a perfect antidote to the madness of the Kasbah and Marrakech itself. After the wonderful sensory overload from the old town sitting with a beer by the pool is perfect.    The spa and hammam are also wonderful.    The Riad is very much at the boutique end of accommodations. Homely and classy in equal measures.    We couldn’t recommend it enough. A very special find.    As an aside Nora organised a day trip to Imlil in the Atlas Mountains for a mini-trek followed by lunch at Richard Brandon’s luxury retreat Kasbah Tamadot. Kasbah Tamadot was fabulous although we had been so spoiled at Les Borjs de la Kasbah it was somewhat of an anti climax!

Review_Title: A surprising and relaxing hotel riad in the busy medina in Marrakesh.
Review_Text: Very well located. Clean spacious room with excellent en-suite facilities. The swimming pool was a bonus as were the relaxing communal areas. A wide range of very tasty food was served at breakfast and any time of the day. All the staff were very friendly and helpful with any requests. Thank you to Tom the manager his family and all the staff for helping us to enjoy our 5 day break in Marrakesh.

Everything was simply amazing highly recommended will always be my hotel in Marakash… all best and best greetings to the whole staff u were so lovely and sweet. For the people who are looking for a cozy place to have wonderful stay this hotel should be your first choice

Review_Date: Elene V wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: A real oasis in the heart of Marrakech!
Review_Text: If you are looking for a place to relax from the hustle and bustle of the city this is the place to be! This beautiful riad gave us an instant feeling of home with an excellent hotel service and a personal touch. From the moment we arrived we felt comfortable relaxed and they took care for everything. We got a very warm welcome with some Moroccon thea and the owner gave us some recommendations about sightseeing Marrakech. They also offer various activities and trips wich we found very useful. We booked multiple trips through the hotel and we were very satisfied. The hotel is a beautiful place and has this warm Moroccan feeling. The city of Marrakech was very busy for us so the hotel was the perfect place to relax. The owners are very friendly and warm people they make sure you are enjoying your stayings in Morocco. The hotel staff were aswell very friendly and offered an excellent service! The food was delicious and there was a wide choice of the breakfast buffet every morning. Everything was very clean and the room was perfect for us. We couldn't have made a better choice for ou stayings!

Review_Date: PA M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: This Riad is just the perfect place to sit and relax after exploring the souks. The pool is so clean and big enough for a proper swim. The staff are excellent and the hotel is perfect. The food is simply delicious and there is such a lovely relaxing atmosphere. We shall most definitely be coming back here to stay next time we come to Marrakesh!

Review_Date: Jo B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Fabulous place to stay - would definitely recommend
Review_Text: This hotel is gorgeous - a piece of calm in the chaos of Marrakech. The staff are helpful and engaging the rooms and the courtyards remind you where you are - not just in a faceless hotel which could be anywhere in the world. The pool is a genius addition so nice to sit around after a long day taking in the sights. Tom and Nora take the time to chat and impart helpful advice on how to get the best of your time there. We absolutely loved it!

Super week at this tranquil hotel. Staff exceptional making sure you have all that you need. Tom and Nora regularly available to assist with any requirements. Enjoyed the on site hammam and the cookery class.  Pool was refreshing after busy mornings exploring. The rooms clean and very comfortable. Breakfast tasty and lots of choice. Highly recommend this hotel and hope to be back!

Excellent hotel in excellent location in old Marrakesh. Beautiful decor with attention to details. Whole experience is like home away from home. We loved the welcome of petals decorating our bed the excellent breakfasts especially the wonderful omelets prepared by Mariam. All staff is extremely welcoming and make you feel the utmost attention. Very recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We truly had an amazing stay at Les Borsj De La Kasbah. The riad has everything you need. Great location (15 min walk to Jemaa El-Fna) nice room lovely breakfast (with Moroccan specialities) great restaurant to have dinner swimming pool spa... The staff was so sweet and helpful. We would 100 % recommend a stay here to discover beautiful Marrakech.

Review_Date: Mary L B wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I stayed at Les Borjs de le Kasbah 11 years ago with some friends and vowed to go back with my family and finally did last week - and it didn't disappoint. We were welcomed with the same friendly professionalism (and mint tea). The air conditioned elegant rooms and cool of the pool were an oasis of calm away from the blistering heat and busy streets of the Kasbah. Breakfast is plentiful and the dinner options are good value and beautifully cooked. I had 2 massage treatments (booked at short notice) which were wonderful My sons will be cross with me for leaving a review as they want to keep this place just for us! Thank you Tom and Nora and team for looking after us

This is for sure one of the best hotel where we have ever been and not only because it's absolutely beautiful but for the whole background and atmosphere you will live if you stay here.  We have spent 3 fantastic days here warmly welcomed by Tom and Nora (the two owners) who have introduced ourselves their treasure yes because it's so!  Each room has its own personality you can wander around this old and stunning place surrounded by picturesque spots where your camera will litterally get crazy!  Every single detail is at the right place!  You will love everything from the excellent breakfast to the romantic dinner in the riad's yard!  The best part for our kids and not only has been for sure the stunning swimming pool in a real oasis of peace for your soul and mind.  Located not far from Jeema el Fna Square that you reach in a very nice walk this is for sure the best hotel in Marrakech!

Review_Title: Perfect retreat from the madness of Marrakesh
Review_Text: I don’t normally leave reviews but felt Les Borjs de La Kasbah deserved one. We stayed in room 303 which was absolutely perfect such a treat. Every member of staff we spoke with was professional and very pleasant (sorry can’t remember their names) and as previously mentioned nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them everything done with a genuine smile. We had an early flight and coffee and pastries were arranged for us a lovely touch. The breakfast was fresh and plenty to eat especially if you have a sweet tooth. The swimming pool an absolute bonus location was good and while it was less than 2k to the square it wasn’t the most pleasant of walks While I wasn’t totally enamoured with Marrakesh I loved Les Borjs de La Kasbah. Totally recommended.

A very nice RIAD that allows you to be surprised down to the smallest details. All staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is a bit further from the center (20 min walk). The evening meal (half board) is served in the courtyard and this together with the silence is just enjoy. Thank you very much.

This is the perfect hotel escape to take yourself away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. It is a calm oasis within a desert of noise and crowds the perfect place to rejuvenate whilst exploring the sights and sounds of this chaotic city.  The staff here are fantastic and just the loveliest people. So welcoming helpful and personable. The facilities are wonderful: very comfortable air conditioned bedrooms charming dining areas and a really good swimming pool area. Unfortunately we didn't have time to use the Spa facilities available.  All meals experienced were of the highest quality whilst also satisfying the appetites of two boys.  This really is the perfect place to stay whilst experiencing Marrakech.

Review_Date: Margit G wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: This riad has a fantastic location in the peaceful part of the Kasbah close to the royal palace. It is the perfect base for exploring Marrakesh but the riad itself is a wonderful place to be in. Fantastic pool uniquely styled rooms great air-conditioning a beautiful central courtyard with orange trees and bougainvillea makes this a perfect place to relax. The owners and staff make you feel so at home and nothing is too much to be asked of them. Can’t recommend Les Borjs de La Kasbah highly enough!

Reading the other reviews I was expecting a relaxing Riad a friendly welcome and great service. All of these we got and more. The welcome is great and so is everything else. I don't like to give a 5 star rating on TripAdvisor as something could always be better. Not this place. Nora and Tom are tireless in making sure that everything is more than perfect. The pool is such a delight for a swim after a day out in the Souk. Meals from breakfast to evening are exceptional. The setting to so tranquil and spacious and all at such good value. Thank you Nora Tom and the great team.

Review_Date: KEITH P wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Excellent Riad accommodation, delicious food, attentive staff and in a safe location.
Review_Text: Our recent stay greatly exceeded our expectations. The hotel is superbly appointed the staff are attentive the menus and food are a delight. This is an ideal base for exploring Marrakesh and beyond and is safely located in the Kasbah. The swimming pool spa and hammam helped to relax at the end of the day’s exploring. Flights have been booked to return later in the year.

Lovely Riad in Marrakesh. The couple who run it (Tom & Nora) are very hospitable and friendly as are all staff.    Located a few minutes walk from the centre of old town and is like a oasis of calm from the often craziness (in a good way!) of Marrakesh!

This is the place I come back to again and again. It's so wonderfully peaceful and a perfect escape from the hustle of the souks.    I went daily to Fatiha for massages or a hammam. I really needed to unwind after a stressful year (does't everyone?!) and she is brilliant.    I loved our room the trips the staff recommended the fact that nothing is any trouble for them and that the owners clearly love their place and pour all their energies into making it as wonderful as they can.    It has wonderful food and cocktails romance birds dancing in the morning beautiful plants a pool (yes) and on site hammam and lovely staff throughout and very reasonable. What more could you ask for? BOOK

Review_Date: Jo McConnell J wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: A beautiful place hosted by beautiful people
Review_Text: My friend and I ended up at les bourjs by a happy accident. On arrival everything was on point a being at home feel yet with exquisite service - which is just my kind of perfect. Hosts Tom and Nora and all the team are always on hand kind friendly attentive engaging and really helpful. For someone that has never navigated Marrakech this was a lifesaver. The riad hotel is super stylish supremely and tastefully decorated rooms perfectly balanced and the delicate sound of the house birds all adding to the ambience. Food - breakfast lunch and dinner - are a feast. Local ingredients made to order and just so relaxed. I was also lucky enough to visit the on site hammam - where treatments are very in keeping - my scrub was very cleansing inside and out. In all I found being at les Bourjs an unforgettable experience and am busy plotting how I can get back and rent the whole place out for a big celebration. 50/10 👏👏👏👏

Review_Date: Virginie C wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Superb Riad located in the bustling Kasbah and minutes from La Koutoubia and the famous Place Jemaa el Fnaa. Perfect location for wandering through the medieval streets of the Medina.    The staff are very attentive and friendly. Attention is paid to detail from a welcome Moroccan mint tea upon arrival daily petal designs on the bed fruit basket and Moroccan pastries in the room.    We took the opportunity to experience a hamam and massage on site which was very relaxing in a beautiful peaceful environment.    We had a superb and relaxing stay and would definitely visit again in the near future. Thanks to Tim and Nora too as they were always so accommodating and cheerful.    V.Cameron
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Danny C wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: A wonderful and intimate place to stay. The setting was idyllic the room was perfect and the breakfast was delicious. The main plus point though is the staff; Nora is a wonderful 'directrice' and everyone from front desk through to the chefs and cleaners are so helpful and friendly.    I would definitely return again and I'd urge anyone who's staying in Marrakech to do the same.

I just love this hotel I have stayed here on 3 separate occasions. Tom Nora & team are so friendly and very helpful. The Riad is so pretty & very peaceful. Situated close to The Jamaa El Fna Square Souks & Stylish bars.

Review_Date: Kian B wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: This is such a beautiful place to stay. It is situated perfectly to explore Marrakech and it is a delight to return to at the end of each day. Tom and Norah are so welcoming and really curate the details to ensure your stay is exceptional. Fantastic breakfast lovely rooms and a peaceful setting to relax with at night.

Review_Date: Vicky G wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: What an amazing place to stay!  Originally we were booked at a different riad but the week before we were due in Marrakesh our original booking was unexpectedly cancelled (not through the fault of the owner I must add).  This was when Tom and Nora stepped in and agreed to allow 12 women on a weekend away embark on their lovely riad.    And just wow! From the most amazing decor attention to detail friendly staff arrangement of excursions little gifts to a sweet 16th birthday and not forgetting ensuring that every guest was looked after and their every need catered for!    I would recommend this lovely little gem to everyone! It’s so close to everywhere you need to be (10 minute walk to the souks and Jamaa Elfnaa square). It has the most beautiful spa facilities including an on site hammam masseuse and outdoor heated pool.  (The massage was the best I’ve ever had!)    I want to finish this review by saying a big thanks to every member of staff at Les Borjs de la Kasbah…every single one of you were amazing.    And lastly to Tom Nora and little Yasmine…you’re hospitality and kindness was first class. Don’t change a think! Keep doing what you do.    Until we meet again back in Marrakesh!    Vicky

What a fantastic hotel this is stayed there for my daughters Hen Party weekend. Tom and Nora our hosts along with all the staff where absolutely incredible they helped make this such a special occasion. Not only for the bride but also her daughter who celebrated her 16th birthday during our stay. Marvellous surroundings wonderful people who really couldn't do enough to make our visit memorable. Can't wait to revisit this lovely hotel. Thank you so much Tom and Nora.

Review_Title: Amazing, spectacular Hen party of 12 aged from 16-73! Laughter, peace, culture and love
Review_Text: We had the most amazing time staying here as a hen party group of 12. Everything about this gorgeous Riad is spectacular from the amazing team led by Nora and Tom right through to the atmosphere the beautiful environment the stunning rooms and gorgeous food. It is literally a haven of tranquility where nothing is too much. Tom and Nora are wonderful hosts and we felt like they and their team (including of course lovely Jasmine ☺️) were actually honorary hens! They helped us decorate rooms ensured everything ran smoothly and were also fonts of local knowledge. The whole Riad is beautifully appointed with lots of different areas to relax all beautiful and the icing on the cake the lovely pool. The rooms were comfy and beautiful the events the helped us run from the welcome buffet through to the hen party banquet were wonderful!! This is an amazing place!!

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with an amazing staff!
Review_Text: We visited Marrakesh as a family of 7 and stayed in this beautiful Riad. Visually it was stunning with colorful decorations and architecture behind the typical sober facade. Everything from the courtyard to the restaurant to the rooms etc. was meticulously cleaned and cared for. Once inside all noise from the busy streets around disappears.    We flew in quite late the first day but were greeted with a full meal while our luggage was taken to the rooms. Which brings me to the staff for which I have nothing but praise! Everyone was extremely kind caring and prepared to help out at any time. Two of us got quite sick on the last two days of our one week trip and the staff went out of their way countless times to make us a special tea bring breakfast to the rooms even pick up medicine at the pharmacie to make sure we were as comfortable as possible. All of which I'm very thankful for!    The hotel offers in-house henna tattoos hammam sauna and multiple massage options. These as well as the swimming pool were very nice additions to our stay in Marrakesh on days where we wanted to rest or stay at the hotel.    In summary despite the sick days at the end we had a lovely stay in Marrakesh thanks to Les Borjs de la Kasbah and its staff. It is the perfect place to stay if you want to explore the city itself and the surrounding mountain villages and coastal cities. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to take a trip to Marrakesh!

Review_Date: richard e wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Title: A Fantastic Riad hidden in Marrakech
Review_Text: We had the most chilled relaxing time. The room's & facilities are amazing with the most attentive & welcoming staff. Thank you to Tom & Nora for making our experience so memorable. The 1001 Night banquet is a must for anyone staying!

Review_Date: Michael and Judy wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: We have just had a wonderful 5day break in Marrakesh the highlight of which was Tom and Nora and Les Bourjs and their amazing Riad with its quiet pool and courtyards—and staff. Nothing was too much trouble.  The room was spacious and comfortable the restaurant has an excellent menu (and wine list!) and the service was always outstanding.  Les Borjs is well located in the Kasbah within easy walking distance of the Medina and the sights of Marrakesh.  Dear Tom and Nora thank you again for making our stay so memorable.

Review_Date: Rony A wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel a group of 8 for three nights.  We are friends travelling together for years all over the world. Thia is a great boutique hotel located in the old city. Very friendly team managed by Tom and Nora the owners.  A lovely central patio surrounded  by comfortable rooms. Highly recommended.

We had a wonderful stay at Les Borjs de La Kasbah made possible by the caring and accommodating staff. Whether we were relaxing by the pool or dining in one of the courtyards the cleanliness beauty and attention to detail across the riad created an environment we were happy to return to after long days in the Medina.    A special thanks to Tom Nora and Nadia for making us feel so at home during our first visit to Morocco- it won’t be our last!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kara M wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: When booking my surprise birthday treat for my sister I was recommended to stay at Les Borja de la Kasbah. I can’t explain enough how wonderful our experience was at this haven of a place. Not to mention the owners and their staff. On arrival we were greeted outside with the warmest of welcomes and served mint tea and a selections of local made pastries. The bedroom and view over the court yard was amazing very clean spacious and even had a mini bar. There is a lovely pool and beds also towels are provided. The staff are friendly making sure you are never without food or drink. This brings me to the breakfast wow wow wow put it this way you will not need lunch. Dinner was great we had a beautiful table under the stars with a good bottle of wine. For exploring the medina you are a about a 15 minutes walk however taxis are always available and you can get a good deal. I will absolutely be back to stay in this beautiful friendly haven of a place.

Review_Date: Madeline Ellis wrote a review Mar 2021
Review_Text: We loved our stay at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. It was easily our favorite lodging out of all the places we stayed during our 2 week tour of Morocco. Tom and Nora are a wonderful team and helped with every question and need. The meals were delicious--all cooked by a private chef on staff. The ambiance was the shining quality of our stay because Tom and Nora managed to create an atmosphere that was intimate yet warm and welcoming yet exclusive. Also the accommodations were top notch and beautiful. The purple bougainvillea were in full bloom and the Riad was sparkling clean and even had fresh flower petals in the fountain each morning. Tom & Nora's attention to detail is what made our stay even more enjoyable--the table-side fire heaters for brisk dinner and early morning breakfasts on the patio mint tea and homemade pastries waiting for us inside of the tent on the terrace upon our arrival and we won't soon forget the evenings spent relaxing in the salon with wine and good music.

Once again no words can express our satisfaction!    Staff are brilliant and Tom offers a wealth of knowledge and years of experience. He will give loads of info and details of local refreshment establishments.  Pool area is great and welcoming.    Will see you soon!

Review_Date: Elfi B wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: By now this is the third time we visited this wonderful place. And even more we were actually to be staying at another riad as arranged by our travel agency (for a roundtrip)... yet even rebooked to stay again here. Because of the feeling of home away from home the rest you instantly find while staying in the vivid city of Marrakech the staff that is really just amazing and always there to ensure a perfect stay the swimming pool the quality of the food the top spa experiences the spacious rooms. For us there simply is no better pick. And we will definitely return once again. Thank you Norah Tom Nadia Fatima Mohammed Mouria and so many others. And for you co-travellers: do not hesitate. Yet do leave us a spare room for returning.

Review_Date: Nicole G wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I highly recommend this Charming Boutique Riad! Located in a very convenient spot close to the Jeema El Fna Sq. La Medina and the Royal Palace. Its location away from the traffic and crowds of the busier streets means that it is also very quiet and peaceful. In the patio and the swimming pool area you can only listen to birds singing! Just Fantastic ! Suite 303 was wonderful! !! Everything bright and clean very good bedding and linen. ALL Staff fantastic very polite smiling and nothing was too much trouble to give great customer service. Lovely friendly guests with quite a few on return visits. Lovely ambiance. Also a couple of solo travelers. Very relaxing and family atmosphere. Breakfast was excellent with a full range of local and continental products food in the restaurant excellent too ! Nora and Tom the owners very friendly and willing to advise about everything to go around and visit. We had a lovely one day trip to Essaouira with a private car and the fantastic driver Mr. Cherif. The Spa service also excellent ! Thank you Hashna ! I strongly thank you Nora Tom and ALL the staff of the Hotel who made my stay wonderful and memorable. I will surely come back because I definitely have an address in Marrakesh from now on. It is called : Les Borjs de la Kasbah !!!

Fantastic. Cannot recommend too highly. Suite was wonderful. Staff fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. Lovely friendly guests with quite a few on return visits. Lovely ambiance. Couple of solo travellers. Very family atmosphere. Food nice. Would definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel B wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: A friend and I spent five nights at this lovely Riad in between Christmas and New Year. After a rather stressful year this was the perfect place to relax and decompress. As the photos convey the hotel is beautiful with various areas to sit and chill - both inside and out. Its location away from the traffic and crowds of the busier streets means that it is also very quiet and peaceful. I had a single room which was spacious and comfortable with great facilities. The restaurant is excellent with fantastic breakfast and evening menus and we ended up eating there most evenings. The hotel also organised an amazing day trip to the Atlas mountains for us. The main thing we took away with us though was the friendliness and helpfulness of all the lovely staff. The owner Tom talked to us every day to ensure that we were comfortable and gave us good advice on what to do (and not do) locally which was much appreciated. It was a lovely break and I certainly felt much more cheerful and relaxed on returning to the winter gloom of the UK! I’ve been recommending this hotel to all my friends and family and hope to return there sooner rather than later.

The location of this riad is excellent I did a walking tour from the riad through to Marrakech and passing some must see points of the capital.    This riad is definitely a luxury accommodation with amazing staff who go above and beyond to give great customer service. From the moment I arrived they had me feeling at ease although it was my first solo trip abroad.  On my birthday I recieved a little gift of Moroccan treats which were a lovely touch.  They arranged an excursion for me as well as a henna tattoo woman who came in for me. I used the spa facilities for a hamman which was so refreshing.  The food was amazing and I would totally come back again with the rest of my family. Thank you all the staff who made me feel at ease on my first solo trip!!!

Review_Date: Virginie C wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I spent a lovely relaxing few days at the Borjs. The service was impeccable and the director and his wife were always very attentive and mindful to all their guests.  The highlight of the trip was the "New Year's Eve" ambient entertainment creating an unforgettable atmosphere of dazzle. The entertainment had plenty of variety and included all the guests from the hotel which allowed for some good mingling.  It started with cocktails by the pool and music from a local folk group. Later the fire breather brought us the thrill of live fire dancing.  During our six course meal we were graced by a belly dancer and an award winning magician delivering truly mesmerizing tricks leaving all the guests asking " How did you do that?". There were also other folk groups playing music during dinner and plenty of dancing with a DJ till the early hours of the morning.  The food was excellent as was the service.  One really nice aspect about the evening was that the staff joined in the festivities and everyone truly enjoyed themselves.

Review_Date: Nigel Graham wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Having stayed at The Borjs in February and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and attentive staff i returned for New Year celebrations. The same high standards greeted me whether it be the cleanliness standard of food or customer service. A lot of organisation had gone into delivering a top class evening of entertainment on New Years Eve and appeared to be enjoyed by guests and staff alike. Truly memorable.

I had the pleasure to stay here on the lead up to new year and into early 2020. Everything was perfect. The staff are just so wonderfully accommodating the rooms are so comfortable and very well kept and the food is divine. We even took part in a cooking course where we made traditional Moroccan dishes comprising several courses. This is a must do ! What really made our stay unforgettable was the New Year's Eve bash. It really is one for the books and not to be missed! The whole evening was spectacularly executed and well organised. The entertainment (fire breathers traditional musicians magician belly dancers...) was unparalleled. I couldn't have asked for a better way to ring in a new year. The team at Les Borjs is so bubbly warm and eager to help. A big hats off to them in making the bash what it was ! The food and decor as well were truly impressive. This boutique hotel is unlike any other. In the heart of the medina a beautiful oasis close enough to all the action but ultra relaxing (highly recommend the spa which made it even more relaxing!). I will certainly be returning !! Thank you Tom and Nora for being so welcoming and creating a family ambiance. Best wishes!

Review_Date: Anssi R wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Fantastic long weekend with our friends!
Review_Text: Les Borjs De La Kasbah offered us a phenomenal 30th birthday weekend in September 2019. We booked the entire hotel with 25 friends.    Tom Nora and the entire team were excellent. The communication before the weekend was fast and clear and they did an excellent job looking after us during our stay.    The hotel was clean the food was great and the swimming pool area was very beautiful. The spa services were excellent as well. I also recommend arranging the private "Moroccon evening" -celebration -- it was so much fun!    I highly recommend Le Borjs De La Kasbah. I've stayed at multiple hotels in Marrakech but this one was by far the best!    Thanks Tom Nora and the rest of the team!

This was our second stay in this hotel. The facilities were great excellent small restaurant with a great selection of breakfast and other meal options. Rooms comfortable clean and beautifully designed. The owners and staff were so friendly and helpful.

Review_Date: Ben B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: This is a great Riad slightly away (not far) from the busy parts of Marrakesh but easily walkable The manager was great. On arrival BA has messed y booking (single instead of double room) and she instantly showed me the confirmation stated single but gave me a double. Really good breakfast and friendly staff. Booked my airport transfer over email for arrival and then on the day of my return. All in all i would highly recommend.

Review_Title: Don’t hesitate to book this riad!
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived to the minute we left the staff couldn’t have been more friendly welcoming and professional. The riad itself is absolutely stunning and definitely captures the essence of a traditional Moroccan riad.  We made full use of the facilities - swam in the pool and ate at the lovely restaurant!  A gorgeous oasis within the magical labyrinth of Marrakech. I would recommend a stay here to anyone. I will most certainly be back!

Review_Title: November break in Marrakesh in perfect location
Review_Text: Perfectly chosen boutique hotel in Marrakesh Medina you would not expect walking straight from the narrow busy street. Clever architecture tastefully designed each room each patio has its own charm and character. Very quiet. Staff very attentive professional and efficient from room making restaurant service and cuisine to trip organizing. In five days we have got a flavor of busy town and souks Atlantic coast and Atlas mountain coming back to serene and relaxing atmosphere of Les Borjs de la Kasbah . Our sincere thanks to all the staff and Salma and Sharif our chauffeur in particular.

Review_Date: tomasz z wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Probably the quietest place in Marrakech
Review_Text: Hotel located in the old district. Looking from the street I never thought it was such a quiet place. You can relax there after a long time exploring the city. Helpful staff. Interesting cuisine. Dinner prices calculated at a reasonable level (we preferred to eat in the hotel rather than in the city). Heated swimming pool. You can even take a bath in November.

Review_Date: isabel b wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Excellent hotel in the old city of Marrakech
Review_Text: Very helpful staff a beautiful building cleverly restored from a series of old buildings very comfortable good sized room and an excellent swimming pool.A very good spread for breakfast.  The position in the Kasbah is easy to get to and near some of Marrakech's best sights like the Saadian tombs

The staff were very welcoming and eager to help. The rooms were comfortable. The breakfast was great - lots of choice including omelettes and pancakes made to order. The location was perfect for seeing the main sites - most of them were within easy walking distance. I could definitely recommend this hotel for a city break

Thank you again for your services and helpful! The hotel stay was very pleasant and comfortable. The staff was very polite and helpful the location was very convenient for getting around and many activities.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I went there with our whole company (18 people for 4 days) to celebrate our 20-year anniversary after I've been there already about 10 years ago (with my wife). What can I say ... this was a fantastic stay it has been more than perfect and better than I could have imagined before - 10 years ago as well as just now.    As soon as you enter the hotel the vibrant city of Marrakech and the Kasbah Quarter fades away and you enter a quiet and relaxing oasis. Everywhere in the hotel you can see that everything has been made with lots of passion and love and they payed attention to every little detail. Rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom - every day nice soft towels in the room as well as at the pool the whole decoration in the room plants all over the hotel...    The hotel itself is really like a dream with everything you are looking for. Wonderful spacious rooms from big suites to smaller rooms (but even the small rooms are big enough and as nicely made and decorated like the larger rooms) a rich and delicious breakfast a nice pool to relax a SPA with hammam and massage a restaurant with outside terrace a bar with everything you need (important for us Germans ... :-) ) and much much more ...    The whole hotel has an amazing and very special atmosphere.    But the best of all in this hotel is the staff. I have been in lots of places in the world but in this hotel you feel at home and feel so welcome. Every staff member is very friendly and helpful no matter whether it's in the restaurant the SPA at the reception at the pool or even the maintenance workers... this is where the special atmosphere in that hotel really comes from.    Especially Jihane and Nora helped me a lot to organize our whole trip including restaurants our trip to Ait-Ben-Haddou guides Moroccan evening etc. They were there to help me whenever I had a question or needed help.    With our group we had dinner after a trip to Ait-Ben-Haddou and also a Moroccan evening with oriental dancers music etc. both in the patio of the hotel next to the restaurant. The food was delicious as well as the wine and all the other drinks we had. The Moroccan evening was awesome. We had so much fun and I highly recommend that especially if you are a bigger group like we were.    For us everything was perfect and I can't find anything to complain. Tom and Nora the owners are doing a great job with Les Borjs de la Kasbah!

Review_Title: Great stay in a great Hotel in a great City
Review_Text: We had a group travel to Marrakech and stayed 5 days in the great Borjs de la Kasbah - and I enjoyed every single day Perfect rooms super kitchen super SPA and exccellent personnel I really can´t find anything to complain.

Fantastic hotel with great staff and amazing atmosphere. The location of the hotel was convenient to most things. It was my first visit to Marrakech and to Les Borjs de la Kasbah but not the last one.

Review_Date: Soozi R wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: First trip to Marrakesh and amazing
Review_Text: We were a couple looking for rest and relaxation with a little understanding of local culture. The hotel was fantastic. All the staff were lovely attentive the suite was lovely very clean lovely little pool with sun in October drinks delightful and food delicious. We were so glad we chose to stay in the Medina Kasbah area as we walked around by ourselves feelings safe and enjoying the locals culture respective fully. We tried local restaurants in the Medina and restaurants in the New Town. Thoroughly enjoyed and we are going to book this hotel for next year. Thank you to Nora and Tom (the owners) and their staff for a superb holiday.

I really enjoyed everything about the hotel but the staff made it special. Munya Nedya Fatima and Salma were wonderful. The restaurant was excellent and I rarely ate elsewhere. The Riad's location is also convenient to most things. Very good stay and very good choice.

Review_Date: kristi l wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: My family (husband and 8 year old son) had the pleasure of staying at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for three nights in October 2019. We had an amazing stay and would highly recommend this riad. We had debated booking at a larger hotel outside the medina mostly because we were travelling with a child but I am so thankful we decided to stay here instead!  The riad is tucked away from the main hussle and bussle of the souks but we still could walk everywhere (or take inexpensive taxis as needed). The riad is gorgeous with a beuatiful inner courtyard lit up with lovely laterns at night that makes for a wonderful atmosphere. My son loved cooling off in the private pool after long days of exploring the city (the pool is larger than it looks in many photos).  Our room was beautiful and huge! Probably the nicest we stayed in during our trip and we could not have asked for anything more.  We had dinner at the riad one night and it was fantastic (not to mention we could enjoy a bottle of local Moroccan wine with our dinner!). As well I tried my first Hamman experience here and it was great! The owners of the riad are extremely dedicated and passionate about the experience they provide to the guests and I cannot recommend this riad enough if you are looking for a place to stay in the fascinating city of Marrakech. Thank you to Tom for such a memorable stay!

Review_Title: An oasis in the chaos of the Medina!
Review_Text: This is a wonderful hotel! We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay here.  It has just what you need in Marrakech - a beautiful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the streets and markets. Our rooms were spacious beautiful unique and had great air conditioning. The courtyard is lovely (we played cards had a drink - yes it has a bar) and there is a separate courtyard with a pool. And breakfast (included in our price) was great and the dinner we had at the restaurant was very good.  We also had spa treatments at the on-property spa. The Hammam was fantastic - a great experience! And the massage afterwards was a welcome pampering during a busy vacation.  All of the staff were friendly helpful and very accommodating (especially the front desk team) - we always felt welcomed and comfortable.  Practical advice: it is about a 15 minute walk from the main square and souks. When it was hot it was just more time in the heat. That said as a first time visitor to Marrakech I was very glad I was not staying in the section right by the main square/souks. There are no cars there so you get dropped off and told to walk the rest of the way. Plus it is very very busy and I was very glad I wasn't staying in the heart of the chaos. Walking away from all that was worth it!  I highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again!

Review_Title: Fabulous Rabi at the front desk
Review_Text: We arrived by taxi and tried to check in to this hotel but soon realised that we had been dropped off at the wrong hotel! (We had reservations at Ryad El Borj). Thankfully the young man at the front desk Rabicouldn't have been more helpful and took us under his wing. He phoned our hotel to arrange for them to meet us at Cafe de France and then organised a taxi to take us there. So a huge thank you to Rabi what service! The hotel looked fabulous and they obviously will go out of their way to assist their guests and those that aren't!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: G W wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I hope to return to this quiet friendlybeautiful riad where the help can’t do enough for you and the food is excellent. Everyone just loved the place and its location near the center of everything adds to it value. Do stay here if you want a touch of quiet in the midst of the frenetic action of the square and the souks. It’s an easy 10-12 minute walk.

A beautiful retreat in the Kasbah just a walk to the main square and souks in Marrakech. Lovely rooms beautiful inner courtyard (enjoyed a couple of lunches there and cocktails in the evening) pool spa with good services. Multilingual staff were terrific. I'm quite picky but definitely recommend Les Borjs de la Kasbah!

Review_Title: An amazing oasis in the middle of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for a special trip among friends. The riad was just amazing and provided a lovely retreat from the lively streets of Marrakech. The hotel's inner yard with its fruit trees was the perfect cool spot to have meals or just to read a book while listening to the birds sing. We definitely enjoyed the pool and hammam as well.  The food was great and the staff was really friendly. The hotel itself is located within walking distance to the main square and the souks so getting there was easy. Can't come up with anything bad to say. Loved the Moroccon coffee in the morning. The rooms were lovely and the bathrooms really spacious. Stay here if you can!

Review_Date: Virginie C wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful location in the Kasbah within walking distance of the main square : Place Djemmaa El Fna where the square comes to life at night and hosts lively events during the day. Walking distance to the “Souks” and to most of the attractions.  The hotel is a little jewel with a serene and tranquil atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle of the Kasbah.  The staff are very attentive helpful and always ready to give some helpful advice for discovering points of interest in Marrakesch  The rooms are excellently appointed spacious and decorated with charm and Moroccan flair.  The Spa offers a wonderful Hammam and massage experience which can then be followed by enjoying time by the pool.  The on site restaurant offers a copious breakfast with home made yoghurts fresh orange juice smoothies home made pancakes omelettes and more. The lunch / snacks and dinner menu comprises of traditional Moroccan dishes and other types of cuisine.  All in all a fabulous luxury Riad offering so many amenities wonderful location warm welcome from all the staff the director and his wife.

Review_Date: Judy G wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I last stayed here about 10 years ago and was delighted to find that it is still as good with delightful staff stylish interior and delicious food. After a day exploring Marrakech it is wonderful to return to this haven of tranquility and sit by the pool.

Review_Title: Gorgeous hidden Riad in the kasbah
Review_Text: Borjs is a beautiful hidden riad in the Kasbah which is tranquil and calm. Wonderful staff are so friendly helpful and knowledgeable about Marrakech. Also fab wine by the pool! Highly recommended 💖

Review_Date: Michelle Jones wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: My husband daughter and I spent three nights here. We were greeted with warmth and lovely conversation along with some delicious tea. We stayed in one of the suites which was beautifully decorated and had lots of space. The pool was amazing. It is a nice and quiet hotel and every person employed was so kind and welcoming. We couldn't have chosen a better place to spend our time in Marrakech. We will definitely be coming back in the future.

Review_Date: vivienne l wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: First time visiting Marrakech with my mom and sister with the goal to visit the Sahara! We don’t really know what to expect and it was a little overwhelming and intimidating from the moment we landed.    But what has kept our short experience in Marrakech pleasant was Les Borjs de la Kasbah. From the moment we checked in service was top notch and everyone was so attentive.    Not to mention their hotel ground is so clean big room variety of breakfast great Spa/Hammam simply a slice of heaven in the Kasbah!

Review_Title: Friendly staff, intimate hotel grounds, relaxing spa
Review_Text: Hotel Les Borjs de Kasbah is amazing. It’s basically a mega-Riad with several properties combined into one renovated to modern building code keeping the original courtyards and updated the architecture in the Moroccan style.    Upon arrival we were immediately escorted to the courtyard for complimentary tea and pastries while they took our bags to our suite and started the air conditioning. During this time we also were greeted by Tom and Nora two of the hotel directors. They are very sweet and friendly.    Our room was a suite with a sleeping area and a living area with day bed and two chairs. There was a mini fridge (mini bar) and cable TV. The bathroom consisted of shower stall and bath tub and a double vanity for sinks so plenty of space. There was also a clothes “warming rack” that you can dry bathing suits.    Dinner was fine. The food was good and the service was slow but we are from America where wait staff is in your face all the time. So don’t be afraid to flag one of the servers down if you need something. I had menu de jour for 20 MAD which consisted of gazpacho arroz saffron and panna cotta with a jello thing.    Breakfast was included in our stay and was one of the highlights of our time here. Great selection of fruits yogurt and smoothies an omelet station Moroccan pastries and crepes coffee with either hot or cold milk juices and teas. They do a great job of presentation and food safety.    Pool area is thoughtful size of actual pool is quaint and fine.    We also did some spa packages - a traditional hammam and full body massage. The price was very very good for the service. It was a very nice way to try a hammam for the first time at a hotel.    Service here is very good. It appears to be slightly understaffed so we were patient with expectations. The size of the hotel and the number of rooms is on the low side so it’s intimate here. The grounds are gorgeous and there are many places to relax such as the courtyard restaurant/lounge pool or library.    On our last day the staff allowed us to move to another room that wasn’t scheduled to be used so it was a blessing to have another area with air conditioning to hang out in until our evening flight.    Wifi is strong and they have several networks scattered throughout the hotel grounds.    We highly recommend this hotel spa because of its friendly staff intimate grounds and relaxing aura.    Thanks Les Borjs de Kasbah!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I loved my stay at this riad. It was so beautiful and comfortable. They have literally thought of everything to make your stay wonderful. The bedroom was so clean and the bed just right for a good nights sleep. The breakfast was fabulous with loads to choose from. The location was perfect a short walk to the main areas but still around shops and restaurants. The staff were so nice it felt like they really cared about your stay. The safe and fridge in the room were useful. The spa on site was fantastic and we had a couple of treatments which were first class. This trip was a treat for my daughter and we were both so pleased we had decided to stay at this riad.

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I've been visiting this property of six years now. I love it. The level of service comfort of the rooms excellent lounging and pool areas and top-notch restaurant distinguish the hotel. When you consider the value of the rates I don't think you can find a better place in the medina. The a/c is perfect in the summer the design of the rooms is fantastic they can arrange side trips and airport transfer with ease and they take time to make you feel personally welcomed. I strongly recommend visiting here.

This riad is amazing and great value for money. I stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed it. Beautiful rooms excellent food very friendly and helpful staff. The swimming pool is an added bonus. I’ve been to Marrakech four times now and preferred this accommodation to the large hotels where I have stayed previously.

Review_Date: Suzanne M wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Quiet hotel and lovely attentive staff. This beautiful hotel ticks all the boxes. You are close enough to get to all the sites but can hide in your oasis when you need a rest. I enjoyed the pool and the spa as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lutz H wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We selected the hotel primarily based on the positive reviews. It exceeded even those expectations. The rooms are individually decorated with not a detail left out. It was my first time in Morocco but I learned that this hotel is a “Riad” with a typical layout of rooms around a beautiful courtyard. Beautiful architecture with carved wooden doors mosaic courtyards.    The personnel were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Perfect service. The owner is present. An English-French gentleman and his wife. He takes an interest in managing and it shows    The location is good. Within walking distance of the Kings Palace and with a little longer walk to the souks and the plaza where the snake charmers etc do their tourist stunts.    I’ve traveled a lot on business in five star hotels but I would prefer this one anytime.    Just yesterday the hotel presented an Arabian night with Berber singers and the obligatory belly dancer. Great fun and the accompanying meal Outstanding.    If you have a chance to stay here take it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maryanne C wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I'm giving this hotel 5STAR rating! Staff are very friendly polite and helpful! The manager Tom and his wife Nora are adorable always ensuring that everything is okay! Breakfast superb! The location is very convenient! Above all I really love the kindness and thoughtfulness of both NIRA Tom and the staff! They gave mW a small present for my birthday and that was really a nice gesture! I highly recommend this hotel! So folks if you are heading to Marrakech make sure you pick this hotel and you won't be disappointed! Maryanne C. Room 203❤❤❤❤💕💕💕✌✌😁💯

Review_Date: ROGER H wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Les Borjs De la Kasbah is the most perfect location for your Marrakesh experience. The Riad is a wonderful combination of Moroccan culture relaxing Spa and a great dining room. The rooms were well designed and so very quiet.

Review_Date: Debby S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: It was exellent!!!  If we go back we would definitly stay there again  Pool is great  Food is good  People are wonderfull  Would recommend this riad to everybody  The rooms are so beautifull and everything is soooo clean
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First time in Marrakech and could not be happier with the hotel. We stayed three nights. The rooms were very nice clean bathrooms were very large. Service was excellent. The staff was very helpful and kind. Tom the director was very personable and very honest. The grounds were just beautiful. So quiet and tranquil it was impossible not to relax there. We had dinner there twice and the food was very good some of the best we had during our short stay. Breakfast was my favorite meal- lots of choices and delicious. The location of the hotel is great we could walk anywhere in the medina but were in a more quiet section of the city.    We had one small hiccup when given a recommendation for a restaurant in town. The hotel called to make us a reservation and then called us a cab. We were instructed that the fee should not be more than 35 dirham to get us there. But what no one told us is that there were two restaurants with the same name in Marrakech so we ended up and the restaurant that did not have our reservation which I guess was a bit further because the taxi ride was 70 dirham. So we got in an argument with the taxi driver to find out we were at the wrong restaurant. In the moment we were upset that the hotel did not inform us that there were two restaurants with the same name but in hindsight we should have confirmed the address or location before venturing out. Oh well these things happen. I would not hesitate to stay again and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Marrakech.

Review_Date: Ivan B wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Our stay at "Les Borjs de la Kasbah" in mid May 2019 was an unforgettable experience !! It was the best of both worlds on one hand a fantastic Riad experience complemented with the VIP service of a 5 star hotel. Despite our many experiences in 5 star hotels we have never seen such a complete infrastructure at the swimming pool (lockers bathroom facilities etc ..). The attention to detail is just everywhere I even could not distinguish the difference between a painted salamander on a wall with a real one! The personal approach of the people at the reception provided an "Unbeatable service" (advice of places to visit what to do etc ..). As the cherry on the cake on a Wednesday evening there was a Morocco evening with belly dancer and a lot of fun. We will definitely come back

Review_Date: Reasonable Traveller wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Stayed for 8 nights in March and the staff, location and accommodations were wonderful.
Review_Text: The rooms were excellent as was the service. Much more personalized then at a large commercial hotel chain as expected. Had dinner several times in the restaurant good to very good food there. Breakfast was always very good with ample choices of food and cuisine. I enjoyed the location near several notable historical sites a short walk away. Quiet street and near most of the sites I was interested in seeing in the Medina. Couldn't have asked for a better choice and the prices were very reasonable. Will stay there again next time I am in the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Los Angeles Urban Adventures wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: The staff here are really lovely and the whole place is a perfect mix of beauty peace coziness and attention to detail. There is a fabulous breakfast buffet and a beautiful swimming pool and wonderfully large bath towels I look forward to staying here again. Thanks for a lovely stay!!

Review_Date: James H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Stayed with my wife earlier this month. Wonderful hotel with cute courtyards pool fantastic breakfast and in a super-convenient location. Very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend staying here! I’d definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our first trip to Marrakech and our 25th anniversary to boot so looking for something special. This was it! It's rather difficult to find as it is within the walls of the old City. One has to park outside and walk in. A local showed us the way (fo  r a small fee😉). From the outside it looks like nothing on the inside quiet and tranquil. We were served mint tea while they checked us in. Good sized room with a large bathroom decorated in Moroccan motifs. The staff was very cordial and attentive. Within easy walking distance of the square and various markets. Breakfast was good - Moraccan fare as well as more regular choices served buffet style. Dinner was included with our room plan. It was just okay looked good but not particularly flavorful. Still if you're looking for a romantic or quiet getaway with all sorts of Marrakech action a short distance away. This would be an excellent choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hannah & Mark wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: An oasis in the bustling city
Review_Text: This riad is fantastic. We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed every day at the hotel. Situated at the south of the Kasbah a short walk from the centre of Marrakesh you'll find this peaceful and welcoming riad. On arrival we were given Moroccan tea and patisserie to enjoy whilst sitting in the delightful courtyard. It feels miles away from the busy and noisy streets of Marrakesh which is a welcoming thought after a day of exploring the city.    The staff here are extremely friendly and helpful and always greet you with a smile. We were also greeted on a number of occasions by the manager who asked us how our stay was going which was a nice touch. The rooms are clean and spacious and have lovely touches such as rose petals fresh on a daily basis.
