We also used the pool (which is heated) and the other communial areas of which there are many to relax in.    There is a modest continental breakfast which is topped off with an omelette and pancake station where you can request your order each morning. The lunch and evening meal options are tasty and we ate here twice enjoying both of our meals.    Overall the staff and peaceful environment make this a fantastic place to stay and we will definitely recommend to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: richard a wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: This is our second stay at this lovely riad in the old town. The location is perfect and a peaceful retreat from the ‘madness’ of the souks and vibrant town. The rooms are beautiful and comfy and all the facilities nice. You can treat yourself to a relaxing massage and the pool area to the side is just great. Breakfast is a nice buffet with choice of fresh egg options cooked for you. The hotel is run by Tom and his wife who will help you with anything and arrange trips for you. We went to the atlas mountains. The staff are all totally nice and i look forward to return one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Calm and serenity in a hectic town
Review_Text: We had a wonderful room within the riad. The service was perfect and made us feel more then welcome. We enjoyed the good food of the restaurant the breakfast with many home made specialities the pool and the overall places to meet and relax (and for some of is have a smoke). Thank you to the team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: john b wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is in the Medina but is very quiet and secluded. We stayed in February and it was warm enough to use the pool.The staff were very friendly and so helpful.The Riad and our room are so tastefully decorated and you really feel that you are in Morocco.  Very good value and we would not hesitate in staying on our next trip to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah H wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here in January for 3 nights (myself husband and 2 grown up sons) and we all loved the hotel.  The rooms were really comfortable with everythingi you needed - heating (which took the chill off in the morning) mini bar safe dressing gowns(handy for using the heated swimming pool) lovely fluffy towels. The staff were very friendly and helpful - showing us where to go arranging taxis etc  The breakfast selection was excellent (particular favorites were the crepes and the omelettes). We also ate an evening meal in the hotel on 2 occasions - superb food (although there wasn't a lot of choice for my vegetarian son). When we didn't eat at the hotel we still enjoyed sitting in the comfortable bar and having a drink. There are lots of nice areas to sit and read a book have a drink or just relax.  The hotel is in a great location as well - easy to walk into the main squares and within easy reach of the sights in the old town.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Nigel Graham wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Needing a break from the long English winter as soon as i viewed the photo's on thier website i knew this was the hotel for me. And i wasn't disapointed. An origional Riad sympathetically restored into a hotel with class which offers excellent rooms and service. One of the directors was available every day but i had no reason to contact him with complaints just to praise the ambience he has created. Marrakesh can be a full on assault on the senses which is fun but the hotel provides a perfect redress to the mayhem which the medina creates. I recommend the traditional Hammam bathing experience a vibrant experience. I hope to return sometime.

I visited Marrakesh for 6 days with my parents and two children. The hotel was even better than we had hoped. All the staff are wonderful - very genuine helpful and professional. The rooms are lovely shared spaces though fully laid out and the pool heated! Perfect for a February break.  Everyone in our party would return again in a heartbeat. Thank You Tom and team for a fabulous week.

Review_Date: Chris R wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: A delightful stay in the Kasbah of Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and I spent 2 nights here in room 202. The room was lovely bed comfortable heating/ air con worked well and the spacious bathroom was well equipped.    We were half board so got the menu du jour. This was good - typically Moroccan - and there was a choice of good Moroccan wines available.    The hotel is well situated within the walls and a manageable walk from the main square about 25 minutes. I should also mention that reception staff were very welcoming and helpful with advice. All told we very much enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bill M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for the weekend . Rooms were great Tom and the staff were all fantastic and the Riad is an oasis of calm and peace! Food (and wine ) in the restaurant was delicious and the pool was a real bonus.  Nothing was too much trouble for the team they arranged a guide for us around the city and booked us on a quad biking trip - both at very short notice. My daughter also said it was the best facial she'd ever had in the spa.  The wi-if was also super fast!!  Would love to come back and have recommended to all our friends !

Review_Date: Poplea R wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We enjoy our hollyday in this clean and quiet autentic riad ! All the staff where friendly and with the smille on their faces ready to satisfy all the request that we had. We really recomand this oases.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a great place i wouldn't hesitate to recommend to everyone. So much friendliness and cleanliness real luxury.    It's about 20 mins walk to the souks. We got a tuk tuk back in about 10 mins which was great fun. It's good to be away from the really busy area of the souks and enjoy the peacefulness of the hotel.    If you're going to Morocco definitely stay here.

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Haven’t visited for a few years so decided to return and use same hotel. Not disappointed. Excellent service at all times. Food very good. We ate most dinners in the hotel and none disappointed. Beautiful room. Only disappointment was the weather but the hotel can’t be blamed for that!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Francisca G wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Surely the prettiest hidden Riad in the heart of Marrakech - a soulful sanctuary within the busy city. Its beautiful mosaic floors and four stunning patios (with a pool and great spa area) with endless rose patels and bespoke furniture make this place a true Moroccan luxury experience itself. My family and I enjoyed our stay with a great breakfast buffet (the Moroccan crepe lady was so nice and memorized all our favourite ingredients) the cool receptionists Rabi and Omar (they truly know how to select the sweetest tangerines ;) and also book the best tours) and of course the lovely owners who immediately made us feel like we're part of their family and constantly exceeded all expectations by surprising us with little goodies and pastries presents etc. - they all made our stay so unique and hard for us to leave. It's a top notch boutique Riad (18 rooms only) which is way more authentic and uniquely luxurious than any hotel ressort. So after our 7-nights stay we can say that it is truly of best value.  Besides if you are thinking about spending NYE here - this is the only place offering a gala dinner party with high-end F&B and top entertainment throughout the entire night.    BTW: And no nobody asked me to write this posting ;) it just truly happens to be this perfect.    A bientôt  Francisca Rebecca Christoph and Philipp

Review_Date: ROGER H wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Wonderful Riad. Delicious food and restaurant
Review_Text: Les Borjs is an amazing Riad situated in the middle of the dynamic historic Medina. Staying here is the true Moroccan experience the location the facilities the staff and the FOOD! The restaurant offers the true “taste of Morocco” Breakfast has delicious fruit smoothies traditional breads and pancakes and eggs and omelettes made to order by the delightful chef in the court yard. The evening meal has very reasonably priced meals. The tagines ( veggie lamb seafood) are wonderful. Plenty of traditional soups salads and local dishes. There is a large selection of the world famous Moroccan wine.

This is an elegant impeccably clean and friendly Riad. My fourth stay in Marrakech and this is the best place I’ve stayed at. The staff are wonderful: courteous and hard working every one of them from Tom the manager to the receptionists waiting staff and spa staff. I was in a single cosy room with a sunny terrace outside. I appreciated the fact that bathrobes were provided. The Riad’s facilities are excellent—especially the spa with full Hammam and heated swimming pool. I swam every day I was here (late December) and the pool was always very comfortably warm. One thing to note—the pool area doesn’t get much sun in December and there’s no roof terrace. I had a variety of spa treatments massages and Hammam and all were superb (as someone with arthritis who has a lot of massages I am pleased to say the masseuse is really skilled). For me the only letdown was the restaurant. The selection of dishes in the restaurant is quite limited and the food in my opinion pretty mediocre compared to elsewhere in Marrakech. As others have noted (see reviews for the Jasmin restaurant) the food is over-seasoned: twice my tagine was virtually inedible. But! That should NOT put you off staying here. It’s a wonderful peaceful place and excellent value for money. Many thanks to Tom and all the staff for a wonderful visit. I highly recommend Les Borjs. By the way it feels safe here—Marrakech is a bustling city with its fair share of scammers but travellers of all kinds should feel comfortable in this area. Finally it was really great that the hotel arranged collection at the airport which made the start of my holiday properly stress-free.

Review_Date: Raj T wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Had a great stay in this lovely hotel in the south of the medina within a 20min walk from the main square. Friendly and very efficient staff. A great spot from which to discover the city. It felt very safe from walking around at night to and from the hotel to the souks. Highly recommended

This was a lovely friendly hotel. The staff were always helpful with information on the area and how to get about. The hotel was clean rooms comfortable and the food was very good. Also situated in Médina the heart of the old city.

Review_Date: Fuad Mu wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Where do I start! The staff are fantastic especially Omar who ensures all your needs are catered for a true star!  The ambience the look and feel of the place makes you feel you are in the heart of Marrakech.  Will definitely be staying here again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Suzanne W wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: So myself and my friend returned for the 2nd time this year to Les Borjs. My 3rd stay in total.  I can’t find anything but good stuff to say about this hotel. The staff are like family the food is fantastic and the rooms are beautiful and kept to an excellent standard by the wonderful housekeeping staff.  Tom the owner is just the best! I had a mishap with my bank card and he drove me to the bank and his wife Nora translated for me. He totally went above and beyond what a hotelier would do! The staff are just beautiful people I hate leaving. I know however I’ll be back again and again so it’s some consolation. I’ve been in January March and December and it’s the perfect hotel regardless of the season x

Review_Date: Amy L wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We picked this Riad from a few being a bit concerned about the distance to the Jemaa el Fnaa but liked the reviews. It turned out to be an excellent choice. Absolutely everything was great from the staff’s welcome and continued desire to be sure we were happy to the beautiful very spacious and comfortable suite. Thick towels robe instant hot water quiet and comfy bed. Breakfast was delicious copious and varied. Dinner and bar delightful and cozy. Omar at the front desk an added plus. We also really liked the walk through the Kasbah area each day which felt immersed in Marrakesh real life. Highly recommend this excellent choice. Wish all were like this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I spent two weeks travelling around Morocco having booked my last night at the Borjs de le Kasbah. From the moment I crossed the threshold to the moment I departed I was made to feel like I was the only guest. My room was comfortable with satellite tv a mini bar & a well appointed bathroom. These are things you would expect to find but the level of service is well beyond what is expected. The young lady on reception who checked me in on arrival presented me with the best mint tea I have had in all time in Morocco accompanied by a selection of home made biscuits. Once settled in she gave me a guided tour of the spa pool bar & restaurant. Breakfast has to be seen to be believed the choice & variety are first class. The location is ideal for the main square & souks. I wish I had been able to stay for longer. The staff both front of house & behind are a credit to this fantastic riad. This was defiantly the best hotel of all on my journey around Morocco.

Review_Title: Excellent Stay - Perfect Spot To Relax & In The Heart Of The City
Review_Text: We stayed for a week at this lovely riad with two friends. The riad is beautiful and set away from the noise and bustle but still only a short walk to the souks and historic sites etc. The welcome was very warm and all the staff (and there were plenty!) were very polite and helpful. Tom the owner and his wife went out of their way to look after guests and offer advice on where to eat where the bank is etc. The food was very good and we also used the Hammam there for steam/clay/black soap treatments and massage and they were great too. The private pool looked lovely but it was a bit too chilly to try it out! Our room was comfortable and there were plenty of areas to sit around the courtyard and have mint tea or a drink and enjoy the peace and quiet. We highly recommend staying here and would certainly return!

Review_Date: Cori T wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Such a lovely place to stay
Review_Text: Ill admit to being concerned Being driven from the airport when the car stopped and the driver said this is the place. The street kind of looks like an alleyway but then when you enter it is the most delightful and charming Riad. The staff is warm and friendly and helpful. The Decor inside and out is tasteful and charming. It’s clean. Really wonderful wonderful place I loved that it was in the old part of town rather than the new modern part of town which might feel more upscale but more ordinary too. This felt more authentic and different and charming. It’s very quiet and comfortable. The spa treatment is outstanding. Really great! So glad I came and will recommend!

We’ve just stayed at this Riad for the past 3 nights and highly recommend it. The staff are friendly and quick to help. The pool is beautifully warm - I swam in the rain happily! The rooms are stunning with all original Moroccan features. We had a back massage in the spa which was great value for money though one downside was that the beds didn’t have the hole for your head so I got a bit of a crick in the neck. No big deal though. The food and drinks are reasonable and tasty. There is a lovely library to sit and read in or just to chill. Mint tea aplenty. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but we called reception to ask for coffee in our room and they brought it to us for no cost and promptly. Get the staff to arrange your taxis from the hotel because then you won’t get ripped off (they use a specific taxi company). You can walk to the Médina and the souks from the hotel.    Really wonderful stay. Thanks to all the staff who made it a relaxed stay.

Review_Title: Perfect spot to stay - see Marrakesh, relax and rejuvenate
Review_Text: Stayed for 2 nights after a great week of group travel. From the moment I arrived the staff were warm and welcoming. The Riad is beautiful w lots of lovely sitting areas a small bar and heated pool and spa. It’s perfect. The restaurant looked delicious too. Great morning breakfast. Easy walk to center square and the souks. Located in heart of Kasbah on small street. Lovely to relax in pool while listening to the Call to Prayer or enjoy a cold beer after a day of shopping the souks. I arrived w a stomach bug and one of the owners went to the pharmacy to get me some hydration med. Had a great 30 minassage. My room was perfect - all the rooms are very private. It’s a wonderful place to stay and enjoy Marrakech / and relax after a long day. Make sure to include some Riad-relaxation-time.

Review_Date: AJ V wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah was absolutely wonderful. From the outside it is very unassuming like most places in Marrakech but once you enter it is exceptionally beautiful and peaceful. To go from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and then into Les Borjs is such a pleasant change of pace. Our room was spacious clean and tastefully decorated. The entire staff is friendly and are happy to help you or provide you with anything you need. We spent a lot of time in the courtyard either drinking mint tea or wine reading and just listening to music and the birds. The manager Tom is very accessible and is always around if you have a question or need anything. Highly recommend this riad to anyone for any occasion.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for a week in riad Les Borjs de la Kasbah at the end of September. The hotel taxi driver met us at the airport . On the way to he showed us interesting sites and shared some history of Marrakech . At the riad we were met by Tom who welcomed us and personally offered us Moroccan tea and cakes he then walked us around to all the facilities e.g swimming pool spa reading room bars restaurant and introduced us to his wonderful staff.  The riad is well located it's a wonderfully calm place after the hustle and bustle of the busy streets outside where all your needs are attended to. The breakfast provided everything lots of choice with fruits juices smoothies home made yoghurt hot freshly cooked different types of pancakes omelettes to suit every taste. In the evening you can eat at the restaurant with excellent menu choice of traditional Moroccan or European dishes. There is a good choice of wines and other alcoholic drinks at very reasonable prices. We'll try the Grey wine next time.  We didn't make use of the Spa & Hammam but it seemed very authentic.  We would like to thank all the staff who were very polite helpful a real joy to chat to and enjoy a laugh and a joke. Nothing was too much trouble for them.  P.S thank you Tom to sending the key that we left in room 305.

Review_Date: Carole L wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: My husband friend and myself visited Les Bors de la Kasbah this October. Our friend had been many times before and recommended it. The riad was everything she said and more it is homely beautifully furnished in a traditional Moroccan style and immaculately clean. The staff are warm and friendly and go out of their way to make your stay special. The food is fresh and tasty you can even have your breakfast omelette freshly prepared and cooked in front of you! The hotel is so quiet it’s hard to believe you are in the Medina. I would thoroughly recommend a stay here to catch the true Moroccan warmth and hospitality.

Can't imagine a better place to spend time in Marrakech. The riad is a collection of houses held together by shady patios hidden seating areas and a sun deck with pool. It's located in a 'quieter' area of the medina with the peace being interrupted only by cockerels and the call for prayer. However as soon as you step outside you're hit by the commotion of what defines Marrakech.  Rooms are spacious and whilst being equipped with everything necessary are distinctly Moroccan. The staff are excellent - warm friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a treat. The food is wonderfully fresh homemade and mainly local. We didn't have dinner but did have pizza which was delicious and competitively priced in comparison to outside restaurants. There is also a bar with a range of local beers and wines.  Only wish we could have stayed longer.

Review_Date: Bel Warren wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: A very disappointing way to end our honeymoon
Review_Text: We were in Morocco for a week and we stayed in this hotel for our final night. Unfortunately the hotel was so poor that it really cast a shadow over the end of our honeymoon. Outlined below are a list of the issues we faced. Some are relatively minor but nonetheless all add up to a really sub-par experience.    1/ The location was questionable with a group of between 4-10 young men constantly loitering outside. The hotel staff were not seen to approach them or try and deal with the problem but we were followed or hassled every single time we arrived at or left the hotel.    2/ At check in we were not asked for any travel vouchers but these were then demanded at check out before they would complete the process. There was no suggestion they even knew it was our honeymoon!    3/ Safe was unlocked with master key rather than any electronic combination meaning the hotel and potentially any number of other individuals would have access.    4/ Bathroom grout was mouldy + bath didn’t drain properly    5/ Toilet didn’t flush properly    6/‘Hot’ water in bathroom was lukewarm at best    7/ Loud music in patio playing until 11pm with no guests in the courtyard but rooms opening onto the space. Not very peaceful! Why have music at all?    8/ Breakfast was scarce and looked very tired (fruit brown meat looked tired bread stale. ‘Fresh orange juice’ was just orange squash. Omelette was burnt due to being left unattended when cooking. Coffee served at breakfast was cold. Ironically there was no chocolate at all in two pains au chocolat.    The staff were certainly friendly so of course none of the above is anyone’s fault in particular- to sum up: we were disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent 3 nights in this little gem in a quieter part of the Medina. The staff are welcoming and warm. The rooms are spacious well equipped and beautifully decorated. There are numerous public areas laid out around a central courtyard and the pool. The pool area is relaxing and we did go in for a dip. It was a bit chilly in late October (25c) but I can imagine how enticing in must be in the height of summer. Breakfast is great lunch snacks very tasty and competitively priced in comparison to other restaurants. Plus you can get a beer! We had a relaxing spa treatment with good quality products. The area is safe and about 10 mins to the tombs and 15 to the main square. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Judy O wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Perfect Tranquility in the Heart of Marvellous Marrakesh
Review_Text: From the taxi waiting for us on arrival at the airport to the owner Tom and his Wife Nora personally helping us into the transfer cars when we left  I cannot fault our stay at this wonderful Riad.  Our room (303) was spacious with a very large comfortable bed sofa and coffee table decorated in traditional Moroccan style  with a generous sized ensuite with both bath and separate shower.  The breakfast  served in the beautiful courtyard had great selection and we ate our evening meal here on one evening and the food was very good matching the more expensive meals we had at some of the "named restaurants " in Marrakesh .  The pool ( more relaxing than Olympic size ) and sunbathing courtyard is perfect for chilling after a busy day in the hectic city centre - which is easy walking distance from the hotel .  I also had a massage which was good value and perfect to unwind after sightseeing all day .  Tom and his team arranged a tour guide for us taxi's during our stay and prebooked tables at restaurants and hotel bars we wished to visit - thank you  this made our trip so much more relaxing and stress free.  I would recommend this hotel especially for couples wanting a romantic break  groups of friends and Solo travellers.  I would definitely come back and stay at this Hotel again

I stayed here on the recommendation of friends . A great riad close to the Royal Palace in the Medina. The room was clean spacious and well appointed. The staff are superb - friendly attentive and polite. Speaking English isnt an issue - the owner is English/French and his wife is tri lingual. The hotel was gutted and rebuilt about 10 yrs ago so everything is modern and finished in understated Moroccan classical design. All in all a delightful stay.

Review_Date: Ute J wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We simply loved it!  Everything is just perfect in this little Riad hotel in the Kasbah.  The team is very caring and Tom and his wonderful wife are great hosts - thank you to all of you you made this a great stay.  Rooms are spacious and decorated with taste the whole complex has been renovated using traditional techniques - there is a very interesting book in the little library documenting the process of creating the hotel from one original Riad and the adjacent smaller houses.  We never managed to make up our mind which area of the house is nicest to relax in - pool bar private balcony spa - so we went to each in turns.  Not to forget the beautiful shady courts where breakfast and dinner are served. Breakfast is a feast in itself here lots of things are homemade and incredibly fresh! The restaurant gives you the opportunity to dine either traditional Moroccan or French we only tried the Moroccan part (not enough evenings) and were very happy with it.  And there are so many small extras that make you feel welcome and comfortable just try it we definitely plan to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Finbarr O wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights and were very impressed with the room the staff and all of the facilities. It is very close to the main square (10 - 15 minute walk) and we felt very safe walking to and from the hotel at all times.  Our room was very spacious and clean with a very comfortable bed. The hotel is very quiet and the noise from the street is completely drowned out.  We ate at the hotel a number of time and I could not say enough good things about the food. Every meal was delicious and there was a great selection of Moroccan and international cuisine. We tried some of the Moroccan wines and they were excellent.  Finally the staff were extremely helpful especially everyone at the front desk who were always willing to offer useful advice.  We would have no hesitation in staying at Les Borjs De La Kasbah again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mina S wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I travelled for the first time to Morocco as a solo female in August 2017. This was my first trip alone. What a fabulous experience I had. The rooms were clean and comforting. Breakfast buffet and the restaurant was delicious! Could not get enough of the tangine!! Staff!! Friendly courteous and highly welcoming!!! Location was very convenient.    I felt comfortable and safe at all times. It was such a marvellous experience. Will definitely return.

Review_Date: Daniel R wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Borjs is a beautiful and elegant riad. Lovely cool courtyards with salons and seating areas nice rooms cosy bar plus suntrap swimming pool. Staff and owners made us feel very welcome and service was excellent. Even a birthday card and best wishes.

Review_Date: Vania T wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: We came across this spa by chance walked in and received a very warm welcome from Belinda the director. We had already paid for our accommodation elsewhere but liked this place so much that we kept coming back everyday for a relaxing time in the jaccuzi and the lovely roof terrace.we also brought our mother and auntie both in their eighties for a massage they both loved it and kept asking to come back. Amazing staff and excellent food. Highly recommended. But the real gem here is Belinda a beautiful and sweet extremely professional showing all what hospitality is all about. We were made to feel very welcome.

I arrived at Marrakesh on the 10th August with a friend my mum(81) and my Auntie (79). We found this amazing place and Belinda the director greeted us with a beautiful smile and friendly attitude. She made us feel so welcome beyond words. Belinda and all the hotel staff are so friendly that you don’t feel like leaving the hotel. The food is amazing and the hotel facilitiessuch as the Marrocos pool and the spa terrace is divine. I love it so much and the most amazing thing is that I acquire an amazing friend like Belinda. Highly recommend!!!! Once again thank you Belinda for making my stay in Marrakesh so memorable.

Review_Date: Steven L wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Really stylefull riad/hotel. Relax and chill atmosphere. Clean  good food nice swimmingpool. People always friendly and try to help you.  I like that the hotel is not in centre of tourisme but in neighbourhoud where people live.  Just small walking to centre

We are a Dutch couple (but I am writing this review in English in case the hotel staff might read it) and had the best time in this gorgeous hotel! Sadly we couldn’t see all the things in Marrakech that we had planned due to me falling down a step and twisting my ankle but I am extremely glad we were staying at this hotel! Everyone was so friendly and helpful the food was fantastic and I have not discovered even one place in the hotel that did not look absolutely stunning. We have stayed here for 8 days and I felt so relaxed after this holiday! So don’t look any further if you are looking for a place to stay in Marrakech this is the one!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maycol F wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: My stay in this little palace was one of the best experiences of my extensive travels. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay because of the top notch staff and facilities. I have never met a sweeter staff and eaten such a lovely breakfast. The staff at the bar and spa were equally amazing. Finally the location couldn’t be better if you want to get a real taste for Morracan life.

Review_Title: Oasis of calm in a hectic city
Review_Text: My husband and I and our teenage son stayed here last week for 5 nights. Fell in love with the place as soon as we were greeted at the door. Check in involves sitting on super squishy sofas whilst drinking mint tea and eating pastries. What a pleasant change when you arrive late and tired.  Our room was lovely and small touches such as fresh flowers was appreciated. The whole place was spotless and the food good. What sets this place apart though is the staff. They were all friendly and obliging going the extra mile if we needed help. Special mention to Norma who lights up the place with her friendliness and to the front of desk staff especially the young man (Rabii?) who swiftly sorted things out for us when our aircon broke late one evening. It is the mark of a good hotel when any issues which arise are handled efficiently and promptly.  We had a fantastic stay and hope to return one day.

Really just superb. Quiet cool well staffed and great location. Will be number one spot for me to return to. Also uses the laundry service for gear after climbing Toubkal they have me half price due no ironing all just effortless to stay there.

Review_Date: s d wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We chose this hotel deliberately from the photos as it had a typical Moroccan feeling rather than a concrete international hotel. I must say that we were so impressed the staff were lovely the room was so impressive spotlessly clean a bottle of water waiting nice little touches rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom and bath robes. The continental breakfast was good a very good choice of fresh fruit cereals different teas and coffees breads and pastries cold meats and cheeses on offer to suit all tastes. I do not understand some of the negative comments Tom the manager was to us extremely polite and interested in how we were. The pool was clean and sufficiently large loungers by the pool with fresh towels always ready. We did book spa treatments individually but they did ask us on the day if we would like to go in at the same time so that we would finish at the same time which we did. I had a hammam followed by a relaxing massage which was excellent my partner had a manicure and pedicure which she said was better than she had had back home same for my massage. There were lovely common areas around the courtyard a tv room a meeting area etc very well laid and fitted out in typical morrocan style. The only niggle was my partner getting stuck in the bathroom when the door handle malfunctioned but very quickly resolved which is all you can ask. We would definitely return as we discovered a couple of guests were doing while we were there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Suzanne W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: I’ve stayed here twice now in 2017 and recently in March. We are treated like family the hammam is out of this world the rooms are beautiful staff are just darling and Tom is the best host! Love it so much we are returning in November and I literally cannot wait!

Review_Date: Lily O wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: An oasis in the epicentre of bustling Marrakesh  I stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for 4 days and had an amazing time. It was my first time in Morocco and as a solo female traveller I was initially a little nervous so I informed the hotel that I would be arriving. They were very prompt in responding to all of my emails and assured me that they would do what they can to ensure that I had a great stay.  And they did!  My room was amazing- very large (much bigger than I expected). Very comfortable mattress. Large bathroom with Argan oil-based products.... The hotel itself was beautiful and offered me exactly what I'd hoped to get out of my stay in Marrakesh- an authentic Moroccan experience. It's in a great location- 20 minutes walk from the main souks. 10-15 minutes walk to nice bars and restaurants. It's also very close to many of the main attractions Marrakesh has to offer. It was off the main road and located on a side road but the road is well known well populated and easy for transport to access.  The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly informing me of the nice bars and restaurants to visit during my stay. They gave me a map to use but after I told them I'm useless at using paper maps they input the location of the restaurants they suggested onto Google Maps on my phone.  Breakfast was included and was lovely with a good selection of traditional Moroccan dishes as well as continental breakfast options. I also had dinner there a couple of times which I enjoyed.  I made use of the hotels other facilities such as a small library which looked out into the courtyard and the spa facilities which was blissful :)  I was very impressed when the hotels Director looked out for me and greeted me by name- remembering the email I had sent the hotel about travelling solo. He made me feel very welcome and greeted me daily and when I was leaving for the airport he helped me by contacting the private taxi company who were running late (I had arranged my own transport).  If I had to list any cons they would be:  1) Service in the restaurants is a little slow  2) The hotel does seem to have much change on the premises for cash purchases and it would take a while (15 minutes at one point!) to give me change whenever I paid in cash.  All in all I had a fantastic stay thanks to the friendliness and helpfulness of the director and the wonderful team at Les Borjs de la Kasbah.

I had no idea what to expect and as our taxi trundled along a narrow side street and when it stopped suddenly outside the hotel my heart sank. But as soon as I walked in I knew we had struck gold. The hotel is simply beautiful charming and such a delight. It is centred around a pretty courtyard where the walls are covered in places with climbing plants in full bloom. One of the best features is a heated swimming pool which we retired to every afternoon for a refreshing swim and a cold beer. The staff are also wonderful friendly and so accommodating nothing was too much trouble. We also loved our room which was spacious clean and traditionally decorated. Breakfast was taken in a lovely little enclosed courtyard and there was so much on offer including cereals fresh fruit cheeses fresh yoghurts fruit juices pancakes and omelettes. The only disappointment was our evening meal and out of the four of us only one main dish came up to scratch. I ordered a fillet of beef served with dauphinois potatoes but the fillet was pretty tasteless and the potatoes undercooked (this is the only reason I have give it a mark of 4 out of 5) On a more positive note the hotel is ideally situated and we were able to walk to the main square the Saadian tombs (a must see!) and the souks. I'm not sure what to make of Marrakesh. It is manic exciting vibrant scary spiritual wild and often overwhelming but it was always so nice to know that we could return to our little oasis where we could relax and unwind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and my husband stayed for a week in April .. hotel is just great .. lovely staff .. beautiful bedrooms .. best power shower .. common areas are so relaxing .. everywhere is spotless ...lovely bar .. breakfast each morning was so tasty .. lovely fresh orange juice and good selection on buffet .. we had some treatment in the spa which were really good ..  location is excellent .. 15 mins max walk to main square .. this hotel is not to be missed .. we just loved our stay .. thank you Les Borjs De La Kadbah
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A peaceful Oasis inside hustle/bustle Marrakech
Review_Text: We visited with friends for 4 nights in May and were absolutely delighted from start to finish. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful - we were genuinely made to feel most welcome. The rooms were spacious clean comfortable and very well presented. The public areas - in particular the main courtyard and the pool area - were a delight to sit in ... everything was so calm and peaceful - you couldn't tell that the hustle and bustle of the Kasbah was just the other side of the wall. The Riad is a little way from the main 'tourist' area of the city (about a 20 to 25 minute walk) but I regard this as a positive asset rather than negative and reception will always arrange a taxi for you if so required. The food was always very pleasant - breakfast (included in our stay) served up a variety of fresh food with pancakes and omelettes made to order. Dinner on both occasions that we dined 'in' was delicious - I can particularly recommend the fillet steak which was done to perfection. All in all we had a wonderful stay at the Riad and would most definitely recommend it.

Review_Date: Allen H wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: My favorite place in all of Morocco
Review_Text: I am a tour operator--I bring mostly American travelers to Morocco. Les Borjs is my favorite place to stay in the entire country. Not only is it beautiful it is staffed by some of the most attentive and friendly staff of anywhere I have stayed. It has a good restaurant lovely rooms a pool hammam and massages available. In short it has everything a visitor needs to feel welcome and content. It is quiet in a city where tranquility is a real blessing.

Stayed for ten nights in April 2018 from the moment we arrived we were enchanted. Fatima at reception was superb.... the room as big as a small apartment and the attention to detail...rose petals on our made up bed each day of a different design.  It offered a cooking class with Miriam..wonderful and translated by Fatima from the restaurant staff..again excellent.  Would recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech an oasis with a wonderful pool area away from the bustling and cultural hub of the main square and countless souks donkeys and snake charmers!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I’d give it 6 out of 5 if I could!
Review_Text: Everything about this hidden gem of a hotel was amazing. The accommodation the facilities the food and the spa. The hotel is located within walking distance of the main square and loads of shopping. It is a wonderful peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the busy streets. The staff was very friendly and accommodating which was nice since it was our first trip to the area and had lots of questions. I would highly recommend the spa as well. The prices are reasonable and the treatments excellent. If you want to experience something traditional try the hamman treatment at the spa. It was invigorating and leaves you skin feeling amazing! The food is also very good. So good that we ate almost all of our meals there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jon H wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Great experience in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Visited Marrakech for the first time and delighted that we stayed at this wonderful Riad which allowed us a real experience inside the walls of the Medina whilst escaping to the peaceful environment Les Borjs offered.    The rooms were clean well furnished and traditional decorated the pool was fantastic to chill around after walking the routes to the centre of the Médina about 20 mins away.    Food was great and the tangine was excellent and breakfast was fine. There was always a member of staff around to provide ad hoc drinks.    We booked a trip to the Berber village via the reception which was a wonderful experience although dress for a climb and trek! We also had a spa and massage which was lovely.    Special thanks to Nora and the staff at the hotel who were very attentive regularly checked everything was ok for us and helped with any enquiries.    Marrakech is a vibrant and at first sight an apparently chaotic place but very quickly you realise there is a rhythm that makes the city tick. The Médina routes are narrow and you need to pay attention as bikes are up and down but everyone is respectful. Have your route worked out and you’re fine!    Heading home having had an amazing stay in Marrakech and the BK Riad.

If you place a premium on the pleasantness courtesy and responsiveness of hotel staff you will be pleased. Food is very good the property is quaint and so comfortable the location within the Medina yet off the beaten path. Well heeled and well traveled patrons abound. While the masses escaped into the Medina I spent rainy days fully contented in the hotel. Happy experience. Does Morocco proud.

Husband was asked where he would like to celebrate his 60th birthday.  He chose Les Borjs de la Kasbah  We travel extensively and have been here several times before.  Despite being offered the chance to go anywhere in the world he chose to come back here to the Borjs for his special birthday..  Huge thanks to Tom Norah Fatima Nawal and the rest of the staff.  Enough said.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Rebuilt and presented in traditional style this hotel still provides the modern conveniences you would expect. Public areas like the central courtyard bar and restaurant are both welcoming and relaxing. Very quiet and calm a respite from the busy and noisy streets of the Medina and Kasbah. Good location - about 20 minute walk to Jemaa el Fnaa. Staff very friendly and helpful. Staying here was a delight and I would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Review_Title: Wonderful oasis in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week in February and were delighted with the standard of the hotel and the lovely helpful staff The hotel is situated in the Kasbah and is an oasis of peace and quiet after the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. It is a leisurely 15 minute walk to the main square. The swimming pool are is great and we had a wonderful hammam and massage. We ate in the restaurant three times and the food was great.    The staff went above and beyond when we had a bad experience at a restaurant one evening and we arrived back at the hotel at 10.45 having not eaten!! They provided 6 of us with a cheese platter with bread olives etc although the staff had their coats on ready to go home!    All in all a lovely hotel and we would not hesitate to recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Atul P wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Dear All  Our first visit to Marrakesh was a lovely one.    Les Borjs should be your first port if you are looking to stay inside the medina as it is a great place to stayrelax and unwind after your daily excursion of the citadel or the mountains.    Inshallah we will be returning soon.  Tom and Team BK thank you for looking after us and making us feel very welcomed    Atul & Lee Pancholi
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When we booked this hotel we were impressed with the reviews but had no desire how gorgeous it is. From the moment you step inside there is a sense of tranquillity charm and timeless style.  The staff are all lovely and want to make your stay special. The restaurant is excellent and well priced with lovely wines. Our room is spacious and immaculate. Each day we return to artistic arrangements to the bedcovers which are sprinkled with rose petals also in the bathroom. Seriously we can't find fault and wouldn't hesitate to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad was a lovely respite from the madness of Marrakech easy to find and very clean and comfortable. The staff were amazing and the food was lovely too. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and owner we felt like we were in the lap of luxury it was one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Intrepid Traveller wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: The rooms are well presented clean and fresh. The hospitality is amazing and all staff were pleasant and accommodating. The location is spot on. We will happily recommend to anyone. The breakfast was delicious!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Denise S wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Located in the old town this is a true hidden gem. A totally relaxing peaceful experience.  More couples then family based and in the middle of "real Morroco"  Definitely what my partner and I needed.  Tom the hotel director has an amazing tram of staff and should be very proud of the service they deliver.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris E wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Wasn't sure what to expect on arrival but boy what a pleasant surprise!! A real hidden gem.  Spacious room spotlessly clean and a very comfortable bed!. From the warm greeting off Nora and a lovely conversation with Tom the Hotel Director to the friendly smiles and greetings from the gardener and room attendants this was a most enjoyable stay.  The hotel restaurant served very tasty traditional Moroccan dishes each and every time packed with flavour and a explosion of spices.  Special mention for Fatima and Nadia always smiling and nothing to much trouble to make your stay more relaxing and enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dolores and Audrey had a wonderful stay we loved the concept of the Riad rather than a standard hotel. We were overwhelmed by the friendliness and competency of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We also loved the selection at breakfast and very much enjoyed the evenings when we had dinner in the hotel. We will certainly visit and stay again in the future

Review_Date: Michaël M wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Perfect hotel in an authentic part of the Medina
Review_Text: I really liked Les Borjs. During my solotrip to Marrakech (5 days) this hotel was the perfect beautiful and peaceful base to discover the city. Really helpful and friendly staff a good room and bed a nice swimming pool (I didn't use the hammam so I cannot judge it. But I heard good things about it) great breakfast ... And the atmosphere is just perfect: different nice and calm patio's cosy corners to read a book ... I certainly go back!

Lovely quite welcoming Riadlovely staff great breakfast and wonderful ambiancedidn’t want to leave!Will visit again very clean.loved the rose petals put on the bed every day! Top quality bed linen towels and dressing gownnice toiletries also

Review_Title: Perfection Exemplified - 5 Reasons to Stay Here
Review_Text: 1. Hotel was clean and beautiful  2. Staff was incredible and helpful  3. Excursions set up through the hotel were on time professional and lots of fun  4. Spa treatments were a great deal and felt amazing after a day of touring around Marrakech  5. Food was delicious
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having stayed many times previously in beautiful riads in the Medina area I decided to give this one a try in the Kasbah area and was definitely not disappointed. The attention to detail is faultless the food amazing the staff wonderful friendly and attentive the plumbing is the best I have experienced in Marrakech the wifi reliable and the standard of cleanliness is very high. If there was one small thing I could criticise it would be the bird poop in the pool area but I appreciate this is difficult to eliminate. A small tip a box of biscuits made by the staff here to take home was worth every penny - delicious. I cannot recommend this place highly enough and would love to stay again next time I'm in Marrakech.

Stayed here in early October and wow. One of (if not) the best hotels I have ever stayed in. So much character. Felt like I was at home. Small intimate hotel beautiful textiles lovely staff and wonderfully clean. Not sure why this hotel was classified as a 3 star as it’s far better. Very pretty. Had the Hammam which was great and reasonably priced (could have been hotter). It’s a 15/20 minute walk to the main shopping area (medina) but you pass lots of shops and restaurants on the way. I went as a single woman and felt totally safe. Would definitely return. Wish I stayed longer. Thank you

Review_Date: Anna D wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Stayed here when I arrived in Marrakech. Felt like I arrived in ' 1000 and 1 night'. A little oasis in the bustle of the city. One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at (and I travel a lot).  Very safe and clean. Wonderful Hamman restaurant  pool and lots of different areas to sit and read. Perfect for a female solo traveler.  The breakfast was fantastic!!!

Review_Date: Dan C wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: From the moment I arrived I was greeted by a calm and serene atmosphere. I’d only booked a single room but it’s honestly the nicest one I’ve stayed in. The room was cleaned daily and everthing worked well during my stay including the WiFi and air-conditioning. I’m so pleased I found it and would highly recommend staying. The massage treatments are amazing and the pool area really calming. You almost don’t want to head off to explore. Tom is a great host and a top bloke and the staff are lovely. Next time ominous Marrakech I know where I’ll be staying...

Great riad lovely rooms resteraunt pool courtyard and staff hospitality plus love kasbah location only takes 20 mins to main square and other sites and 10 mins to tombs  loved everything about riad owners Tom and wife Norma just lovely ... 10 mins from airport they arrange pick up and drop off that's well worth doing ... overall excellent experience and definitely go back there

Review_Date: Sofia G wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Everything was amazing. Staff were extremely helpful and polite the hotel was beautiful and my room wonderful! Loved the little balcony. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Review_Date: Kelly N wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: From the first moment we met the driver at the airport to the last moment he dropped us off the service kindness and hospitality of the staff was faultless. The architecture and decor at the Riad is calming authentic and makes you feel relaxed within moments of arriving. Our room was lovely spacious and clean - simple yet homely and had everything we needed. The spa was fantastic - we highly recommended both the Hammam and the massages all of which were reasonably priced. Tom the owner welcomed us on our arrival and was charming and helpful even lending us some cash when we hadn't had chance to get to an ATM. The pool area was a delight and we were lucky enough to have it to ourselves on our first day. The 20 minute walk to the medina was in our view ideal because it meant you could escape the hustle and bustle without being too far from the action. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and only wished it had been for longer. We are looking forward to a return trip to see Tom and everyone else again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I decided to take a last minute trip to Marrakech as a chance to explore and reflect before taking on a new job.    I booked this reservation solely based off of reviews and wow did it ever pay off.    I’ve been all over the globe and this staff was the most friendly and helpful that I have ever encountered. Whether it be booking an adventure spending time in the spa or dining it was a 5 star experience.    The property was pristine and well taken care of. It gave me the choice of going out and exploring in the city or relaxing by the pool or reading in one of the many relaxing common areas.    To wrap it all up Tom ( the co-owner) made a point of meeting me and ensuring my stay was going well which was really the cherry on top.    A+ Staff  A+ Ownership  A+ Property  Would recommend to any and all family and friends.

Review_Date: Louie L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Spent 5 nights at LES Borjs de le Kasbah on a golfing and cultural experience we were met at the airport by the hotel owner Mike " a lovely touch. All our golf and transfers to the courses were arranged by Mike and his son Tom so no hassle for us. The hotel is an oasis tucked away form the hustle and bustle of the surrounding area where peace and relaxation guaranteed. The staff at the hotel were always on hand with wonderful service and friendly advice about the wonders of Marrakech. The food was superb and plentiful. There are about 12 golf courses within 15 minutes of the hotel the only problem was choosing which ones to play. Our thanks to Mike and Tomfor making our stay memorable.  BRIAN NIGEL MARK NICK GARETH GARY AND OZZIE DAI.

Review_Date: Tara S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Amazing stay in a beautiful room (302) with rose petals. It opens out onto a lovely courtyard. Room so quiet and peaceful with just the sound of birds. All the staff are friendly helpful and welcoming for a homely stay. They are also happy to offer you ideas on where to visit with hints and tips. Get ready to relax and feel pampered by trying the lovely hamman scrub and relaxing massage plus pool. Food is all very good (e.g. tagines) and loving the variety at breakfast.The pictures don't really do it justice because it is an absolute gem! Reviews speak for themselves...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a lovely stay at Les Borjs de le Kasbah. The property is hidden away in a back corner of the Kasbah and has been completely renovated in the classic Moroccan style. It has plenty of amenities including a pool a bar and a restaurant. Our room was very small but not uncomfortable with AC and a nice bathroom. Breakfast was awesome with lots of cold choices and cooked to order omlettes and pancakes. The only drawback is that it is located fairly far from the main square and the souks so we needed to do a lot of walking to do our sightseeing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We are SO GLAD we found this riad!
Review_Text: We recently spent 6 nights at Les Borjs and what a wonderful time we had! We were traveling with our daughter son-in-law and son for the first family trip in a few years and this riad guaranteed that any family tensions that tried to rear their ugly heads were immediately assuaged by the lovely rooms courtyard pool and hammam not to mention the fabulous staff. The beds were so comfy the bathrooms absolutely clean beautiful tilework everywhere and air con when necessary (we used it only at night). We had breakfast in the courtyard each morning and dinner a couple of nights. The location was a 15-minute walk to the main mosque a bit farther from the souk but in the (relatively speaking) quieter neighborhood of Kasbah. Tom you have done such a formidable job of creating a real oasis amidst the chaos of the medina and all 5 of us so enjoyed our chats with you. Le soir morocain was especially fun and very interactive -- if your visit happens to be timed right do it you won't regret it.

Spent 5 nights at this gorgeous Riad and wish we had more time to extend our stay!  Such tranquil beautiful grounds to relax in and take advantage of their great service delicious food and wonderful wine list.  We found the staff here to be absolutely wonderful. Always friendly attentive and greeted us with smiles. Nothing was too much trouble. We had booked for our family ( including our 2 kids aged 11 and 9) to join in their Moroccan night ( a fun night with Berber music Belly dancing and set menu). On the night after asking about the set menu items we realised that our fussy eaters were unlikely to eat the set menu items ( we loved them though!)We apologised and asked for just a main course of their choice but that we were still happy to pay the full charge for them to attend the Moroccan night. The hotel staff happily presented the kids with our own main course choices and rather than charging the kids the set price for the Moroccan night ( which included entertainment) waived the fee and only charged for their meal! . This was just one of the many times the hotel and staff truly made us feel like guests rather than a number.  From a location point of view we also found it ideal. It was close enough to walk to the Medina ( approx 10 mins) but far enough to allow some breathing space.  (TBH we ate out just one evening spent a few hours each day shopping but then found ourselves wanting to get back to this hotel to enjoy the pool relax and enjoy a perfectly made Negroni! )    A special thanks to Miriam the delightful breakfast cook who made our omelettes and pancakes each day ( always with a smile!) and Nadia and Nora for their warmth a bubbly greetings! All the staff were brilliant- I just didn't get all their names! And of course to Tom the hotel manager who took the time to chat with us and make sure we were happy.    A most memorable stay! Highly highly recommend!!

It was everything we could have wished for a wonderful hotel friendly helpful staff in an engaging and exotic city.  The hotel catered for our every wish food allergies were no problem and the service was warm friendly and always delivered with a smile.  Great facilities pool spa bar reading room wifi and satellite television.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A haven of tranquility and relaxation
Review_Text: A wonderful Moroccan hotel in the old part of town Busy outside but wonderfully quiet and relaxing inside. Our hosts (because I can't bring myself to call them 'staff') looked after us very well - giving sightseeing eating out and transport advice. The rooms were comfortable and clean the food was good - great breakfast buffet. I enjoyed lounging around the pool fluffy towels included meeting new people and sharing experiences. It was nice to have Tom (the manager) around to talk with about the area and the hotel.  I also used the spa facilities which was a great experience I had a hammam my skin was so smooth after.

Review_Date: Elaine T wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: A place of Calm and tranquility
Review_Text: We have just returned from a tour of Morocco and stayed the first two nights and the last night there in our seven night tour .  We were delighted with our room 203 it overlooked a court yard where you can eat breakfast or evening meal there are lovely flowers growing up the surrounding walls make it feel calm.  There is a casual breakfast each morning with everything you would expect on offer.The evening meal we had twice and both occasions the food was very tasty and good quality.  It has a good size pool and relaxing area unfortunately I did not have time to sample a spa treatment which I would have like but a member of our group did and said it was wonderful .  The hotel is managed by Tom whose family own it and he meets his guests and takes time to ask how everything is and makes sure you are enjoying yourselves.  He went beyond his duties and shared his Yorkshire Tea bags with us at breakfast which was the best cuppa of the week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen H wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: An amazing oasis of calm in an exciting city
Review_Text: I have today returned from 9 blissful days in Marrakech staying at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. As a first time visitor to Morocco and a solo one at that I was excited but a little apprehensive. I needn't have been. The whole experience was amazing from the complimentary pickup from the airport the beautiful pool the idyllic courtyards the amazing friendly and helpful staff to the delicious food the relaxing spa treatments and the clean comfortable and luxurious rooms. Nothing is too much trouble for Tom and his wonderful team. I am searching my diary for an opportunity to visit again later this year!! If you are thinking of booking stop hesitating and do it!! You won't regret it!! PS. Look at you tube video on the website - it is exact as wonderful as it looks.

Review_Date: Danielle N wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Probably the best boutique hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: If you want tranquillity and outstanding service while staying in a traditional property in the Marrakech Medina I'm not sure you can do better. Moroccan style with superb levels of style and comfort and everything that you need for a great stay. Located in a quieter part of the Medina but within easy reach of tourist sites eating places and markets. The courtyards effectively shut out the city and are filled with trees running water and lots of birds (particularly noisy morning and evening).  Each suite is slightly different but all offer peaceful views  unique furnishings and plenty of space. The pool is a huge bonus - on site and big enough to spend an afternoon next to or in. A hammam/spa and restaurant on site mean that when you are tired out from the heat there's no need to look elsewhere and the offerings of both are extremely high quality. The dining menu includes both Moroccan and international cuisine and lighter meals around the pool are also good with staff happy to vary dishes according to individual requirements. Breakfast is also very good - with pancakes omelettes and local delicacies cooked to order.  But what really makes this Riad stand out is the personal service offered. The manager takes time to meet each guest and help them to make the most of their stay in Morocco. All the staff at the hotel don't just respond to requests but anticipate them too - truly exceptional. And the flowers scattered across bedrooms and bathrooms to greet you are the final touch.

This is my second visit to the riad and I am already thinking of when I can come back. The rooms are very comfortable and give a real sense of the Moroccan style. The heated pool is a wonderful place to relax especially after a morning of shopping- an oasis of tranquillity in a very busy city. However what really makes this riad so superior to the rest is the staff. They are all so helpful caring and attentive whether you are a lone traveller family or couple you are instantly made to feel welcome and looked after throughout your stay. It truly is one of my favourite places to come and escape.

Review_Title: Pure bliss! An oasis of calm and tranquility
Review_Text: I've never been on trip advisor before but signed up so I could leave a review.    Believe everything you've read. Staying at Les Borjs de la Kaspar is heaven.    It's a beautiful building remodelled a few years ago using local traditional craftsmen (no power tools) with big cool spacious rooms a lovely courtyard that is filled by nesting sparrows in the evening and a pool to relax by. You are surrounded by the gorgeous colours of the well tended plans. Traditional yummy Moroccan food and most importantly good cocktails. I love it so much I've been back three times now! Once I went adventuring and the staff helped organize lots of local trips and we so helpful providing good deals maps advise. The second time I came to write and the atmosphere was perfect as it's so calm. And this last time was to relax. Sunning and spa! I really recommend the spa. Have a Hamman to waken your skin and then a long back massage or facial.    What makes Les Borjs such a stand out is the staff- Tom the French/ English manager goes out of his way to welcome everyone. All the receptionists are so accommodating. The man who runs it during the morning ran out to get extra sun cream when I ran out! Fatima and Nadine friendly servers and Nora checks in with you throughout to see how you're getting along.    I love it here and cannot recommend it highly enough. Go! You won't be disappointed.

Review_Title: Quality hotel which offers a welcome respite from the streets of Marrakech
Review_Text: I booked a single room half-board very much last minute and settled on Les Borjs de la Kasbah based on the existing reviews and very reasonable price.    The initial benefit to the hotel's location is that it's roughly 10-15 minutes from the airport which is brilliant if you have had to travel a number of hours prior to arriving in Morocco. Not to spoil the introduction to the hotel once the check-in has been completed but it was a nice touch to be greeted by the director and enjoy tea/snacks while the room is prepared.    My choice to go half-board at the sacrifice of a smaller room was absolutely non-regrettable. Based on the description of the room in square meters I was expecting a fairly small area however I was relatively surprised and happy that it exceeded my expectations in terms of overall space - which because of the cozy aesthetic comfortably mitigates any pre-existing concerns about the size.    I arrived late afternoon on my first day so I was able to enjoy the evening dinner menu which comprises of three courses for those wishing to incorporate the half-board aspect giving a choice of two options for each starter main and dessert. I was fortunate enough to have chosen the chicken tagine for the main course which cannot be understated as one of the best courses I have ever eaten anywhere. I'm happy to say that it has certainly set the standard of what I believe tagine should taste like in Marrakech if it is anywhere near as amazing from the restaurant at the hotel.    The staff although often caring and attentive (one time I was sitting in the indoor lounge and one of the staff closed the curtains to the main door and turned on the AC which I appreciated) are easily approachable and quick to attend to service requests.    As stated in other reviews cleanliness goes without saying - absolutely no issues is spotless.    Overall it's a great relief to come back to the hotel from the often blistering heat of the Medina. The social areas for relaxing are very comfortable and emanate tranquility. If I come back to Morocco I will certainly be recommending LBK to family + friends.

Unfortunately I caught a stomach bug in Fes so we were rather exhausted (and not very optimistic) upon arriving in Marrakech after an 8 hour train ride. But then we discovered Les Borjs de la Kasbah. Described to us aptly as something between a Ryad and a luxury hotel this proved to be a tranquil oasis in the heat an bustle of the city. The room was spacious clean and not laking any of the comforts of home. The staff was polite and friendly and took excellent care of us. The restaurant bar and pool were of the highest standard so despite my upset stomach we had a wonderful stay. We didn't get to see much of Marrakech but thanks to Les Borjs de la Kasbah we didn't miss anything. Thank you for making our stay in Marrakech so special and a very pleasant experience despite the circumstances. We heartily recommend this place and we will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Repeat visitor in love with this hotel
Review_Text: Everything you've read is true. It's quiet beautiful serves fantastic food has incredibly warm service and offers exceptionally comfortable rooms. Just stay here. I can't enough good things about this property. It is so relaxing; you will never want to leave.

Review_Date: Alisa N wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Best Hotel I've stayed at. Was sad to leave.
Review_Text: When I booked my trip to Morocco I was not exactly sure on what to expect. I did the research but sometimes it's a complete waste and you don't get what you expect. I didn't get what I expected I got better. I was greeted  by staff not only upon my arrival but everyday everywhere I went within the environment. The staff and guests were all so friendly. Fatima Hisham and Elham were a few of the people I spent more time speaking with although everyone made me feel at home.    My room was always impeccably spotless. I loved how they left rose belts on my bed everyday. The extra touch really made a difference.    The meals are were delicious. I loved how breakfast was included. The egg omelette was delicious. My favorite main entrees for dinner: of course the chicken tangine and chicken cordon bleu. I tried the chicken tfgya and it was also delicious but not my favorite.    The pool area is great. It's relaxing and great place to start your day.    Last but not least make sure you have a Hammam. This was the best thing to do at the start of my trip. It rids all the dead skin so I glowed the entire trip.    Thank you so much to everyone at LBK. I will be back to see you soon. You are all amazing and I appreciate your hard work into making my stay the best.    I hope everyone gets to experience this at least once in their life.    Alisa

Review_Date: Bella R wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Don't look any further, just book it
Review_Text: This beautiful gem exceeded my high expectations with the warm and attentive staff genuine welcome and so much more...  I stayed for two nights in room 205 and just wished I could of extended it for longer!  Highly recommend spa( super relaxing experience) and skincare products that you could purchase in there too!  It's a winner choice and I am glad that I experienced it myself.  Thank you Guys you are doing brilliant job 👌

Review_Title: Felt like a Princess of 1001 Nights
Review_Text: Already at arrival I felt really welcome by the friendly staff. They offered me tea and delicious cookies and showed me the entire facilites to make sure I find my way at the Riad right from day 1. My room was stylish cozy with dark wooden furniture fresh and shady (plus airco) large comfortable and very clean. The housekeeping did an excellent job. I e.g. just mentioned (not complained) that at home my mattrass is a bit softer. They immediately came to change the mattrass!    I loved the breakfast and truly appreciated that I could decided on taking a lunch or dinneer spontaneously without previous booking. The quality and choice of dishes was very good so was the atmosphere in the inner courtyard.    I really want to mention the service attitude attentiveness and friendliness of the whole (mainly female) staff absolutely extra-ordinary very diligent and professional.    In general I enjoyed the ambiance the decor the spa pool and sunbathing facilities in the Riad which was most welcome due to the hot temperature in Marrakech. I feel it was good value for the money. The location in the old Kasbah is very recommendable. In my opinion a much better choice that going for a hotel outside the city. In the end I could keep my room till departure at 16:00 h (without extra charges). True customer service!    The only negative comment from my point of view: I booked at the reception a guided tour 3 hrs for dirham 400 plus entrance & taxi fees. I felt this was not worth the money.    100% recommendable

Review_Title: Lovely oasis in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: Borjs is a beautifully renovated riad in the southern part of the medina near the Saadi mausoleum and royal palace. Rooms overlook either the pool or the courtyard where dinner is served; they are very quiet due to the ancient type of construction (adobe). They have all the modern amenities and include lovely rose-scented soaps and shampoo. Dinner is excellent. The riad is located about a 15' walk from place Jemma el Fna which means it is far from the tourist traps close to the square and is much quieter. Early mornings and late evenings the medina comes to life and outside the hotel one feels part of regular neighborhood with its craftspeople and local stores.

Review_Title: Lovely hotel just a short walk from main sights
Review_Text: The reception desk service was really excellent and the other service was fine although we did have to ask for towels for the pool on several occasions. The building rooms pool area were all really lovely. The restaurant was good as well. The location is very convenient for the main sights but a bit hidden away from usual tourist spots so taxi drivers had some problems finding it.  It would be great if the water supplied in the room on arrival was chilled.

Review_Date: Sophie W wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Marrakesh is hot busy and crowded. But when we stepped into Les Borjs we got into a quite beautiful and nice world. This place is safe clean and convenient. Breakfast is luxurious buffet and has a lot of choices.

My wife and I stayed here having found an advert for the place at the back of the Telegraph. Booking straight through the hotel site we saved money got an upgrade (apparently the best suite in the hotel) and got free transfers.    Having never been to Morrocco or Marakesh neither of us really knew what to expect. This Riad is basically through a door off the side of a quiet street. The receptionist's customer service was second to none from the moment we arrived. We were greeted with mint tea biscuits etc and given a tour of the place. We mentioned it was our 10 year anniversary the following day and when we arrived back at our room found a bottle in ice waiting for us! Our room was perfect the whole place is spotlessly clean and the swimming pool is just right for having a dip or lying next to sunbathing.    Location wise it's pretty good. It's not far to the main square and really easy to navigate there. It's also at the quieter end of the old town and right next to a great cafe called cafe Clock. There is also the cafe Kasbah not too far away.  Our favourite find was the Nomad cafe which we went to a couple of times. Prices for food are cheap so no need to worry there. There is also another good cafe opposite Nomad on the other side of the square - the name escapes me but this is also very good.    All in all a great stay lovely weather lovely hosts great food. Don't come here if you want a boozy trip. Although they serve beer/wine at the hotel it's really not that sort of place.    Hope this helps.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A piece of heaven in the middle of chaos
Review_Text: This riad turned out to be more than we'd expected. Only 15 min away from jemma El fna and located within the medina this was by far the best place we've stayed in Morocco. We had booked a standard room and got upgraded to a superior one upon arrival. The pool is beautiful and even bigger than the pictures. We could hardly believe we were in the middle of the noisy streets of the medina. The hotel service was top notch: all of the girls were respectful well informed helpful and always smiling. Wish we could have stayed longer...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place was even nicer than the photos. It is so quiet and peaceful. The staff are exceptionally friendly. And the place itself is beautifully done up. The food is great and it is a 15 min walk from the main souks and square. The pool was a major plus we did a lot of research to find a place that had a pool but still had character. Most places only have a tiny pool in the middle of a restaurant or are modern hotels outside the city walls. So this place was perfect. Couldn't recommend it enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane M wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Having visited Marrakech frequently in the last few years and stayed in many places I have now found my home from home in the city. I researched this hotel before staying and visited on my last trip to check it out was impressed and booked. Tom and Norah were welcoming and helpful as were their fantastic staff nothing was to much trouble. The hotel food and pool were first class my room was spacious clean and more than comfortable. The experience was lovely boutique hotel meets luxury traditional riad just perfect. The meals were very tasty always using fresh ingredients my compliments to the talented chefs. Norah arranged airport transfers and made all the paperwork easy and quick with homemade pastries and mint tea a great welcome. Will be returning again and again.

Review_Date: Frances T wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent! This is a gem!
Review_Text: Stayed here from the 21st - 29th June for my first visit to Marrakech and Morocco. I was not disappointed at all with this lovely friendly boutique hotel/Ryiad. From the moment we got there the staff and owner Tom and Norah were great hosts and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were very comfortable with great extras like the bath robe as a nice touch.
