The pool was a nice size not too big and quiet and tranquil with service at the pool for great salads sandwiches pizza and drinks. We paid for half board and there was always a choice from the menu and the food was very fresh and cooked to a very good standard that I couldn't fault it in any way.  The location is ideal in the royal quarter of the Kasbah within easy slow 10 min walk to the main square and souks. We went out early in the morning after breakfast at 8am so we could be back around the pool by 1pm as it was 42°F most days so good to have a nice place to relax and cool down at out of the heat. I would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone as it is big enough to have a lot of great service and well maintained decor of a high graded hotel but small enough with low amount of rooms to feel you are feeling like a valued house guest.  Thank you for a great stay and look forward to next May when I stay again!

Review_Date: Jonathan M wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Les Borjs is a wonderful Riad created out of 7 adjoined properties and restored completely by hand with no power tools. The worksmanship is excellent food is lovely and the staff are excellent. We don't often visit the same place twice as we like to try new places out but we'd definitely go back here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We don't normally write reviews but felt we really needed to say something about this place! Where do we start? This place is an absolute gem! From the moment we stepped inside we were amazed at how peaceful and calm this place is considering the all the chaos right on its doorstep!    We stayed in one of the suites which was lovely. The room was quite spacious and clean. The only problem we had was the odd smell from the bath - which I would blame other factors not so much the cleaning staff.    The staff at the front desk keenly helped us arrange tours and guides for us and eagerly helped us make bookings with the spa. If you end up staying here and trying the spa (because your body might ask for it with the heat and all the walking) the best part is the hammam although I wish there was a better massage at the end of the treatment. We did go in for massages in the days following and felt relaxed enough but we knew going in that we weren't exactly on a spa vacation.    We loved the staff! A shout out to all of the lovely ladies who were pleasant from the start of their shifts right to the end! And Tom what a lovely person! It was very kind of you to take the time out and come chat to us.    All in all given its location facilities attention to detail and staff we would have no hesitation to come back with our children! Another winning factor for this place is that we were looking for a place which was clean close to attractions with a pool and reasonable spa; and this place met all of our criteria.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben S wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: I can't say enough good things about this Marrakech oasis. We stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for two nights left for a few days came back for one night left again and returned for a final night. Each time we returned the staff greeted us like we were old friends and it felt so sincere.    The hotel is walking distance from most attractions the food is great they have a stocked bar a wonderful pool and each room is spacious and opens onto a central courtyard.    Any request we had the staff helped us out and though we didn't use the spa services they looked great. I would recommend this hotel highly and thank the staff for a lovely home away from home during our Moroccan vacation.

Review_Date: Rosalinda G wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: I really recommend this Ryad the place is like in the pictures very clean we had a early flight and they brought us breakfast to our room at 5am they go beyond on customer service. The hamman and scrubbing bath is marvelous.

staying in Les Borjs was the best decision i made in marrakesh.    upon arrival Nora at the front desk greets you like you just arrived in your own home. she welcomes you with a traditional morracan tea which was excellent while she handles the paperwork. she then shows you the room and i knew right then i made the right pick. this place is immaculate and you can tell the people who work here pride themselves on keeping a top notch operation.    i had a chance to interface with many staff during my 3 nights stay and they were all extremely nice and incredibly helpful. i came to marrakech without doing much research and Nora and others helped me figure out the best places to go and looked up other information.    i can't say enough positive things about this place. yes the location is bit away from the main square but i found that as a positive also. you will get to see the other side of the old town where you won't see too many tourists at night. i enjoyed walking back to the hotel because it gave you a different perspective than had you stayed right in the center. besides palace and tomb is stones throw away.    on my last day i got to meet the owner tom and i could see how this place has the dna that it has. tom is well travelled also so he knows what is like to be in a foreign place. he's had an interesting life which i think translates very well into what he is doing now. we had a pleasant conversation.    overall there's no doubt you will have a good time staying in les borjs. if you can't believe what i am saying tune into hundreds of other reviewers who are raving about this place also. i don't normally write reviews but i do so when i see an exceptional place such as les borjs.    to tom nora and all the staff i want to thank you for your hospitality and i will sure to stay here again when i come back to visit. cheers!    kevin

+Friendly staff  +Great location 10 minute walk from central square  +Quiet relaxing atmosphere  +Good size rooms (thanks for upgrade)  +Socially responsible policies regarding staff and environment  -Only negative is the wifi isn't great

Review_Date: Liam J wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: A beautifully designed and thought-out hotel.    Perfectly blends exquisite Marrakech aesthetic with exceptional service.  Delightful design touches include the latticing the archways & bougainvillea. Resident buntings sing and play all day. There are several intimate and more social lounges set around a stunning centrepiece riad style courtyard and fountain.    The staff & management are beyond wonderful; calm kind co-operative but never intrusive; They will help you with anything and offer services from day trips to an in house hammam and swimming pool.    The kitchen dinner and day menus are excellent the specialties requiring 24 hour notice are well worth it the rooms are gorgeous (I stayed in four because we kept extending our stay)    I liked it so much I joined trip advisor :)

Review_Date: helen m wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: I booked this holiday on the strength of other travellers' reviews.. also it was within my price range for a mini break. It more than exceeded my expectations. Upon arrival I was immediately upgraded to a double room from my originally booked single. Nothing is too much trouble for these lovely members of staff. I met the owner Tom who is British and makes a point of introducing himself to all guests. My room was lovely; had all the facilities and amenities one would expect at a high end hotel and the food is freshly prepared with a good variety of local and european dishes.  I think the very best feature of this riad is the intimacy and peace that it provides even though it is placed just within the busy Medina. The swimming pool is fabulous too with a small bar and snack area. Main meals are in the dining room and wonderful central courtyard. The very best value for money and friendliest establishment I have ever stayed in.... and at my age I've done a few! Perhaps I should also add that I am a middle aged female single traveller so friendliness service comfort and safety are of paramount importance to me.

Les Borjs de la Kasbah is located on a small side-street on the south end of the Kasbah close to the Royal Palace. The entrance is simple and nondescript but then opens into a large beautiful courtyard. We were warmly greeted by the owner and his staff upon our arrival. The hotel accommodations and amenities are excellent. The breakfast buffet is excellent - the best breakfast we had during our entire time in Morocco. The pool provides a refreshing respite from the heat of the day. I highly recommend Les Borjs to anyone staying in Marraketch.

We have stayed here several times but not for a good few years and had forgotten just how good it is a true hidden gem that superlatives don't do justice. Tom (the manager) and his team are so welcoming and very accommodating. The rooms are generous in size and beautifully appointed.    The location is great with an interesting 10-15 minute stroll to the main square through the "true" Marrakech and close to the old synagogue.    I cannot recommend this Riad highly enough with just 18 rooms its big enough to count but small enough to care!    Thanks for a great stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Plain on the street side, beautiful on the inside
Review_Text: We were amazed at the room size the quality of fit and finish the service and staff the food and the exotic character of Les Borjs de la Kasbah. The owners (English/French) somehow managed an exceptionally elegant hotel but with Moroccan character by combining 7 buildings into one well-designed hotel with a great (licensed) restaurant and swimming pool. Access is relatively easy if the owner knows when you are arriving. We stayed two nights and would have enjoyed many more.

Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a wonderful retreat from the Kasbah and is a riad that my wife and I would return to without hesitation. The noise bustle heat and yes sometimes the odors of the Medina seemed miles away as soon as we crossed the threshhold. The main courtyard is comfortably large — and many in Marrakech are uncomfortably small or have tiny “swimming” pools stuck in the center — and the spaces at the perimeter of the courtyard with cushioned couches and chairs are wonderful places to relax and rejuvenate (especially during happy hour).    There’s a large pool (by riad standards) in a separate sunny courtyard with comfortable lounges and plenty of fluffy towels.    It would be hard to exaggerate the helpfulness of every member of the staff. They worked tirelessly and bent over backwards to help my wife when her luggage was delayed three days (Transavia Airlines). They repeatedly called the airport’s baggage office for us and essentially acted as our intermediaries with the airport bureaucracy. They also were very helpful in suggesting places we could shop for necessities. They had good advice and suggestions for restaurants in the vicinity and were cheerful and gracious to boot. Language was not a problem (which is not the case in some riads) and some of the staff were fluent in English.    Our room was very pleasant with ample AC (which we could easily adjust) and had a lovely sitting area and large bathroom (with both shower and large tub). The bed was extremely comfortable. The furnishings were lovely and authentic.    Tom the manager made a point of speaking to us each day either at breakfast or when he saw us lounging near the main courtyard and always wanted to know if everything was OK or if we needed help with anything. His care and concern (about everything not just our delayed baggage) were apparent and genuine.    It is at the very southern extreme of the Medina so it is a bit of a hike if you go on foot to get to the souks or to some of the better-reviewed restaurants. However to us that was a real advantage of staying here. The location though it looks as though it might be inconvenient is actually pretty close to ideal. It’s in the Medina in a real neighborhood but it’s also easy to get in and out and it’s very close to the Sa’adian Tombs and a few other sites (and to a goverment-run fixed-price store if you’re not eager to engage in hard bargaining in the souks). The desk will call a taxi for you on demand at any time so getting to the new part of the city (Ville Nouvelle) or to the Jemaa El Fnaa or to the souks or to the major sites is quick easy trouble-free and ridiculously cheap (10 - 30 MAD depending on the distance). Also the riad is located on a wide main street so taxis can pull up right in front. Many other riads are located on narrow derbs that taxis can’t reach so if you with them it’s a constant struggle through crowded narrow crooked alleys to get anywhere.    Les Borjs de la Kasbah also operates a restaurant. It has an extensive a la carte menu featuring both Moroccan and Continental dishes and also has a set menu that changes each night. We actually ate here all five nights that we stayed (we then moved to a different riad at the opposite end of the Medina for five more days). The atmosphere was inviting the ambience pleasant (even romantic) the Moroccan wine was inexpensive and delicious and the food was good. The Moroccan dishes were not gourmet but well prepared tagines tangias and couscous among many other things and were easily as good as any of the other moderately-priced restaurants we tried.    Breakfast was the only flaw albeit a minor one. Moroccan pancakes crepes etc. were prepared in advance and set out under plastic wrap (so flies couldn’t reach them). Since there was a cook on site who prepared eggs to order we’d think that it shouldn’t have been necessary to prepare other dishes in advance. Also breakfast was supposed to begin at 7 AM and one morning when we needed to leave early wasn’t set up until 7:30. Also to save themselves trouble on that day the staff had already set up the tables in the dining courtyard for dinner so we had to eat breakfast that morning in a room off the courtyard out of the open air which we didn’t care for. The coffee was excellent as was the homemade yogurt. The fresh sliced oranges and grapefreuit were juicy and sweet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Staff was friendly. Especially the director where we had a short chat with. Invited us to use the pool even though we did not stay at that hotel.    Food (tajine kefta with eggs) was good and not pricey at all!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bryony K wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: 3rd visit to this Hotelrecommendation in itself! Lots of complimentary treats this time as we were celebrating a Birthday & Wedding Anniversary! Consistently good Riadrun by extremely helpfulpleasant Staff under the Supervision of Tom the Manager. We had guided tours of Marrakesh & the Atlas Mountainswhich included stops at a traditional Berber Housethe Ouzoud Waterfallsa Women's Cooperative producing Argan Oil & a Saffron Farm. These were arranged by Nora at Reception. The Hammam is a mustit was only a shortage of time that prevented us from having more treatments. My advicego & experience this Hotel yourself!

Review_Date: Helen C wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Loved staying here. Delightful to meet Tom and Nora. They run a beautiful hotel.
Review_Text: Fabulous hotel. The staff were delightful and very helpful. Our room was large with everything you would expect . The courtyard was a cool relaxing area to read and relax. Can thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rich W wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Lovely traditional retreat in great city!
Review_Text: We had a wonderful 4 days in the special Riad in Marrakech. The detail in the restoration is wonderful to see and the friendly service is first class. Is seems so strange how peaceful it is given the hectic city just outside.  The hotel arranged a tour of the Atlas mountains by a guy called Cherif. I cannot recommend him more if you are thinking about doing a similar trip here. Safe driver and really interesting guy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One of our favourite riads among all those we stayed in during our 2-week trip in Morocco. We stayed here for 2 nights - the room was spacious and clean and overlooks the courtyard. We had dinner in the courtyard on both nights and the food was yummy. There was a good variety of breakfast choices - breads yogurt fruits pancakes eggs etc.    Would stay here again if we visit Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A return trip to Les Borjs after a break of a few years and thankfully little has changed apart from some new planting and sprucing up here and there. Lovely rooms wonderful staff many of whom remembered us from previous visits (I do like a place that can retain good staff) great food and a relaxed ambience that other places would do well to copy. Get them to arrange your trips for you you wont be disappointed. My husband loved his cookery lesson and I loved eating the fruits of his labours! Tom as ever went out of his way to be helpful and we look forward to returning sooner rather than later. Oh and Happy Hour is a great new addition since our last visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: KAVIA S wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I recently stayed here for two weeks while in Marrakesh. The hotel was beautiful and the staff EXCELLENT! Everyone pays such close attention to detail and they make sure you are pleased with everything. They are genuinely concerned about you having an excellent stay in Marrakesh :-) This is the best staff hands down.  Thank you Les Borjs de la Kasbah for making my stay in Morocco pleasant. You are the best!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A quiet tranquil and elegant oasis in the middle of the vibrant bustle of the Marrakech kasbah. Every one of the personnel we interacted with was friendly service oriented and very good at their job.

Review_Date: Caroline H wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel - a place of calm and tranquillity in the midst of a wonderfully vibrant diverse & interesting Kasbah. Staff helpful efficient but non-intrusive. I cannot recommend highly enough - a must if visiting Morocco. Thank you to Tom - an excellent host and his amazing team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Hands down! Why?  1.) The Staff. I cannot speak highly enough about the staff. They were exceptional and examples of what everyone in the hospitality industry should aspire to. I got sick during my trip and they treated me like a member of their own family. They brought me bananas and rice to settle my stomach made me special rosemary thyme tea and cumin water (Moroccan traditional remedies) and thoughtfully checked up on me. Their care was such a comfort and you could tell that they are sincere in their desire to accommodate you so that you have the best stay. .  2.) The Restaurant. My group ate 90% of our meals at the hotel. The food was so delicious there was no need to look elsewhere. Over our weeklong stay we tried a selection of items from the menu and everything we tried was delicious. Get the chicken tagine. It is out of this world delicious! One day we took a 3-hour private cooking class where we made a 3-course meal which we then ate. It was educational and fun trying our hand at preparing traditional dishes under the guidance of Mariem. the sweet loveable house chef.  3.) The Pool. My favorite spot in the hotel was by the pool. Pictures cannot capture how beautiful it is. The pool was the perfect temperature and the courtyard was sunny and beautiful with its flowering vines. The pool-side food and drink service by the incredible Fatima and Mounia made spending the day there a delight.  4.) The Spa. My husband and I had a hammam gomage message package at a very affordable price. The hammam was beautiful marble and the massage room was warm and comfortable. We got scrubbed down and then rubbed down and after an hour and a half I felt and slept like a baby.  5.) The Room. It was spacious well appointed and nicely decorated with traditional style that was also comfortable. Well lit with separate tub and shower ample storage and a comfortable bed. My room overlooked the courtyard with windows that opened so you could hear the birds chirping from their nests in the flowering vines. If you wanted to get out of your room there were plenty of seating areas in the public areas that you could tuck into.  6.) The Attention to Detail. It may seem inconsequential but the small details really stood out at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. The mint tea and Moroccan cookies we were greeted with the flower petals placed daily on our bed the complimentary bar snacks during happy hour the music selections during dinner and even the towels at the pool! Seriously the softest nicest pool towels I have ever experienced. You can tell the owner and staff make the extra effort.  Don’t hesitate to book a stay at this hotel. You will not regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely Haven from the Busy Streets
Review_Text: We stayed four nights in this wonderful hotel. It was remodeled combining seven houses (or riads) in the Medina - or old town -- of Marrakesh. The architecture and decorations are traditional Moroccan and so tastefully done. Our room was a junior suite - very large and so nice. The staff are all wonderful and helpful - they even sent someone to buy us train tickets for when we would leave for Fez. The owner came by to say hello and ask if all was going well. There is a nice big courtyard and several other sitting areas to relax and have a drink or snack. Also a nice restaurant. Breakfast was great with lots of choices from eggs to crepes etc. I had a massage in the spa which was lovely and very inexpensive compared to the US. A second courtyard contains a nice pool and lounging area. I have only good things to say about his hotel. It was away from the main square about four or five blocks and a welcome haven from the craziness of the streets square and souks of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An oasis to come back to and relax after the bustle of Marrakech. The decor rooms and pool were of the highest quality and it was to be approached by the owner in person to ask how I was enjoying my stay.

Review_Date: Ginny K wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Sadly I only spent one night here but it was just perfect. Friendly and welcoming staff beautiful surroundings peaceful room overlooking the courtyard and a lovely tranquil feel despite being in the heart of the Kasbah. Will definitely return!

We stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for 4 nights in March with our 2 year old daughter. The service and friendly nature of the staff was impeccable. They would go out of their way for us and especially our daughter. The Riad itself is beautiful with traditional Moroccan architecture. Our room was spacious clean and quiet. The location is excellent just 15 mins walk from the Jemaa El Fnaa square. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty with a hot and cold selection plus some Moroccan specialities. Tom the owner was ever present and only too happy to talk and give advise. The only minor negative was dinner at the Riad which was 'OK' in terms of taste. Overall we had a superb stay and would definitely stay here again.

This place had great reviews online and it was fully justified. Run by great staff had an amazing hamman and lovely decor.    I was given a free upgrade into an amazing room. The location is slightly away from touristy part but that is definitely a good thing

Okeveryone says how amazing this place is.an oasis of tranquillity in a wonderfully crazy city.with some of the most truly friendly and helpful people who you will ever meet in a hotel environment.with a very kindand easy going driver who collects you from the airport and takes you on great day tours.or the comments about the beauty of the roomswith lush soaps.sadly it's all true and my title was just a good bit of British cynicism.thanks Tom x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic stay in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: A short break in the half term holiday staying in this amazing boutique hotel. Situated in the old walled part of the city in the Kasbah you are immersed in the hurly burly of street life until you step through the door into an oasis of calm. From before we arrived we had exceptional service. When you arrive you are welcomed with mint tea and pastries in the beautiful cool calm courtyard. Our room was one of the larger ones as it had space for the extra bed. The beds are made with crisp white sheets decorated with rose petals and palm leaves. In the the seating area there was a bowl of fresh fruits and a bottle of mineral water. The bathroom had a bath separate shower two basins and a European toilet. The towel's were fluffy and plentiful and a few toiletries were also provided. The room had a safe for passports a good size wardrobe and a dressing table desk. There is also TV and satellite system if you have time to watch it! The rooms are heated or cooled by an air conditioning system which was very efficient.  The breakfast was very good a wide range of cereals fruits meats and cheese as well as pastries toast and breads. A Cook makes wonderful Moroccan pancakes and omelettes to order. And there is English breakfast tea alongside the full range of drinks  Evenings are started in the bar area with one of the delicious cocktails. The chef has a menu of international dishes alongside Moroccan ones so there is something for everyone. The portions are large and everything was great quality. Its worth leaving room for pudding!  We didn't go to the spa but judging by everything else I'm sure it would offer a superb service. The heated pool was a big hit with my 9 year old and was warm enough to use in February  The reception can arrange trips and tours for you and offer a wide range at great prices. We booked our trips in advance but almost wished we hadn't.  What makes this hotel so good is the incredible cleanliness the warm helpful friendly staff and the attention to every detail.  I cannot recommend this place highly enough and I have travelled all over the world.

It is an amazing riad very typical excellent location very quiet amazing helpful staff. Great food and restaurant and happy hour at the bar. My friend and I loved the tea-sweet welcome. My only suggestion is to put a little bit more light in the restaurant and improve the Wifi connection in the rooms.

Review_Title: Nothing short of superb! BOOK NOW!
Review_Text: We very much enjoyed our stay in this sublime oasis. Tom the director was highly accommodating and friendly and made our stay extra enjoyable. The staff are all very welcoming smiley and helpful. The rooms are luxurious and very comfortable and has all the amenities you'd need. We particularly enjoyed the variety of choice and top notch quality of the food in the restaurant. The hotel is fantastically situated and our night's sleep wasn't disrupted at all by the exciting hustle and bustle of the city. Book immediately for a magical and agreeable time. We were highly impressed with this magnificent place and will without doubt return soon! Thank you Tom and staff. :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Book your own airport transfer and guides and excursions!!
Review_Text: Dear Tom: Your place is amazing your staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is excellent the boring lunch and dull passionless dinner cuisine needs to be improved. We slept well and enjoyed the amenities. Adequate internet for most part of our stay.  At the same time we recommend to scrupulously handpick your tour guides chauffeurs and the like. Regrettably our otherwise pleasant vacation was negatively impacted by unreliable unpleasant (unsafe) outside services while we relied on your hotel's recommendations and experience to assure a worry-free holiday. Travelling with a child (6) we left a few days earlier (than booked and paid)... sad!

Review_Date: Elfi B wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: My husband and 2 year old daughter visited Les Borsj de la Kasbah during Christmas 2016. Having read basically all reviews about this place on every platform I could find we had very very high expectations about the Riad. We were absolutely surprised to learn that the truth was... even better than we could have imagined. We could continue to compliment the beautiful junior suite we stayed in. We could align with so many great comments about the food. We could be another guest telling you to really check out the spa (as it really is better than a couple of others we've tried). And we could also just be amongst those visitors that left Les Borsj de la Kasbah having made friends with guests and staff. So let me just rap it up by saying: the amazing reviews are just a shadow of the wonderful experience we've had. We'll be back next Christmas. Perhaps you as well?

Beautiful rooms and grounds terrific breakfast (especially the little pancakes with honey) wonderful staff terrific small spa helpful travel advice....I really loved my long stay here. I stayed in a single room that was perfect for my needs. The owner and people who work there will do anything to help.

Review_Title: Echoes of all the positive comments
Review_Text: There is really little to add to all the glowing reviews already here except to add 'I agree'! The decor the welcoming helpful staff the local menus and the attention to detail makes this a wonderful comfortable place to stay. I would recommend the hotel to all my friends and look forward to returning before too long.

Review_Date: Paul S wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: A wonderful retreat from the hubbub in the Kasbah
Review_Text: We traveled with two other couples for a birthday trip. The experience package included a tour of the souk a session in the hammam and a cooking demonstration. It was extremely good value. Our birthday dinner in the hotel's restaurant was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Peaceful and welcoming Riad close enough to walk to the main sights of the centre. From start to finish the staff at Les Borjs de la Kasbah couldn't have been more friendly or helpful (particularly the reception staff). The Riad has been beautifully designed and decorated with all areas well maintained. The continental breakfast had a great selection including freshly cooked omelettes and pancakes. We enjoyed a Hamman Spa massage treatment at the Riad which we would highly recommend. The only downside for us (being sun worshippers) was the lack of sun by the pool. As it was January when we visited the sun is not high enough in the sky to quite reach the beautiful courtyard swimming pool. However I would imagine it is quite a sun trap in the summer months. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a traditional style Riad in the heart of Marrakech.

Loved our time here. The property is quaint and beautiful. The breakfast food and the other food items were delicious - some of the best we had in Morocco.The spa was the perfect relaxation we needed. The service was fantastic. We had to catch a flight at 7am and the staff hand delivered a hot breakfast at 5am so we could eat before we leave.

Review_Date: steve r wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: We spent a week a Les Borjs as a gift for my partners 60th Birthday and had researched in depth where to stay. Delighted in our final choice as we were pleasantly surprised at what was behind the front door. Atmospheric and cultural treats awaited us as the decor and design of the hotel was charming to say the least.  We were lucky enough to stay in two of the suites both were different and both had there own appeal. The lay out of the hotel is beautiful and peaceful but be aware of the dawn chorus depending on which room you are in. Inside Restaurant is cosy and the outside restaurant area lovely and very decorative. Cosy areas are abundant to sit and relax at any time of the day.  Breakfast was extremely good with very tasty fresh produce.... particularly loved the bread.! Plenty on offer and enough choice for everyone. We stayed half board and found the evening menu varied and very appetizing with an excellent a la carte menu if preferred. Staff are friendly and helpful and will do all they can for youbut don't expect the same from the night staff as one member in particular was certainly lacking in people skills.  Completely fell for the charms of the lovely receptionists Inham and Nora who made up for any shortfall in others. Spotlessly clean hotel hidden from the hussle and bustle of the city and would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Owner Tom was also available and helpful when needed and will try and resolve any issues you may have.  We have very fond memories of this visit and look forward to returning one day soon x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ROGER H wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah a wonderful oasis in a wonderful city
Review_Text: Les Borj Kasbah Spa Hotel is the perfect hotel in the best location for the true Marrakech experience. The hotel is fantastic however it is the staff who really make this hotel stand out. The kind friendly and knowledgable team will impress even the most travelled guests.  I particularly love the 15 minute walk into the main square passing the spice shops fruit juice stands and smoky bar b ques. Keep an eye open for the donut guy selling huge sugar coated 10 cent donuts. He is on the right as you enter Rue Kasbah. Buy a bunch for less than one Euro and share them with any kids hanging around. Their smiles and politeness a true reward.  Open your heart and embrace the people sights sounds and tastes of this fantastic city and country. Trust me you will be booking your return to Les Borj de la Kasbah before you leave.

Review_Date: Sarah E wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Wonderful, friendly and relaxed Riad in a fantastic location!
Review_Text: We had an amazing time at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. The staff were so welcoming and went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Breakfast is great as is the restaurant and bar and the location is perfect for all the major city sights. Our suite was a peaceful break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech - we will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is the second time I have stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah and it won't be the last. I love it. A quiet oasis from the frenetic pace of Marrakech. Great location - a 10 minute walk to main square but in a quiet side street. Everything you need is close by.  Tom and his team could not be more helpful and nothing is too much trouble.  Rooms are great and very stylish. Food is excellent and have enjoyed several meal in the hotel.  Nice pool area and spa facilities.  Highly recommended.

We stayed in Les Borjs de la Kasbah for 6 nights. Such a beautiful hotel. We were greeted by the beautiful Nora who made us feel very welcome. Breakfast was freshly made everyday. Omletttes are so fresh new fluffy. Everybody was very friendly and nothing was ever a problem. We enjoyed all that was to offer in the hotel and look forward to going back in the next year or so. We enjoyed several excursions organised by the hotel so we knew what we were paying and didn't have to worry about getting there or back as we had door to door pick up/return everytime. Was sad to leave but all good things come to an end. Thank you to everyone at Borjs de la Kasbah. You're truly the best 5* hotel we've stayed at for a long time. See you again soon.    Nikki & Lee xXx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my partner spent a week at the hotel and had a wonderful peaceful and tranquil time it was everything we were looking for absolutely stunning and beautiful place with food and staff to match we were waited on hand and foot by the wonderful happy staff who were always happy to help with anything we asked nothing was problem we had an absolutely wonderful time
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah was the perfect hotel to relax and unwind in the crazy city of Marrakech. The staff are extraordinarily helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself is located in Kasbah (just outside of the old city walls) and accessible to cabs. It is a good location for sight-seeing (they can also arrange reasonable car services to get you to and from destinations as well). I took advantage of their spa facilities and highly recommend the Hamman Bath. It was a bit chilly to swim but the pool is heated. My room was quite comfortable and spacious. As a solo traveller I felt safe and looked forward to coming back to this beautiful hotel to unwind.

Review_Date: alison r wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Soothing stay after a desert trek
Review_Text: Lovely traditional but stylish Riad in an interesting area just a short walk from the centre of Marrakesh.  This was a perfect relaxing end to an energetic holiday. Very comfortable rooms lots of quiet corners to relax and the luxury of a pool and spa where you can enjoy high-quality traditional hammam or massage. Very good breakfast and charming staff. Highly recommended.

Review_Title: Day visit for pool and spa.
Review_Text: We visited this hotel to use the pool on our final day in Marrakesh. We were made to feel very welcome by all of the staff including the director. To use the pool it costs 100MAD which was much cheaper than other options.

Review_Title: Exceptional and Beautiful Les Borjs de las Kasbah!
Review_Text: My two friends and myself have just returned from a fantastic three night stay at this beautiful Riad. Although just 15 mins walk from the central Medina and busy bustling Souks the minute you walk through the door of Les Borjs you are transported into a world which is a blend of traditional Moroccan and European culture. The quality and level of service we received was truely outstanding nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were so attentive kind and helpful and obviously happy in their work! Special mention for the excellent cocktails during "Happy Hour" and delicious cuisine. Tom the Director should take credit for his attention to detail and in creating such an exceptional and unique haven . We fell in love with Morocco Marrakech and its people during our visit and hope to return again one day!

Review_Date: Monica H wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Excellent stay in a great location!
Review_Text: My friend and I just stayed here for 3 nights in late September and really enjoyed our stay! We stayed in a suite and found the room to be very comfortable (including living area and large bathroom). The staff certainly MADE the experience the best part of our stay they are SO friendly and go out of their way to make sure you're having a good time. The breakfasts tea time and happy hours are all two thumbs up in my book as well! I made time to hang out by the pool area on a very hot day but didn't get the chance to use the spa - next time! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakesh. They have a great location friendly staff large clean gorgeous rooms and multiple common areas all which make this hotel amazing :)

Review_Date: Liz B wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: My family and I spent a few days at this hotel and I will gladly recommend to anyone who will be visiting Marrakech. It boasts of a great location right in the heart of the Kasbah and is right in-between a Riad and a resort. You have all the amenities without losing the cozy feeling of a boutique hotel. I loved the decor which is very traditional Berber/Arabian colors and themes. The owner Tom is very visible and friendly and is passionate about running a family friendly hotel. Le Borjs was definitely the highlight of our stay in Marrakech. The staff is very friendly and you get the feeling that everything is possible as they can arrange any tour experience or guide to make your experience better. We got to personally know Nora Hesham Nadia and Fathima. Take advantages of their spa treatment you will get a bang for your buck and your body will thank you. Also take advantage of their dinner package and save yourself the hassle of going out. This place has earned every single one of its five stars! Only regret is not planning a longer stay here. I will definitely return if I'm in the area!

Staying here was a memorable experience. Nothing was too much trouble. Special mention to Nora who reorganised a couple of tours after Sahara Tours International cancelled as I was the only participant - which my travel agent has subsequently said was unjustified. The hotel is a quiet oasis. Rooms are beautiful . The pool is great. It is a 15 minute walk to the main square so dont expect to be surrounded by hundreds of entertainment or dining options - but there are a few gems if you search Trip Advisor.

My husband and I had an excellent stay at the Les Borjs for 4 nights. We were in suite 107 quiet spacious and romantic. Located close to the souks (15-20min walk) Les Borjs is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle yet accessible from all major tourist spots on foot or short cab ride. Believe the pictures the hotel and grounds do indeed look as depicted online. In terms of amenities full service restaurant bar and spa meant you really didn't have to venture out if didn't want to. We availed of their Hammam service (exceeded expectations!) and took the Ourika valley tour both were timely well organized and good value for money. Last but not least the people at the Riad... The staff are unbelievably polite and accommodating nothing and I mean nothing(!) was too much trouble. We would highly recommend this Riad to anyone looking for a charming relaxed comfortable stay in Marrakech!

Review_Date: Barbara K wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is Superb!!
Review_Text: We just finished a 4 day stay at Les Borjs de la Kasbah and had a fabulous experience there! Like other riads in Marrakech you enter from a typical local bustling street into a virtual oasis of tranquility. The staff is extremely warm and helpful (and all are fluent in English) the patio where lovely breakfasts are served is a delight and our room was lovely and very comofortable. Every effort was made to make our visit easy and problem-free. The riad is a 20 minute walk to the main ("Jemma") square and is slightly tricky to navigate the first time - but it turned out to be a marvelous part of our trip to walk to and from the square the souks and other parts of the city back to Les Borjs each day. Fabulous place!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stany S wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: What a service the people really make the difference in this beautiful and authentic ryad. It is never too much too late too early. Coming from these hectic little medina streets entering this ryad means an oasis of charming quietness and luxery. Great experience. All food is always prepared at time of ordering. I selected this ryad based on comments and reviews from other travellers and I was not disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best part of our trip to Marrakech!
Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad for a week back in May and it was exceptional - probably the best part of our trip to Marrakech. The staff are brilliant the service is as you'd expect in a top 5* hotel and we really couldn't fault anything about the place. We were lucky that it was almost empty whilst we were there so we had the whole place to ourselves most of the time and we were upgraded to one of the suites for almost nothing which was really generous and accommodating of them.    The Riad itself is around a 20 minute walk from the main square but it's a simple route we actually had building works going on right outside the Riad whilst we stayed there but as soon as you walked through the doors there was silence it's a really peaceful and tranquil little escape. Also make sure that you eat at the Le Jasmin restaurant in the evening at least once it's a genuinely top restaurant in it's own right and as good as any food that we had whilst in Marrakech!    Overall I couldn't recommend this Riad enough my parents went to Marrakech a month after we did and decided to stay in a posh hotel costing three times as much they came back really underwhelmed and wished they'd took my recommendation to stay here. I haven't stayed anywhere else in Marrakech but we were really really impressed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeremy B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: A wonderful stay and a great place to relax
Review_Text: We spent 10 days in August in this fantastic boutique hotel in the old part of town 10 minutes walk from the centre. The staff are fantastic and nothing was an issue. Tom runs a great team and they always smiled and laughed with us.  The whole hotel is very clean and rooms have different designs on the bed everyday which was nice touch. Rooms spacious and well equipped.  Meal meals were good for half board basis with enough variety. For breakfast you must try the crepes and omelettes which are freshly made to your requirements.  Although a smallish swimming pool it is quite sufficient for sun bathing and a dip.    Shops are fairly local. The hotel arranged 3 trips for us and these were superb no trouble arranging anything and all the stress taken out.  Highly recommend you visit this hotel if you are in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A fabulous stay in a gorgeous hotel
Review_Text: My husband daughter and I spent 4 nights in Les Borjs de la Kasbah and we all adored it. The hotel was just perfect in everyday. We had suite 303 which was beautiful. The soaps in the bathroom were gorgeous so much so I wanted to buy some to bring home! The pool was perfect and surrounded by jasmine. All the staff were amazing. We will definitely be returning to this slice of paradise.

A fabulous riad located within 10 minutes of the market square. The staff are fantastic and go out of their way to ensure you have everything you need. I loved the different rose petal designs in the room. The room was clean and spacious. The breakfasts were also fantastic- I especially looked forward to the smoothie of the day! The swimming pool is a good size. I would recommend the walking tour as it really helps to find your way around the Medina. I would absolutely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My stay at this Riad has been wonderful it has exceeded my expectations. Special thanks to Nora who helped me with anything and everything possible. Sll the staff are very kind and helpful.The rooms are beautiful we're are in the 303 suite. Love the flower petals details in the room everything is very clean and you have peace and quiet so near to the hectic medina.Breakfast is not the biggest selection but there ate good choices.Definitely will recommend this place!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose this Riad for the celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary and we are so glad we did.  We booked a suite and on arrival we were given their best suite...the 303.  During our entire visit we and all other guest were treated as royals.  The level of service from the complete staff was fantastic ! Everybody was so nice.  The manager Tom came every morning in the breakfast patio to greet all the guest personally.  The day of our anniversary they surprised us with a romantic diner in a cosy place adjacent from one of the patio's.  A nicely decorated table with lamps flowers and...sparkling wine. A special menu was presented to us printed on a paper with our name on it was a marvelous celebration.  Room was large good double bed with quality sheets and pillows great bathroom with bath and separate shower with high (!) water pressure and free amenities. The soap in the dispenser in the shower had a nice fragrance like roses.  Although it was very hot during our stay (40-44° C) the aircon in the room did his job without a problem.  Room was kept very clean and there were rose petals on the bed every day !  The layout of the Riad was marvelous lots of hidden corners were you can relax two nice patio's of which one with orange trees and a fountain in the middle just idyllic.  Nice swimmingpool available with enough sunbeds and free towel service. If you desire a service on the poolside you just have to push a button and the staff comes to you for your order...even a simple bottle of water was then presented in a nice ice bukked to keep it cool.  Breakfast was OK dinner was good a three course diner for the half board guests you can choose between two items in every course. A la cart is also available with some (small) extra costs.  Wines...available good and...affordable !  Enjoyed the happy our...6-7 pm with great cocktails !  It's a 20 min. walk to the square and there is a small shop approx. 100 meter to the left to buy large water bottles.  Said all this we are still in a daze because of the great service we received.  Thank you all for making this celebration unforgettable !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: This is a great place to be! The staff is helpful the food is great - breakfast as well as dinner the hotel is well organized and maintained. It's a quiet but central place. An I will for sure choose the same place for my next visit to Marrakech.

After reading lots of previous positive reviews I booked this place for our family holiday to celebrate my husband's birthday. I booked directly with hotel requesting the room 303 (as it was stated best room with a view to pool and was suitable for us as a family of three plus they had special offer on for stay of 4 or more nights free cooking class spa day day out with guide or bit of all three options). I received email confirming all done apart from that offer was only for two people and we wld have to pay for our daughter.  Couple of days before holiday I received a call from Tom (manager) apologising for double booking room 303 and offering room 107 instead.At that point I wasn't too happy but Tom convinced me that our stay is going to be a VIP one.  Now the moment we walked in this Riad we were treated like VIP's with a bucket full of complimentary treatments. Tom even offered our daughter a Complimentary separate room next to 107. Room 107 is beautifully decorated with a nice clean and modern bathroom. Would definitely recommend staying in that room.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nora's hospitality was exceptional she definitely made us feel like royality. we thoroughly enjoyed our spa treatments cooking class and a guided tour of marrakech.  Beautiful clean quiet Riad with a touch of both modern and traditional touches. I would Definetey recommend it to everyone who wants to stay in marrakech but little away from hustle and bustle of jema el fena. UNFORGETTABLE STAY.

What an amazing haven in the magical mayhem that is Marrakech ! This riad is truly exceptional with tranquility and calm in total luxury. The room are gorgeous beautifully decorated and spacious with fabulous bathrooms. Staff are friendly and professional and we couldn't fault food or drink - especially 'happy hour' cocktails . We had a wonderful hamman in the hotel it was blissful - the reception and 'lounge areas are beautifully and tastefully presented with total comfort and aesthetics being paramount. F A B U L O U S - :D

Review_Title: First time in Marrakesh, best decision booking this riad!
Review_Text: This review is way overdue but I owe it to this riad. It was my first time in Marrakesh and booking this riad was the reason why I wanted to come back to Morocco as soon as I left.    My sister and I arrived in the evening and were picked up from the airport nice and easy. Got to the riad and was welcomed with a mint tea and a few nibbles. I believe it was one of the riad managers who then came to speak to us who was very welcoming.    The room we were given was lovely. I stayed with my sister and we found it funny that our bed and bathroom had rose petals scattered all over...but it was a nice touch.    DINING:  Arriving quite late we were pleased to find out we were able to dine in-house without making reservations. The food and service was exquisite. Lovely atmosphere for me to try my first Moroccan Tagine ha! Breakfast is complimentary and there was a vast array of food for us to choose from. You can also request for pancakes omelettes and so forth.    During our stay I had two massages and a Hammam. The experience was incredible and the lady was so nice! The riad also had a decent sized pool which we used.    All in all the riad is close to everything and easy to walk back to (without getting lost). I stayed at a different riad with my partner this year and it definitely made me realise how good this riad is. I'll definitely come back! Staff is attentive Nora especially and Ilham were so sweet and willing to help from taxis to excursions. 5 star for a riad without a doubt!

I stayed for 5 nights and my stay could not have been more perfect.  The Riad is in a great location for exploring the Medina but is a perfect oasis away from the hustle and bustle on the streets.    The staff were amazing and on hand for any needs and were always happy and friendly - the food was really good and I ate lunch or dinner there each day.  The rooms was great and was very quiet even though it over looked the courtyard.  I had two treatments at the spa which were both really relaxing and again the staff were lovely.    It was one of the most relaxing holidays I have in a long time and I'm already planning my next trip back.

Review_Date: Maggie B wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: The staff at Les Borjs de la Kasbah couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. We had 7 people staying and all the rooms were lovely as was the courtyard and relaxing rooms around the courtyard. Breakfast was excellent. Close enough to all central locations we wanted to visit that we could walk everywhere but far enough away to be a quiet haven as well.

This hotel is perfect for exploring all that Marrakesh has to offer from shopping in the Souks to sight seeing in the town or a trip up in to the Atlas Mountains. Marrakesh is a busy bustling and vibrant place and Les Borjs offers an oasis of calm in as soon as your through its doors. Very comfortable clean and well appointed rooms pretty riad gardens and a lovely quiet pool area mean you can fully relax. Every morning enjoy a lovely breakfast to set you up for the day and if you want to have beer or glass of wine before or with an evening meal the restaurant offers fixed or a la carte dishes. For those looking for spa treatments there's everything you'd normally expect to find plus a traditional 'Hamman' Turkish style bath a very relaxing experience in tranquil surroundings. In all this hotel offers great value and a great place to stay in central Marrakesh. Would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Graham B wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: After 13 hours of travel arriving at Les Borjs de la Kasbah was like arriving at an oasis in the midst of the busy medina. We were greeted by the hotel director and promptly taken to the lovely courtyard for some mint tea and pastries. The hotel was beautiful and the room was clean and spacious just like the website photos. We stayed 2 nights and had three meals in the hotel and the food and service was impeccable. Our 8 year old son was especially impressed by the 5 different types of moroccan pancakes freshly cooked at the breakfast buffet. Every request we made of the staff was met with a "no problem sir" response and we ended up booking a full day walking tour of the Medina (highly recommended) through the hotel. After leaving Les Borjs we went on a 3 day/2 night Sahara desert tour (also highly recommended) and returned to Marrakech and stayed at the Kenzi Club Agdal Medina which was a big mistake. Had we known we would have returned to la Kasbah for our final night in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Adrian E wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: An oasis of old world charm and care in a city of trepidation
Review_Text: The Borjs Hotel experience was outstanding due to the staff food and the hotel itself.  It saved my solo holiday and overturned the disappointing tourist sites and some experiences of Marrakesh into a success.  Well worth spending your holiday at the hotel and just taking the tours from the hotel to make a great holiday.  Calm and restful in a city of trepidation. I'm sure Miss Marple was hiding away somewhere due to the old world charm in a modern recreation. I would not hesitate to revisit.  The desk staff were the best I have ever encountered and a special mention to Fatima and her colleagues in the bar and at breakfast who were utterly wonderful.

Review_Date: Susan W wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: The location was really central  but lovely and peaceful. The staff were so friendly. The rooms were clean and lovely. The pool was great. The food was delicious. Made our stay perfect.There's a wonderful spa so I booked a brilliant massage. The staff helped me book trips to Essaouira and the Atlas mountains. Their driver was so helpful and charming.

Stayed for 5 nights recently at Les Borjs. Although the hotel is in the Kasbah which is a busy and noisy area once you get in the hotel you are in a totally different world where it is peaceful and serene. The room was spacious clean and comfortable. As a seasoned traveller I find it to be one of the best hotel I have stayed at. From the time of arrival staff were welcoming courteous and helpful and constantly going the extra mile to make our stay a pleasant one. They are a credit to management. Wide choice was available for breakfast. The new town was easily accessible about half an hour walk away with lots of things to see and do. I would recommend to anybody.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I didn't stay at this Riad although having seen the quality of it I certainly wish I had!  No.. My visit was to participate in one of their Moroccan Cuisine courses.  Absolutely splendid!  I was the only participant on the day and I was a bit worried that it would all be a bit rushed to get me out of the way so that the kitchen could return to normal.  But not a bit of it! I was treated as an honoured guest and felt very welcome.  Chef Miriam is very good! She led me through the process with great attention to detail and made sure I understood what each ingredient was for. I learned a great deal about the range of spices.  I would also like to thank Nadia who stood by throughout the course giving me any supplementary information.  I would recommend this course to anyone wishing to learn more of Moroccan Cuisine.  As for the rest of the building. If the bedrooms are as sumptuous as the public areas you are in for a very good time if you should choose to stay here. The décor is magnificent clean airy and very colourful.

Myself and 23 girlfriend took over this lovely kasbah for a birthday celebration. It is what it says on the tin a pretty little slice of peace and tranquility in a quiet back street a 15 minute walk from the main square. What stands this kasbah apart is the wonderful staff. They are nothing short of delightful friendly but professional and each was willing to go out of their way to make our stay perfect - thank you.

Review_Date: ally M wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: I foolishly posted my review of this wonderful Riad under the restaurant review area. I'll try to repeat it here for the Riad itself.  We are currently spending a week here and are delighted to have found such a lovely gem.  An oasis of peace and tranquillity in the old Medina. Wonderful attentive staff. Nothing is too much trouble.  There are thoughtful little touches everywhere.  Quiet courtyards and comfy seating areas lovely bedrooms and a great pool.  I feel truly comfortable and relaxed. Just what a good holiday should be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing Stay at Les Borjs de la Kaspah
Review_Text: I booked a last minute 5 day trip for myself and my partner to Marrakesh. The Borjs had really good reviews and was reasonable priced.    When we first arrived at the hotel I was a bit worried as there is literally a pile of rubble on the opposite side to the entrance to the hotel (looks like a building has been knocked down). From outside you wouldn't know that there was such a beautiful oasis inside.    Inside is so peaceful and serene and such a nice getaway from the bustling streets of the medina.    When we first arrived we were shown to the courtyard and given Mint Tea and Pastries. From start to finish the service we received whilst at the Riad was impeccable. All of the staff treat you like family and go out of their way to help you. There was not one member of staff I could fault.    On one occasion we didn't have time to get breakfast as we were going on an excursion early in the morning. I was rushing to get ready so my partner quickly went to pick up some pastries for us to take with us. The waitress saw him and told us she would take anything we wanted to our room for us to eat there whilst getting ready.    On another occasion I was feeling a bit of a sore throat and wrapped up in warm clothes with a scarf wrapped around me. The waitress saw me and offered to turn the heaters on and made me a Honey and Lemon drink.    The staff in the Spa are incredible! Definitely treat yourself to a Hammam and Massage - the treatments are so reasonable and lovely! The staff there made us feel so comfortable and like family giving us hugs when we left. We could have stayed in the spa all day!    The rooms are clean and traditionally decorated - so cute when you arrive to rose petals on the bed and arranged in the bathroom.    The lady at Reception (with braces - sorry I am bad with names!) was incredible helping us arrange excursions and offering recommendations.    I am so happy we booked the Borjs and we are now planning another short trip back in a couple of months. I don't normally like to go to the same place twice but the Borjs is an exception!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Charming Hotel - great location in heart of traditional Marrakesh
Review_Text: Beautiful smaller hotel.  A peaceful haven with the busy side streets of Marrakesh just on the doorstep.  Friendly and attentive service.  Great restaurant - to be honest the tagines and traditional food here was as good as the better restaurants we visited. Highly recommended.  Good breakfast - lots of freshly cooked pancakes and eggs fruit etc.  Good size rooms over looking the traditional courtyard. Theres a small pool and a spa. I booked a back massage - this was perfect.  Easy to get to anywhere from here. This is in the heart of Marrakesh away from the shops like Zara and H& M which are opening up more and more in the busier more commercial shopping areas - where the more expensive swanky hotels are - here you have the markets and traditional smaller stalls in among the locals and the true atmosphere of Marrakesh.  But if you want the more commercial side - its only a 5 min taxi ride away.  Loved it and will definitely return in the future.  Thanks x

Stayed there for a week. The service is impeccable. They go above and beyond.    The hotel is small quite and nice. Definitely go for half board if possible because the restaurant is great serving the traditional tagine and international food (and seven types of pancakes in the morning).    My only problem was the free wi-fi not functioning a couple of days but they fixed it pretty quickly.    I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: D P wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Magical hotel with a delightful ambiance
Review_Text: We were charmed by the staff from the moment we entered this hotel impressed by the extraordinary attention to detail in the preparation of our room and amazed by the architectural creativity in the design of this hotel. Tom and his wonderful team create such an aura of well being and luxury in this amazing place that it has to be experienced to be believed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna D wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: The attention to detail at this hotel is outstanding. My room was beautifully designed and comfortable. The Haman was blissful! The staff are lovely so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was awesome. The most charming hotel I've ever stayed in.

Review_Title: Wonderful stay.Birthday to remember thanks to the Hotel and staff.
Review_Text: We had a Wonderful stay at this Hotel.It is spotlessly clean lovely comfortable beds and the whole place has a relaxing and peaceful feel too it. Thankyou for the extra special suprises for our Anniversary and my Husbands Birthday  The staff our lovely and very helpfula special mention to Nora and Irlam (excuse the spelling) on Reception they are so super. Tom the Director is also at hand to make sure everything is ok for your stay Thanks Tom.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel made our stay while on holiday in Marakech. It is an oasis of calm and tranquility to escape the heat. The staff are exceptional friendly welcoming helpful and really did make this a wonderful stay.    I can't recommend highly enough. We stayed in a lovely suite overlooking the pool. The room is is beautiful clean and very welcoming.    The food is amazing quick service and staff always around the hotel. If we ever returned to Marakech we would stay at this hotel and would highly recommend. Not a single negative we didn't want to leave.    Thank you for making our time in Morocco so amazing :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eric M wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Very helpfull and communicative in at least three foreign languages personel.  Hotel is situated in a lively area surrounded by many pleasant restaurants and hammams. Warm feel. Good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very quiet and hotel and lovely personnel
Review_Text: It was always a pleasure to come back to the hotel after a hectic stroll through the souks of Marrakesh. All personnel was very friendly and always ready to help you. They fluently speak French and English have a good sense of humor and can give you good tips for places to visit or restaurants. And the different sort of pancakes during breakfast are really delicious. Top hotel!

Review_Date: Christine O'Neill wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: This is a wonderful small hotel in a great location with tasteful interior very clean and comfortable and great attention to detail. All of the staff were pleasant helpful and charming and they were always available without being pushy. Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a real find and I certainly look forward to my next stay there!

Review_Title: Can’t say enough good things about this charming spot!
Review_Text: Excellent accommodations in boutique Marrakech hotel and spa. Attention to detail hospitality traditional yet modern fabulous location and good value. Tom Bruce-Mitford who is the Director was on site to make sure our group was well taken care of. Front desk folks were attentive and very patient as there were about 8 of us who arrived and departed at various times over 3 days. Lovely spa and the massage I had was so relaxing that I wished it never ended. Safe and well-situated this place will not disappoint.

This hotel's rose-hued walls fit perfectly in the "red city." Add black wood doors green-and-white tile and the bloom of bougainvillea and the aesthetic is gently pleasant: no overkill. The on-site bar restaurant pool and hammam make this hotel a perfect retreat after souk-ing it.

Review_Title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah was reccomended by several friends, and it far exceeded even their high marks.
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and although we have friends who have visited Les Borjs de la Kasbah really didn't know what to expect. This without doubt turned out to be one of the finest holidays we have experienced. The entrance to the hotel is so misleading. Once inside the reception door it opens out into another world. The patio area is so beautifully and tastefully set out with a central fountain surrounded by flowers. Leading from this central features are doors leading to the lounge dining room pool area  and bedrooms on ground and 1st floor.  Our bedroom was on the first floor and looked out onto a small courtyard. There was plenty of room for a couple with comfortable beds and plenty of wardrobe space. The lighting was very good . We didn't spend any great time in the rooms during the day but TV reception was good when needed with a selection of English News and film channels. The on-suite bathroom couldn't be faulted with twin vanity facilities and two showers.  The hotel is located only about 15 minutes from the airport and the transfer was all arranged by the hotel with a member of their staff meeting new arrivals. For less than £2 you can get a 10 minute taxi to the New Town and there are several exciting excursions to Berber villages/Atlas Mountains etc.  Breakfast offered a wide choice  satisfying most peoples needs. Cereals toast fresh fruityoghurts Croissant's cheese meats fruit juice etc. and much much more .  Lunches were available and snacks were always available. A different set menu was available each evening  in addition to selections from The Al a Carte menu.  The peacefulness and ambience of the whole hotel was unbelievable it was difficult to believe you were so near busy areas hardly a sound could be heard once you have entered the reception..  We could go on and on praising this hotel we really have tried to find anything we disliked or could find fault with but there were truthfully no negative comments to report.  What really put the icing on the cake were the wonderful staff working there. Everyone without fail were helpful pleasant and went out of their way to make our stay most enjoyable relaxing and peaceful. The Director/Manager Mr Tom Mitford Bruce was always available and made himself known to all new arrivals
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Heike S wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: The riad Borjs de la Kasbah stays for the famous Moroccian hospitality. Tradition and modern together with a very very friendly and helpful hotel staff make this riad a very special place. We stayed there as a group for a city trip to Marrakech. The rooms are lovely and very comfortable and when coming back from the city the beautiful patio and restaurant invite you to rest.

What a fantastic riad recommended to us but surpassed our expectations. The rooms were lovely very clean and with comfortable beds. Ilham and Nora on reception couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. They arranged trips taxis and restaurants for us and nothing was too much trouble. The location was great as it was about a 25 min walk from the souks and was away from the hustle and bustle of the square so was very peaceful to return to each evening. Loved the hamman in the hotel and would highly recommend. I would recommend this riad to everyone from families couples and groups of friends.

Review_Date: Chris R wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: This was our 1st trip to Morocco but definitely not our last. Borg was Recommended to us by a friend who is a travel agent and had stayed here. We are 4 ladies who like a bit of luxury and we certainly got this here.  All the staff were exceptional especially the two lovely ladies on reception. Tom the owner made a point of welcoming us and was very keen to make sure we had a good time. They just couldn't do enough for you. Nothing was to much trouble. The Riad is in a really safe area within walking distance to the square and souks. it has a lovely pool area and a great spa. you must have a Hamman. great experience. The hotel arranged a guide to show us around which i would really recommend. They also sorted out a fantastic taxi driver for us who spent the day with us taking us up to the atlas mountains and showing us many things on route.(£50) He then found us a guide who showed us up to the waterfall. £20. It very steep but well worth the climb wear sensible footwear. We had a cookery lesson at the Riad making a 3 course meal which we then ate for dinner one night. We felt extremely safe on our visit to marrekesh it is a really clean place. Prices were really cheap for most things remember to haggle. Henna tattoo at the Henna Art Cafe was about £4 they also do great lunches. You must have a go in tuttut. we paid about £2.75 from the square back to the hotel. if you not sure where to stay this is in a great location and would give it 5****. thank you Tom and staff.

Review_Date: M K wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: This was our first trip to morocco.After much consideration searching for a hotel online I chose this one and even after having read the positive reviews it surpassed our expectations. Our room was comfortable clean and had lovely decor. Although the pool is not large it kept my daughter occupied for hours. The staff are really welcoming helpful and polite and recommended places we could visit. My wife was unwell for a couple of days the staff were so attentive and concerned it felt like we were staying with family. Thank you for such an enjoyable trip hope to see you soon.

Review_Title: Came for the pool, visited every day!
Review_Text: We stayed at a local Riad which did not have a pool so Les Borjs de la Kasbah was recommended to us.    Lovely pool beautiful hotel and excellent service from all the staff. Lunch & drinks were served pool side    Also used the spa while we were there.

We are probably a bit biased with regard to reviewing the "Borjs" as we have visited it 7 times over the years and trip number 8 is 2 weeks away!  The first time we came here was in 2008/9 and as it was our first time in Marrakech we wanted somewhere relaxing and a haven from the wonderful madness of the city. Since that first visit we have been back to Marrakech well over a dozen times and also to the Atlas and Essaouira. Throughout this time we thought that there must be other riads or hotels which would outdo the "Borjs" and that all the accommodation would be better and that we were missing out! How wrong we were this place is the ultimate in comfort chill out fantastic rooms and food and staff who we now consider friends.  Tom as director of operations has taken the standards to a higher level than ever and elevated it to even higher grade.  There is a lot of choice of accommodation in Marrakech all purporting to be the best but I guarantee you will not be disappointed if you come here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Incredible hospitality in a bit of paradise
Review_Text: From the moment I walked in I was in love. The public areas are truly serene with soft music the smell of orange blossom fountains and cascading bougainvillea falling over the walls of the several courtyards around which the rooms orient. The restaurant is under a retractable roof through which you can view the stars the tile work throughout is exquisite the pool is warm and impeccably maintained and the reading and relaxation rooms around the main courtyard are divine. Really everything about the property is amazing. My room was incredible: huge tub mammoth vanity walk-in shower very comfortable bed huge closet perfect air conditioning mini fridge seating area. The floors are warmed so while the a/c keeps you cool you can still walk around the room in comfort. Giant breakfast was more than expected. The hammam is luxe and quite beautiful. I favor a more vigorous massage like sports massage or deep tissue and wish there was more of that on offer in the spa but that's my only minor complaint. The staff was humorous but respectful and everything you could ever want is made available if you ask. The staff works under the direction of Tom who is old world in his manners incredibly hospitable and attentive. I really couldn't be happier with my stay. Marrakech is deeply stimulating and at times hectic so it felt even better to enjoy the luxury this riad offers. I really couldn't recommend this property more. Great for solo travel friends couples (super romantic) and adventure travel if you want to really unwind. Loved the guests the location was great the driver from the airport stayed late to meet me after my flight was delayed until a 4am arrival. Really everything was amazing. Stay here.

We stayed here as a family of 6 (2 adults and 4 teenagers) for 3 wonderful nights before heading to the beach resort of Agadir. It is truly an oasis amid the bustle of Marrakech. We were personally greeted by the hotel director with mint tea and pastries and our rooms were beautifully presented.  As well as enjoying the pool bar and restaurant we all did a fun cooking lesson and my partner and I enjoyed an excellent value massage.  The hotel arranged a tour guide for a half day and they also booked our transfer to/from Agadir at a better price than I could find on the web and the driver was charming efficient and reliable.  Best of all we realised on arrival in Agadir that one of the boys had left £50 in cash in his room but the hotel had already found it and arranged to return it to us! Amazing!    Thank you to Tom and all of your fantastic staff for your amazing hospitality at your beautiful hotel!

Review_Date: Sarah F wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: A sanctuary from the moment we arrived to when we left we had 1st class treatment from all the staff. Always ready to help with a smile. The hotel is beautiful we couldn't have wished for anything more. We highly recommend the cookery leason and the spa. The pool area is exacting what is needed to wind down and relax. A truly special hotel our sincere thanks to all the staff who made our stay so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is our last night here and I am sat in the candlelit couryard which is an oasis of calm and relaxation. When we arrived we were greeted with tea and biscuits and then shown to our beautiful suite 303.This Riad is amazing and been restored to a very high standard. We ayte here on the first night and the food was very good and a reasonable price. I did the cookery course which was great fun but it also gave me the opportunity to see the kitchen. It was like the rest of the riad immaculate. I also had a hammam and massage. Both very good and a fraction of the cost in the UK.The best part of the Riad however are the very helpful staff.
