They were all so lovely and very obliging. One even went to the supermarket for me so I could take some ingredients home.  I am not a fan of Marrakesh and unlikely to return but I will be recommending this Riad to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma R wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, perfect for exploring this amazing city
Review_Text: When we arrived we were greeted and shown to the courtyard for complimentary Morroccan tea & biscuits. Words cannot describe how peaceful this hotel is. You have to remember that you are still in the medina yards from the hustle & bustle and chaos yet you wouldn't know it. Brilliant service staff work hard to make sure the place is spotless. Lovely small pool for relaxing if you like though we went exploring! I also loved the breakfast don't expect full english but the cook makes any omlette you desire or any pancake they were scrumptious! Cocktails very nice though rather on the strong side!! I always recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: First trip to Marrakesh - Simply amazing!!
Review_Text: Riad was beautiful clean and spacious . Multi lingual staff all nicely dressed and friendly. Breakfast.. oh.. fruit and cheese platter home made yogurt; fresh squeezed orange juice... and more!! Those Moroccan pancakes were the best!! Then there is the spa. I will go back just for the hamman and massage. Just too many good things to mention about this place. It deserves A++.

Review_Date: Thomas Hodgson wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: This is my second time as a guest & I have to say that even though it is the low season the standards don't slip.  I reported two issues with my room which were Air Con & TV Channels. The first was resolved within a day but the later was never resolved to my dissapointment. Food is always of a fairly good standard.  Good value hotel with class service.

Charming great staff just lovely!  My husband and I are traveling our first time to Morocco this was our first hotel. What a great introduction. This place has wonderful hospitality and great attention to detail. It's very hot here and I believe important to have a place to spend the 2pm to 7pm hours of the day. Borjs offers lovely pool for a nap and a great patio to relax on to beat the heat. If you are planning to stay in a raid this is a good option. There is a bit of a walk to the square we did not mind it bc it's quiet at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yvette H wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Great Raid in an excellent location. Fantastic pool and spa. Best massage and hamman in Marrakech!!    The breakfast was lovely and the restaurant and bar offered great choice and value for money. The hotel also offer lots of different excursions.    All the staff were very frendly and helpful plus you get a free airport transfer. Exellent hotel would highly reccommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ceri M wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Just returned home from a fantastic week away at this beautiful riad! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated superbly. The staff were always so kind and attentive especially Nora and Tom which made the stay even more pleasurable. We were sad to leave and are already planning our return! The rooms were lovely and spacious clean and well air conditioned. The pool facilities were great and the food was delicious! We particularly enjoyed happy hour where we enjoyed some fabulous cocktails made by the lovely Fatima!    Can't fault this holiday destination and can't wait to return! Totally recommend to everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just got back from a 9 night stay in Marrakech and this Riad was superb. When we got out of our taxi from the airport the area looked run down but it proved to be a very safe and pleasant area.  The hotel itself was wonderful a real gem. Our room was a lovely suite with a large bathroom. Also soft large towels  The pool area is really clean with comfortable sun beds. Plenty of sun throughout the day.  The staff were excellent and the director was very helpful and friendly.  We could not have asked for more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tony K wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We have just returned from 10 days holiday staying in this wonderful Riad in the Medina of Marrakech.  On arrival we were slightly put off by the street outside but on walking through the main entrance of the Riad we the (my wife son and I) were at awe! It is one of the most beautiful tranquil hideaways that you can imagine with quiet well planted courtyards from top to bottom resembling one of the tropical glasshouses at Kew Gardens and curtained rest spots with traditional Moroccan comfy seating around the fountained courtyard. We were given a tour of the facilities by a very helpful person on reception including the pool and facilities and shown our lovely rooms with air conditioning. The pool is a good size very clean with good changing facilities large towels and comfortable wooden loungers and umbrellas for shade. At the press of a button one of the extremely helpful staff will come and take your order for drinks or food and bring it to you poolside.  The restaurant is very good with a good choice on the menu after you have had one of the freshly made cocktails at happy hour. Breakfast is continental with lots of fruit and freshly cooked pancakes or omelettes and more than you can ever eat and I was made delicious smoothies each morning by the chef.  What made our holiday so special and relaxing were the most friendly and very helpful well-presented staff in a Moroccan uniform always smiling and wanting to help you Fatima Norma Nadia Noele and Semele who cooked the breakfast every morning and taught us how to make a Tagine to mention but a few.  Our rooms were beautifully cleaned each day and our bed covered in rose petals on our return. We were upgraded for free to a suite after the first night which was very pleasant and spacious and a real treat for us. We did several excursions organised for us through reception and our special driver who was extremely pleasant and knowledgable was called Sharif who I would recommend you ask for. My wife had a foot and leg massage in the Arganier Spa above the pool one day after a long day in the souk and loved it.  I cannot find any fault with this establishment at all and will be making a return trip in the not too distant future.

Review_Date: Harry C wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Shower was worth the booking on its own the cleanest I have ever felt in my life like washing in the tears of angels. Complimentary exfoliating soaps and perfumed shampoo. Large bath. Spar offering massages and treatments. Nice people working there. Reception helped organise cabs and dinner reservations really went the extra mile. Staff sometimes take a little while to get things for you but I think that is simply a cultural difference. Courteous and friendly British Director made us feel welcome and listened to all our comments.    Make sure to take advantage of the lovely pool great for a little plunge when sunbathing but not one for lengths at only 10m. A real tranquil retreat amongst the chaos of the medina. Speak to the riad about air conditioning as our room was very hot making it difficult to get a good nights' sleep.    On the whole wonderful and all for a superb cost.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There was not one thing bad about this riad it was perfect. It is quiet yet in the Medina it is an easy walk to the Jemaa El Fna Ben Youssef Madrasa and many other sights. They were so accommodating we arrived rather late and were prepared to drag our 3 tired children into the Medina to find some food but the staff told us no they would keep the kitchen open so we did not have to go out. We had a great couscous ravioli and chicken tagine. The food was lovely with very unique smoothies for breakfast such as date and nut or beet and banana. The omelettes were cooked in the dining area and made to order. The breakfast buffet was perfect for us! We were in rooms 301 and 302 because we felt we would be more comfortable in 2 rooms they seemed rather large even in comparison to US and European hotel rooms. The courtyard separated the rooms my husband stayed in one room with our 2 younger kids and our older daughter and I stayed in the other room. I could not hear my youngest daughter when she cried at night so the rooms were pretty quiet. The rooms were also very clean and had unique touches like the bed spreads were creatively placed on the bed with rose petals. My daughter loved the rose petals everywhere and thought it was beautiful and very special. The parking was rather simple the front desk staff helped unload our things then parked the car in a lot diagonal from the Riad. All in all everything was perfect!

Review_Date: Hannah T wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: What an absolutely amazing week! Myself and my friends had been planning this holiday for a good few months and I have to say that our stay at Les Borjs de la Kasbah was the absolute highlight of our time in Morocco.    Our experience started when we were picked up at the airport by the very pleasant driver that the hotel had arranged for us. We were then invited for Moroccan tea and a selection of pastries these were most appreciated after a day of travelling. After we had had spent some time relaxing in the main courtyard we where then shown to our rooms all of which were absolutely lovely we were then given a brief tour of the hotel and it's facilities. The weather at the time was beautifully sunny so you could imagine how grateful we were upon seeing the pool. After spending the first day relaxing by the pool we then went for a lovely traditional Moroccan meal at the hotel restaurant. The following day we gorged on the amazing breakfast buffet the selection was vast and freshly prepared- just what we had hoped for. After a day spent wondering around the enchanting souks of Marrakech we then decided that we would go back to the hotel and treat ourselves to an afternoon at the hotel spa; this was pure bliss and something that I would thoroughly recommend taking advantage of! We felt that the manager and his team were fantastic and a real credit to the hotel; we were looked after from the second that we arrived and made to feel very special. I am already planning to return with the family for my mums 60th next year.

Review_Title: A beautiful Riad with wonderful staff and the added bonus of an onsite hammam/spa and pool!
Review_Text: This is an amazing peaceful Riad in the quieter Kasbah area of Marrakech - about a 15/20 minute walk from the bustle of the main square and souks etc.  The staff are wonderful; always smiling friendly with a great sense of humour yet at the same time courteous and discreet. They are happy to answer any questions and give great advice - from where to go things to do the culture and traditions and customs... Special thanks to Jihane - reservations/reception who we emailed back and forth a few times before the visit with various queries. Tom who greeted us on arrival (as we were being served the delicious complimentary mint tea and pastries) and who popped in to say hello most days. Also Nadia Fatima and the spa ladies who all made our time there so special.  We visited during Ramadan so during the day Marrakech was quiet with some of the shops and restaurants closed however after sundown everything came to life - it was amazing and incredibly busy. Marrakech has a wonderful vibe and yes everybody is touting for business but we never once felt in any way threatened or intimidated. We booked the three hour walking tour on our first morning which was great very informative and good for getting your bearings if you haven't been to Marrakech before.  It was very hot when we were there - in the 40s so we were more than happy to laze around the pool at times being brought drinks and snacks.  I thoroughly recommend the hammam which we had on the first day followed by a massage - what a great start to our four days!! We had another massage before we left too - they were so good definitely amongst the best I have had.  We also tried the cookery school - thanks to Miriam our Moroccan chef and the lovely Nora who assisted and translated for us and then sourced ingredients for us to take home! We prepped and cooked a three course meal and ate it for lunch - delicious!! The breakfasts are very good freshly squeezed orange juice tea/coffee breads and pastries Moroccan pancakes eggs to order as you like them... We ate dinner in the hotel on our first night and opted for the traditional Moroccan menu ( they also have a French / international menu too). We couldn't fault the food - the wine list is fine too - all Moroccan wines at very reasonable prices. They have a happy hour from 6 - 7 every evening with some great cocktails which you can have outside in one of the pretty courtyards or if too hot in the airconditioned bar.  The bedrooms are amazing we stayed in 202 (one of the three suites) spotlessly cleaned every day with the thickest most luxurious towels and bathrobes provided. Lovely toiletries in the bathroom too. We asked to see some of the other rooms as we are intending to come back with friends and family -Nora showed us various types - they are all beautifully decorated and very spacious.  We had a really wonderful time here and I just hope that people aren't put off by the one negative reviewer whereby despite giving the actual hotel and staff a rave paragraph then proceeds to publicly air a grievance with Tom the manager (surely this should have been sorted out privately by email with the hotel?) I feel strongly that it is unfair to then give this wonderful place where all the staff work so hard to make your stay so pleasurable a one star rating which clearly greatly drops the hotel's ranking on tripadvisor.  If you're planning a trip to Marrakech stay here you will not be disappointed. We will certainly be returning and hope to bring friends and family too.

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: I recently was in Marakech to visit a friend and stayed at Les Borjs for a few days. I was welcomed by a friendly and helpful group of staff who immediately made me feel relaxed and showed me to my lovely single room. This was on the downstairs level in its own courtyard. As the temp was about 38 degrees I went straight for a dip in the very inviting pool followed by some comfortable poolside lounging reading and refreshments! For me the pool is a real highlight of this place as they are hard to come by in the Medina and I have stayed at quite a few Riads now. The ambience of the place is welcoming relaxing staff always on hand including the manager who is English and always willing to advise regards things to do / places to go. There is a lovely bar area an excellent restaurant which is open throughout the day and evening and lovely plants fountains orange trees birds etc give the place such a special feel.  It also had the advantage of being located in a more authentic less manic part of the Medina though not too far a walk from the usual manic mayhem of the souks and central square.  I had a fantastic stay - thanks very much!

Review_Date: Stuart S wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: I rarely give 5 star reviews but this place.....................
Review_Text: I'm not one for long winded reviews so will keep this short and sweet. OMG what an amazing place in the middle of the manic madness of Marrakech. 10-15 mins away from the airport and 10-15 mins walk from Jemaa el-Fnaa this lovely little Riad is ideally located. The staff are lovely rooms clean and spacious and the food is delicious. That really sums it up in a nutshell and I don't think any more can be said.    If I return I would rebook this place without a shadow of doubt love it :)

This Riad is set in the Medina close enough to walk to all the sights of Marrakech. The street in which it is situated is nothing to write home about but once you enter it is like a different world.    The Riad is beautiful the staff are great and do everything to make sure your stay is enjoyable.    This Riad is unusual in that it has a reasonable sized pool but is located within the Medina.    The food was good usual Morrocan fayre plus some European style dishes. You can also get snacks at the poolside.    We would definitely recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nadine O wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: My single room was charming and surprisingly spacious the riad - delightfully tranquil the spa facilities and treatments - amazing. The staff were so helpful and patient. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay

I also stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for four nights with “Donna Z” and 22 other ladies and read her review and the reply of owner; Mr Bruce-Mitford who I believe is the father of manager Tom (aka David Brent – as suggested by another reviewer) and was not actually present when the unfortunate events occurred. Donna’s comments were not “exaggerated” or “false” and many of the guests were left feeling embarrassed humiliated and anxious about the remainder of their stay after Tom’s extraordinary behaviour on the Thursday night and subsequent ridiculous Friday night apology. The atmosphere greatly improved once Tom left completely and the amazing staff are a credit to the owners for the way they handled the incident and carried on working very diligently to restore peace and harmony.  The Riad is a truly delightful 3*/4* purpose built retreat in an extremely convenient location. It was absolutely perfect for a celebratory single party occupation. The bedrooms were very comfortable and the communal areas most welcoming for relaxing contemplation or sitting with friends. The pool area was perfect for a few hours sitting in the sun away from the chaos of Marrakech. The food at breakfast was good and the smiling chef Miriam made super smoothies great pancakes Berber bread Moroccan sweet eggy bread and other local delicacies every morning.  Lunch and dinner were not “haute cuisine” but were more than adequate for what was wanted on a half-board package. The waiting staff were charming funny and extremely patient with so many drinks bills flying around. The Moroccan Evening was a great success and enjoyed by all.  The spa services were fabulous and nearly everyone enjoyed a massage and/or Hamman.  I cannot thank ALL the staff enough who salvaged a ghastly situation – EVERYONE (cleaners kitchen reception spa gardeners security bar and waiting staff) should be treasured for making the Riad de la Kasbah such a special place.

This hotel was the 2nd location on our visit. After 3 days in the High Atlas Mountains we returned to Marrakech for our stay in this Riad. On entering the Medina and travelling down a dusty road it was difficult to imagine what the hotel would be like. On entering the minimal entrance from the street passing through reception into the first courtyard we were met by an oasis of tranquility from the hustle and bustle outside. It was immediately apparent that this was a hotel of high quality with a lot of thought put into it's traditional style of design. The standard of our room and furnishings was first class. The communal areas were tastefully furnished and the dining area good. A special mention to all staff we encountered. All very friendly courteous and helpful and with a very good sense of humour too. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for an authentic feel away from modern large hotels.

Review_Date: Donna Z wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: My friend and I organized a trip for 23 of our girl friends to celebrate our joint birthdays and booked the whole Riad for 4 nights. Good stuff first - the hotel is beautiful and is in a very peaceful and gorgeous setting about a 15 minute walk from the main square. The hotel is well maintained very clean the colour schemes and furnishings are wonderful and the rooms are lovely with extra special touches like fluffy towels and bath robes - alot of thought has gone into making the guest feel special and comfortable. The biggest shout out must be for the staff who go over and above in the levels of service and professionalism and I say a big thank you to them ALL for making our 5 days so special. Also the spa facilities - fabulous and thank you.    Ok - now the not so good stuff - the manager Tom. Sorry Tom but you nearly ruined the whole weekend for me and were close to turn a weekend that had been in the planning process for over a year into a complete disaster. It is NOT cool to get absolutely drunk offer your guests drugs (and say how good they are when we say no thanks) join your guests for drinks into the evening without being invited go around the table and insult guests with personal comments about their appearance and then try and enter the bedroom of one of my friends when she went to bed!! Thankfully another friend was there to pull you out of the room. I appreciate that the next day you apologized to everyone and sent us two bottles of wine (for 24 people) but ...really!!! Was this really an apology when you started to repeat the things you said the night before ? I was also very surprised when you then asked me if you could take photos of us on our "moroccan evening" for marketing purposes ?

Review_Title: Group Visit to Les Borjs de la Kasbah
Review_Text: As a group of mature ladies some approaching 50 we had been planning this trip for almost a year. On arrival our expectations were surpassed and in all it was a truly magical experience made even more so by the wonderful Moroccan staff lead by Jihane. The Riad is beautiful and takes you away from the hustle and bustle that is literally outside the front door! The compulsory h/b was good especially breakfast - delicious omelettes and pancakes and even the wine is reasonably priced.  If you're looking for somewhere special to go with friends or family it's perfect and only a short walk away from the main Medina & souks!

Review_Title: Lovely stay away from the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: I stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed my time there. The hotel was set in the Kasbah which is quite busy but once you step the doors it's so peaceful and tranquil. It's just what you need after the hustle and bustle of the souks. The staff are extended helpful snd arranged for a medina tour at very short not be. The rooms are lovely and the restaurant serves good food. The fish Tagine was especially good. It's also fantastic that they have a lovely outside pool to cool off from the sun which was needed.    Taxis are really cheap however make sure you agree on the price before you set off they will try and up the price where possible.  Being on my own it's advisable to have your wits about you as people will hassle you and want to talk to you. They were all friendly but just to be aware it happens quite a lot.    I tried Al fassia restaurant which the staff in the hotel recommended which was fantastic. Sat outside in the garden. Food was delicious and staff were very attentive. This is the 2nd restaurant in the same name I'm told it's smaller than the other but still worth visit.    Overall my stay has been lovely. I would highly recommend the hotel as it's what you need in Marrakech which is very busy.

Review_Date: Lorna L wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Mature hens (or chickens if you are from Denmark)
Review_Text: I have just spen the most amazing 4 days with 23 ladies for a joint birthday. We had the place to ourselves (we had booked all rooms!). The staff were awesome. Hammam was amazing. Thoroughly reccommmend.

We did not expect the excellence that we found in this delightful Riad. It is truly a wonderful experience to stay at Les Borjs. It is comfortable clean the staff are helpful and friendly. Nothing is too much trouble. The building has been restored by hand with love and vision to perfection. We loved it. Thank you Tom and the team. We wish you all the best for the future. Ken and Maggie Holloway.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was on the dental conference and the hotel was perfect for it. You step in form a noisy busy street on the edge of the souk into an oasis of calm and comfort. Our room was comfortable and there is a peaceful and relaxing pool area to soothe away the bustle of Marrakech or in our case the concentration of lectures.

Review_Date: Sarah J wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: I recently organised a long weekend to Marrakesh for a group of dentists and it was absolutely fabulous. We took over the entire Riad which is perfectly set up for this kind of booking. The whole group had nothing but praise for the rooms the restaurant the spa and swimming pool and most of all the staff. They were a complete delight and went out of their way to ensure everyone had a memorable stay - so a huge thank you to them all. On the final night we had a Gala Dinner with cocktails around the pool and some impressive local entertainment with fire-eaters and belly dancers. The hotel also organised a city tour with very informative local guides and a fantastic trip up into the Atlas Mountains. So all-in-all a great trip and highly recommended.

This hotel is a beautiful Moroccan home away from home. Attention to detail is found at every turn in the concept and design of the hotel in the genuine care attention and attentiveness of every single wonderful member of staff in every role. It is found in the exquisite Moroccan cuisine...I stayed full board and fully (puns intended!) enjoyed each dish which included a wonderful breakfast. Stay for the Moroccan evening for a taste of the food music and dance.  The hospitality of Marrakech is mirrored in the hotel; I was always greeted with a warm smile some tips and advice a friendly word or compliment and I was greeted with delicious tea and pastries. All the staff were so lovely; special shout-outs to Nora Hicham and Ilham who looked after the reception/management while I was there. They do their jobs amazingly. Nothing was ever too big or small to help me out with. I had a glasses 'malfunction' and 'tout de suite' Nora arranged for them to be fixed as good as new. She also assured me in arrival that it's a safe place for solo travellers - I agree - and she talked me through a city map which was a lot better than the one that I had! This is a place that goes over and above in all senses. The room was a spacious single offering with é suite bathroom. My room was always made up so tastefully every day. I had my first hammam at the onsite spa which was an unforgettable experience in pleasing surroundings. I couldn't possibly stay anywhere else when I return.    You will be right next to the Royal Palace and near to the ruins of the Baadi Palace which is worth a visit. Currently there's also a wonderful photography exhibition at the Baadi Palace; if art interests you a trip to the Musée de Photographie is worth winding though the souks for. The view over the city from the rooftop café is amazing and the photos of faces of Morocco over time were very emotive. You will be just close enough to the Djemaa el Fna which is an experience for all the senses! Have a coffee on the top terrace of Café de France whilst you plan your return journey. Use your instincts and talk to some local people who I found to be helpful and warm.    See Jardin Majorelle and the Berber museum if you can.    Les Borjs made my first stay in Marrakech a magical one. Merci! Shukran.

The hotel is just round the corner from the main street of the Casbah but is quiet and peaceful. You can walk to the Djemaa el Fna in about 15 minutes. Our rooms were quite small and cave-like but I suppose that's unavoidable in a Riad. (Also we were told the rooms were small in advance which was honest.) We were on the ground floor and there was some noise from staff and other guests but it was OK.  The hotel was well-appointed and the staff were lovely. The bar pool courtyards etc. are all fantastic.  I thought it was a bit petty to charge us for two local calls from reception to our travel agent with a huge mark up.  The food was OK but you're better off eating in the open-air stalls in the Djemaa el Fna.Breakfast was excellent.  There was a slightly surreal David Brent sort of moment when the (English) "Director" introduced himself and then kept insisting I was Greek.  It was a good place to come back to after the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. We would definitely stay here again.  We walked everywhere even late at night and didn't once feel worried or threatened.

Review_Date: Kay M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed for a week at Les Borjs de la Kasbah and were genuinely saddened to leave: the place the people the experience the price were everything you dream of for the perfect holiday.  THE PLACE: Les Borjs is beautifully designed spotlessly clean and unbelievably quiet yet located within walking distance of all the main sites. The intimate restaurant serves fantastic local food and their half board package is great value offering 3 courses on the Morrocan ‘menu de jour’ which changes daily. Our breakfast favourites were the date and nut smoothie and home made yoghurt. Loved the hot power shower in a wonderful room (they’re all good) plus having loads of space and free wi-fi.  THE PEOPLE: Cheesy as it sounds staying at Les Borjs truly felt like being part of a family. The staff are a happy team from Mariam cooking with quiet matriachal expertise to the rascal humour of our favourite waitress. The director Tom works hard at improving Les Borjs – installing improved wifi and effecting a switch of produce supplier to ensure consistently best quality food ingredients whilst we were there. Monsieur Ali who led our city walking tour was superb. All in all it is a welcoming place for everybody including those who travel alone: I would have no hesitation in returning in future without my young adult daughters next time.  THE EXPERIENCE: You need to be reasonably agile (definitely wear training shoes) for the trip to see the waterfalls at Setti Fatma which involves a scramble up the mountains but it is absolutely worth going. En route back to Marrakech we skipped the suggested visits to the toiletry/saffron manufacturers and instead asked our driver Shareef to take us to buy tagines and pottery. What an Aladdin’s cave he introduced us to!! Huge amounts of choice and the chance to bargain but without the sales pressure of buying from the souk.  We also loved the fun and interesting cookery lesson experience at Les Borjs – Menu 3 is absolutely yummy! – plus our evening vists to the vibrant ‘Cross Cultural Café’ located just around the corner from our Riad.    It's hard to believe that it's all over - we had a fabulous time and would recommend without hesitation!

Review_Date: Amanda O wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Our first trip to Marrakech - I'd wanted to go for years - my partner hadn't! However on the advice of our local travel agents he booked a week at Les Bourjs as a Christmas gift for me. What a fabulous gift! I can only reiterate the comments that everyone else has given regarding the beautiful intimate and friendly hotel and the welcoming staff who immediately made you feel at home. They genuinely seemed to want to make our holiday the best.  We had suite 202 which was lovely light airy and spacious - and spotlessly clean!    The whole riad has a light airy feel to it arranged around the various courtyards. The scent of jasmine and orange blossom gives an exotic scent and the bougainvillea is just so pretty. With all that and the birdsong we could have been in the middle of the country rather than on the edge of an exciting city with all we wanted within easy walking distance.    So what did we do there? A half day city trip on the second morning to get an idea of what was there. La Place of course is a must - such an amazing experience and different by night and day. Shopping in the souks and artisan centres (for "fixed prices" - no haggling) a trip to the achingly beautiful Majorelle Gardens. A camel ride in the Palmeraie and a 4x4 trip in the High Atlas Mountains - berber villages breathtaking scenery and snowmen that the berber children had built by the side of the road. So so much to do in Marrakech - and then back to the tranquility of the riad afterwards.    We ate in the restaurant most nights and the food was delicious. Breakfasts were fantastic - the only problem was been tempted to eat far too much - especially the fresh cooked Morrocan pancakes.    Being a comfort bunny like another reviewer on here my only gripe is that I found the pillows hard. My partner didn't seem to have a problem though!    We would definitely go back and most certainly recommend Les Borjs to other travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew L wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: A really well designed space comfortable tranquil with a very personal feel. Nicely decorated and furnished rooms. Located an easy 20 min walk from the main sites of the centre of the city so great for sight seeing - but when you've had enough of the street life - returning to the enclosed candlelit courtyard  proved a fantastic relaxing retreat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Oli P. wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Our stay at "Les Borjs de la Kasbah" was just more than words can say. Located at the southernmost edge of the Kasbah close to the Royal Palace this "Hotel de charme" offers all you can expect from a luxury place but with such a personal touch and a great attention to detail that make you feel at home from the first minute.    Hotel Director Monsieur Tom and all of the 26 staff are committed to make your stay an amazing unique experience. The service was extraordinary and the food absolutely delicious. If we return to Marrakesh no doubt we will stay at "Les Borjs de la Kasbah".

Review_Date: Sarah G wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Amazing Riad in a perfect location
Review_Text: My stay at Les Borjs de la Kasbah was amazing. Everything from return airport transfers eating drinking the spa tours the room - all faultless. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and made me feel a part of the family. It was nice having trustworthy people and suggestions as I was a solo female traveller in my 20's. I felt very safe at all times.    Top tips.  - Lamb Tagine is delicious!  - do the 1/2 day tour early in your stay. It is a great way to get your bearings early one. After that you'll walk everywhere.  - a Moroccan hamman followed by massage is a must!    I'll be back for sure.    THANKYOU!

Review_Title: Incredible hotel, wonderful food, amazing service!
Review_Text: We didn't stay in this hotel but we very much wished that we did - and certainly will be booking a trip in the very near future. In our first hour in Marrakesh we wandered from our (absolutely lovely) Riad down the street and around the corner. After our first experience of the wonderful mayhem we wanted a cold drink and some cosy bites. When we looked around we were outside this wonderful hotel.  The welcome was warm and we made ourselves comfortable in the gorgeous courtyard while the staff attended to our drinks order (it's worth noting the Borjs is one of the few hotels with a proper drinks license). It was the first of many visits - and oh how I wish I had been staying there so I could have enjoyed the heated pool. You won't find many hotels or riads which can provide a heated pool in winter. A soak while looking up at the sky and the vines climbing the walls would have most certainly have been bliss.  Yes while street food (meat on a stick) is quite wonderful it's also nice to treat one self while on holiday and the food at the Borjs is absolutely exquisite. The Moroccan chef prepares many a tagine and traditional fayre but also a selection of international dishes (after a few days away you may hanker for something not cooked in stoneware!). All were perfect and good value in a lovely restaurant setting.  The hotel is owned by a British couple and their son Tom. He is the director of this establishment and his passion for outstanding customer service is evidenced throughout. The story behind how the hotel was purchased and renovated (with no heavy machinery even the pool was excavated by hand) using the finest materials and expertise of local artisans architects and engineers is worth exploring. What Tom brings to those finest traditions is an understanding of what UK travellers look for during a well-earned break and there's no doubt about his fantastic hosting skills - he is a true gentleman.  I've recommended this hotel to three people who are considering a break to Marrakesh Glasgow only recently having established direct flights. When I return to this amazing city I won't hesitate in booking with Les Borjs an oasis of calm and service in the heart of the Kasbah.

Located in the old city of Marrakesh this lovely Kasbah has around 21 rooms all of varying size and shape.  We were luck enough to get a big room but some of the people we traveled with were not so check when you book.  breakfast was great as was the bar and outdoor areas.

I stayed here recently with a group of about 12. We were royally welcomed and made to feel at home. Staff friendly and fun without any compromise in service. Very helpful. My air-con/heater didn't work and in five minutes I had a oil radiator for my room. The system was sorted the next day.    The best breakfast ever pretty much everything you can think of including morrocan specialities. Fresh juice and smoothie each day. Tea and coffee the weak point biut excellent Mint and herb teas.    And do try the hammam and massage really good not a wimpy beautician massage. The surround is stylish and comfortable. Very convenient for the old town and souk.    The rooms are as nice as the communal spaces. Lovely towels and linen and quality toiletries for a real feel of luxury. Being a comfort bunny I personally found the beds a bit firm but the delightful surrounding made up for this.

We just had our first trip away without our baby and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. We were collected from the airport in a smart bus arrived at the hotel served complimentary delicious tea and it was all lovely. Our room was large and luxurious not to mention spotlessly clean.. We had a great time exploring the souk the staff were very attentive and helpful and all in all we can't wait to go back. It was so easy quicker than getting to Leeds!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa T wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We had a very pleasant 3 night stay and the highlight was definitely the cookery course the Chef went out of his way to make us feel welcome in his kitchen and we cooked some wonderful food and he made a real fuss of us for the rest of our stay a really nice touch.  The room had everything needed good lighting mirrors etc and was very clean and serviced very well each day.  All in all a very good experience and a Riad I would recommend. The one fault I would find is that although the staff were always very willing to assist in the bar and restaurant areas a bit of direction and management was needed. Staff could often stand around talking to each other while we were waiting for plates to be cleared from the table or drinks to arrive. Staff were not proactive as I would have expected and as another reviewer noted breakfast items were not replenished and often cutlery or bowls were not available.  We did not use the spa or pool during our stay but both looked very inviting. Reception staff were helpful and the entire hotel was beautifully clean.

Review_Date: Karen W wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Helpful staff, great room and location
Review_Text: The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.  Room was very large and in a good location clean and quiet.  Good choice at breakfast - can recommend the omelettes.  Stayed for 3 nights.Close to airportinside the city walls and in good walking distance to all main sites.

I stayed here with a friend for three nights in a premier twin room and we could not have been more pleased with our stay. Like the majority or reviewers here I can only praise the professionalism and friendliness of the all the staff - nothing is too much trouble and you are really made to feel at home. The fact that the majority of staff is female gives the hotel a special feel which is very friendly and relaxed and it does really feel like the staff all enjoy their working environment and their colleagues and they take the utmost care of its maintenance every area is spotless and carefully maintained. Location is perfect - located at the south end of the Medina it's central without the worst of the bustle. Spa/hammam and pool very good restaurant. We booked a premier twin room on first floor with plenty of wardrobe space and twin bathroom basins. The free wifi worked well throughout the hotel although not that fast. Beds were very comfy with memory foam mattresses. Local little songbirds/sparrows go to sleep in the courtyard trees at 5pm during high spirited chatter which is then repeated when they all wake up at 7! :) Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Chris G wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Well done Tom and the team
Review_Text: As a virgin visitor to a Marrakech Riad we were slightly apprehensive with the location on arrival. Fear not fellow travellers this boutique style hotel is typical of all Marrakech kasbah locations. A safe as anywhere and more so than most UK cities day and night. The friendliest staff thet we have had the pleasure to come across. ( especially noilela the funny one) .The joint owner/manager Tom is genuinely interested in your views and opinions and seems to constanlt strive to better this establishment. A memorable stay with a great hamman/spa . We cannot finish this review without mentioning our suite. We stayed in room 107 fantastic . Thankyou.....we'll be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best place to stay in comfort and in the Medina. The staff was very friendly and the amenities were superb. Don't miss a day in the spa and enjoy the pool at the end of the day. And to close the day in great style enjoy the amazing restaurant in house.

Review_Date: AlisonP P wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: This is a truly beautiful riad very tastefully renovated a little oasis of calm in the midst of the bustling medina and with probably the most consistently professional and courteous staff I've come across anywhere. This was my third visit to this riad; I can't think of anywhere else I've been back to more than once but along with it being a delightful place to stay just in its own right it's perfectly situated in the medina about ten minutes' (interesting) walk from the main square of Marrakech and various other interesting sites. I have recommended this place to several friends and family members - all who have visited have enjoyed it so far and fingers crossed my parents do in November!  Have to give a mention to the drivers for the excursions and to and from the airport. Extremely polite and helpful without being obtrusive and willing to stop and show you interesting things but not at all pushy about doing so.  If you're looking for some recommendations of things to do alongside the obvious and stunning Jardin Majorelle the Palais down the road is worth a visit and if you can find the nearby tinsmiths' square which we came upon by accident (try Kosybar for a coffee during the day) it's worth a visit for a little peace and quiet off the beaten track. Five Elements spa down the Rue de la Kasbah is well worth a visit too.

Review_Date: Ronald P wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: I've been waiting a few days after coming home from Marrakesh to try and think of something new to say about this hotel/riad after all the other contributors praises but I can't !  It is just a great place to stay. Full of character and charm and though essentially modern it has been so tastefully restored by the owners.  If the building is one part of the equation that makes this place special then the staff is the other.  Smiling friendly always helpful every one of them.  Les Borjs is only 10 mins from the airport just in the old city walls yet handy for the new city with it's shops and banks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel - a Oasis close to the action
Review_Text: A small but perfectly equip hotel on the end of the Kasbah only a short wold from the main square and on a small busy street as you enter you are transported completely away from the hustle and bustle of the city into an oasis of tranquility. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and keen to ensure you have a great stay. I would certainly recommend to friends and family and would be excited to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lars B wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: This hotel is located n one of the narrow allies within the Kasbah. It is the most Beautiful Little hotel a so called Riad which is a denomination for e rich mans house. The hotell has a typical Maroc architechture and in the centre of the Buildings is a small open Patio with a well and lots of flowers. The personel is very service minded and the rooms a clean nice with very comfortable bath rooms. It is highly recommended. Mind you it is situated aprox. two kilometers from the Grand Square.

This hotel takes some beating and is an oasis of calm in a city that is lively to say the least. From the moment we arrived late one evening to a warm greeting and a wonderful suite we felt completely at home and at ease.  The hotel is ideally situated near the Royal Palace and yet still only a walk of 10-15 minutes to the main square. Everything a tourist would want to see is within easy walking distance.  First the rooms are beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean - rose petals laid out onto the bedding and towels that are the thickest ever. We had suite 303 with excellent views over the pool on one side and small courtyards on the others.  Dining is a pleasure and the service superb. The only downside to otherwise excellent food is the lack of choice particularly if staying more than a few days. The local cuisine is tasty and very filling. Lunch by the pool and a very good breakfast make the dining complete.  I could waffle on for a long time but would like to thank the staff for making our break so memorable in particular Nadia Btissam Ilham Nora Fatima and Mounia. Also a special mention to Meriem who prepared breakfast for us.  Thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kate H wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Stayed just under a week in sept 2014. Very calm comfortable and relaxing. Lovely decor charming staff andnice pool. Convenient for all sites and organised excursions interesting with reliable informative drivers -who did not insist on taking us to shops. Thoroughly recommend.

Review_Date: Michaela P wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: One of the nicest hotels we've stayed at
Review_Text: We went to Marrakech in August and stayed here for 5 nights and have to say the hotel was beautifully restored to a traditional raid the decor was just beautiful the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and the food was delicious with great traditional choices initially we had a couple of problems with our room which the hotel staff addressed immediately the whole area especially the pool area was exceptionally clean. The hotel and staff made are time in Marrakech a most enjoyable and relaxing time and would not hesitate to recommend Les borjs de la Kasbah to anyone and everyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Absolutely heaven-a sanctuary from the madness of main square!. Beautiful rooms with a balcony and lots of light. Excellent service wonderful pool happy hour!! and good food. Loved the ambience of this riad.  It was easy to find. Very welcoming front desk. Silly me- once inside the riad I couldn't find the opening to the main reception..the owner saw that I was lost and came out of his office and gave me a tour of the riad. I stayed here my last night in Morocco after a 8 day tour --and am very thankful I did--I left with fond memories of calm clean and beautiful! As I left early they even brought me breakfast to my room--never expected that! This is the riad I would stay at if I returned to Marrakech.

I stayed at this charming riad for one night prior to commencing an 8 day tour of Morocco and I have to say it was the most enjoyable of all of the hotels/riads I stayed in throughout my time in Marrakech and Morocco for that matter.    The hotel staff were very friendly and hospitable during my stay and it was may clear just how much attention the hotel management take to detail - On arrival at the riad I was welcomed with a pot of Moroccan tea and Moroccan sweets and my bed and en suite were donned with rose petals - both very nice touches and added a sense of ambience to my stay.    The breakfast which was included in the cost of my accommodation was very satisfying with delicious omelettes and crepes made fresh upon request.    Although I was meeting my tour at a different hotel in Marrakech at 7pm the day of my checkout the hotel staff were more than happy for me to checkout but leave my baggage in storage at the riad. Although I checked out at 11am I spent a very relaxing day poolside lounging on a deck chair beneath an umbrella. The pool is very clean and well maintained and the perfect place to spend a couple of hours (or day like I did) to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech's manic Medina. Whilst I was on my own at the riad I found it very easy to meet other solo travellers by the poolside. On my day of check-out I also had a very enjoyable pedicure at the riad's own spa which they managed to fit me in immediately upon request (I'd still recommend booking just to be on the safe-side).    The pool and courtyard in the riad are two lovely features of this riad. I enjoyed my time here so much so that I paid to come back on my final full-day in Marrakech to dine at the pool's restaurant for lunch and use the pool and shower facilities which cost around 150 dirham (or 15 europe). The pool's change rooms which are (donned with warm showers) was a real treat after spending 5 days in a hostel with questionable showering facilities.    Overall I had a very enjoyable experience at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. The staff are very friendly the riad is exceptionally clean and tidying and it's in an ideal location. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Michael P wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: I chose this riad as it had a pool and was within walking distance of the main square. On arrival I was welcomed with some mint tea and cookies. As I had arrived late I dined in the restaurant that night The food was lovely at reasonable by European standards. The riad is located in a small but safe street about 20 minutes walk from the main square. It is on the same street as the Royal Palace so their is a police presence which is reassuring. Their are loads of open spaces around the hotel to laze around which is nice. The pool is nice and their were always plenty of deck chairs. Breakfast was good typical Moroccan with plenty to choose from to suit everyones tastes. The staff were all very friendly and more than helpful. My room was located close to reception so I could pick up the wifi. Room was a good size and cleaned daily with the staff leaving rose petals on my bed everyday. My room had a fridge which was a big plus. In my opinion and based on European standards this hotel would be five stars in many areas such as customer service dining quality and facilities provided. Highly recommended.

Review_Title: I definitively found my place in Marrakech
Review_Text: I went to Marrakech at least 6 times between 2000 and 2014 always experiencing different locations hotels styles (ryad de luxe hotels cheap hotels etc.) I finally found my place in the city at Le Borjis del Kasbah. There are a couple of reasons why I said that. First: the hotel. Les Borjis is a charming quiet clean small hotel combining the charme of a ryad with the services of an hotel (spa swimming pool concierge large and comfortable rooms etc.) The staff is friendly and efficient the breakfast is excellent. The restaurants is worthwhile it offers good Moroccan or international cuisine. Second: the area. The casbah is walking distance from Jema el Fna and the souks and offers the experience to live in the Old Medina while it’s slightly removed from the most chaotic and crowded area. Third: the house. This is and ancient building amazingly restored by local craftsmen who recreated the atmosphere of an old Moroccan estate. The wooden moucharabia that closed the room was a real masterpiece such as the decorations of the façade and the floor. Please note that if you are looking for a modern full service luxury hotel with an Olympic swimming pool this is not the place for you. But if you look for a quintessentially Marrakech experience Moroccan hospitality at its best do not hesitate to book a room here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from this wonderful boutique hotel that is full of morrocan charm. My sister and I had a fantastic time and definitely highly recommend. The staff were wonderful (nothing was too much trouble) the pool is great - can always get a sunlounger there is a little bar (that does serve alcohol) and several lounge areas. The courtyard is also a nice cool place to sit. The location is great - close to old and new town and 10 minutes from the airport. We also had a massage in their spa - heavenly!    The hotel recommended us a great place to buy argan oil which is just around the corner from the hotel and is pure argan oil rather than vegetable oil sold in the souk. I've been using every day and my hair and skin never felt so good.

We wanted a hotel in the old part of Marrakech but we also wanted a pool to cool off in which is what made us choose this hotel over a riad. I'm so glad we did! This place was simply amazing. It was an oasis of calm in a crazy city! The staff were really helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and had air conditioning. The pool area was lovely (and we couldn't hear any noise from the streets outside). The choice on offer at breakfast was great. The only slight down-side was the beds were not very comfortable but this would not stop me from returning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrackech.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel. Relaxing and peaceful but great location
Review_Text: Stopped at this hotel Last week and the service from staff and director made the holiday. I proposed to my partner during the stay and all staff were extremely helpful during our trip. We booked an excursion through the hotel; the driver took us on a 2 hour 30 minute drive to some amazing waterfalls and talked to us along the way pointing out various landmarks. The hotel is situated around a 20 minute walk from the main square which has various bars and restaurants as well as a variety of shops and souks. The hotel restaurant is delicious and we dined there for 3 of our 7 night stay. First class hotel and would definitely stay again.

Review_Date: richard a wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: We wanted a hotel in the old city and this was just perfect.we were greeted with drinks on arrival then taken to our rooms.the rooms were clean and large.overall the hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere and the staff were superb.breakfast was nice and we also had a couple of evening meals which were very good.the English manager/director was on hand and very helpful.they organised a trip for us at reasonable cost .i would recommend this hotel and would return myself.

This is a really nice Riad only a few niggling issues stopped me from rating it a 5.    We arranged a transfer with the hotel and the driver was waiting for us when we landed. It is a very short drive to the Riad and we were greeted with welcome drinks on arrival. The room was absolutely huge and well maintained. The whole property is a wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.    The Riad seems to be in a more local area of the Medina and we did not see as many tourists as we expected walking from there to the main square. However this was probably an advantage as the area felt safe and was full of families both day and night. There was also far less hassle than nearer the square and souks. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the main square and much of this is spent dodging traffic. This wasn't a problem for us but is definitly something to be aware of. On the plus side taxis are able to pull up right outside here which is impossible in some other areas.    The staff were consistently friendly and helpful with excellent English. It was great to have the pool especially in such heat. Drinks at the Riad are more expensive than outside but very reasonable by UK and international hotel standards. We booked a hammam and massage which was very good and also very reasonable.    There were 2 things that sold Les Borjs de la Kasbah to me when booking. 1. The air conditioning and 2. The wifi. However these are two things that did not function well during our stay. The air conditioning was not cool enough and the wifi was incredibly patchy. I know this wouldn't bother many people but it was a nuisance when I was relying on it for an important work email.    I also found myself slightly dissapointed with breakfast. The cereal never had any bowls and when something was gone it was very rarely replenished. Some of the fruit also did not seem very fresh but these are really just me being picky. All in all a good choice of Riad great atmosphere friendly staff.

Really enjoyed my stay here the staff were wonderful and seemed genuinely happy to be there and to help. The property itself is beautiful lovely Riad. Great pool great fountain in the middle of the property the room was very nice shower was clean and seemed new. Wifi wasn't great but frankly I'm not sure you're going to get very fast internet anywhere. Excursions arranged through the hotel were enjoyable and available at a decent price. The included breakfast was very good I didn't try the lunch dinner or spa but all were offered at reasonable prices.    Nice public areas was fun to watch the FIFA match with others staying in the hotel in the common TV room. TV also available in the rooms lots of english channels.    The location was good short walk away from the centre of the old city overall everything was great - would not hesitate to recommend.

We arrived very late in the night and had arranged a pick up with the hotel in advance. The flight was early but the driver was only five minutes away. Arriving late and having never been to Marrakech did mean that when no-one answered the door for a little while we got a little on edge but then we were welcomed in greeted by the hotel director and shown to our room which was a great size and beautifully presented - right down to the rose petals on the bed everyday!    The pool is a good size and it's very refreshing you can have food by the pool when the Moroccan heat gets too much and take a dip too. It's incredibly relaxing which is exactly what you need when you've walked the streets of Marrakech.    Food-wise breakfast was included and a wide selection provided including the Moroccan pancakes. When we overslept on our first day they kept breakfast running a little longer for us and that sort of detail is typical of the hotel. We also ate one evening meal there which was very nice and not unreasonably priced by european standards.    We also took a spa treatment which was brilliant and hugely recommended too the price is reasonable and the treatments are very relaxing (enough to make you fall asleep). If your aim is as ours was to have a relaxing getaway for four days Les Borjs de la Kasbah is ideal - you'll feel welcomed and the staff are really helpful the reception staff speak English perfectly although a little French is helpful at times.    I'd say this is a hotel for couples friends or solo travel rather than families - who may want a more resort style hotel with more activities for the kids but there was a family staying there who seemed to be enjoying it as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from this lovely hotel in the Kasbah after taking a cooking class. The very kind Miriam showed us how to cook a traditional Chicken Tagine soup with dates and some lovely almond pastries. one of the reception staff was also with us translating as we don't speak French but that added to the class more. We were able to choose which dishes we wanted but you must book ahead. I originally thought it was a little bit pricey at ?40 each but you do get to eat the meal afterwards for lunch and we enjoyed cooking together and had fun doing something new and we were there for 4 hours all in. We ate by the pool and would have used the pool if we had remebered to bring our swimming costumes and could stayed on for evening drinks. It's a lovely hotel in a quiet part of the Kasbah really charming with warm friendly staff and we may stay there next time we visit Marrakech.

We went to Marrakech early June. There are so many choices of where to stay making a decision was very difficult but we chose Les Borjs de la kasbah based good reviews a recommendation of a friend and that they had a decent sized pool which is not that common for the riads.    We stayed in a suite because I was aware some of the rooms didn't have a shower but knew the suite had both and we wanted to make sure we had a shower. The suite was beautiful big decorated with such attention to detail. The room came with a plate of fruits toiletries in the bathroom and complimentary water.    The Riad itself is beautiful very clean a lovely courtyard lots of places to chill out and take things in. I am glad we chose somewhere with a pool as we spent a lot of time by it when it was abit too hot to go out walking. We were there at low season and it was still pretty busy so I would imagine at busier times you would struggle to find space round it.    The breakfasts were lovely a selections of eggs bread pancake and fruits. No meat sausages etc    We tried the Hamam and a massage which was great. The massage was amazing! Highly recommended!    The staff were on the whole very friendly and welcoming. Service could be pretty slow in the restaurant and bar staff seem to disappear all together for long periods of times. I noticed guests at the restaurant having to knock on the door of the kitchen to get attention. But this seems to abit of a theme when reading reviews of hotels and eateries in Morrocco that generally service is relatively slow so I don't think this particularly unusual. But just something to be aware of things are much slower paced!.    The location was ok it's a 15-20 min walk to the main square but it's not relaxing one the locals tend to get around on motorbike driving them very fast down the little alleyways so you do have to have your wits about you. They also try to trick by telling you roads are closed when they aren't! So make sure you know where you are going.    I think this place is beautiful but perhaps a little isolated ..I would definitely come back here again if I wanted to get away from it all. But if I wanted to be in and around the action the nice restaurants shops etc I would probably chose something more central Overall a lovely place and lovely holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Duncan S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: A haven of peace and calm from Marrakech's hustle and bustle
Review_Text: We could not believe the peace and calm that you experience in this wonderful riad once you step through the door off the street. The welcome started with mint tea and patisserie in the courtyard to the gentle sound of birds and the fountain. Everywhere was spotless the staff immaculate in their outfits and with a ready smile and greeting at all times. With temperatures outside nearing 40 degrees the air-conditioning in the room was really effective and when combined with a very comfortable bed we slept well during our 3 night stay. We really enjoyed our breakfasts - especially the fresh fruit and omelettes but due to the draw of Jemaa el-Fna Square and other evening entertainment we only managed one evening meal at the riad but that was excellent. We really hope to return to Morocco and this is definitely where we would always want to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Good Overall Riad Experience in Marrakech
Review_Text: This was our first night stay in a 13 day Morocco tour. Looking back I would say it provides a good view of the overall Riad experience. It has a nice garden area with a good sized pool for a Riad. The seating around the garden is in a very comfortable alcove type arrangement with some privacy but a community feel. The food was always well done with the ever present Tangine and Grill options. As we noted with all Moroccan hosts the service is an interesting blend of traditional waiting and do it yourself. You will need to reach out for assistance more than you are used to but the response is always warmly received and well executed. The rooms are comfortable with very firm beds that are a standard everywhere we went and a clean layout. Given it is a Medina location and in densely populated surroundings the views and light in the room are limited but the space is open and airy. Internet is spotty everywhere so you have to find the zone that works - here is was out in an alcove off the garden.    All in all we a glad this location was selected for the first phase of our trip and we would certainly consider it if we return to Marrakech.

Stayed 4 nights in late May. This is a lovely calm oasis in the hectic city. Beautifully decorated and well maintained. We had room 303 which had a 4 poster bed and views over the courtyard and pool. Excellent facilities- pool spa restaurant bar safes in rooms good towels bathrobes etc. Approx 20 mins walk to the main square- felt very comfortable and totally safe walking back even late at night. All staff friendly and helpful- nothing too much trouble from ordering taxis to storing our bags on our last day. Massage and facial in the spa both excellent.  Don't hesitate!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a week here and loved this place. It is just 10 min walk from the main Marrakech attractions and is really quiet clean and very very nice.    The staff were very friendly and always helpful. We liked the touch of the general manager waiting for us on our arrival day to welcome us even if we arrived very late.    They serve very good breakfast and also the quality of the restaurant is quite good (although we only ate there once).    Overall we can definitely highly recommend this place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had four nights here and loved it. Staff where all friendly and extremely helpful. Very nice room and a good size pool given the location in the Medina this is a rarity. The food was good and we enjoyed the meal in the restaurant the lamb tagine was fantastic and the banana pancake one of the best I have had. It is a 20 minute walk to the square but that's fine given the quality of the hotel pool and staff. Only comment I would add is I don't know why the glass roof over the restaurant is sometimes closed it's better open . A couple more sun beds around the pool would be nice there is a bit more space to do that. Over all I would highly recommend this hotel.

I chose this riad based on all the other amazing reviews. Very good value for money staff were very friendly and helpful. I was staying on my own and the lovely receptionist asked all the other guests if any of them wanted to go to one of the day trips with me so that I wasn't on my own. They also arranged a lovely guide to take me around the city at very short notice.    I only ate at the riad once but it was lovely. I had the beef cous cous. I nearly had a heart attack when the meat came attached to the bone (I'm a really fussy eater) but it tasted absolutely delicious. The breakfast was lovely too- there was always someone there to cook you up a fresh omelette. They also have buy one get one free on cocktails between 6:30 and 7:30pm.    As a single person staying at the riad it would have been so easy for me to hide away in my room whenever I was there. I was impressed by the many cute places to sit and enjoy a cocktail or glass of mint tea- the bar the terrace the pool etc. There was even a little living room area. I was also impressed by how good the WIFI was!    All in all a great riad!

Have just got back from a 5 night trip to celebrate a wedding anniversary. We chose the hotel based on other reviews and were not in the least bit disappointed. The hotel is located in a quiet part of the medina but only about a 15 minute stroll away from the main square (Jemaa el-Fnaa) and it really is a little oasis of peace. The facilities are fantastic and our suite was beautifully decorated and very comfortable with rose petals on the bed each night! The restaurant courtyards and pool are idyllic. The staff are friendly and helpful - the two ladies who run reception each organised restaurant reservations for us (including a fantastic anniversary meal) as well as taxis (telling us how much to pay for the fare in advance to save too much haggling). The spa is also well worth a visit -- a real experience and totally relaxing.  All in all I would thoroughly recommend the Borjs and will definitely go back for another visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose this riad based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. We contacted them directly to take advantage of their 'pot pourri' special offer of a guided tour of Marrakech a cookery lesson and a hammam. We were very pleased with all aspects of the riad but especially the friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much bother. We'd booked a suite which was beautifully decorated and had fresh rose petals on the bed every day; a lovely touch. Although it is located in the centre of the Kasbah area of the Medina it was very quiet inside the riad complex and peaceful. You do need to be careful on the road outside with carts bikes scooters etc but that is largely the case everywhere in Marrakech. It took us 15 minutes to walk to the main square and there are ATMs and a bureau de change on the way.  The only thing we'd change would be the option of feather pillows as we found the pillows too hard for our liking. We usually take our own but this was not possible with only travelling with hand luggage. However that is a minor point.  Definitely one to return to for a relaxing break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Celia S wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Excellent oasis in hte middle of the old town
Review_Text: This wonderful hotel was like stepping out of the noise and dirt of the old town into a quiet little heaven. Staff was wonderful the food and bar drinks were great and the beautiful interior was kept spotless. Lunch at the pool was a highlight - how delightful to eat there when it was too hot to be anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This small hotel is located in a quiet part of the old town - The Medina. The welcome is great the rooms are comfortable and well equipped and the facilities are superb for such a small hotel. I would strongly recommend a visit. The staff smile all the time - a very happy place.

This is a very attractive hotel and really quiet. My daughter loved the pool. We loved the spa. We really enjoyed our trip to Imlil which the hotel arranged and had lots of fun in the cooking class. The only downside is that the roads to the souk were a little scary for our little girl so some might prefer to be closer to the busier side of town but personally the quietness was worth being further out for us.

I was so lucky to be booked into Les Borj for 3 nights--my first stop in Morocco. Everything that's been said is true. Welcoming helpful staff; good rooms; lovely courtyard for relaxing great WIFI reception lovely (though chilly) pool bountiful breakfast buffet and more. Easy access to major Kasbah sites for the hardy walker.    As a single senior traveling alone: sheer perfection!

Review_Date: Julia W wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: Had a wonderful time and could thoroughly recommend. Central but concealed. Quiet and wonderful ambience. Staff friendly and very helpful. Perfect spot for long or short stay. Do the horse drawn trip around old and new city and Atlas Mountains

I have spent 4 nights here in october 2013 we where 12 girls and we all loved it! Nice atmosphere good food (especially the breakfast) lovely and helpful employees. I LOVE the location for this riad right in the middle of the Medina. One step outside and you are there! I felt safe and its a big plus that you can drive the taxi all the way to the door. Did not try the spa...

Review_Title: Maybe there's a nicer place in Marrakech...maybe...
Review_Text: Okay so I've stayed in one place in Marrakech -- two separate times -- and I'm not inclined to explore elsewhere after having great luck at Borjs de la Kasbah.    When you enter the fortified city you take a dusty road past vendors and merchants and you head away from the tourist areas. We took a cab at night -- not so much out of fear as much as it would be an uninteresting long walk to reach the medina and restaurants in the heart of the fortified city. And that is the only drawback. That's it. You're not in the middle of everything but you're still close and you're still in the fortified city -- actually with very convenient egress to get to the airport quickly to catch that early flight back home.    Being off the beaten path has its benefits in the form of the restaurant. Knowing how fantastic their authentic Moroccan cuisine is if I was staying in the center of the old city I would travel out of my way to get to the restaurant that is just a few steps away within the heart of the borjs! For our final night during our second stay we were fortunate enough to have live entertainment in the form of musicians from the southeastern part of the country and even a traditional belly dancer. The family loved the show and the entertainers were very friendly.    The staff is also very friendly. Everyone seemed to take ownership. It was never clear to me who was in charge -- in a good sense because everyone seemed to feel empowered and accountable for ensuring a first rate experience. This began on our arrival as we were served hot tea (in near 100 degree F temperature -- surprisingly refreshing) as our bags were taken to our two rooms. Another employee offered to show us the grounds and amenities. We were very relaxed even before we where shown to our rooms. As you can see from the photos that I posted there is no roughing it here. The rooms had us in the lap of luxury.    We didn't linger in our rooms there was much to see and do...and when we did linger there were plenty of areas withing the courtyard and grounds to hang out and meditate or read or converse. Even if we weren't in Morocco the best word to sum up the place -- and the experience -- is "oasis."

We had an excellent three nights break away from children and exploring a new part of the world. The staff we're welcoming and charming throughout our suite above the restaurant courtyard was spacious and charming. We chose one away from the pool thinking it would be quieter but actually got this wrong although the restaurant did not continue too late.    Excursions and recommendations were excellent particularly the private tour into the Atlas Mountains taking in many sights and a 30 minute camel ride (paid on top).    Pool and massages were fantastic so relaxing after a day in the city following my wife round the Souks and we're not massively into spas normally.    My only quibble is that the food was nothing special in fact quite ordinary considering the hotel states is pride in its kitchen. The a la carte dishes often looked preferable to our set guests menu so perhaps we just went for the wrong option. We didn't really have one meal that stayed in the memory; perhaps this is just Morocco and it's not somewhere to go if you want high quality food.    All in all though an excellent small hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great food in a desert of mediocrity
Review_Text: Stayed at a nearby Riad where the food was not good. Visited Le Jasmin restaurant at Les Borjs de la Kasbah two nights running. Had a variety of traditional Moroccan food over both evenings and enjoyed all of it. Service was exceptionally friendly and the two female servers were happy to take the time to explain the menu to us. Prices were very reasonable and local wines were well priced. Food was very hot and delicious. We left clean plates behind on both visits. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent the day here - we didn't stay overnight. We used the Hammam had a massage had lunch and used the pool. It was all excellent. An oasis away from the frenetic kasbah. The service was great from all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kate S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: Lovely Boutique Hotel - Well run and peaceful in crazy town!
Review_Text: This is a lovely boutique hotel tucked away about 20 mins walk from the main square. The staff are attentive and very helpful and the facilities are perfect for a relaxing break. Excellent standards all round ( that measured against my OCD other half)!  Ask the staff for where to eat go or visit and they cannot do enough. They can organise trips if you want. The in house hammam is also super convenient.    The GM is a lovely guy and if only all hotels had someone as attentive.    If you are new to Marrakesh then the new town is the bit they serve booze in forget drinking in the old town apart from the hotel. Watch out for those boys trying to take you to the tanneries google this fairly harmless scam before you get here otherwise you will be on a bit of a goose chase!    If you want a crazy busy hotel this one is not for you - here you will find peace nice food and helpful people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Once you enter the hotel from the busy street you walk into a orange tree filled courtyard where you can relax in cabanas or enjoy a drink of mint tea at a table.  A short walk from the square and other attractions. Staff friendly and informative willing help and give information. Beautiful pool area to unwind weather permitting.
