Rooms were big and well apponited. Strongly recommend this riad for your Morrocan experience.

Review_Date: Julie T wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We are staying near by and so just came for dinner. Very reasonably priced tasty food served by the friendliest staff we've met so far. There's a choice of outdoor or indoor seating inside this wonderful traditional riad. The food is Moroccan and international and all four of us really enjoyed our dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at this lovely riad for three wonderful nights just a short walk from the square it is a peaceful haven. The staff are all friendly and really made our stay special.  The suite was fabulous and we had our very first Hammam ( Heaven ) I cannot reccomend this hotel enough its brilliant and I really would say that this hotel is a wonderful advert for the people of Marrakech. We are planning to visit the Les Borjs again and will definatly have the brilliant hammam again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and toddler (20 months) stayed at Le Borj at the end of February. It was a perfect stay. The Riad itself and the rooms within are absolutely pristine definitely renovated for the western traveller (all the modern amenities menus etc.) yet it maintained an air of authentic Morrocan-ness. Rooms were HUGE and very well appointed. The pool was gorgeous a little too cool for February but I'm sure it's lovely in a month or so. My only tiny little niggling complaint was that the beds were very firm but I'm used to a super soft bed at home. I certainly didn't lose any sleep though.  The British owner and family were usually onsite to make sure things were running smoothly. They always took the time to welcome each guest personally and to check in with them every day. Absolutely lovely people. The staff are also brilliant willing to help you out day and night. They made a fuss over our baby and were very accommodating. Families with well-behaved kids shouldn't hesitate to stay here if you're looking for the non-resort kind of experience (which we were).  The location of the riad was great located in the Kashbah a quiet area still inside the medina but only about 20 min walk from the (manic) Jemma Al Fna. It's also very easy to get to the outside/ Palmerie area with the supermarkets and bigger shops/ hotels.  Food was good traditional Moroccan breads and eggs cooked to order for breakfast with a diverse Moroccan and western menu for lunch and dinner.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone!

Review_Date: Traci H wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Beautiful peaceful quaint great food excellent service. Group of 8 women all loved this hotel. No wifi in the rooms but in common areas. Location is 10 min walk from square and other attractions. Do not try to find this hotel on your own because it's in an alley and not easily recognizeable. Great value for money tour guides available by request at front desk comfortable beds great air conditioning wonderful/loungey common areas very clean intimate and specialized spa experience nice pool. Everything about this hotel says vacation and relaxation.

Review_Title: A wonderful Riad with so many special touches
Review_Text: My friend and I spent 3 nights at this most delightful Riad in November 2013 . From the moment we entered this wonderful peaceful haven we were looked after so well by the staff The attention to detail was amazing from the decor in our rooms and the lovely orange blossom smelling products in our bathrooms to the amazing breakfasts Beetroot and courgette yogurt was delicious and fresh juices and fruits were in abundance Spicy omelettes home made breads and dried fruits were just some the choices available which made breakfast a mouth watering experience . We were lucky to have such glorious weather and so after the hustle and bustle of the souks we could lie in the.sunshine around the roof top swimming pool and order drinks and snacks or have a massage in the spa My daughter and her boyfriend have just returned on my recommendation and they too had a marvellous time - I can't wait to return

Review_Title: I highly recommend this hotel/riad to stay at !!!
Review_Text: I have just returned from visiting Marrakech for the first time.. As a single female I was a little apprehensive visiting Marrakech on my own.  Les Borjs staff were so helpful and supportive .. Initially the friendly complementary taxi from the airport to the warm welcome when I arrived at the hotel to the with Moroccan mint tea and cakes in the courtyard with the peacefulness of a small fountain coolness and quiet.  I had booked a small twin room which was in a small courtyard with 2 other rooms .. quiet peaceful and whilst on the ground floor I felt extremely safe and at ease.  I booked half board and the food was great I am a vegetarian and there was a different vegetarian dish every evening .. wonderful.    The hotel booked a guide for me who was fantastic and I would strongly recommend and got talking to other guests who were very impressed with the excursions the hotel had to offer.  I would recommend the Hammam and massage as well ... and I floated back to my room so relaxed after having them ... the pool and sauna were wonderful too.    The hotel is situated where it is easy to get to the main attractions ... situated in a nice area of the medina easy to get to about a 10 min walk from Jemaa el Fna. Can't wait to return.

So much better than a large chain hotel! When you enter the riad it is a haven of peace amongst the (enjoyable) craziness of Marrakech. Very welcoming staff restful atmosphere excellent value spa treatments. Loved the breakfast selection. Great location. Didn't need to resort to taxis in the 5 night stay. This might not appeal to everyone. . But. ... free wifi that was accessible everywhere I tried within the hotel.  I will return to this one.

Just spent a long weekend at Les Borjs and enjoyed the experience immensely! Selected and booked for me as a birthday treat by my daughter who also enjoyed the trip. We loved our suite on the 1st floor which was a dual aspect room with a view of the pool on one side and a small courtyard on the other - lots of sunshine pouring in at both ends of the day! The bed was very comfortable and the shutters lamps and curtains created a very snug atmosphere indeed in the cooler February evenings. We ate in the hotel each evening and the food was delicious and varied with lovely waiting staff always keen to please with a ready smile. (Unfortunately we weren't able to enjoy the half-board rate as we strayed from the tabled'hote in error). The breakfasts were also excellent with lots of tempting Moroccan treats (which we had to try!) and the added bonus of finishing at 10 am which allowed a lie-in! Great. The hotel is in walking distance of the main square and souks and I would recommend an early trip in a horse and carriage booked via the hotel which allowed us to orientate ourselves within the city ready to return to our favourite areas. (It also confirmed that staying within the walls of the Medina is the very best!) Our driver actually managed to take us through part of the souk area which was amazingly tight and caused us to breathe in very tightly! We had some excellent treatments in the spa with great massages. I would highly recommend Les Borjs which is beautifully restored and created with a fabulous tranquil atmosphere in a very lively city. Just gorgeous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our warm welcome the helpful and friendly staff the facilities were all superb better than other 5 star hotels I have encountered on business travel! Our bedroom was beautiful and the courtyard does create a beautiful oasis of calm in hectic Marrakech. We went to the Atlas Mountains on a day trip organised by the hotel and it was well worth the drive to experience more of the Moroccan countryside and local culture. The spa treatments were lovely thank you Ladies. We would most definitely recommend and hope to return. Thank you to all the staff for making my husband's birthday weekend so special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For SPA in Marrakech we had the best experience at this spa ask for Hasnah she is an amazing masseuse great spa and very quiet. The ryad is the old Kasbah behind the royal palace so very safe the architecture is traditional service supper good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carole H wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: A real gem giving peace and tranquility which is what we were looking for in our holiday. After a couple of days we were moved to a suite which was superb - the attention to detail and the petals left on the bed each day were amazing.The staff were all very efficient but also had time to stop and talk. The pool area and rooms around the courtyard were a pleasant contrast from the hustle and bustle in the medina. Tom and Francoise made us very welcome and again found time to stop and talk - very hands on. The only thing which would have been better would have been to have the evening meal in the larger dining area - I assume this is used more later in the season. Carole & Alex Smith Solihull
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Pleasant, but lacking the personal touch
Review_Text: We had a lovely large room which was clean and comfortable. I was expecting a fireplace but in fact the reversible air conditioning unit was very effective in keeping the room warm enough on the chilly January nights. Breakfasts were very good and we enjoyed the one dinner we had in the hotel although the restaurant room is long and narrow and a bit cramped.  Location is a good compromise being in the Medina and so within walking distance of most of the sights but in a reasonably quiet road.  A few little niggles: we had quite a wait - at least 20 minutes - for our welcome drink. Maid service was a bit erratic: on the third day our plate of fruit disappeared from our room along with our spare bar of soap. And we didn't get much guidance about where to go and what to expect in Marrakesh which we understand other riads offer. The staff were very friendly and willing to please but overall there didn't seem to be anyone actually managing the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's very difficult to improve on previous accolades which say it all. Les Borjs de la Kasbah is an exquisite bijou offering a unique experience of peace and tranquillity in contrast to the hectic world outside its walls! It has been beautifully extended and restored to perfection with attention to every detail of Moroccan character and charm. From the moment we arrived we were looked after by a wonderful team who made every endeavour to ensure our comfort and happiness. Nothing was too much trouble. The Riad itself offers so much at excellent value from the room facilities to the pool area and hammam (a "must") at the Spa. It is well placed for all the main attractions by foot and a joy to return to after the hustle and bustle! Our huge thanks to Francoise Mike Tom and everyone at Les Borjs for having made our recent stay so very special.  Chris and Kit Slade Cheltenham.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Before booking this delight of a "Borges" the only complaint I had read were that the bedrooms were dark. However after a day touring this amazing city it becomes obvious that the subdued light of the bedroom also equals a refreshingly cool bedroom. This is only one of the fascinating architectural details known only to locals and of course the owners of Les Borges on how to build in a hot climate. Although not in the heart of town the walk to the market is manageable when not in the midday sun. Otherwise a short taxi ride is easily organised by very helpful receptionists. This beautiful grand old house and it really does feel like someone's home is not to be missed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was treated like a king in the hands of angels. With short notice I was booked in pampered and l made to feel like I really mattered by every member of staff. Marrakech isn't Marrakech without a hamman and a hamman isn't a hamman unless it's at Les Borjs de la Kasbah.

Review_Title: A very unique, serene experience. Highly recommend!
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is absolutely stellar. From the location to the staff all was a positive experience. It is very clean and beautiful. The rooms are spacious and cater any need imaginable. I wouldn't comment on any changes that would need to be made. Everyone is very friendly and welcoming and strives to make your stay as pleasant as can be. The staff really go above and beyond! They are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. From providing stamps for letters and sending them to providing the best advice regarding excursions you know you can count on them for any information! I had an excellent holiday and was at much peace whilst staying at this oasis in the midst of a chaotic city. It truly is a beautiful place so ornate. Such great taste in decorations and so nicely finished! The spa is a superb outlet to escape daily stress. Service all around was highly impressive and commendable. HIGHLY RECOMMEND 5 STARS ALL THE WAY. Thank you for a brilliant time!!!

Review_Date: Sarah F wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: My partner and I recently booked a morning's cookery lesson with chef Houssein. It was excellent really interesting and very hands on. We also learnt how to prepare moroccan mint tea properly. Houssein was great fun and very patient. We were then able to eat our 3 course meal in the beautiful surroundings of the hotel. Thoroughly recommended and very reasonably priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Walter L wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: An oasis in the Marrakech centre
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a real oasis in a typically local community. The staff is really commited and very joyful it likes to make you feel at home and is very succesfull at that! Meals vary from fair to excellent. The maintenance of the room excels also: The rooms are spatious and with all the luxury needed. Night rest is also guaranteed. The rate value for money is OK.    I would happily return for another holiday!

Review_Title: An Oasis in the middle of the desert
Review_Text: Excelent service and amenities the food is very good and also the spa services. The location is not excellent but is not bad either is kind of far from the main attractions however that helps to keep it quiet and relaxing. I had a few problems with the bathroom I hope they increase the maintenance there. The rest of the room was quite good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A big thank you to all the staff as we had a wonderful time and will return. A peaceful haven and would definitely recommend.  Everything was beautifully presented and everyone could not have been more helpful. Recommend a visit to the Atlas mountains. Long trip but amazing views.  Also visit restaurant Pepe Nero which is first class. A bit difficult to find but well worth it.  The horse and carriage ride is a must and great fun.

Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Peace and quiet in a frenetic city
Review_Text: We had a wonderful few days at Les Borjs … This was our first time in Morocco and we were also experiencing a riad for the first time although I think this is technically a hotel. It was amazing how the noise of the city totally disappeared as we walked into Les Borjs de la Kasbah.    The courtyard was beautiful and a very relaxing place to spend time. Our room was spacious and well-furnished (although it was not as light as we might have hoped but this could of course be entirely due to the fact that it was on the ground floor). The swimming pool was a good size and a constant and lovely 25 degrees!    The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them.    The result of the project of merging more than one property to construct Les Borjs is of a very high standard and the effect is ‘seamless’.    Breakfast was a lovely experience with freshly cooked eggs cooked individually for us as well as Moroccan pancakes etc. The weather was amazing during our stay and when the roof above the restaurant was opened up it was lovely to see the clear blue sky above us while we ate our breakfast. The evening meals were also excellent.    Les Borjs is very well situated in the medina close to the royal palace and is a relatively short distance to walk to the main square Jemmaa El Fna to the Koutoubia Mosque the souks and everything else on offer in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we were made very welcome with mint tea gorgeous pastries and a warm welcome. The room was large well designed with it's own terrace overlooking the restaurant. One night we had dinner and enjoyed music and dancing at a Moroccan night. The food was delicious and the wine list has a good number of Moroccan reds. We enjoyed the hammam two days in row it was so good the massages were sublime. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly the place was immaculate. The neighbourhood was interesting close to the tombs and palaces and a 15 minute walk to the square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A haven of tranquility in the heart of the old city
Review_Text: Highly recommend this lovely hotel which is literally built into the walls of the medina and is within walking distance of the main square. It was lovely to return to the peace and tranquility after the hussle and bustle of the streets (we especially enjoyed relaxing in the 'Moroccan lounge') and the room was very comfortable and incredibly quiet. A little disappointed with the food and the service could have been a bit more attentive but not enough to spoil our stay.

Review_Date: chris s wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Arriving here through the hustle and bustle of the casbah is an amazing experience.the contrast is unbelievable. Norah on reception greeted us with a smile and proved to be helpful and informative all the time on our 6 day stay.our room was spacious and spotlessthe whole place is very very clean.the reception rooms are comfortable and full of local character. the atmosphere is so peaceful and quite. Norah in the dining area is a real character with a real sense of humour ably assisted by Mohamed.We also enjoyed the hammam; had a body scrub and massage very relaxing.we really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay here again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: tony w wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Great Riad with excellent facilities. Pool and spa nice room very good service from all staff particularly reception nice breakfast location towards the edge of Medina area but great to be close enough to the action without it being noisy. Very little to fault. Would stay there again which is always the best test. If you want the Moroccan / Marrakech experience in a small and friendly hotel without being in a large standard 'Western' hotel then this is the place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alex A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed here for five nights in need of some winter sun and relaxation. We picked Les Borjs for the good reviews the facilities and the price. We had both visited Marrakech once before separately so had something with which.to compare this experience.    Our room was comfortable and well appointed my only criticism was that the beds were very hard (I do like a firm bed but this one did keep me awake a bit!). The hotel is built around a pretty courtyard so lovely views from everywhere.    We each had two spa treatments which were excellent I particularly enjoyed my hammam. We also did the cookery class which the hotel offers; this was good fun and very good value as it fed us for both lunch and dinner as well as teaching us the rudiments of Moroccan cuisine.    All the staff were efficient and very friendly and the atmosphere was at all times both relaxing and convivial. We loved it!

Arrived very late for a one night stay and was warmly welcomed shown to my room and presented with a pot of mint tea lovely!  My room was on the second floor with a view of the pool on one side and and a small courtyard on the other. The double bed was very comfortable as were the chairs in the sitting area. A good size bathroom too.  The tv had several English channels including BBC 1 and 2 ITV 12 and 3 and channel 5. Free wifi was also available but I could only get it on the ground floor but that was ok as there are several very pleasant seating area's.  There wasn't a huge variety of food for breakfast but the pancakes I had were delicious!  As I had an evening flight I asked to keep my room on. Unfortunately there was someone else already booked into it and so the reception staff gave me a small room on the ground floor. And at no extra charge. This level of service I've rarely encountered on my travels. This hotel deserves every bit of praise already heaped on it. If you want loud music and entertainment every evening this hotel is not for you. If you want good service good food tranquility and a lovely clean room then this is definitely the place for you.

Review_Title: Beautiful rooms, Great food, friendly Service
Review_Text: Nicely tucked away in a quiet street not too far from the main square this place feels secluded intimate and with a little bit of a luxury feel about it. Service was faultless from the very friendly staff and the food was very good indeed. All very laid back and a range of social and eating areas from the main courtyard the open air lounge the indoor dining room with the retractable roof the pool and bar area. Be warned though the pool water is pretty chilly but refreshing on shot day which most are in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Great welcome, authentic and very comfortable
Review_Text: There are already lots of great reviews of this hotel and we can endorse them all. But before we even arrived we were very taken with the website which reads like a guide book of Marrakech constantly updated by the owners who have devoted their careers to specialist tour operation. They realise the importance of a great welcome and some of the staff who deliver it have been part of the ‘family’ since the outset. The hotel itself is created from 7 riads re-constructed by local craftsmen with the added luxury of a pool (unique in this part of the medina). From the central courtyard bordered by the public areas of bar restaurant lounge etc there are passages to the bedrooms around a further 4 courtyards. It feels very exclusive and calm. The decor has been sourced locally personally by the owner and is extremely tasteful; every room is different and it’s all spotless. It's really lovely to return to a room that's been freshened up with rose petals always in a different design at the end of a hot day exploring. The whole place oozes 'care'. The food has been praised by others already so I can only echo what’s been said. You must try the hammam and massage too but don’t expect to do anything much with your day afterwards!    Outside the riad one is transported back in time - the medina is noisy colourful vibrant. The kasbah area is the posh end and the historical palaces are nearby. The central square Jemaa el Fna is about 10 minutes’ scary walk away but only scary the first time as you soon realise that the other road users are actually very skilful. We were there around the time of Eid - an important family festival which requires the slaughter of a ram in each home so for the first few days every second truck and moped (!) was carrying some poor unsuspecting creature. Very biblical.     It is worth taking a guide round the souks - it is so easy to get sucked into shops and feel pressurisedI to buying spices wooden objects carpets etc etc when you may have no idea of the quality. We just realised this at home using the  "35 spice mix" for a chicken dish to find it quite thin. The Ras el Hanout from Waitrose/Tesco same thing but with fresher spices  would have been much better. Of course we sniffed a very fragrant sample in the souk but were sold a ready packed version! This is the only negative comment however and has nothing to do with the hotel.    Our thanks go to Tom Fatima Nora Ilham Mounia Nawal Miriam and the others. We have a very happy memory of our stay with you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, great location - but lacked atmosphere
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in October. The hotel itself is very beautiful the pool area good-sized and the staff friendly and helpful (special mention to the receptionists here). The location is also perfect - close enough to the centre of the Medina to walk in the day and for evening dinner but far enough away to be quiet. There were however for my taste a few negatives. It may have been the time of year but the hotel's public areas such as the bar dining area and pool area seemed to lack atmosphere. I can't say what would improve this - maybe it was down to us guests to provide some buzz!? Because it was quiet there weren't always staff ready to serve when you needed them. Our room on the ground floor was a little small and the two twin beds had been pushed together to make a double. This would have been okay but they had to be pushed to a side wall and there was no room at the bottom of the bed - so whoever was on the wall-side had to clamber over the other person if they needed the loo in the night. All-in-all however I would have no qualms about staying here again. My one tip though is to try the street restaurants in the main square for food in the evenings - great food good price and a great buzz.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne F wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: The best personal service we have ever received
Review_Text: We only stayed two days in this 'little oasis' but the service food and location were perfect.  It was a birthday treat and when we returned to the room a message Joyeux Anniversaire (Happy Birthday) had been spelt out in rose petals on the bed. The receptionist Nora deserves a special mention. She was absolutely charming and nothing was too much bother for her. The restaurant staff (names unfortunately not remembered) were also wonderful.

So many good things have been said about this lovely property. We had two rooms for our family of 4. We were in a tower with just our rooms and the manager's residence. It was quiet the furnishings of high quality with a lovely outlook of a courtyard complete with flowers and fountain. The service is what set this apart from many of the places we have stayed around the world - it was impeccable. Nothing was too much trouble. Tailored meals for our picky young children - no problem. Breakfast in the wee hours of the morning before an early departure - no problem. Laundry done same day - no problem (and no extra charge). Spa services with short notice - no problem. Need a purchased shipped overseas - no problem.

What an amazing hotel - I literally don't have a single negative thing to say about the hotel!    There is a lot of hustle and bustle in the roads around the riad but once you walk through the door it's like you've entered a little oasis of calm! The receptionist showed us to a beautiful courtyard and offered us mint tea and pastries whilst our luggage was taken to our room.    Apart from the riad being beautiful clean calm etc.etc. the one thing that stood out for me were the staff. Without exception they were so incredibly happy helpful and kind - nothing was too much trouble. I would go so far as to say that the service we received there was the best I've ever had anywhere.    We ate in the restaurant a few times and the food was really tasty and breakfast was incredibly and I'm only sad that my stomach couldn't manage all the food I actually wanted to eat.    I would highly recommend this riad - you will not be disappointed. We didn't want to come home!

Review_Date: simon r wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Wonderful place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Hi Spent some time here wish it was longer as this is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. We were meet with a warm welcome with mint tea ans Moroccan pastry's which we enjoyed in the centre of the riad. The riads centre was set with the traditional water fountain and rose beds just setting there was so peaceful you dont here anything of the hussel and bussel that's going on just outside. The rooms are just fantastic. They are set out in the traditional Moroccan style with a bit more luxury thrown in for good measure. The pool area was very clean and was set with sun beds and tables. There was also a great pool side snack bar. The restaurant was set out in a court yard style. The food was lovely with a good range of French & Moroccan dishes. The was alot to chose from at breakfast as well in fact the best choice we have seen in all the places we have stayed at. We meet the owners during our stay they were just lovely warm friendly people who were dedicated to ensure your stay with them was memorable. In fact all the staff were great and very helpful. This place is a must i would encourage everyone just to pop on a plane to Marrakesh and stay here as its a great place to relax and recharge.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben W wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights recently at Les Borjs and I can safely say it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. There was a problem with our booking (caused by our agent not the hotel) but they went over and above to sort this upgrading us to a suite and giving us a free night - none of wehich they had to do. Our room/suite was beautiful the hotel is peaceful and secluded tucked in a street away from the madness of the medina. During our stay all of the staff we encountered were very helpful and so friendly we used the spa enjoyed the cookery class ate dinner here one night and lazed by the pool and the same team worked tirelssly to make our stay comfortable and enjpyable. I cannot praise this hotel highly enough and would reccomend to anyone who is planning to visit this amazing city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ruth H wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: The photo's match reality: well maintained & attractive. The staff are absolutely delightful: attentive without being intrusive responsive charming & helpful. The pool is quite small but clean & a Godsend in the heat the bar is good & well staffed. The rooms are clean well equipped & attractive. The only possible criticism is that due to the architecture with the doors fitted to the outside of the wall mine wasn't very sound proof but it is traditional and picturesque. Position: a good distance from the centre which means it is quiet. Food: Very good.    I hope mamon enjoys the roses :)    Ruth

Review_Date: L M Thomas wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: This 'riad' experience was priceless! There is nothing about going to a fantastical place and have even better accommodations. The women at the front desk are the sweetest and so delightful not to forget very resourceful.  With our arrival they seated us in the courtyard and served us Moroccan tea and cookies while we waiting for them to check us in and gather room keys! That was the best nothing like after a long travel resting out on a beautiful courtyard sitting in comfy and cushioned sofas to enjoying tea and cookies :-)    My room was so adorable. The sizing was perfect with closet space nice sized bathroom a/c unit and some really nice accessories in the room. I enjoyed the doors and of course the windows! I wish I could've bought some to bring home!    The ladies at the desk helped us arrange a guide and a tag-along guide as well also where ATMs were and the best places to get some awesome buys. The Riad was walking distance from many main things and elements of Morocco especially Jmaa el fma square the Jewish Quarter etc. You can easily find your way after getting lost a few times! lol    I had the pleasure of eating lunch and dinner and the dinner was the best Lamb tangine I experienced my whole trip! The tangia was splendid full of flavor and tender as it could be! I fell in love at first bite. I then decided to take their cooking class they offer and I am so glad I did. The chef was a pleasure learning with and we made him laugh dearly by trying to repeat his French for ingredients! We had a blast and learned so much. He taught us how to prepare lemon chicken tanginess milk pastille the moroccan salads french native tongues of Morocco how to prepare the Moroccan style tea and so much more!    The Hammam spa was an experience...I never been scrubbed like that in my life and I loved it! The steamy room calms you and you forget you are completely nude for the most part but believe it or not the roughness of scrubbing is enjoyable. The ladies was fun! We shared some laughs but I love to share laughs with people because I am a little silly :-)    I enjoyed my stay and would go back and stay a complete isolated day at the riad sharing time laying by the tranquil pool partake on a massage and scrub a few drinks at the bar surf the web out in the courtyard day-dream eat sleep eat walk around gather my thoughts and just embrace all that Les Borjs de la Kasbah has to offer and it's a little bit of heaven!  By the way if I have a daughter I will name here Miriam :-)

The hotel is in a fantastic location. You just walk outside and you are in the centre of the Medina. No need to get a taxi. The hotel staff are incredibly warm and friendly in fact it is the genuine hospitality of the staff which make this hotel so special. This was my fifth visit to Marrakech and I would definitely book this hotel again. The rooms were very spacious as were the bathrooms. We were given rooms for my daughters right next door to each other which was very convenient. One negative was that the bed was very hard for us but I think this is just a matter of personal preference. It was also great to have a decent sized pool in such a central location. I think it was good value for money and the breakfasts were also very good. A definite thumbs up.

Review_Date: Stacey M wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: I can't rate this hotel more highly. From the moment we set foot in there we were treated with such warmth and hospitality. The staff are wonderful especially Fatimah. It is in a brilliant location because it is away from the direct hustle and bustle of the Jamaa square yet only a 10 minute walk away from it all! Staying in the old city is also a really unique experience that I would recommend. We stayed in room 202 which is a suite. It was gorgeous. Not good for people who don't like steps as there are 3 steps leading up to the bed. Everyday there were fresh rose petals sprinkled on our bed and around the room. Totally gorgeous.    A slight smell of drains came from the bathroom in the late afternoon but this was completely understandable - it was 46 degrees when we went!    This is also one of the only hotels/riads that has an outdoor pool (as opposed to a plunge pool that is shaded). The pool has a handy sitting area around the shallow end so you can sit happily in the water to your hearts content.    Only thing I would say is that it took quite a long time to get our food when sitting around the pool. For example between 30 - 60 minutes. Actually if you take this into consideration and order in good time it is no problem at all. Just bare this in mind.    We attended the Moroccan evening which was fun - great food music and a belly dancer.    There is a spa on site that does not charge through the roof. I went twice because of this fact.    We happened to pop to Essaouira for a few nights and when we returned we had a day to spend back in Marrakech. The manager went over and above to help us out. Even though we had not paid to go back they offered us a room for the day at no extra cost and let us use the facilities as if we were guests again. Honestly it was fabulous and I would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Quite possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in. All the wonderful qualities of this hotel have already been posted so there is little to add. The walk to and from the sights of Marrakech can seem very long in 46 degree heat but you are soon revived by a dip in the pool and a cup of mint tea. The hotel is also well set for making a winter stay memorable. If you are looking for a hotel in Marrakech look no further.

An oasis of away from the craziness of Marrakech. Beautiful courtyard with fountain great pool - larger than most Riads IT facilities and lovely comfortable relaxing sofa areas Room was delightful and large and retaining all the traditional features that you would expect from a classic Moroccan Riad while containing all modern comforts including great bathrooms wonderful beds and air conditioning.  Situated centrally in the Kasbah close to the Royal Palace and within easy walking distance of all the main sites its in a lovely neighbourhood but within walking distance of Jma. The breakfasts were lovely and the staff delightful so eager to please. The one dinner i had from restaurant was one of the best meals I had in Marrakech. Will definitey go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What can I say about this hotel that hasn't already been said? The Staff are wonderful charming and helpful. The rooms are beautiful and the food superb.To have a lovely pool and on-site hamman is the icing on the cake. It's a haven of tranquility away from the non-stop activity of the medina and we loved every minute.In fact we are planning our next visit. You must stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Megan C wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is an oasis of calm amid the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Located near the edge of the medina it is easily accessible by car but close enough to be within walking distance of the medina's main sights.    We had a lovely comfortable room overlooking the courtyard. I spent several hours relaxing by the pool which was well attended by the snack bar staff. While we did not eat dinner at the riad but breakfast was excellent.    The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful.

We could not fault this Riad from the moment we arrived we were looked after. Upon our arrival at 20.30 we were given tea and Moroccan cookies we didn't want to venture the streets at this time to eat the staff suggested we share a dish as the cookies had filled us they served us in the comfortable lounge the food was delicious and then showed us our room.  This hotel has been expertly designed the rooms had everything you need in a bedroom good lighting ample storage space and the bathroom had light coming though the ceiling roof.  We found that after wondering the crazy city of Marrakech this was a perfect retreat the swimming pool was also very welcoming after a morning of hustle and bustle.  The breakfast was excellent lots of choice and nothing was too much trouble for the staff serving. Every member of staff had a smile and was willing to help at all times if returning to Marrakech I certainly would return here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: the very best hotel in Marrakech.
Review_Text: the very best customer service is always so unobtrusive that it is almost imperceptible. so it is with this most wonderful of Riad's.    The hotel itself is wonderful relaxing great rooms both public and private really wonderful food and a stunning Haman but it is the quality and care of the staff that marks this out as a world class hotel.    Everybody works together to deliver really exceptional customer service everyone always has a smile on their face and after the bustle and noise of Marrakech it truly is an oasis of calm.    i have stayed in many of the Worlds very best hotels but none of them have better service than this one.    if you going to Marrakech do not book anywhere else stay here!

My husband and I spent a wonderful 9 nights in Les Borjs. It makes you feel as if you were visiting friend's house in Marrakech. Location is great and safe. The place is designed and maintained with a lot of care. Comfortable beds in clean rooms add on the interesting traditional style architecture. Staff are there for you and you experience Moroccan hospitality first hand. Ask for anything you need help with i.e. transfers excursions prices.....  It allows you to step in and out of the 21st century at will.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a great place to return to after a busy day sightseeing in the craziness that is Marrakech! Our room was clean and an adequate size. There was a table and chairs just outside the door to relax in. The riad and rooms have some lovely architectural details that remind you that you are in Morocco (unlike some nondescript hotel rooms). Like most riads in Morocco it has lovely courtyards. The pool was a great way to escape the hot Moroccan sun and seemed clean. The breakfasts were satisfying and we also had dinner one night at the hotel and it was quite good. Moreover the staff were all friendly and professional.    The riad is about a twenty minute walk from Jemaa el fna square and all the attractions and restaurants that we wanted to go to. We never had to use a taxi while there so its location is convenient if you are okay with short walks.    We did have some slight issues with parking our rental car. At first someone on the street tried to convince us that we could not drive down the street the riad was on (not true) but we continued. The area the riad recommended was full but we found another place close to the hotel. It is a bit of a challenge driving and parking on the narrow streets but worth it to stay within the walled city.    I would definitely recommend staying here while in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The perfect base for exploring Marrakech
Review_Text: This small personal hotel offers every possibility for a perfect experience in Marrakech: cooking classes spa treatments restaurant and extremely helpful and friendly staff. The Riad is truly an oasis in the medina. With welcoming areas to sit read and relax the hotel is a great contrast to the rest of Marrakech. The staff of the hotel were exceptionally kind and helpful. I have no hesitations about recommending Le Borjs de la Kasbah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris O wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah in April 2013. It is an oasis of peace and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Beautiful courtyard with fountain library IT facilities and lovely comfortable sofa area which is great for relaxing with a good book after a hectic day sight seeing. Room was delightful - large with a seating area  TV and a huge well appointed bathroom. Also had a heater which made the room comfortable on chilly evenings. Buffet breakfast in the atrium was delightful - lots of choice and freshly cooked eggs and pancakes. We ate in the restaurant each evening - traditional Moroccan cuisine or Moroccan with a French twist -all delicious and good value. Had a excellent hamman and a massage in the spa. Staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Les Borjs is an easy 15-20 minute walk from the main square. Definitely a great place to stay.

Review_Title: Tranquil oasis in a hectic city
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakesh and hopefully will not be our last. The experience enhanced by the welcome to the lovely Riad set within the walls of the city.  We were collected from the airport by Abdul and whisked back to the Medina in 15 minutes where we were welcomed by Mohammed with a welcome glass of fresh fruit juice. After being shown round the Riad we were taken to our room (303). The room has a dual aspect looking out in to a courtyard on one side and the pool on the other. The bathroom had both a shower and bath and the basin and towels were decorated with rose petals – these were replaced daily. The bed was also covered in petals and each day a different design was left. Despite the fact that the bed was 2 large single mattresses pushed together with a double sheet over it was still very comfortable and no one disappeared down the gap!  On the first full day we took a walk around the city with a personal guide (Camil) – this was a wonderful way to see some of the sights and understand what we were looking at as our guide was very knowledgeable about the various historical sites he took us to. One note of caution – he did take us to a shop where it was almost expected we had to buy and to pay in cash – while the spices we bought I have enjoyed using it was not clear if we could have had a better deal elsewhere. This did leave us without any cash as we walked through the medina but I think my partner was secretly pleased I could not buy everything I saw. We did eventually have to go to a cash point and at this point it was useful to have the guide as he pointed out that some cash points are not as safe as others!  Another day we took a drive out to the Atlas mountains – the only problem was that I had not taken any walking shoes and my sandals were woefully inadequate for the trek up the mountain so we had to stay at the bottom – not a bad thing as we sampled the local tea and watched the local life in the village. There were plenty of hawkers trying to sell you anything even though we had no cash. On the way up we had stopped at a Berbers house and were shown around and even offered to have some to the bread that had been freshly made We had also stopped at a local cooperative where the ladies of the village sat and cracked the nuts of the argen tree to make the oil that is used in many different ways. On the way back we stopped at a pottery where there were thousands of pots of all shapes and sizes and colours.  On the last day we took a horse drawn carriage ride around the city – what an experience in the Marrakesh traffic! We went to see the gardens that Yves St Laurent restored – defiantly worth a visit. The driver dropped us at the door and waited for us to return. He then took us on a tour of the city very nice to see it from a different angle.  Breakfast & Dinner in the hotel is in an open air courtyard with a room to one side (just in case of rain) however we discovered that this courtyard did have a roof that was slid over – just as well as one night the heavens opened and a spectacular thunderstorm hit Marrakesh. The food was lovely and a good selection of local and European dishes were on offer. It was my birthday on one night and after dinner a cake had been arranged and all the kitchen staff came out and sang to me! Another night there was some local entertainment music and dancing – the belly dancer was mesmerising to all! There was also a girl who was henna tattooing during dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After looking online at several smaller riads I chose Les Borjs de la Kasbah because I wanted a riad in the medina. As a woman traveling with two other women I also wanted to have hotel services such as a bar and restaurant.    Les Borjs is absolutely beautiful -- even better than the website -- with wonderful service. The staff made arrangements for day trips to the Ourika Valley and Essaouria a half-day guide in the medina and last-minute manicures and pedicures in the hotel's peaceful spa. The hotel bar serves an excellent Moroccan rose.    My only quibble was with the hotel's restaurant recommendations. On two separate occassions we asked for suggestions for dinner. Both times we were directed to Al Baraka in the Djemma el Fna. When I heard the location the first time and that there was belly dancing I asked for another recommendation but was told that other guests liked it because of the belly dancing. Then on our last night we asked the woman at the front desk who wasn't the same one as earlier in the week for a nearby restaurant. We said we had an early flight and wanted a casual dinner. Once again we were directed to Al Baraka. Fortunately another guest recommended the Kasbah Cafe which was less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel.

The entrance is in a cement wall in an unprepossessing street. Once inside though the place is a Tardis-like revelation. There are large rooms a peaceful central courtyard with a fountain tables and nooks with sofas.    The restaurant also in an atrium has a retractable roof three storeys above. Breakfast is half buffet (fruit pastries the usual stuff) and half cooked to order (omelettes pancakes eggs as you want them). Dinner was also good typical Moroccan food.    Our room was large very clean and very quiet. There were rose petals artistically scattered on the huge four-poster bed. The bathroom had a bath and separate shower. There was a comfortable sofa and a TV which had all the main UK channels not just BBC News.    There's a decent-sized swimming pool which gets sun for most of the day despite being in a walled garden.    The staff were friendly charming and attentive. Some spoke a little English (as well as French and Arabic); one Tom is English and very helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at "Les Borjs" in February 2013 three couples and one couple took their 12 year old son. My husband and I have stayed before for the others it was a first trip to Marrakech. Yet again the Borjs de las Kasbah was everything a riad should be an oasis of calm in a hectic city. The staff are unfailingly courteous and helpful special mention to Tom and our lovely waitresses at breakfast and dinner who went out of their way to make my 12 year old nephew feel at home...he quickly got used to their good natured teasing and he said it made him start every day with a smile. The food as always was first class the bedrooms spacious and well appointed and the airport transfers and trips organised by the Riad went like clockwork...The half day city walking tour is a good way to start a trip to this city you get a sense of the history and geography and how life is and was lived and because you have a guide there is no hassle from stallholders etc. The trip to the Atlas mountains was a joy walking in the snow with the sun hot enough to warrant factor 25. Several of our party hadnt holidayed outside Europe before they are all hooked and looking forward to their next trip and every one of them has said they wouldnt stay anywhere else other than Les Borjs de la Kasbah.

Review_Title: Fabulous Hotel in a Beautiful City
Review_Text: We are a group of 40-something women who have just returned from a 4 day trip to Marrakech (March 2013)' One had a birthday the day we arrived and another during the stay.    We picked Les Borjs de la Kasbah after reading extensive reviews on Tripadvisor of various Riads available and couldn't fault it. Before arriving there was some email correspondence which was always answered within 24 hours efficiently and courteously. The hotel arranged for a taxi to collect us from the airport. Not a long trip but the taxi can drop you directly outside the hotel which makes life a lot easier!! It worked out at 15 euros per room so 7.50e each which seemed comparable to the prices at the airport and a lot more efficient.    The hotel is beautiful as you can see from the photos already posted. We were in room 206 - a double with really nice bathroom sitting area tv (never switched on but I believe they have all the cable channels!!) fridge etc. There is an enclosed terrace outside 205 and 206 with sliding windows overlooking the breakfast area and a small table and chairs outside the room. perfect for sitting and having a drink (or a cigarette!!!)The whole roof of the breakfast area slides back 'a la Wimbledon' which is lovely!!    The courtyards are beautifully kept with a library area (book exchange) tv room comfy area with couches and cushions. This is also the best place to get a strong wi-fi signal. The pool area is perfect. Heated pool that is a decent enough size to swim in lots of sunbeds and umbrellas. No stress no grabbing of sunbeds - just peace and quiet :-)    The staff could not do enough to help. Always smiling and helpful nothing was too much trouble for them. The birthday girls received 'Happy Birthday' cards and their names spelled out in flowers on their beds!!! The rooms were kept immaculately as were all areas of the hotel.    Breakfast was a real treat. Lots of choice; eggs cooked to order wonderful pastries moroccan breads fresh fruit cereals cheeses etc. I don't think anyone could fault the choice. We also ate there one evening and again the food was fabulous and exceptionally good value.    All in all the hotel was a joy to stay at and I would certainly go back there again.    Boring bits but may be useful!!! Rooms have a safe deposit box with a key. Hairdryers are in the bathrooms quite powerful but no styling nozzles if you need one!! No kettles in room (we took a travel kettle which was perfect for early cups of tea on the terrace - how terribly British!!). Brilliant showers and constant hot water and pressure. Towels and bathrobes provided. Didn't have any problems with mozzies or flies. Easy straightforward walk to the main square (about 15-20 minutes saunter). 2 minutes to the Tombs. Bombarded by every stall-keeper and shop owner you pass. A smile and some patience goes a long way :-). We did get fed up with people trying to show us the way to places (and expecting payment) so had to be quite firm in our 'No's' !! Money changing is easy. We tended to use the exchange at the Government Department store with the big stone lions outside on the way to the square. The rates didnt vary enough for us to need to hunt around. This shop is expensive but hassle-free so a good place to look at the sort of things you might want to haggle for in the souks!!    A beautiful city that requires a lot of walking but is worth every step. I think 4 days is enough for Marrakech - if I had been staying longer I would have wanted to visit the mountains or the coast. Places we enjoyed: tombs Jardin Majorelle Tanneries Dyers Souk Spice Souk (jewish quarter) Maison de la Photographie sunset over the square on a rooftop terrace. Dinner on the roof at Cafe Kasbah. The beautiful architecture and just ambling around getting constantly lost!!

Review_Date: Geraldine M wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: A Wonderful Oasis in an Amazing City
Review_Text: I stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah with my sister and 2 female friends for 3 nights from 28th June 2012. It really is a lovely place. The rooms are huge beautifully decorated and wonderfully clean. The pool area is fabulous - a real oasis in the heart of the Kasbah. Lunch by the poolside was great and after the first day the staff set 'our' table for us right by the poolside. The staff are very friendly and were only too happy to help out with ordering taxi's and recommending places to visit. Breakfast was plentiful and the dinning room in a lovely setting. I didn't try the spa but my sister and friends all had a massage and said it was very good. Marrakech is an amazing city - vibrant and lively and full of contrasts. The hotel is not in the best of areas but please don't let this put you off - I'll definitely return to this wonderful place - one of the best places I have ever stayed.

Just returned from yet another relaxing stay at Les Borjs. It's like being home from home for me after coming here many times since January 2011 so I can vouch for the other reviews in excellence. I am over 65 and travel to different countries every 2 months mostly combining business with leisure. On one occasion I hadn't booked ahead so swiftly and Les Borjs was full so I stayed at the newly revamped famous landmark 4* Design Hotel in Gueliz 4* La Renaissance ( #236 of 437 Hotels in Marrakech). Much more expensive soulless and certainly not the kind of personal service I had got used too staying in the 4* Les Borj de la Kasbah (#76 of 437 Hotels in Marrakech). I soon learnt to book ahead.    The difference between this family owned boutique hotel in the Kasbah and a swanky corporate like La Renaissance is the love and detail that dwells within at Les Borjs. Tom Jihane ( the lady in the office ) Sofia the attentive maid and Hassna in the Spa rooms are just examples of care toward me pampering and devotion to the craft of service. Nothing is too much. Sometimes I would work in Casablanca for 10 days topping and tailing work with a 4 day Les Borjs relaxation stay either side which proved invaluable as did being able to leave small bits of shopping and luggage behind saving me lugging it all the way to Casa and back. This is high personal service. Incidentally I don't speak french and on more than one occasion Reception organised train tickets for me or written details down on paper for me to hand into the ticket office. I tried this at La Renaissance Reception and got blank looks. Nothing is too much trouble at Les Borjs.    A recent addition to Les Borjs is updated cable TV prior to this visit BBC World on a loop was the only English option while now you can get all UK terrestrial Channels( plus European networks ) great if you plan a long visit and want a night in. I'm not really a 'pool person' but the laid back serenity of the open air pool is exactly what is required somedays reading a book and for me a plus - an almost child free zone. Only seen one child on all my 10 visits to Les Borjs larger 'family' hotels inevitably have a more vibrant pool area which I am inclined to avoid.    I aways book half board upfront not just for it's outstanding value but simply because I have never had a bad meal in 10 visits. Not one. Stylish beautifully presented clean wholesome Moroccan/French/ with an Asian fusion dinner menu. Restaurants in London charge more than double for less. Service is exemplary and the breakfast buffet is a feast of invention difficult to know where to start the choice is huge but I always go for the homemade yogurt first with the good coffee and the sweetest freshest orange juice to follow then I start eating as the stomach takes me. You won't fail to be impressed by Naoual & Fatima in the Restaurant & Bar long term employees and always welcoming made my stay as a single person not feel out of place with the couples at table and never made to feel "alone' in a restaurant. As I said FAULTLESS and my moroccan home from home. See you again this year Les Borjs!

Review_Date: Maggie F wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: We stayed in Les Borjs de la Kasbah for a week and loved it. The staff were lovely particularly on reception the rooms and all other areas were really well decorated and very well kept. Breakfast was good and when we chose not to go out in the evening the standard of evening meals was also very good. There was about a 15 minute walk to the main square in the old town but apart from having to stay aware of the numerous mopeds it was fine. Staying there was very relaxed and friendly and when we left we were even waved off at the door by the owner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can but only agree with all the other reviews given here. This place is wonderful and without fault the staff do their utmost to make you feel welcome and happy - from the welcome mint tea (delicious) and moroccan biscuits on arrival to the amazing breakfasts each morning (yes the avocado smoothie really is as good as Rosemary described) and the lovely - well priced - Moroccan dinner which we had one evening.  Not forgetting the lovely salad lunch in the main courtyard we had on our last day.  The rooms are individually designed with each and all opening out onto beautiful courtyards.  The pool and Spa/Hamman area is tranquil - pool is heated too!  Special mention to Darek who actually went out of his way to buy us a Supratours coach ticket as we mentioned one day that we had to go across to the station in the new town to buy it to go to Essaouira after our time in Marrakech - he just said leave it to me and we only found out afterwards that he actually went to get it personally - and he asked for no commission either - just the face value.  He also organised a great daytrip for the two of us and another solo traveller in the hotel's minibus up to the Ourika Valley to see the waterfalls at Setti Fatma. The driver was a great tour guide giving lots of tips and stopping at the places we wanted to go to.  You sensed that this level of service is the norm here.  There is nothing not to love here (unless your idea of a good holiday is to stay in your room on t'internet and you find that the hotel wifi doesn't extend to the rooms - which would not be my idea of a holiday but I guess it is for some people?) As it happens there is a free to use PC in one of the rooms off the main courtyard for essential net and email use - more than good enough for us.  One tip don't take any notice of scroungers outside and on the walk up to the tourist areas (and everywhere else in Marrakech too) - they will try to tell you that the road ahead is "closed". its a ploy to ask you for money when they have you all alone or to direct you subltly to their mate's spice/slipper/etc shop- even the ones who engage you with that old classic: "I am a university lecturer and i was lucky to meet your lovely Queen when i was at a reception held by our crown prince". the whole idea is to get you somewhere a little quiet before requesting in sinister tones for some money to buy milk for "my newly born twins who's mother cannot lactate". As anyone who's been to Marrakech before will attest It's virtually impossible not to fall for someone's story at some time. the best insurance is just not to have a 100dirham note as your smallest change - just make sure you have a few 5 dirham coins in your pocket to quickly hand over and scarper quickly - and put it down to experience and enjoy laughing about it when you tell the tale later (as i am doing now!)  Would I stay here again? Yes Yes Yes
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a beautiful tranquil haven situated in the heart of the Marrakesh old town right next to the Royal Palace. The rooms are spacious and cool with excellent en suite bathrooms. Wonderful selection at breakfast heated swimming pool fabulous service. There's nothing not to love about this place. Go.

My wife and I stayed here 3 nights in late Feb. Hotel and room were immaculate. Staff very helpful kind and friendly. Breakfast was good a bit disorganised but in a laid back kind of way. Pool and patio areas gave space and peace.... I imagine the pool must come as a welcome cooling off place in the hotter weather.    Marrakech was a bit of culture shock for us. The hotel is in a cobbled street full of workshops and shops for the locals it is slightly off the beaten track yet still inside the city walls. It took a bit of getting used to but once you know your way round the kasbah area and up towards Jemma n Fnaa square is great for exploring by foot. But a taxi can stop outside the hotel as well if you feel too tired to walk to one of the sights. So all in all the location is fine.    It is a 5 min walk to the Saadian tombs and the nearby mosque. There is a nice rooftop cafe there..the Kasbah cafe..which we can recommend.. For one evening meal we went to Pepe Nero which was excellent..... and we enjoyed the meal and belly dancing show at Le Salama restaurant (near Jemma n Fnaa..be there by 9pm for a nice 15 min show).    Thanks to all the staff at les Borjs...and for our anniversary surprise... much appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a heavenly place to stay. I went recently feeling very tired and as soon as I stepped through the doors I felt revived. The staff were very kind and the lovely building a delight to be in - the open central courtyard very calming. Food very good particularly the breakfasts - avocado smoothie mmmm. Also a hammam and excellent masseuse. The situation in the Kasbah area is perfect. The hotel arranged for a walking tour of the Medina with a guide on my first day and a visit to the Atlas Mountains which was inspiring. I would love to return. Thank you!

A lovely well run organisation just outside of the centre of Marrakech old city but within easy walking distance of all the visitor attractions.    I really like the rooms with their comfortable beds and typical local decor which is in keeping with the style of the riad.    Having stayed here on numerous occasions i have only praise for this hotel the accommodation and the food. One point to note is that the food has a wide appeal being cooked with a Moroccan influence but taking styles and flavours from many continents.

Review_Date: Janet W wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the middle of mad Marrakech
Review_Text: Les Borjs is a beautiful building whose architecture is that of an old rich man's house in the centre of Marrakech. All thge staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the foot massage I had in the spa was wonderful!    Breakfast was fantastic - especially the choice of local pancakes!! My only criticism would be that one out of the two meals we ate at the hotel was of apoor standard but when this was pointed out I was only charged half price for the whole meal.

Review_Date: Linda M wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We loved the design and decor of this beautifully converted riad. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and the food excellent. Lots of plants shade or sun and a great pool area. We went in mid-February and it was warm and sunny. A good place to stay in Marrakech within easy walking distance of all the sights and fun of the city. Not to be missed. Linda & Ronald Bedford UK
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: penny N wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We have just returned from 4 nights in this lovely Riad and I heartily recommend it. Our room was large clean and had a huge comfy bed and very spaceous bathroom. The pool area is a really nice addition and the staff are so friendly and welcoming. Both my partner and I have travelled pretty extensively and I can honestly say that we were charmed and delighted by both Les Borjs de la Kasbah and by Marrakech itself and would recommend the location and this Riad for a romantic long weekend of winter sun and relaxation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superb Hotel de Charme in the heart of the Kasbah
Review_Text: My wife and I visited Borjs de la Kasbah for 3 nights to celebrate her birthday after making a last minute booking with Expedia. The reviews here on Tripadvisor helped me to choose and I have to say I was in no way disappointed by this excellent and charming small hotel.    We arranged for the hotel to pick us up from the Airport (for a price of 15 euros) and we were taken right to the door of the hotel which is in the Kasbah area of the Medina (the old town). The outside is very unimpressive but once you step through the doors off the noisy street you enter an oasis of charm and calm. We were greeted by friendly staff who invited us to have some mint tea in the courtyard whilst we waited for our room to be prepared. The courtyard is beautiful and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly.    We were then shown around the hotel and then taken to our room. We had booked a suite and arrived at room 202 which has a private balcony which overlooks the outdoor restaurant area. The room itself was excellent. Sofa chairs satellite TV minibar then up a level to the bed and a great en-suite with bath and shower. There were flower petals on the bed and spread around the bathroom. There was a bowl of fruit and complimentary water. The room was very clean and very comfortable. Very quiet at night and complete with heating which is useful as it can get a little chilly at night in January (even though daytime temperatures were 28C).    The hotel has a lovely heated outdoor pool and a spa (which sadly we did not get around to using so cannot comment).    The hotel also has beautiful outdoor areas in Moroccan style. There is an internet area and you can pick up wifi in most of downstairs area including the restaurant - but not in the rooms.    There is also a bar which you often will not get in a Riad - so an added bonus.    Breakfast was great with a choice of fruits cereals bread homemade yoghurt. You could also have eggs omelettes etc and a selection of Morrocan pancakes cooked to order.    We did eat in the restaurant twice. Even though the food was very good I would say that this was the weakest aspect of the hotel as it was not up to the standard that the website had led us to believe. However the service was good and the environment was lovely.    From the hotel you can walk to the Jemaa el Fna square within about 10 minutes. This is a very safe walk (as long as you don't get run over by a moped). If you are feeling adventurous you can also get there via the maze of small passageways of the Kasbah by just entering the passage directly opposite the hotel. So the position of the hotel is ideal - you are in a quiet corner of the Medina but within an easy reach of all the action.    The staff were always very helpful throughout. Always available to answer any questions. All spoke good English.    If I ever go back to Marrakech I would definitely go straight back to the Borjs del le Kasbah as I do not believe you could do much better.    Highly Recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosane W wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: I went to this hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my 50th birthday and was not disappointed. We stayed in a suite which was lovely spacious and very luxurious. There was a bowl of fruits in the room on arrival. I slept very well even though the hotel is in the Kasbah area as there was no noise at all coming from outside. The hotel is very tastefully designed which made me feel very relaxed after spending a day walking around the Medina. The staff very very nice and very attentive to our needs. I would definitely return to this hotel if I ever go back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tatiana v wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah - oasis of charm in Marrakesh
Review_Text: We spent 3 nights in this charming small hotel and were very happy there. Set back from the street with the pretty garden inside the whole place feels like an oasis. Beautiful orange trees flowers and small fontain in the middle put you in a different place from the Marrakesh streets outside. After a hard and hot day in Medina you can dip yourself in the swimming pool or relax in hammam with massage and spa. Everything is made here with love -- from style rooms and comfortable bathrooms till soft sofas in the garden where we sat looking through our photos of the day. The food in the retaurant is exellent ; breackfast and a la carte .You can try not only delicious Moroccan food - lamb tadjin is very good - but european as well. Every timereturning to hotel from our excursions we felt as if we were coming home so pleasant was our staying here. I can highly recommend this peaceful hotel de charme for those who understand how important is the right choise of the oasis in Africa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julian Davies wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Fantastic service in a truly lovely hotel - recommended highly. Really nothing to complain about at all. Have stayed in many different places and now know this is without a doubt This is the best place to stay in Marrakech! Can't wait to go back there.

Review_Date: Brian C wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is a real find. It combines Moroccan authenticity with every modern comfort. We’ve stayed here three times now and would gladly come back. The unassuming entrance belies the elegant courtyards the feeling of quiet and space where you can relax under orange trees and escape the hustle and noise of the city. It’s located within the walled city and the transfer from the airport takes only 15 minutes. The staff made us welcome at once and were attentive throughout our stay. We found the dining experience very good not too expensive and the menu changes each day. You won’t get your full English here but with home-made breads and yoghurt and pancakes and eggs cooked to order you won’t go hungry at breakfast. The rooms are spacious and attractively furnished and the beds extremely comfortable. We loved the fact that the owners only employed a Marrakech architect and local craftsmen to build this hotel handcrafting all the lovely decoration using traditional methods. This riad is a jewel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pearl M wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We have just returned from 5 days in this Riad and have thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The bedroom was beautifully furnished in typical Moroccan style and very comfortable. The breakfasts were delicious with a good choice as were the evening meals. The staff could not have been more helpful and we would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Clive F wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: Do not expect some European marble palace deposited out of context in the middle of the Kasbah instead you will find an imaginative blend of Moroccan architecture and French elegance entirely in sympathy with its surroundings.  The cuisine too provides an excellent choice of both local and European dishes.  This riad was formerly several different dwellings so each bedroom is unique . Ours was beautiful overlooking an inner courtyard typical of Moroccan buildings. It had all the usual extras that people seem to expect these days! I would have been perfectly happy without them but my wife disagrees. Ah well!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sally S wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: Eight of us just spent 3 nights at the Borjs to celebrate a 50th Birthday. The staff could not have been more helpful from booking through to the time of our stay. They put on a party for us for the 50th along with singers a belly dancer and a fantastic cake. All the staff were courteous funny and helpful.    We had a premium room which had everything we needed even british TV channels if required. The bathroom was fine with an adequate shower and toiletries along with lovely towels.    We all ate in the large part of the dining room which had 3 patio heaters in. We were never cold in that part of the dining nor the breakfast room. Cant see how previous reviewer sat around breakfast buffet as this was laid in the corner of the smaller dining room. We were not cold in the bar area which had heaters on the wall.    We enjoyed the food although there is not a lot of choice. 2 choices for each course. The tagines were excellent. The food for the party was not as good as the other nights. We felt there was adequate choice for breakfast with fresh juice fruit cereals yoghurts bread croissants etc and you could have pancakes as well as cooked eggs. Make sure you ask for the egg choices as they dont ask you. We were asked on the first morning but not again.    The transfer was very quick at 15 minutes from the airport although we were unaware that you are charged 400 (£28 ish) dirhams to back to the airport. Only the pick up is included in the room rate. It is cheaper to get a taxi which is around 80/100 I believe. It was a 15 minute easy walk to the Souks and main square. We would not hesitate to recommend the Borjs. It was nice to be in a small hotel where all the staff knew you rather than in one of the large impersonal hotels located on the outskirts of the city.

Review_Title: Look no further...a great place to stay!
Review_Text: Extraordinary service. Attentive yet relaxed staff. Good location at the right distance from the wonderful madness of the Marrakech medina. Can't-beat off-season rates. This place is worthy of all the praise...

Review_Title: Not bad but not as good as reviews?? Be warned!
Review_Text: I have to question how some hotels receive their reviews. This Riad is well placed for most of the souks main square and main sights. However the walking is done amongst cars vans motor bikes cycles and even horse drawn carriages using the same narrow confined space. It is an area totally unsuitable for anyone with any mobility difficulties at all in view of the uneven street without pavements with many obstructions. Just to make it worse there is the intense traffic pollution and none stop harassment to contend with.  The Riad itself is quite beautiful if a little basic. The staff are very friendly and helpful but some are a little inexperienced. The breakfast is not particularly good and the dinner is only average and not particularly cheap. Eating out is a much better option for those able to venture out.  Be warned... we stayed in early December and our first three days were very cold no more than 13C by day dropping to 2C at night. This meant that there was nowhere in the Riad where it was warm enough to sit except our room which did have a large fan heater.  We were very surprised that we were not told that the pool and the area around it was to be closed for repair. I found out by accident and did request a discount or upgrade which was given. However this was not adequate compensation for having nowhere at all on the premises to sit in the sun which was the only way to get warm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yvonne C wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: Amazing Riad located within the walled city and easy access to the Souks etc
Review_Text: I recently stayed at this wonderful Riad with my grown up daughter and this Riad was the best part of our stay in Marrakech.    Its a lovely traditional classic Moroccan Riad beautifully designed situated centrally in the Kasbah close to the Royal Palace and within easy access of all the Souks etc.    I had an offer of four nights for the price of three which was half board so we had all our evening meals at the Riad. The food was reasonable in price and excellent I have to say. There is nothing not to like about this Riad with the exception of it would have been nice to have had tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. I asked for room 303 when making the booking and they were really kind in giving me this room. There was a lovely courtyard with a water fountain in the middle plus a swimming pool at the rear f the property.
