The only slight thing that happened which was more annoying than anything was on the last night when washing my hair in the shower the water stopped. I went down to the reception to be told it would be back on again shortly. It only happened the once but by the time that the water came on again I had managed to get chilled (the weather was quite chilly in the evenings) and needless to say I came back home to the UK with a stinking cold.    The staff were extremely helpful and polite at all times. They used to put flower petals on your bed and sink every day.    Unfortunately the weather was really mixed during our stay. I had a couple of days where I sat by the pool for a short while when the sun did actually decide to come out. Generally the weather was quite chilly at times it was grey and cloudy then pouring with rain on our last day.    During our stay we used to walk up to the Souks most days and also went round the Royal Palace. You would see the snake charmers and the monkeys in the square. We used the taxi service through the Riad to be collected from the airport and then again going back to the airport.    If I ever decide to go back to Marrakech I would most certainly stay at this lovely Riad again.

In a beautiful city this really is an amazing hotel. It is located within the walled city and is within walking distance of the souks and the main sights. The staff is exceptionally helpful and the excursions organised by the hotel are well worth it as the guides are knowledgeable and friendly. There are no great restaurants nearby but this is not a problem as the dinners in the hotel restaurant are great - there is a nice selection of Moroccan dishes and wines and the set menu changes every day. Also do not miss the hammam - a truly rejuvenating experience. All in all a fantastic riad would definitely stay here again!

Review_Date: Kris G wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: Very comfortable place to stay feels like a new hotel but has all the style of a traditional riad. Hotel itself is very beautifully designed. Everything in the guest room is new and well maintained. Staff puts flower petals on your bed and sink every day :) most staff spoke English well and were very helpful! They called a shuttle for me back to the airport among many other things. You can eat meals here if you dont feel comfortable out in the medina.    downpoints: no wifi in room had to go to lounge/patio/internet room to get it which was inconvenient late at night when planning what to do the next day. maybe the wifi signal doesnt travel well through the thick riad walls?    Also the riad is located in the far south of the medina so it was a bit of a trek up the Rue de la Kasbah to get to the main square Jemaa Al-Fna and the narrow Rue de la Kasbah tends to be clogged with mopeds/scooters spewing foul exhaust that you constantly have to watch out for. I suppose it is typical of the crowded medina area though.

Review_Date: Peter N wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: The Borjs is a wonderful gem retaining all the traditional features that you would expect from a classic Moroccan Riad while containing all the comforts that western life expects including great bathrooms wonderful beds and airconditioning.  Situated centrally in the Kasbah close to the Royal Palace and within easy walking distance of all the main sites it also offers wonderful tranquility from the buzzle outside. In fact - you would not know that there is an outside world once inside.  What really completes the Borjs is the people there. The staff will be some of the gentlest and most helpful people that you will ever met always greating you with a smile while taking great pride in who they are and happy to assist in all ways with kindness and humour.    The Borjs and its people will without a doubt be one of your most endearing memories of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sue B wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: Lovely place located in the Medina in the Kasbah area
Review_Text: Great place lovely room we had a suite on the first floor which was beautiful lovely huge 4 poster bed seperate bathroom with a shower and bath. Pool area was lovely we didnt go in the pool as it was in the shade so not warm enough due to the time of year but the sun beds were in the sun for a couple of hours. Food was lovely we are there 1 night and breakfast was good. The only complaint which is why I gice an overall 3 was the hotel allowed a film crew to stay and they should have closed the hotel to other guests because they took over everywhere even the restaurant not allowing the other guests of the hotel to eat in the main area we were all sat in the side areas so could not see the traditional musicians and they even told them to turn down their singing and instruments so they could talk!! There was a seperate conference room they could have made them use if thats what they wanted to do! They were constantly talking loudly mobiles ringing all the time and generally noisy which is not what we went to the Riad for in fact the riad actually stated in its brochure that this sort of behaviour was not acceptable. It is a place to get away from work and mobiles so we were very disapointed. We would not have expected the hotel to turn away this big business but they should have insisted they hire the whole riad. One morning they were shouting and mobiles ringing at 5.30am !!! Just ignorant and a complete lack of care for other people. A great shame as the day before they arrived it was a perfect oasis of tranquility.

Chef Hosain assisted by Maryam shared their spotlessly clean hotel kitchen with us for a morning. The class was partly hands-on partly demo with recipes & detailed instruction (in English) being provided. We made Chicken Pastilla 7-Vegetable Couscous & Cornes de Gazelle (dainty almond pastries) & were shown the finer points of making mint tea. A lot of the weighing & preparing of ingredients had been done in advance for us AND we didn't have to wash up - just eat the delicious meal we'd cooked!  We booked on the internet before we left the UK & at the same time chose which of the 3 menus on offer we'd like to cook.The cost was 400Drh each (half payable in advance) the rest after we'd eaten the meal which was beautifully served to us at a table beside the swimming pool.  We weren't staying at the hotel but it looked very attractive with several lovely courtyards. All the staff we met were exceptionally friendly & smiling & spoke good English.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Successfully mixes a riad with a hotel
Review_Text: It's in good area which has many features you'd get in a hotel but with the charm of a riad.    Sadly my room was very small - however it was adequate for my needs. The bathroom was made more than just functional thanks to a sink unit made from a beautiful piece of marble. Water pressure and temperature were perfect - unusual for riads in my experience. The courtyard was pretty and the swimming pool and bar made it have a boutique hotel feel - most riads will not have these facilities. My room also had a mini bar and breakfast cold be brought to the room.    The place had really friendly staff all of whom spoke good levels of English. They were a good example of how decent staff can make a good place great.    Breakfast was fine not amazing but good for the price. I ate once at the restaurant - decent if limited menu options. However the food was delicious - have the chocolate dessert - it is staggeringly good and you are on holiday..    I can see why many people especially those new to Marrakech would love the place. An orange tree grows by the pool - those in the room on the first floor could probably reach out and pick them off the tree. The courtyard is airy and surrounded by lounges ideal for chilling out.    My room was able to pick up the wifi in the communal area - to me wifi is as important in hotels as water and electricity so hopefully this will be hotel-wide soon.    The location is fine - about 15 mins to the centre but there is a kiosk just outside selling water and snacks if you need some essentials. One slight disappointment was to be told that there was a car park when i was emailing the hotel before my trip only to find that this meant the street. It's a tiny narrow street and leaving it there is a risk due to the commotion you get in every Marrakech street. I was told by one of the locals that he would deliberately damage my car because I was parking it outside the hotel rather than at the end of the street where there was one of the hundreds of parking attendants you see in the town. I don't know if the car was damaged because it had so many dints and scratches anyway (the guy from Avis said to me 'everywhere' when we looked round the car for scratches and dints when I picked it up).    There is a noticeboard in the hotel which shows it under construction five years ago. To see the pile of rubble and a donkey where there is now a swimming pool and sun loungers shows what an achievement this place is. People who have had the vision to make places like this have transformed Marrakech and restored many riads to their former glory.

Review_Title: Open the door and take a step inside
Review_Text: 13th October to 17th October 2012  The first of three hotels we stayed at during our holiday in Morocco Les Borjs de Kasbah is located just inside of the city wall in the south of Marrakech. This unimposing Hotel is like a pomegranate sold on one of the local fruit stalls nothing special to look at from the outside but open it up and take a peep inside and it’s full of little jewels. The staff were helpful welcoming and considerate but without being intrusive and our generously sized bedroom had plenty of storage space free safe was very clean and tidy and a couple of richly coloured local carpets added to the welcoming warmth of the room which was topped off with bath robes and the largest fluffy bath towels.  Fresh pancakes and eggs cooked to order any which way made a for a classic start to the day setting us up for a stroll along Rue de La Kasbah to the sights and sounds of Jemaa el fna. After more than a spot of shopping in the souks snake charmers and the maelstrom of the streets it’s worth getting back to Les Borjs de Kasbah early to spend a couple of hours around the pools relaxing in the sanctuary of the riad.  Marrakech is brimming with places to eat so we only had one evening meal at the hotel and although this didn’t quite match the timbre of the rest of our stay I’ve no hesitation in recommending Les Borjs de Kasbah as a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was by sheer luck that we found this hotel! Due to its small size we came across the same company several times per day. What started as a "hi" in the breakfast room turned into delightful companions for dinners shopping and trips to nearby towns. Our sons hit off and now my son's friend is visiting us from the UK. The waitress in the breakfast room was really helpful and a delight. The rooms are immaculately cleaned each day. Thank you!

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in a turbulent city
Review_Text: What happened to us was unforgettable in every way.  An extremely kind staff beautiful setting lovely rooms and calm relaxing 'lounges'.  Breakfast was a nice combination of the traditional continental ingredients and typical Morrocan flavours and dishes.  We had dinner once in this nice Riad and this also pleased us a lot.  Rooms well cleaned every day and lovely bed decorations with flower petals.  The Riad is situated in the southern area of the Medina but it's a nice walk to the big square Djeem El Fna. Just take the 20 minutes walk and enjoy being submerged in more and more crowded streets to end up on the square.  I would advise to take a taxi home after midnight. It won't burn your money.  As I heard from other guests staying in the Riad the Haman and the Pool should have been really good too.  We slept really good though the beds are slighty hard.  I hope for you you'll have the opportunity to go there once!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I loved Les Borjs de la Kasbah. So relaxing and peaceful!! Beautiful rooms and gorgeous swimming pool. I really loved it.The bathroom was clean and gorgeous. The sheets and covers and pillows were amazing. love. love. love.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Annette F wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: We spent a week in Les Borjs and cannot fault this hotel. Calming peaceful and cool. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and very comfortable. The pool area was an oasis in a very hot city of 49 degrees C. Because it is a small hotel we got to know all the guests who were so friendly. The hammam was unbelievable never experienced anything like it. The massage the next day was just as good. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It made our wonderful stay in Marrakesh even better.

Review_Date: Kate S wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Every aspect of this hotel was magnificent! From the welcome drink to the calm and comfortable room the friendly staff in the hotel and the restaurant the lovely pool the cleanliness and.....the hammam....o the hammam. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. They are efficient kind hard working and in every single way welcoming and accomodating. Go relaxbreathe...you will never regret it!

Review_Title: Not just excellent - this is special
Review_Text: We have just returned from a week here and found les Borgs an absolute delight.  The room [305] was superbly appointed and decorated tastefully in what I am sure reflects local style and tradition with a modern twist. Bath robes and fluffy towels in plentiful supply fresh flowers quality toiletries good flat screen TV with Freeview a huge comfy bed with lovely fresh linen and everything you would expect of a top class European hotel made this a wonderful comfortable sanctuary to which to return from the frenzy and mayhem of the Kasbah.    The staff and thereby their management have achieved that rare golden mean of being friendly and available whenever you needed them without ever being pushy or "in your face". The pool and surroundings are likewise first rate: solid wooden loungers with clean fabric cushions and fluffy towels provided. Cool discrete changing rooms with individual lockers prevent you having to "to and fro" between pool and room and the whole area is scrupulously maintained.    We ate in most nights and found the quality of food and value for money significantly better than when we ate out. The food was contemporary European with some local twists. Breakfasts with a well stocked buffet for the cold stuff and cook to order for eggs crepes etc all accompanied by quiet classical music were a particular treat and the perfect start to the day.    What made Les Borgs really special to us was the architecture that preserved a riad style with modern convenience in one harmonious whole - the line of sight from the central courtyard to the mosaic and fountain on the dining room wall showed real flair and the opening glass roof [as at Wimbledon] preserved a traditional outdoor feel by use of modern techniques to ensure comfort in any conditions.    The situation at the South end of the Medina was great for access to all main sights [twenty mins walk to the Souks and Jemma El Fna a few minutes from Royal Palace etc].    We have over the years experienced some excellent hotels but there has never been one with the magic of les Borgs
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian N wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: A beautiful hotel within the Medina and within walking distance of many "must see" sights. An oasis of calm and quality within the normal hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. The extensive experience the owner has in the hotel industry is evident in that the best qualities of many larger and more expensive hotels have been incorporated within. The rooms are beautifully dressed and maintained the food is excellent and the staff second to none in their attention to detail and the care in which they go about the task of making your visit a most enjoyable experience. To award this hotel experience less than 5 stars would be difficult and perhaps more of a statement relating to the reviewer. Quite frankly without fault and one of the most enjoyable family holidays we have ever had. We recommend this hotel without hesitation and will certainly return.

Review_Title: Delightful riad - chic & charming with professional, attentive & friendly staff
Review_Text: Stayed here twice on our visit to Morocco & Marrakech . This riad is a wonderful peaceful haven away from the chaos & intensity of Marrakech. It is spotlessly clean with good sized rooms ( we stayed in 3 of them) good standard of furnishings & comfortable beds. Robes  toiletries hair dryer (a powerful one) fluffy towels all provided with good quality sanitary ware in the bathrooms. Internet terminal & computer available & free to use plus library room all opening out onto the central courtyard. Pool area/ loungers (towels provided) plus spa spotlessly clean & welcome relief from the heat ( we didn't get chance to try the spa) .  The food in the Riad is first class- excellent choice of food at breakfast  plentiful & served in the restaurant which has a retractable roof so you eat under the sun or stars. Omelettes & other egg options are freshly made & the yogurt home made. Only comment is I prefer the Moroccan pancakes freshly made rather than made & then reheated & this I fed back .  We ate dinner here on one night - delightful ambience excellent food reasonably priced with efficient  attentive yet discreet first class service by the friendly staff .We celebrated our wedding anniversary & they made it so special. The staff went out of their way to ensure our stay here was a good experience  made enquiries if they didn't know the ansas ( eg dress code at the Mamounia ) & responded to problems immediately ( our air conditioning broke and we were moved to another room within 20 minutes) .Throughout our stay the staff were attentive efficient & professional at all times  The location of the Riad in the southern medina suited us -a short walk of no more than 10 minutes to the Royal Palace  the Centre Artisanal (to check out the fixed prices here before heading into the souks to ensure you don' t pay over the odds for your souvenirs when haggling ) & Saadian Tombs . Check out Cafe de la Kasbah which has a lovely roof terrace overlooking the Kasbah mosque & entrance to the Saadian Tombs & serves good reasonably priced food too- its a great place to watch all the local life on the streets. A further 10 minute walk brings you to the main square Jemaa El Fna  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Les Borjs deal Kasbah as an excellent place to stay in Marrakech. It is a delight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A lovely hotel within walking distance of the main square (about 20mins) We had a junior suite which was very comfortable and clean. The food was excellent with a good choice of dishes for each meal. Fatima was very attentive at breakfast. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful particularly Tariq and Nora on reception. When we asked where we could buy toothpaste which we had forgotten the owner went out to the corner shop and bought us some for which he wouldn't accept payment. The pool area was a welcome retreat after spending several hours either in the souks or on a walking tour.  We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel which we plan to use on our next trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mary C wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Les Borjs de la Kasbah is in the Medina close to many of the must-see sites but just far enough away from the busiest streets to feel peaceful. There's only about 20 rooms which are each unique and beautifully furnished plus have every amenity. With a bar pool spa restaurant and a really wonderful staff the hotel has everything you'll need. You might want to comparison price directly with tour operators before arranging excursions through the hotel though.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam C wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: an oasis of calm in the madness of the Kasbah
Review_Text: The front facade and the street outside bely the comfort and tranquility that lie behind the walls. The property has been skilfully converted in to a lovely medium sized hotel/riadh the rooms are large well appointed as well as being light and airy and for an added bonus the air conditioning actually managed to keep the room at a pleasant temperature not an oven or fridge which is so often the case.    The restaurant/breakfast area is in an open air courtyard area and is a very pleasant place to start the day the breakfast menu is fairly wide including the staples of "eggs as you like them" and "croissants and jam". We only ate in the hotel once in the evening and were a little disappointed the menu was good however not all the dishes were cooked well we were perhaps unlucky given the other reviews of the food.    Overall we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and have already decided that if we return to Morocco for a weekend break over the winter then this is where we will stay.

Review_Date: Helen H wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: When the transport from the airport turned into the street I thought I had clicked on the wrong hotel! My fears soon disappeared when we saw what an amazing hotel this was. After a morning out in the hustle and bustle of the markets and attractions my husband sons and I were all eager to return to its peace and tranquility of Les Borjs. The staff were courteous and professional to the point of one of us needing to visit a pharmacy and a member of staff coming with us the help with the language - this I hasten to add was nothing to do with Marrakech. The decor of all the public rooms and our bedrooms was absolutely beautiful. Watching the birds roosting in the courtyard was an amazing sound and sight. The spa treatments were very good especially the hammam which was quite an experience. The breakfasts were of a wide choice and lovely as were the light lunches by the pool. We were a little disappointed with the one evening meal we had in the hotel - this did not reflect on how we felt about the hotel as there are plenty of restaurants locally.  For peace of mind we pre-booked transport from and to the airport.  We also booked a guided WALKING tour through the hotel which was very interesting. At 4 hours it was a touch too long but a must we felt. This 4 night holiday was a surprised 'big O' treat for my husband from my sons of 25 and 22 years old and myself. We were recommend Les Borjs de la Kasbah by friends who went earlier this year. It is an absolute delight and we couldnt have been happier with the choice. We would love some day to return.

Review_Title: All the elements of a great formula.
Review_Text: Staff food location rooms everything was perfect during our weeks stay at the end of July despite temparatures in the upper 40's and being the first week of Ramadan.    Our second trip to Marrakesh the first being seven years ago and the hustle and bustle that makes this venue so exciting is contrasted by the peace and serenity that pervades Les Borjs.    The food and staff are worth a special mention with chefs creativity always a vegetarian option and always friendly staff giving attentive service. The type of establishment that is a wonderful antidote to the international gin palaces that are cloned accross the globe.    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dave A wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Title: An oasis of peace and quiet.
Review_Text: This hotel ranks as one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. It was an oasis of peace and quiet  [ there were no children there during our stay ]. It is very much a couples hotel in my opinion. Great rooms and decor throughout absolutely wonderful. All members of staff and management were totally professional and most helpful. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I'm not that keen on big hot busy hot bustling hot hot cities when it is hot...but...my companion was eager to explore another souk and so we did. To arrive at Les Borjs was a delight after the drive in from Essaouira. It is dark and cool and water trickles in many quiet places where lush plants abound. We were welcomed by the hotel manager with mint tea and biscuits and given a quick sketch of the services and general layout of this jewel of a Riad. The room air con was perfect and controlled via a remote; our room a haven with a minibar and safe and plenty of hanging storage. Did I say the bathroom was a dream? Hand tiled and with both bath and two showers it was complete with double sinks lots of lovely toiletries and big white bathrobes. We had two 'neighbours' on our landing and never heard a squeek.    We soon got into an early morning visit to the dining room for a slightly chaotic breakfast service complete with Moroccan delicacies and could order pretty much whatever one wished. Do try their 'smoothies' - a combination of fruit and vegetables. btw The staff were full of fun and returned smile for smile and were typically fluent in a couple of languages.    Couldn't wait to try the menu in their dining room the first night but I suspect a new chef as the service was tentative and food a bit heavy-handed. Meknes rose wine was delicious & that the room is open to the stars made it a magic evening. The Riad has a convivial bar area next to and overlooking the table area; put it to good use as most restaurants do not serve alcohol.    What else? Walking to the usual suspects - tombs & palace & marketplace - was fairly easy even with a recent hip replacement. A guide and an air conditioned car will get you to all the nooks and souks; do shop at the co-operatives for haggle-free buying.    A week old restaurant The Kasbah Cafe about a 5 minute walk from the riad served wonderful Moroccan dishes on a rooftop over-looking both the Palace walls opposite as well as the storks perched high above the churning crowds below. The rooftop dining area was cooled with the same technology as airlines - automatic mist lines were strung above the rattan umbrellas making the decor as sophisticated as the menu.    All in all Les Borjs is a peaceful oasis of beautifully thought-out rooms and common areas. We felt pampered catered-to but service was never intrusive. Salads and light lunches at the pool bar were absolutely perfect. Books-around-the-pool time in the afternoon was simply heaven after a hot trek thru the big wide world outside.

Review_Title: Fantastic! Can't wait to go back!
Review_Text: We have just returned from morocco having spent part of our stay at this riad. The room was beautiful wonderful air conditioning and comfortable beds. The staff were friendly and helpful and we had a fantastic tour organised by the riad. We took part in a cookery course which we enjoyed very much even though it was very hot! Our teenage sons enjoyed their stay there as much as us old timers!

A lovely escape. picked up at the airport; only a 10 minute drive away. Cool pretty and very well kept. Gorgeous room and lovely staff. Well situated ; very quiet . Great swimming pool and sun bathing area. Good dinners and we had a great hammam experience.    Nothing to do with hotel: they really still need to do something abouit the aggressive "guides" "taggers on" in the Souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First trip to Marrakech. Excellent hotel - for families and couples stayed with 7 yr old child we all loved it. Location close to Jema' el fna - 15 mins walking important historical sites eg saadien tombs and palace badi round the corner. Hotel - very clean and comfortable staff superb - couldn't praise less took care of all our needs. Hotel is in Kasbah ie old part of town so you get to experience the true vibrant culture. Would definitely go back and recommend. Used hotel spa and hammam - very relaxing. Another mega plus point - very calm inside indeed; not noisy!    NB - the majority of guests staying did not have children with them there was another couple with toddlers and ourselves with child staying there at the time but this did not appear to be a problem for staff or any other guests so I would definitely rate this as a family friendly hotel. We have been back 5 days and I can't wait to go back!    Staff were very helpful and housekeeping ensured that the beds were always madde and there were fresh rose petals everywhere daily! We only tried the spaghetti it was nice there are stalls outside the Kasbah where you can grab a quick bite too

About 10-15 mins walk from main square gives you the ability to see a bit of the old town going to/from main attractions. Clean good facilties and very helpful/friendly staff. Only problem was that they under-charged me as they failed to add the tip i included on the two meals i had in the hotel!

My husband and I stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah on our honeymoon. It was our first time to Marrakesh and I did hours of riad searching previous to deciding on Les Borjs de la Kasbah.    I couldn't have picked a better riad! Our room was amazing staff was beyond wonderful and the neighborhood was somewhat outside the square (but close enough to walk).    The food was amazing and we ate at the riad many nights because the food was great.    They also recommended many wonderful places to visit.    It was also very close to the amazing banya spa in the Kasbah.    All in all I hope I go back very soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is set in the Kasbah district of Marrakech.It is an exceptional small and friendly hotel where the staff go out of their way to ensure their guests have the best stay possible.It is located within easy walking distance of many attractionsDjemaa el Fina the main square is about a 15 minute stroll away. There is a Pharmacy( english speaking )and a corner shop very close by.Les Borj is typical of Moroccan riad- style hotels there are wonderful courtyards providing calm and cool in the heat of the day.The pool is set in its own terrace and is more than adequate.Our room was large comfortable and well furnished the en suite was spacious and the shower excellent.Wi-fi is available in public areas and some of the bedroomsthere is also a computer which is complimentary for guest use.Breakfast is served in a covered courtyard which gives the feeling of al- fresco eatingplenty of choice but do not expect a full english try the selection of pancakes and pastries instead.Dinner can be taken in the courtyard or inside we found the choice and quality of the french/ moraccan food very good.The staff are the hotels greatest asset they are all very welcoming and courteous english and french is spoken and they were always on hand to give advice on transport sight seeing and hangling in the souks.We stayed for 3 nights mid April and would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel and hope to return ourselves one day soon.

I returned to Les Borjs de la Kasbah six months after my first visit. Last time it was my honeymoon this time it was for a quiet "girlie break" with one of my best friends. The visit simply confirmed my view that this place is "Heaven on Earth". It is perfect for a quiet romantic holiday or a peaceful get away - with the option of venturing out into the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The building and its courtyards are beautiful and healing to sit in. The spa is fabulous and I have to say that the prices are very reasonable - try the hammam or the tonic massage (great stretching out of the body and they even massage your eye lids!). Ultimate pampering luxury. But the best part of the hotel is the staff who are all so friendly. They are the heart of the place and make it feel like a home from home. All the staff are very skilled linguists and put many of us to shame in this respect (me!) They go above and beyond the call of duty and are to be congratulated on their professionalism. This time I ate more in the hotel restaurant and have to say that I was extremely impressed - absolutely delicious Morrocan food by night (fabulous chicken with dates and figs or something stuffing it) a gorgeous chicken pastilla and duck to DIE for) but also wonderful day time snacks - if you want a simple club sandwich and chips followed by the best chocolate mousse ever for lunch then this is provided too! A word about the area the hotel is in - it is in the heart of the Kasbah area and feels more like an area the local people live than a tourist area (good!) although there are shops and restaurants that will appeal to travellers. Step outside the hotel and you are in a very interesting world but a non-threatening one and one in which I never feel harrased when I have visited - even when there was just me and my friend as two women together (take "respectful clothing" to be polite though). Oh yes in response to the previous review mentioning the swimming pool - it was toasty warm when we were there to the extent that steam was rising off the water in the cool air of the early morning! In conclusion if you are thinking of booking here I would HIGHLY recommend it - you are in for a treat! My husband and I are already booked to go back in the autumn and this may well become a regular thing for us money and time off work permitting. Enjoy!

Review_Title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah - Perfect!
Review_Text: Just returned from this beautiful Riad in Marakech. We stayed for a week and it was absolute bliss. Staff were fantastic and so helpful. The Riad had everything we required and a whole lot more!!!! Food in restaurant was Moroccan inspired and delicious! A nice 15 minute walk along the Rue du Kasbah and we were in the main square (it was like stepping into another world snake charmers monkeys etc - what an experience) Again the hotel was a little oasis for us in this very hot city lovely pool hammam and spa. Little touches made the difference - rose petals on the bed everyday and the hepful staff with tips on how to handle the haggling!!!! Can have a lovely lunch by the pool which was nice especially after a hot dusty morning sightseeing. We will definitely be back. Aileen Cheshire
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: peter e wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: Well located, comfortable with good service but left on a sour note
Review_Text: This is a very good hotel located in the kasbah and is a far better option to the riads of the medina. Room was most comfortable and traditional in style with good furnishings albeit it was the only hotel during my trip where despite it being early season I was given a single room as booked. Service was also very good throughout my 4 night stay and there was a free internet terminal for guests to use. The courtyard areas were most pleasant to relax in and had much character. Staff were all most polite and helpful and the breakfast choice although limited was quite adequate. Standard in rooms was very high with comfortable bed good pillows and quality towels. Good level of cleanliness everywhere and difficult to fault. Room was nicely heated at night and hot water was always available. Room rates were also good when stayed late February as had 4 nights for price of 3.  However I left this hotel feeling sour after using the self coded room safe during my stay. It was the first of 11 hotels during a 5 week trip around Morocco and I carried 20x £20 notes as a reserve for card failure/loss This money was check counted into the room safe on arrival and recounted before I left and two of the notes were short. Said nothing at hotel as had received such polite service and knew would only be told "it is impossible" and "you are mistaken" but I was not. Lesson learnt for rest of trip and the reserve remained otherwise intact until my return. So be warned  in what is an otherwise good standard hotel.
……… in the madness of the Medina chill out in luxury at ‘Les Hotel Borjs de la Kasbah’………… highly recommended / Cliff and Louise

Review_Title: As good as all the other reviews claimed
Review_Text: The enthusiasm with which other travellers had written about this riad raised our expectations - we were not disappointed. The staff were courteous and pleasant the ambience extremely tasteful and the food was well cooked and presented with a wide enough choice for us to eat dinner in the restuarant for four out of the seven nights we stayed without getting bored. We upgraded to a suite (booked through a British Airways package holiday) which was superb and made the holiday for us - not so expensive to do it £160 extra for the week. As others have written it is extraordinary how you step through a door from the hurly burly of the city into an oasis of calm within the courtyard of the riad. This riad was built in 2007 but based on traditional designs and they have done a cracking job. The pool area looked rather cramped in the photos but we found it was fine in reality. A couple of fairly minor points - service could be very slow at lunchtime (dinner was good) so allow plenty of time and the air freshener in the bathroom was a very strong and persistent scent of naphtha (mothballs) - not to everyone's taste maybe it's a Moroccan thing? Overall though Les Borjs de la Kasbah is highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David R wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: Although we did not stay here it is definitely top of the list for next time.    We had coffee here and were given free access to view the hotel.    The Hotel consists of about four Riads combined around courtyards with fountains and swimming pool.  The overall character is of quiet tasteful quality and the staff were very helpful in answering our questions and showing us round.    On the edge of the Kasbah close to the Palace walls on a very quiet and clean street it is about 30mins. walk to the square but only 30dirhams by taxi. 30 dirhams is the standard fare within the Kasbah so make sure that you agree this with the taxi driver before getting in to avoid misunderstandings at the end of your journey.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great Riad tucked away in a quiet corner of Kasbah area of Marrakech Medina. The Riad is about a 20mins to half hour walk to the main square and souk. Therefore it is not a centrally located venue. The Riad itself is stunning. Great ambience and the attention to detail and the service is faultless. The only let down is that...more » there are bedrooms with physical single bed. I found this is very disappointing considering that a lot of visitors to Marrakech are there on holidays - and lets face it who would want to sleep in a single bed? Let alone sleeping in a single bed while on holidays for 4 nights? Aside from this I could not fault the Riad. It is run and managed very well location wise is fine as long as you don't mind the walk. The facilities are well maintained; swimming pool clean and peaceful outdoor space for you to enjoy the sunshine and to relax. Breakfast is well seved; freshly squeezed orange juice each morning Morroccan pancakes fresh fruit.I would recommend the Riad as I really enjoyed the ambience it offers but I would probably not stay there again given that I was allocated a room with a single bed
Had a really lovely short break here - staff were knowledgable and very helpful. I would have loved to swim in the pool but as it was not heated sadly this was not an option.

Sometimes it's worth doing the extra bit of homework Les Borjs de la Kasbah is definitely worth consideration to anyone planning a trip to the heart of Marrakech. Although this Riad is situated near the Old Royal Palace and in a quieter part of town (no bad thing) it's an easy and enjoyable walk to the key sights.    I first stayed the Borjs de la Kasbah a little while after it first opened and I recall there were some inevitable but very minor teething problems. I am pleased to report that after five years the establishment runs like a well oiled machine: quiet unassuming and efficient. Not the very cheapest Riad but you always get what you pay for and worth going for one that's established and well run.    I stayed overnight en route from Essaouira and so was only able to have breakfast. In short I concur with many of the other reports excellent quality and great attention to detail.    Before this trip I checked out a few other Riads via Trip Advisor but decided to stick with what I knew and I'm pleased I did. However one of the more recent T-A reports for Les Borjs stated that the pool was unheated – I feel I must correct this as the manager told me over breakfast that they'd recently replaced the pool's heat pump at considerable expense!    I shall continue to recommend Les Borjs de la Kasbah to colleagues friends and family. Excellent!

Review_Title: A Peaceful retreat from the bustling Marrakech
Review_Text: On arriving for our first visit to Marrakech it was early evening we were a little daunted when the taxi driver drove us up the Kasbah to the hotel.  On arriving we were greeted and shown to the bar where we then given a cup of Morocco mint tea. Then a quick tour of the Riad and to our room.  We booked one of the Suits and it lived up to expectations. Beautifully decorated and rose petals everywhere. Bed very comfy!.The view from the suite looked over the main courtyard.  The Riad restaurant offers good food and I would recommend going for the specials menu as it makes you try a few different dishes.  The one downside is that on the Riad website it says heated pool and this is not the case in fact it was icy cold and even putting our feet in was painful.  The Riad is well located at the end of the kasbah and is a 15-20 minute walk to the sooks.  I would also recommend the double decker sightseeing tour as this helps you to get your bearings of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely luxury in a quieter part of town
Review_Text: We only stayed here for 2 nights so didn't eat in the restaurant. Staying with another couple we both had lovely rooms which were large and very clean with a wonderfully powerful shower and some lovely toiletries and little touches. It is ideally located away from the main square but within walking distance so you can soak up the atmosphere on the way. I would definitely recommend a stay in Marrakech but it can be a bit 'full on' and mad so it was nice to stay a little outside the mayhem. Breakfast was good with a good selection of breads toasts etc. Would recommend a stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: just on the outskirts of the centrea pleasant stroll from centre.this really is an oasis in the surrounding hubbub.the staff were very helpful and pleasant.i found the restaurant very much to my taste and the prices alcohol v expensive-food cheaperare roughly what i'd expect to pay in london.so its not cheapbut an excellent standard overallespecially when compared to the exorbitant mamounia hotel where a beer costs about£9 for a 330ml bottle of local casablanca lager.all my fellow residents expressed their satisfaction and i can only concur.the waitressesespecially were wonderful.though only 2 nights a good place for tourists who are paying for the hotels etc themselves

When I arrived here I had been ill for a few days so was delighted to be welcomed with kindness & thoughtfulness by the staff. My room was one of the smallest yet it was warm inviting comfortable and I loved its cosiness and charm. A great shower lovely toiletries provided a soft robe and rose petals on the bed all helped to make this hotel that bit above average.    In fact I loved it! Breakfasts were good with plenty of choice - suggest you don't leave it to the last minute though. The bread cakes and yoghurts are homemade and delicious. The cook will prepare you an omelette or boiled egg if you wish.    I took the Cookery course which was a lot of fun and interesting too. However the actual food I had cooked was not all that interesting in taste when I came to eat it later that day. I notice that others comment on the food being bland - I ate dinner her on two other occasions and then the food was excellent and perfectly seasoned for the dish!    Situated at the far end of the Kasbah I enjoyed walking through this very friendly area and could sense the community spirit here. I didn't take the obvious main road route to the main square as my knowledge of the Medina told me it was quicker easier and more fun to go that way.    Would I return? Without a doubt! This hotel is a gem with excellent staff superb cleanliness very pleasant rooms an excellent menu and great location.

Review_Title: Nice Hotel but still needs work
Review_Text: This is a clean friendly hotel. It tries very hard to please and is getting their. It still needs work on its food which for my taste is a little bland. It has to be said it is a fair way from the main square but for some that might be a plus. All staff are exelent.

I have been to the fascinating city of Marrakech more than 20 times over a period of some 40 years and have previously always stayed in 5-star hotels and riads but was attracted by the excellent reviews this rather less pricy small hotel attracts. I am glad to say that my partner and I were not disappointed.  The southern part of the medina is somewhat less touristy than the northern end perhaps because it is a fair (but interesting) walk to Djemaa el Fna and the Koutoubia though less than 15 minutes from the Bahia and Badii Palaces and Saadian Tombs. We were tired enough at the end of the day to dine in something we would not normally do; however Les Borjs de la Kasbah offers an excellent dinner package if you dine in at least three nights and the food is interesting and good. A small supplement for a Moroccan-themed dinner with music and belly dancer was well worth paying. We had no time to use the pool or spa but both looked inviting.  The conversion of several houses into a charming boutique hotel has been done most sympathetically and with good taste. Modern comforts have not diminished authenticity. The multilingual staff were invariably smiling and readily accommodated special requests. The complimentary airport pick-up on arrival and the serving of mint tea and cakes whilst checking in are nice touches. We shall very happily return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christine W wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: Thank-you to the staff and management for a great stay myself and group of friends all ladies were very appreiative of the attention given by all the staff - especially Mohamed and Hussain - special thanks to the camel.....thanks again - Wright party

Review_Title: Best hotel in three week Morocco trip!
Review_Text: Caution: Marrakech has a small print policy that if a large booking comes up they can bump you out of your reservation. That happened to us two times and we ended up at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. Thank goodness! This is an oasis. Marrakech is a busy noisy exciting place and when you are done touring what you need is a place like this. Believe it or not you can walk down a sketchy alley full of donkeys motorcycles bikes pedestrians people and go through the doors into a "riad" that offers peace and tranquility. The service is great the food is excellent the rooms well decorated and clean. I understand in speaking with the staff that this used to be the #1 rating in Marrakech and it should be! We stayed at five other hotels during our three week trip in Morocco and by far far far this is the best hotel we stayed at. Dinner is great at the hotel -- while you can have Tagine -- you also have a large selection of modern cuisine which is a great break from the standard dish. This was the only hotel to offer a computer and if you want to make international phone calls all you have to do is go to the front desk. The bathrooms are delightful -- heated towel rack plush towels nice soaps shower and bathtub. We miss Fatima the wonderful woman who manages breakfast. If only she could be there at home every morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As you enter the Borjs de la Kasbah you leave the chaos outside and enter a tranquil oasis. The staff are terrific helpful and courteous.  Rooms are clean comfortable and in decorated and finished to a high standard. We ate several times at the hotel restaurant and enjoyed the experience every time.  A must if you stay is the spa- the hammam and spa treatments are fantastic i felt refreshed and rejuvenated after the experience.

Review_Date: Thomas M wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: A very nice and in certain ways authentic hotel.  In the middle of the Kasbah where you would not expect a hotel anymore it is like an oasis for tourists.  The hotel offers a very calm extremely friendly and service orientated atmosphere. The rooms are offering all kind of standard features a western tourist would look for. The hotel has its own hammam and pool and the organization of trips in and around Marrakesh help a lot to explore the entire region.  The food in the restaurant is great and offers for everybody something delicious.  We have been very happy to stay there over 5 nights and it was all penny worth.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in a vibrant city
Review_Text: From the moment you enter this Riad you will love the serenity of it. The place is beautiful and very clean with very fiendly and attentionate personnel. Everything was thought of to make your experience a memorable one: from the decor of the rooms to comfy morrocan salons in the patio. Its is located at the southern limits of the Medina and close to the Royal Palace and the Tombeaux Saadiens. It is a 20 mns walking distance from Jemaâ El- Fna in an area where you get a full immersion in the local life. It is clearly my place of choice in Marrakech for my trip next year.

Review_Date: mike k wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: My first trip to Marrakech and this Riad is a absolute gem ; right in the heart of the bustling Medina but inside the front door there is only peace and tranquility. The service accommodation food ( French /Morrocan ) were all tip top. They arranged all transfers  advised on activities - nothing was too much trouble . We were on a golfing holiday and I would recommend Marrakech as a winter venue - courses were excellent . The Riad just made the holiday fantastic

A brilliant hotel. Lovely friendly staff who are all very helpful and genuinely want to make you welcome. Out of the loud hustle and bustle of the centre but an easy walk in which I think was well worth it. It's so loud that after a busy day exploring coming back to the quietness and chilling by the pool with a nice bottle of rose (£10) was something to look forward to. Very comfy beds good showers and rose petals on the bed is a lovely touch.

This is a fantastic place in the southern medina about 15-20 minutes walk to the main square. We thought this side of the medina was more authentic and less touristy than the other side and the best museums are around here. The owners have put a great deal of thought into this hotel - it is the little things that make a hotel perfect and they have truly thought of everything! We booked a suite through Expedia which was just wonderful - a four poster bed lovely sitting area and a large bathroom with yummy toiletries! We arranged an airport transfer through the hotel as our flight landed quite late and the mint tea and biscuits on arrival was a good touch. The room was looked after very well and there were fresh rose petals scattered on the bed every day - we also had fresh roses in the room and a fruit basket. Breakfast was very good (the fresh orange juice and fluffy scrambled eggs were particularly good!) and we ate in the restaurant every night too. The food was very good and we just couldn't face the madness of the medina in the dark!! The staff are a credit to the hotel - do leave some money in their tip box on checkout. They are worth every penny!  We had a hammam in the spa which was great and lunch by the pool one afternoon which was delicious. Because this is a proper hotel there is a 24 hour reception and the staff can arrange anything you wish.  All in all we would say this is one of the best hotels we have ever been to and would love to return one day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm and charm in Marrakech
Review_Text: Close to the Royal Palace down a narrow street in the ancient walled city of Marrakech Les Borjs is a group of ancient riads joined together to make a charming little hotel based around several inner courtyards. The staff were very efficient and friendly the breakfast was a comprehensive choice and the spa area delightful. I particularly rated the hammam. Marrakech is an intoxicating blend of cultures and the narrow streets of the Kasbah are a vibrant mix of astonishing sights and smells. You will see tiny shops selling spices storks nesting on chimney tops people tempting you to buy things a hurly-burly of chaotic traffic from horse-drawn carts to hooter-happy taxis. All the while the heady scent of open-air cooking draws you towards the massive main square. Les Borjs is the perfect oasis of calm after a day in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

Review_Date: irene, leeds wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: amazing calm oasis in a crazy,crazy city!
Review_Text: we stayed for five nights and had the most amazing time.all of the staff were extremely attentative without being too over powering.the bedroom was extremely comfortable and was beautifully decorated each day with flower petals.during our stay it was my wifes birthday without any prompting staff would wish her a happy birthday and after our evening meal they presented her with a cake beautifully decorated and with her name on (and it was totally scrumptious). none of this was pre booked and totally done under their own initiative (absolutely wonderfull).All of the meals were excellent and the kitchen is very clean we know as we spent three hours doing the cookery school with the chef a fantastic experience and a great meal at the end. the hotel is in a great location for exploring the city and is beautiful and calm once inside an ideal escape after visiting the souks. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel with its ideal locationtranquil interiorgreat food and excellent staff. definitely worth a visit and we will return to experience it all again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: karin e wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: I have stayed in this wonderful riad together with my girlfriend. The place is stunning very well located in the kasbah and very quiet. We did some cookery classes organised in the hotel which were fun and very well organised. The hammam was excellent we had very good treatments at very reasonable prices. The whole place rooms and restaurant are very clean and the people who work there are so kind you feel like in a family. In this occasion I want to thank especially Mohammed who with his kindness is always ready to give some help and organise trips for the clients. I miss Les Borjs de la Kasbah and will go back there again as soon as I can!

Review_Title: first time to north west africa
Review_Text: Excellent introduction to Marrakech. Could not have chosen a better place to stay. 4 hour walking tour of the old town a must if you want to get a broad flavour of the place before setting off on your own. Guide excellent very informative and knowledgeable. Most things within the walls within walking distance being mindful we were there in October when it is cooler. A wondeful oasis to return to after a day in the souks or climbing in the Atlas mountains. Spa facilites excellent and all staff delightful. Will certainly stay there again. Single rooms with no supplements an added and very much appreciated bonus.

We stayed their with our 2 year old and we were well looked after by the staff.  they went out of their way to make life easy for us and with a 2 year old in tow people should know that this can be a challenge.  Yes the excursions were a bit over priced and our guide was a pain but hey its probably not the hotels fault as any registered guide would cost money.  My advice would be to stay away from this and look to tour the city yourself.  Its not that hard!!  The breakfast was fine and maybe it was us but we got a great variety of things to eat everyday which we relished as otherwise the food is not to everyone palette in marrakech.  The hamam experience was great fun  i only wished we hadnt left it till the last date.    The hours we spent at the jama al fanaa drinking mint tea were well worth if you can find a good enough spot.    Overall i was dreading the trip with my 2 year old but was pleasantly surprised by all the fuss they made of him and he even got cuddled by the belly dancer the hotel had got for one nights entertainment.    We will definitely go again.
A great 7 nights at a great hotel in the Kasbah Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gilly L wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Birdsong and evocative music echo around this relaxing hotel. The staff eager and  helpful; the food and wine generous; a spa visit essential.  Mohammed arranged everything from a cookery course to an excellent guide.  Walk 15 minutes to Big Square and souks or 5 minutes to Ets. Bouchaib for  shopping without bartering.  Ideal 4 day break for us two girlfriends needing peace quiet good red wine and  lots of shopping therapy.

Review_Date: Philip L wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Marrakech now has a new town with all the world famous retailers and top hotels. But if you want a 5* small hotel with alot of character within walking distance of the main square in the Medina and yet quiet and relaxed Les Borjs de la Kasbah is perfect. They pick you up at the airport which immediately takes the strain away and then after some refreshing mint tea on arrival in their courtyard you find some fruit and gorgeous little cakes in your room along with rose petals on the bed. What a start !!  Also noticed that when you stay in many so-called top hotels the towels are not always large and soft. These were and it was just one of many small details that makes this Hotel rather special.  Day trips to the Atlas Mountains and Essaouira guided tour around Marrakech were all arrangd through the Hotel and excellent. The swimming pool had loungers and large shades for everybody and the spa was well worth the several visits for a massage.  The buffet breakfasts were very good and there was a good deal on the evening meals. We stayed seven nights and three of these meals were outstanding two were good and two were just O.K. We were told they would make sure that all the meals were up to their normal high standard. Their wines were very good and reasonably priced.  We had a wonderful stay at Les Borjs where all the staff were friendly attentive and smiling and have already recommended this Hotel to our friends..

Review_Title: If you can, go there immediately!
Review_Text: We have just returned from our honeymoon at this riad-hotel. We honestly could not fault it - the staff were so lovely and attentive that we were sad to leave. The whole place is so aesthetically pleasing that I struggled to read my book for gazing at its beauty. We really enjoyed tha Hammam and we both had a wonderful massage. Also we loved the Soiree Marrocain that they hosted one night in the restaurant. Out of interest on our last day we went to La Mamounia to see what it was like but despite its grandeur we would still rather stay here. A perfect oasis of calm and beauty. Thank you so much Monsieur Tom Mohammed Abdulatiff Youssef Nawal Hachid and all the other wonderful staff who looked after us and made our honeymoon so special. We hope so much to return. Anne and John
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: OK But not worth the money
Review_Text: Do not get me wrong this is not a bad boutique hotel but it does not live up to the claims on the website or some of the other reviews on here.    The main problem was lack of consistency and small details which you expect when paying this sort of money in a place such as Marrakech.    We stayed for a week in a deluxe room and the main part of the room was nice enough with a good sized bed and plenty of wardrobe space.  However the en-suite was a little shabby and the shower was no use for anyone over 5 foot tall In addition there was little hot water to be had (Only had a proper hot shower on two days out of the week).    Service on the first few days was very patchy but did pick up when more guests arrived. Standards of service should be just as good whether there is one guest or 30.  Excursions  The hotel charges a large premium for excursions booked thru them and for this I expected a much better service (and some protection). Most of the excursions seem to be based around getting as much money out of the guests as possible and there were a number of occasions when we felt rather uncomfortable with the hard sell tactics that were deployed on every single excursion we undertook.  SPA  Use of the SPA and Sauna are at addition charge (Should you really charge for use of the sauna?)My wife and I both had the Hammam and Gommage unfortunately the Hammam ran out of Steam and we were left sitting in a old room for 10 minutes until they fixed it.  My wife also had a couple of massages and she was happy with those  Restaurant  The biggest disappointment was the restaurant. When you consider they charge near enough western charges the standard and service were nothing like those of similar hotels in France.  If you arrived at Breakfast after 8:30 there was not a great deal of choice left (we only managed to get croissants on one day) and on a number of occasions I had to ask the staff to top up the coffee or orange juice) and generally service was not good.  We had evening meals in the restaurant on 3 occasions the first was actually reasonable (though still over priced compared to similar local restaurants) on the second occasion service was reasonable but the food was disappointing (very overcooked which is OK if you order a Taging but not for sliced beef). However on the third occasion my wife and I both had very upset stomachs so suffice to say we did not eat there again.    Overall if Les Borjs wants to appeal to the sort of clients who like true 4 star service it needs to improve both its standards and its consistancy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Simply stunning, cannot wait to return
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful 4 days in Marrakech and were fortunate enough to have stayed at the stunning boutique hotel Les Borjs de la Kasbah. From the moment we were collected by the friendly driver (transfers are free if you book directly via the website) and arrived at the hotel we knew we had made the right choice. The owners of the hotel have managed to create an incredibly tranquil ambience something impossible to believe achievable given that one of Africa’s busiest squares Jemaa el Fna is just a 10-15 minute walk away.    Our room a premium Double overlooking the courtyard area was very spacious and well equipped with everything you could need for a short stay. The bathroom was a particularly generous size and had the benefit of a separate shower and bath. As with all of the facilities the room was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The pool area provided a welcomed break from the scorching midday temperatures as were the comfortable seating areas located in the shade around the main courtyard.    If you are planning a stay at Les Borjs de la Kasbah I thoroughly recommend that you eat at the hotels ‘Le Jasmin’ restaurant. It was by far the best food that we ate during our stay in Marrakech and the French & Moroccan menu was complimented by an impressive wine selection something that we found difficult to find in the other restaurants we tried in the area. The snack menu offered by the poolside at lunch times was also very good value.    The staff at the hotel were all absolutely fantastic we simply could not fault the service we received during our stay and we were very sad to leave. We are already planning a return visit to Marrakech and will certainly be booking this hotel again.    TIP - Make sure you book directly via the hotel website to get the best deal and free transfers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claire B wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Title: Lovely and quiet with lovely staff
Review_Text: Lovely place to stay. Made a fuss of us as it was honeymoon with petals etc on the beds and a nice message. However the highly-moveable twin beds that were REALLY soft werent that conducive! We said so in our questionnaire and had a much better double on our return from a second centre. The pool is lovely and the bar really nice. The food in the restaurant is excellent. (if pricey)  We did the cooking course and the chef was really helpful and informative. He even came out to speak to us on our last night dinner to explain the recipe for dish we loved.  Very good facilities and you dont feel like leaving especially considering the 30 minute hike to the Djmaa Square in the August heat! There is nothing much around there though so you need to go to the square to eat if you are on a budget.  Also the Medina is buzzing and very busy with traffic- watch yourselves as you walk through.  If you want a laugh go to the "white horse" bazaar just down the road to see all the souvenirs you could ever need or want.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: andrew b wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Text: I stayed with my wife and two adult daughters. The outstanding feature of the hotel was the quality and friendliness of the service. Nothing was too much trouble and extra touches included providing a bucket of ice for our own wine we had bought and agreeing to provide evening meal service later than usual. All the staff were warm and helpful and this created an important atmosphere of welcome and relaxation. The rooms were beautiful although a slight disappointment was one having only a shower and no bath but the outlook from the bay window was very appealing. Air conditioning was an important reliable feature of the rooms given the 40 degree heat!!. Touches like arrranging flower petals on the bed and artfully folding nightware were also very good. Breakfast was vegetarian and very good quality although some things run out (pastries) if you eat later as we did on one morning. My family very much enjoyed the spa and pool day too which was relaxing in such a peaceful environment. Dinner was good value and the first meal was excellent. There was some disappointment on our second meal when the steak that was ordered as rare came well done. My daughter then asked for some more jus to go with it and was given a vinaigrette tasting mixture and poured it over the meat before she realised what it was. She ate the meal rather than ask for a replacement but it was spoilt. Also my other daughter ordered a lamb dish the same as mine on the first evening and this was a less generous portion and not so skilfully cooked.    We would thoroughly recommend the hotel for all the above positive reasons and also as it is so central to Marrakesh yet is so peaceful and beautiful. It is only a 15 minute walk to the square not 25 as reported elswehere. We would have stayed longer if we could!    General recommendation for the future. We booked through expedia and paid a very high price for the airport transfer whereas if we had booked direct with the hotel the transfer would have been free. The hotel could consider this policy as other expedia hotels (eg Deux Tours) do not charge. It was also slightly disappointing that the hotel forgot us on arrival and we had to phone to be collected despite email confirmations beforehand.    Could the hotel also consider providing complimentary water especially in such searing August heat as we found it expensive to keep paying bar and mini bar prices

Review_Title: Great Choice but on departure it got weird...
Review_Text: From the courteous staff to the lovely surroundings and the great food...this is definitely a good choice for Marrakech.    It is about a 20 minute walk from the centre which is good as you get to see plenty on foot en route. Very near to the Saadian Tombs (about 8 mins) but everything else is just as easily reached on foot. Don't be put off by the hustle and bustle and lack of any real maps...the medina is worth exploring.    My room was small but perfectly clean and comfortable. Although this is a hotel it has a very 'Riad' style to the way it has been designed and decorated. The only complaint with my room was that there was a subtle wiff of stale water in the bathroom but that was eliminated by keeping the plug in the sinkhole!    To avoid any annoying illness that might spoil a short 4 night trip I decided to eat only in the hotel. This turned out to be a very good choice! Breakfast has a reasonable variety of food which won't leave you wanting. The pool snacks that I tried were all really good portions and very tasty and the Moroccan dishes in the restaurant were to die for! The vegetable tagine is just about one of the best things I have ever eaten...I'm not kidding. It might be worth noting that as a Vegan I had no problem in this hotel getting what I needed.    The pool is an absolute God send in the heat of the medina and the courtyard is also a lovely peaceful place to relax and have a tea.    The only thing that left me wondering was a situation on departure. I was told that the credit card terminal wasn't working and that I would have to go to the cash point to get the money out to settle the bill. This also happened to a couple who were leaving the same time as me. We all said 'no way'. Not only it that not safe it's not appropriate. There was some faffing about and they finally got the machine to work in an office next to the reception. They then tried to charge me for an extra night (I had booked a stay 4 pay for 3) so there was some debating and math going on before they realised their error apologised and adjusted the bill. I didn't know until afterwards that this had also been the case for the couple who were leaving the same time as me. We could'nt decide if this was just bad luck mixed with a genuine error or someone trying to scam a few tourists?    It was a real shame everything else had been so perfect.

This is a perfectly ok hotel but did not live up to our expectations. After reading so many rave reviews on Tripadvisor we expected a lot more than we actually received.  The Location of this hotel is a lot further from the main sights than we were led to believe. The main square is a good 25 minute walk from the hotel and when returning later in the evening we were continually pestered by young boys near the hotel asking for money which became a real nuissance. The rooms are adequate but not plush and the toiletries in the room were basic and a dissapointment. Pressure in the shower fluctuated daily.  Breakfast again was ok but nothing to get excited about and was not very varied.  The staff all seemed friendly enough but one day by the pool i asked for some mayonaise with my toasted sandwich I had to ask three times before it eventually arrived. when it did it was old and had oil running arround the rim of the bowl and so could not eat it!. Staff seemd to be wandering around in a bit of a dream.  So sadly my husband and i were dissapointed with out stay at the Borj hotel.  Not the best Holiday!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My sister and I booked this riad as a surprise 5 night break to Marrakech for our twin sister's 50th birthday purely on the exceptional review's on trip advisor. We were not disappointed the friendly manager welcomed us with mint tea before showing us to our suites which were beautiful cannot be faulted one of the best I have stayed in.  Breakfast was wonderful dinner exceptional good choice of traditional/continental cuisine. One evening the riad held a traditional moroccan evening with entertainment belly dancer musicians and we had a fabulous time.  Through the hotel manager we booked a private day trip to Essaouira which has a beautiful coastline. We had a fabulous fish lunch overlooking the beach recommended in our travel guide. Not to be missed is a private tour of the souk. We each also enjoyed the riad's spa traditional Hamman/facial and pedicure totally pampered not to be missed.  We have all said we will go back with our husbands for a romantic break. The riad is located just inside the red wall of the city 10-15 min walk to the medina which makes it very quite both by day and at night.

Review_Title: Wonderful hotel, didn't want to leave
Review_Text: We are full of praise for the Borjs de la Kasbah. This hotel is beautiful peaceful and so friendly. Greeted with mint tea which sets the theme for your stay. Every area is perfect for a relaxing and luxurious break. Our room was great and the rose petals on the bed each day were a lovely touch. The food and service is outstanding. Loads of choice for breakfast and the most perfect eggs. The massage in the spa is something not to miss and the hammam an experience to try. We thoroughly enjoyed the cookery lesson and would recommend the expense of taking a guide out with you to the Souk you will learn so much more and the big bonus is no hassle !!!  A memorable and wonderful trip we are already saving up for another visit .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As other reports have said this hotel is outstanding the staff from the porters to the manager were a very helpful profesional and hard working.  The rooms were very high quality and very clean with fresh flowers and rose petals on the bed daily.  The pool area is perfect to relax and is much needed in the madness for Marrakesh.  The restaraunt i think is the high point of the hotel for me the high standard of the food blew me away and the court yard area were you can eat surrounded by beautiful plants and a water feature.  Also me and my wife did the cooking course in the hotel which i would highly recomened.  All in all the best hotel iv ever stayed in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Sublime tranquility a few feet from the hustle and bustle of the city
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel - the hotel itself is absolute perfection and the attention to detail and thoughfulness of the staff made our stay extra special. Staying at the hotel was a real treat and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone wanting a bolt-hole from the madness of Marrakech outside the hotel walls. Simply wonderful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel created from a riad and several old houses which blend to make a luxury hotel with the rooms looking on to courtyards full of flowers orange trees and fountains. All the rooms are different - our party of 8 ladies took the 4 twin bedded rooms two being standard rooms and two deluxe. There really wasn't much difference in them- the deluxe rooms being a little bigger but they were all furnished well with easy chairs comfortable beds large wardrobes with rugs cushions and walls in soft earth colours.The bathrooms were very large and had a large bath with shower separate shower cubicle and some had double sinks too. They were all spotlessly clean  The hotel staf fwas one of the best things about the hotel. All spoke perfect English and nothing was too much trouble for them. They were obviously proud of their hotel and genuinely seemed to enjoy their work always smiling and very helpful.  The hotel is within the walled Kasbah but a 20 min walk from the main square. We never felt threatened when walking and taxis were easy to find if you didn't fancy the trek. We also walked to the Saadian tombs Badia and Bahia palaces and the souk. The city is exciting  colourful and frenetic- it was a delight to return to the peace quiet and comfort of the Borjs. It also has a swimming pool great to cool down in.  The breakfasts were excellent- great choice of fruits cheese breads and freshly squeezed orange juice which was wonderful and eggs cooked to order. We ate in twice in the evening as there are no restaurants close- the only negative feature of the hotel.The food was good not exceptional but about the same price as the central restaurants  If I return to Marrakech I will definitely return to the Borjs- it is lovely!

Review_Title: Best hotel we have ever stayed in
Review_Text: From the warm welcome with mint tea & pastries to the lovely room fabulous food great pool & spa traditional decor with modern comfort & really lovely staff - everything was perfect. About 15 minute stroll to main square but worth it for the peace & quiet. BK is like an oasis in the madness of Marrakech. The only sounds are the tinkling of the fountain in the main courtyard & birdsong. Absolutely loved it. Ate in the restaurant nearly every night as food was so good & reasonably priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely combination of modern convenience and traditional charm... but a little overpriced
Review_Text: A friend and I stayed at Les Borjs de la Kasbah for five nights at the end of January for a girls' break away. We paid 1400dh per night for a premium twin room (although we did get one night free as they had an offer on at the time so paid 5600dh in total). This also included free airport pick-up (although we had to pay an extra charge for transportation back to the airport at the end of our stay).    When we arrived we were greeted with mint tea and Moroccan sweet pastries (little baklava-style things). This set the tone for the rest of our visit - the staff in the hotel were very polite friendly and helpful. Our room was a reasonable size and very comfortable with a large bathroom (including a tub as well as shower). It had every modern convenience but also traditional charm complete with flower petals on the pillows every evening.    The hotel itself is a lovely a complex of six small town houses and a riad. It's pretty well integrated though so you can't really tell that it wasn't originally built as one building. The rooms are focused round a series of courtyards one of which includes a small swimming pool with lots of little tucked-away sitting areas.    Other facilities (as well as the pool) included a computer with internet access for guest use; a few books and games (chess etc); a bar; and a restaurant. There's also the hammam of course where we spent a relaxing afternoon one day.
