(We opted for a package which included hammam time with an exfoliation treatment with Beldi soap and a body poultice of volcanic clay - this cost 250dh each but we got a 20% discount on this as guests of the hotel.)    Breakfast was served in the hotel's restaurant which is half inside and half a courtyard with a glass roof which was very charming. The only problem with this was that there were several little birds (similar to sparrows) that flew into the courtyard every day and would brazenly tuck into the breakfast which was laid out there - not a very appetizing (or hygienic) sight! It could easily have been overcome I'm sure by keeping the food in the inside area rather than the courtyard area; or using a hard plastic cover instead of just cling film which the birds could peck through.    Breakfast itself was pretty good though (although most people seemed to avoid the dishes that the birds went for which wasn't everything) -- it included pastries cakes/breads cereal fruit etc as well as freshly-cooked eggs (scrambled/omelettes etc) and Moroccan-style pancakes (a little like very thin English crumpets in that they have air bubbles in the same way very tasty).    We also ate in the restaurant a couple of other times as well once for lunch and once for dinner. It was convenient to have a restaurant on-site and the food seemed to be quite good quality. But it was more expensive than equivalent places we ate in the town I think.    As well as the on-site hammam/spa treatments the hotel organises various other activities. We had a cooking lesson one morning which was one of the highlights of our trip. We paid 400dh each for this which included all the ingredients the chef (who gave the lesson) and someone from reception (who acted as a translator). We spent a couple of hours cooking and then enjoyed the fruits of our labour as lunch. It was a nice way to find out a bit more about Moroccan cooking and talk to local people in a relaxed way.    The hotel also organises various tours and excursions. These were very convenient as they left from the hotel but they did seem a little expensive. If you're considering booking one it seems to be the norm to do so once you've arrived so you don't need to worry too much about deciding in advance.    We decided the book two trips through the hotel in the end for the convenience as much as anything else. Our first was a day trip to the Ourika Valley -- you drive through the valley and stop in a few places for photos and end in a village where you can walk up to a waterfall (which wasn't as spectacular as I was anticipating I have to admit). It cost 350dh each and basically just included transportation there with the hotel's resident driver - you had to pay extra for a guide up to the waterfall and lunch etc.    Our driver was friendly enough but a little disingenuous I felt. A couple of examples - although we were advised by reception before we left that a guide to the waterfall shouldn't cost more than 100-150dh and not to pay more the driver presented us with a guide that he said would cost 200dh and that there was no alternative which we found a little strange; also we had understood from the information in the hotel that the driver wouldn't stop at any shops etc en route unless specifically asked to but we did end up stopping at a perfumery (which we'd actually been told was just a garden before we stopped) a pottery and a Berber house which again we found a little strange as we didn't want to make any purchases and had said so. It was all a bit uncomfortable and we did not enjoy feeling pressurised by an expectation that we were going to buy something (when we'd said to the driver at the start that we didn't want to). We did enjoy the trip and it was interesting to see the surrounding countryside but it didn't quite meet the standards that we were used to in the hotel itself.    Our second excursion was an evening trip booked to the Fantasia at Chez Ali. We paid 500dh each which included our transport there and back a meal and the entertainment (Berber tribes singing and dancing plus a horsemanship display). We mostly went as my friend is interested in riding but I found it quite an enjoyable evening too and there were mostly lots of Moroccan people there (ie not just foreign tourists).    Over all I'd give Les Borjs de la Kasbah a thumbs up. We enjoyed our stay here but I think it probably is a little over priced and as described above there were a few 'spoilers'. Plus I'm not convinced the excursions offered the best value either.    Marrakech itself an interesting place to visit it a little overwhelming to someone who hasn't travelled much outside Western Europe and North America. As two girls travelling alone we didn't feel intimated though which we had worried about beforehand. The poverty especially the kids begging took some getting used to though. I did actually suggest to the hotel that it would be nice if they had a place in the lobby (alongside their staff tips box) to donate to a reputable local charity but didn't really get a response to this!    One tip if you don't want to take a pricey guided tour is that the open-top bus tour (the bus touristique) offers a good introduction to the town.

I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. From the warm welcome we received through the smooth transfers through the beautiful breakfasts and dinners we ate there to the pool facilities and the luxurious suite we had it was WONDERFUL! Nothings was too much trouble. A must stay place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We only ate in the restaurant but the food was delicious and the staff very friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We could not find fault with his hotel. A cosy retreat from the busy streets of the Kasbah & Medina. Staff were extremely pleasant and tended to our every need. Great breakfasts. Restaurant (French & Moroccan menu) and snack bar served freshly prepared delicious meals. Rooms tasteful well appointed and very peaceful. Swimming pool refreshing & Hammam well worth a try - came home with skin as soft as a new baby. About a 10 - 15 min stroll from the main square. Would not hesitate to recommend this charming hotel to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: All of the wonderful reviews about this place were so true it is a splendid retreat amid the frenetic streets of Marrakech. The staff is excellent incredibly attentive and hospitable. The restaurant was wonderful we had dinner there a few nights. Breakfast in the morning had everything imaginable. The hamam and spa was well worth it and a delightful end to a day of wandering around Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: my second visit to this hotel it was fantastic the first time and has not disappointed me on my second visit. Nadia and Mohammed were wonderful although it would be unfair to single them out because all of the staff are fantastic as 5 ladies travelling together the front desk really looked after us made great recommendations for places to eat and sorted out our travel. They found us a great guide who took the five of us on a walking tour round the medina and answered all of our questions its well worth doing this. what can I say except we will be back again

Everything was perfect! We were picked up efficiently from the airport by the hotel's driver. On arrival at the hotel we were given a wonderful welcome with a very relaxed check-in drinking complimentary mint tea. Because they had realised from the DOB on my passport that my birthday was a few days after our trip (not the reason for going I might add!) they gave us a free room upgrade. I expect all the rooms are probably very nice and I think the upgrade just gives you that much bigger a room. Our rooms were both superb. The bedroom and bathrooms were clean and spacious and full of character. The rose petals were a sweet touch! Because we were only at the hotel a short time we didn't use the spa or pool facilities which although small would have done the job perfectly if we had wanted to use them. Breakfasts were continental style not a huge choice but nothing to complain about. We ate a couple times at the hotel (lunchtime and evening) and all the meals were very good. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly and made you feel that nothing was too much trouble for them. In our opinion the hotel was in a perfect location. Far enough out to be quiet and away from the hustle bustle but still only a 15 or so minute walk into the centre of things. I based my choice for this hotel on the reviews that I had read and I'm so pleased I did. It was superb and I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a short stay in Marrakech.

Our second stay at Les Borjs de la Kasbah service still as good as three years ago rooms (we had 3 in total) were all excellent - staff were very accomodating. Would recommend booking a private guide through the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble - we will definately come back and stay again. Spa was excellent and very reasonable in price.

Review_Title: A gem of a place in a great location..
Review_Text: I was looking for a few days away alone to combine relaxation with a bit of culture and came across an old Guardian travel article about this place. Looked at the hotel website and decided to go for it. They collect you from the airport for free in their very nice hotel minibus. You would never find the place alone as it is within the labyrinth of old streets within the Medina. Upon entering the small entrance you cannot be disappointed. The little central court yard is so tranquil and beautiful and the reception staff charming especially the lovely Nadia. In fact all the staff are extremely kind and very unobtrusive. I had a small double room at a very good price (considering most place charge supplements for solo travellers). Lovely with a gorgeous bathroom although I will agree with another reviewer that the beds are very very firm...maybe that is common in Morrocco? Anyway super clean nicely furnished with s luxury feel. Great breakfast too. Location wise I thought it was perfect because you feel you are staying in an authentic living working part of the ancient city as oppose to the bigger chain hotels which are in the newer part. A 10 walk and you are in the mad Jemaa el Fna square where it all happens. Lovely to get back to this peaceful hotel at the end of the day (and as a single woman traveller I felt completely safe). Great spa treatments too with a lovely pool. I will definitely return.

Review_Date: Miranda B wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Title: An oasis in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: This was my second visit to the hotel and I was not disappointed. Stepping from the bustle and dust of the narrow street we were welcomed into a cool calm and beautiful riadh. Smiling girls greeted us with hot mint tea and our room was perfect - large and beautiful. The feel of this hotel is one of luxury intimacy and warmth though I'm sure it's refreshingly shady in the Summer! The attention to detail extends right through the building from the architecture and furnishing to the service and the food. The spa with it's traditional hammam simply the icing on the cake.

Review_Title: Oasis of calm, tranquility and comfort
Review_Text: I stayed here with a large group of extended family and we had a genuinely wonderful time so wonderful in fact that we spent much more time in the hotel than we would normally on a holiday to such an interesting country. The attention to detail at Les Borjs is second to none every tiny thing has been thought through and the little luxuries really add to your stay. From the authentic artisan-made fitting and finishings to the monogramed towels and flower petals on your pillow I can't think of anything I would add to my marvellous experience here. The food is of particular note and especially welcome to the many vegetarians in our party who found eating out a little difficult in the rest of Marrakech. Considering the 5 star luxury on offer the price is extremely reasonable and the location is excellent walking distance to the main square through a fascinating old fashioned Kasbah. The hotel staff are all fantastically helpful and professional but maintain a distance that is comforting to uptight Brits like us. They were particularly helpful when the King's convoy potentially blocked our way to the airport without them I would have had 12 stranded family members including a 90 year old woman and three babies! They also helped us arrange a day trip to another city recommending hotels attractions and transport. The hotel beds are amazingly comfortable an the ambiance is quiet without being staid. I didn't visit the hamam but some of my family did and absolutely loved it. I can't recommend this place highly enough it's really worthy of being voted the number one hotel in Africa.

Review_Title: Not overly luxurious, yet cozy & with friendly service
Review_Text: I stayed in the Borjs recently among other places in Morocco. This was my last stop before I headed back home. The hotel is very comfortable and clean and the young staff very helpful friendly and attentive. The rooms are somewhat modern and well laid out. The food is very good breakfast in particular. As the hotel is an amalgamation of numerous smaller riads it does feel a bit less personal than a single riad unit.  In spite of what most places say all over Morocco (they all tend to tell you that given their privileged location you are always right at the centre of the action!) Les Borjs is not 5' away from Djemaa Fna but a good 15/20' walk instead. Make a wise decision: spend a couple of bucks on your taxi ride back after dark.

Review_Title: Fantastic hotel, one of my top 5 ever. Super staff
Review_Text: We stayed here for five nights after a tip from a friend. Gorgeous rooms: we stayed in three different rooms one suite and two doubles because we had booked three nights and decided to come back after a trip to Essaouira. Pool is very nice and cosy not perfectly fit for a 3 and a 5 year old but there was a small strip where our kids could stand in the water. The architect did a fabulous job.  One very very small thing to think about is that the suite we had (room 202) is above the kitchen and so when people clean up or prepare breakfast you can hear them. But we're not complaining we loved the room anyway. This is no issue in rooms 205 and 305 that we had later and are on a different courtyard. Staff was wonderful breakfast excellent. Superb bathrooms.  It's in teh Kasbah so you will most likely need a taxi driver to get you there the first time.

Review_Title: Great hotel, friendly and relaxing 5 stars
Review_Text: I chose Les Borjs because of the 5 star reviews I saw on Tripadvisor and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were extremely helpful friendly and really made me feel welcome. I was in a single room which was spotless and a good size with shower and bath tv etc etc. After the noise and heat of Marrakech it was a real treat to come back and relax at Les Borjs. The location was excellent and aboout 10 mins walk from the main square and souks. Beware of one or two people outside and unconnected to the hotel who will try to get you to give them money for no apparrent reason. The restaurant is great and you can have ommelettes freshly made for you in the morning - stacks of other food as well. Overall one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

My wife two sons and girl friend stayed for three nights. Very comfortable rooms friendly staff good facilities and great breakfasts. Lunch on our last day was good too. Located close to the rue de la kasbah it was easy to get around - either walking or by taxi (which the riad was very pleased to arrange). The hammam and massage was a real treat!

Our experience in Les Borjs de la Kasbah was incredible.  We were not sleeping there but we took the cooking course. We got lost on our way to the Les borjs and when we got there Nadia’s smile welcomed us friendly. They gave us a tea and some biscuits and we felt like princesses in that beautiful surrounding.  The course was just perfect. We could choose the menu in advance (out of three) and we prepared 3 dishes and the tea. Meriem showed us how to do it and then we were practicing ourselves so we could watch take notes and cook. Nadia translated everything into English always with her smile.  Afterwards we had our lunch in the patio the food was absolutely delicious!!  This was our best experience in Marrakech and I want to thank all the staff who took care of us for their professionalism and kindness.  Shokran!!

Review_Date: Kevin C wrote a review Nov 2010
Review_Text: Stayed with my girlfriend at Les Borjs for 3 nights. The hotel was absolutely gorgeous down to the smallest detail. The hotel is truly an oasis of peace and quiet in the middle of hectic and overwhelming Marrakech. The interior courtyards were very impressive with fountains palms and beautiful tiling all around. The room was very comfortable and the staff even spread roses around our bed and bathroom for our welcome. Excellent value for the money. The breakfasts were also very tasty. The only drawback is its location. It's about a 20 minute walk to the main square the Djemma al Fna (unsure how to spell it) through narrow streets where cars and motorbikes barely miss you as they buzz by. I would recommend making a right as you go out of the hotel and walking on the main road along the kasbah walls.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Delightful service, but a little out of the way
Review_Text: Hidden in a secluded corner of the old city and not easy to find at first but once there the service is out of this world. Nothing is too much trouble for the attentive staff. Excellent restaurant in the hotel but going out requires either a walk along the Rue de la Kasbah which is not particularly pleasant or negotiation with the driver of one of the "petits taxis" which ply for hire in the old city who may or may not understand any European languages or know where he is going.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing riad - service, food, cleanliness could not be bettered.
Review_Text: My friend and I (mature ladies!) stayed here for 4 nights in a superb twin room overlooking the central courtyard. We loved the rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom - we commented that this would be an ideal honeymoon hotel! Once inside the riad it was hard to believe we were in the bustling city of Marrakech as the only sound was from the birds!  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff - Mohammed on reception booked taxis had money changed and organised a trip into the Atlas mountains which suited our needs rather than the standard trips. Fatima in the restaurant was friendly and welcoming.  The staff in the spa were excellent - I would recommend the hammam it's a very special expereince!  I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech - it is a little way from the centre but we found this a bonus as it was so peaceful.

We have just returned from a wonderful week at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. From the minutew e arrived we were treated like royalty! Every member of staff (from cooks porters cleaners to restaurant and reception staff) gave us the utmost help and courtesy. We enjoyed fantastic food in the restaurant (starting each day with a sumptuous breakfast) and a relaxing time in the hammam. Hotel organised various trips out (very good and a little cheaper than our holiday company's) and nothing was too much trouble. The setting is great but is about 15 minutes walk from the main square. We would love to go back and would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We really enjoyed Marrakech and Les Borjs is truly an 'Oasis' of luxury and peace in this interesting and bustling city.  Rooms are lovely and look out over the courtyard pool is heated with lunch loungers and drinks available at the pool bar. Would have liked to have had more time to try the Haman but hope to return soon.  Helpful 'Concierge' service from Mohammed at the front desk and friendly service at the bar and restaurant from Fatima - thank you. You can walk to the centre of Marrakech and the sights from here.  The food in the restaurant is delicious with extra 'amuse bouche' courses served before starter and desert; reasonably priced and served in the atmospheric dining room. Breakfast was the full works with French and Morrocan pastries fresh fruit cereal eggs and hot special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm in the madness of the Marrakech Kasbah
Review_Text: I spent 5 days with my mother and aunt (both seniors) at Les Borjs de la Kasbah (BK) in late Sept.2010. It was the first visit to Marrakech for the ladies and the bustle of the Kasbah was a little overwhelming for them. Each time they opened the doors of BK they felt as though they were entering an oasis of calm leaving the madness behind.  The hotel is built to traditional riad style with the rooms looking over a beautifully tiled courtyard. There are a number of communal areas which open onto the courtyard and can be used for having tea reading or just spending some quiet time in a comfortable and relaxing environment. The whole hotel is scrupulously clean decorated to an very high standard and the staff work extremely hard to ensure your every need is met.  The only small drawback is that the hotel is at the far end of the Kasbah meaning a 25 min walk to get to the Djemma el Fna which in the heat and crowds was a struggle for the ladies. However walking to the Bab Agnaou meant picking up a 'petit taxi' was a cheap and easy way of getting around town.  I have now stayed twice at BK and would happily visit again as wold the ladies!

My wife and I had a great stay at this lovely riad. The room was clean well-appointed and cool (which was a great relief from the raging heat) and the riad itself was extremely comfortable with a much-needed pool. It was quite an oasis from the madness in the streets outside.    The location of the riad is brilliant and is in the old medina near the Saadian Tombs and Badii Palace and gave an insight into the real street life (as opposed to that in Hivernage). It is only 15 minutes walk to Jemaa El Fna and Koutoubia Mosque.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We just loved this place. It was 5 houses that have been knocked into one. From the outside looks like nothing but beautiful and serene inside. Good sunbathing midday by lovely pool. Would recommend to anyone - I would be very surpised if anyone could be disappointed by this lovely hotel. 15 rooms I think which was a good size.

Review_Title: Excellent adventure at the Borjs de la Kasbah
Review_Text: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Marrakech staying at the Borjs de la Kasbah - probably the best idea I've had. Great riad in both location and the quality of service they provide giving you excellent meals a good sized pool for relaxing in or by (some people from other hotels paid for meals so they could use it).  The single room is roughly equivalent in size to a city hotel but with nice Moroccan styling and superb air conditioning (necessary in 40 odd degree heat of August). Also there were nice touches such as rose petals on the bed on arrival the well stocked mini-bar and the bathrobe for the spa treatments.  The meals on offer were excellent 3 course meals or the option of a la carte dining if you preferred being half-board I was given a meal of the day menu with two options each for starter main course and desserts. Breakfast was Moroccan pancakes crepes croissants etc... But the best meal was the Moroccan evening where dancers and musicians played while you were served a set Moroccan themed meal - an excellent evening.    I also took a couple of the excursions using the Borjs minibus which despite the heat was largely comfortable and Abdul the driver was extremely good and informative - speaking French and English. The trips to Ouarzazate / Ait Benhaddou (where Lawrence of Arabia was filmed) and Cascades d'Ouzoud (waterfalls) were fantastic - if a little expensive for one person - check to see if anyone else would like to go so you spread the cost.    Marrakech itself is a little crazy and hectic at times but the hotel is like a oasis of calm very quiet with excellent and attentive staff who litterally cannot do enough for you. I would definitely recommend this hotel as the best value in Marrakech and plan to use it again someday. I really cannot stress how good my experience of the Borjs de la Kasbah was and it made the holiday great.

Review_Title: It was wonderful to experience Marrakesh staying in such wonderful surroundings.
Review_Text: We've just arrived home after staying at Les Borjs de la Kasbah. We went to Marrakesh to celebrate our wedding anniversary and usually stay at 5* corporate hotels. However we had a certain search criteria and Les Borjs looked like the closet to our match. We were so pleased with our choice It was such a wonderful experience the staff were incredibly helpful throughout the hotel. Our room was lovely and much bigger that I was anticipating. We ate in the restaurant a couple of times and the food was fantastic. Another comment I read on here was that the pool can be become very busy which we noticed on a couple of days. However we also had a couple of days were there weren't many people around the pool at all.    I thought that this hotel was fantastically located for the main square and once inside it was incredibly relaxing and quiet. We had both enjoyed a Hamman on our last day which was another fantastic experience the hotel provided.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great hotel in the Kasbah / old part of town. Rooms are large & very comfortable. Pool area is on the small side especially if the hotel is busy i.e. getting a bed can sometimes be a problem. However having access to the pool after walking around the town / sights was another luxury.  Breakfast is plentiful & of a good quality.  All the staff are excellent & offer fantastic service with a smile.  Hotel is around a 15 mins walk to the Medina / Square & the local traders are keen for you to buy from their shops albeit this a common theme anywhere in the old town.  Petit Taxis are a good way to get out & about especially in the evenings & a return trip to the Medina or even new town should be around 100 dirhams.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic place to stay, made our stay in Marrakech perfect
Review_Text: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August 2010 we found this hotel was a excellent as all the other reviews on trip advisor suggested.  We were able to easily arrange airport transfers via email for a reasonable price the driver was very friendly & knowledgeable and their comfortable people carrier was also available for excursions etc.  On arrival the staff were very friendly especially the manager Mohammed we were served complimentary mint tea and very tasty cake/sweets.  The food in the restaurant was of a very high standard warranting the higher price than other local restaurants.  The pool was excellent for relaxing out of the very hot midday temperature it also has a bar which serves reasonably priced snacks and light lunches.  There were several lounge areas close to the bar both inside and out with free wifi and even a computer free to use for internet browsing.  We found that our room was excellent very well decorated in the traditional Moroccan style with high quality bedding towel's bath robes naturally produced soaps and very effective air conditioning.  The bathroom was consistently decorated with the rest of the room with a very pleasant bath and shower.  We also went on the fantasia horse show excursion which although slightly expensive was really good 5 course meal great entertainment and travel to and from it which was about 30 mins.  All in all we found that the hotel was great quality had fantastic service and was in a great location about 15 mins walk from the main square so you are close to the culture but have all the amenities you would expect from a modern hotel.  This hotel really is an oasis of calm and comfort in a very hectic city really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again and recommend for anyone wishing to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely Riad in the Chaos of Marrakesh
Review_Text: This is a gorgeous hotel in the middle of the craziness that is Marrakesh. The rooms are well appointed with air conditioning for the summer or heating as we needed in the middle of winter! Rose petals on the bed everyday were a lovely touch.    The pool is lovely to relax by after a day wandering around Marrakesh. The hammam and massage were good too.    Had dinner there a couple of times which was good but by far the best was the mint tea and little moroccan cakes and biscuits that we had at least once a day in the relaxed bar whilst we were there.    The staff are great all of them were extremely helpful and it was interesting to talk to Francoise about the environmental practices that they try to employ at the hotel.    Whilst I was happy enough to leave Marrakesh I didn't want to leave this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A real gem in busy Marrakech
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend and I think we couldn't have chosen better. Staff is really friendly and helpful rooms are clean and comfortable the mint tea is perfect!  We've also taken a day trip to the atla's mountain organized by the hotel which was also great.  They have a very nice restaurant too.  We have absolutely no complaints about the hotel - Marrakech in the other hand was kind of disapointing... streets are crazy traffic is just non sense and when you go to the market thousands of seller practly force you to buy stuff. You get lost easily and local people try to confuse you even more so they can charge you later to help you get back to a familiar spot... It was certainly a once in a lifetime (literally) experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Guy S wrote a review Jun 2010
Review_Title: An oasis in the crazy Kasbah!
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights to roughly coincide with my birthday. From the moment we arrived at reception the welcome was warm and friendly - as was the complimentary mint tea! We had booked a superior room which was pretty large very comfortable and well appointed (and on special offer at 4 nights for the price of 3!) .    We ate out each night except the last when we had a very enjoyable meal in-house which was pretty reasonable pricewise. The first 3 nights we ate at Chez Chegrouni (authentic unlicenced on Main Square nr Cafe de France) Le Marrakchi (touristy with belly dancing!) and Riad des Mers (specialist seafood in a riad) all of which were excellent but Chegrouni on the main square was without doubt the most authentic & best value for money. We had excellent lunches at The KozyBar (Place Des Ferblantiers nr Bahia Palace) & The Old Post Office (New City behind the new Post Office).    We tended to do our sight-seeing in the mornings & get back to the hotel late afternoon to relax by the pool or in our room before having an aperitif in the courtyard before dinner. One day my wife and I had Hamman treatments which were very relaxing and excellent value for money. The buffet breakfasts in the hotel although not abundent were excellent - including the made to order pancakes cooked before you!    We visited many of the sights both in the Medina and in the New City and overall had a fabulous time and found eveybody to be very friendly. One of the better places we found for shoppong as an alternative to the main souks was the Artisan Centre on Rue Mohammed 5 which is a co-op and haggle-free zone! The Main Square at night time is a crazy place & you need to have your wits about you but we never felt threatened despite walking wherever we could rather than taking taxis.    We would recommend Marrakech and more importantly Les Borjs des La Kasbah without hesitation and would specifically mention a number of their excellent staff who made our visit a bit more special - Mustapha in the Bar; Fatima at breakfast (plus the pancake lady!); Nadia at reception ; Assiza in the spa/hammam ; Senna at the pool bar ; Naoul ; and last but not least Mr Tayeb the manager who gave us a lift one day to Jardins Majorelle when he thought the taxi driver was asking to high a fare!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great place to be if you want to be near to the Djemaa el Fna but far enough away. Not too much to see nearby and if you want to eat out you are a cab ride away from anywhere decent. Eating in the hotel is very good great setting and the meal with local entertainment should not be missed...    The staff are fantastic and their recommendations are solid gold.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Five days in Marrakesh is about three days too long. But staying in this Riad made it much more pleasurable. The staff are attentive and welcoming the rooms clean and spacious and although located in the kasbah you would not hear a thing once inside the Riad walls. We don't normally eat in hotel restaurants but the aggressive hassling from the locals meant we stayed in to eat at the Riad more nights than not - the food was excellent (the steak and the lamb dishes were superb).    We booked a guided tour on the afternoon of our arrival (you can get lost in those souks!) - in about three and a half hours we saw all there was to see of old quarters; the next afternoon we saw the new city. The main square at night is a sight to see but be warned - you will not be left alone and we even got people asking for money just to take photographs. The activities in the square seem set up purely for tourists and you can't just stand look and enjoy unless you retreat to one of the cafes around the sides. On reflection I wish we'd spent three days in the Atlas mountains but as stated above the Riad made everything so easy.    Having travelled all over the world I found Marrakech the one city that I couldn't wait to leave. Being so heavily reliant on tourism it would do well to remember not to bite the hand that feeds it - I didn't want to give a single dirham to the local businesses there who treated tourists aggressively - we are cash cows there to be fleeced. The friendliness of the locals soon revealed nothing more than a desire to take you to an uncle's shop or to ask money for 'accompanying' you to your location. So be warned and gird yourself whenever you leave the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for 5 nights in early May and we were very pleased with our choice. It's not really a Riad which tends to have only a few rooms and limited facilities it's technically a hotel since it was formed by combining several Riads. The advantage of this is that it has many more facilities such as a nice swimming pool spa full service restaurant and bar and an internet room which you might not find in a normal Riad but is still relatively small so still feels quite personal.  In terms of decor and ambiance I'd describe it as comfortable and pretty rather than seriously upscale and luxurious. We visited plusher place like Villa Flores and Jardins de la Koutarbia which are maybe more at the luxury end. However this is no bad reflection on the Borjs as the decor is tastefully done but it is more of a 'kick your shoes off' style ambiance which we much preferred. It is as others have pointed out a very pleasant haven to retire to after a day in the madness of Marrakesh Medina.  There are two main courtyard areas the one at the back being home to a pleasant swimming pool with a small cafe for lunch and drinks plus the spa and hammam. The front courtyard with fountain is classic Riad and a lovely place to sit with an early evening glass of wine (still too cool in early May to dine outside) and includes a Majlis style sitting area at one end and a library/enclosed sitting room opposite. The restaurant and seperate bar are also situated off this courtyard.  We opted for a suite (303) which was situated away from the main courtyard and found this to be very comfortable spacious (though I suspect the standard rooms are quite modestly sized) and surprisingly quiet with the morning birdsong the only thing likely to interrupt your sleep. Importantly there isn't a mosque within near earshot so you won't be disturbed by a 5am morning call to prayer amplified through speakers which we came across in other riads/hotels.  Food is a pretty good quality not haute cuisine but nicely prepared and tasty. In a city where hygiene is a consideration the kitchen can be viewed through a large glass window which is re-assuring. Breakfasts were the standard fare of fruit yoghourt pastries Morrocan pancakes and eggs any way but most if not all were home made (including all the pastries and even the chocolates after dinner). We can vouch for there being some skill in the kitchen because we took advantage of a cooking course where with the chef's help we prepared our own lunch of Moroccan Salad and Chicken Tagine with preserved lemons. This was a fun and informative morning and thanks are due to the friendly and helpful chef for being patient with us.  It's a good point in this review to make a mention about the staff generally. In addition to our chef all the staff were friendly helpful and pleasant to deal with. It was one of the things that made the stay so relaxing and so was much appreciated.  Marrakesh actually has a surprisingly large number of attractive looking Riads and hotels. I think the Borjs would suit those who appreciate quality but want the ambiance to be more relaxed rather than hushed tones-a place where you can be comfortable. I think Borjs de la Kasbah fulfils this brief perfectly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect Riad for your Stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Nadia welcomed me with a smile and I was offered a mint tea with cakes when I arrived; my room was spotless I found that it was very convenient to have a restaurant pool Spa Internet cafe on site. Prices were very reasonable. Breakfast is great. Location is really good 15mn walk from the main square. They also had a Moroccan evening just before I left with dancers musicians etc. A perfect spot for your holidays.  Another plus for me: i was able to have a Moroccan cuisine course with the chef; being a food lover I thought that was a really nice touch.    Un riad absolument fantastique pour des vacances paisibles; j'ai particulierement apprecie la gentillesse du personnel surtout de Nadia qui avait toujours le sourire. Le riad est bien place et vous permet de vous relaxer aux abords de la piscine au Spa ou bien encore dans les salons amenages a cet effet; vous pouvez egalement profiter d'un coin Internet tres appreciable lorsqu'il s'agit de confirmer votre vol de retour ou d'organiser les excursions.  J'ai eu l'occasion de beneficier d'un cours de cuisine ce que j'ai enormement apprecie; le Chef etait tres sympatique et tres professionel.  Le petit-dejeuner est excellent jus d'orange frais fruits frais crepes cereales etc; Myriam qui s'affaire derriere la plaque de cuisson et vous regale de ses crepes Marocaines.  Un oasis de paradis dans cette ambiance exaltee qu'est la ville de Marrakech.

Review_Title: The most perfect place to be stranded
Review_Text: We were due to stay for 3 nights at the Riad but it ended up as being 9. We were stranded by the ash cloud and no flights and whilst this had its problems the staff made us so welcolm and were extreamly good at accomodating us. This is the most charming and delightful oasis in what can be a mad and chaotic city  even the Kasbah has its moments just outside. We wondered where we were travelling to on arrival when the streets seemed full of humanity  then to find the delighful patio and mint tea and be enchanted by the place. The rooms vary in style we are uniquely able to comment having been in 3 and seen others  but most have a space and charm you will fall for although the dawn chorus of birds took some getting used to!  The bar has a good range of well priced drinks and the Maroccan wine is a delight to sample especially the Cuvee de President rouge.The restaurant meals are lovely and the Maroccan cuisine excellent the veal tagine especially. I loved the breakfasts with the pancakes and the eggs and these varied over the days a great start to the day.  The pool area is great although the water in April was a little cool to swim in and a shock on our system but in the summer ideal.  Then the staff are just superb I think its invidious to pick them out as all were so gracious multilingual and so charming you really felt the benefit of a small Riad in this way. However Mohammed the manager and Nadia did so much to try and help in the no flight predicament I could not ask for more from them. Mustapha on the restaurant was also very friendly and absolutely charming.  I thoroughly recommend this Riad why try anywhere else La Mammonuia at twice the price would not touch the personal service we received in our hour of need. Dont try the rest just settle for the best Les Borjs de la Kasbah    Thank you for your hospitality
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and luxury in the hustle and bustle that is Marrakech.
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we felt pampered and lucky to have found such a welcoming riad. The staff were extremely helpful the rooms were very well equiped and spotlessly clean and the food was of a high standard.  I would not hesitate to go back or recommend this to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A tranquil haven in the centre of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.
Review_Text: We had a really tough job trying to decide on a hotel in Marrakech as there were such mixed reviews of most places. Eventually we settled on Les Borjs de la Kasbah on the basis of what we read and kept our fingers crossed until we arrived. We couldn't have been happier with our choice! As soon as we arrived (the taxi driver had nto problem finding the hotel and gave us free bottled water on the journey too!) we were presented with a pot of mint tea and beautiful Moroccan pastries. A guided tour of the hotel followed and we soon realised that there were some amazing facilities especially bearing in mind the size of the hotel. Our room though not huge was lovely. The bathroom was enormous with two showers and two sinks!    Throughout our stay here we found the staff were all wonderful they couldn't do enough to assist us! Every day our pyjamas were folded beautifully on our beds. The fresh flower petals on the pillows etc. were a lovely touch. We ate in the hotel restuarant on two evenings and were very impressed with the food. The breakfasts were simple but very nice too.    As a city Marrakech is fascinating but very busy and chaotic. This hotel was perfect for relaxing in between wanders up to the square and through the souks. On one day we went on a hotel-organised trip into the mountains which we really enjoyed.    I would highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if ever I get the chance to revisit Marrakech.

Review_Title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah a beautiful quite retreat in the heart of the kasbah.
Review_Text: Just come back from a birthday trip with the 5 other girls. We stayed in Les borjs de la Kasbah following an article my friend had read in a magazine. The hotel was beautiful and the hotel staff could not do enough for us. When we arrived we were invited to have mint tea then were given a guided tour of the facilities before being shown to our rooms which were all different and very beautifil looking into the inner courtyard. Attention to detail was brilliant the beds turned down nicely and rose petals scattered on the bed and in the bathroom. There were towels supplied around the heated pool which also had some great showers. Food was excellent and very good value for money. A great experience in a mystical city.  Would recommend getting a guide to show you around we did and went on a 4 hour trip which was fantastic having the culture explained and finding some truly hidden gems we would have just walked passed.  The only down fall was trying to get some loose change to tip when out and about it was quite difficult but we managed it in the end.  We were initially worried about the dress code but there was nothing to worry about as european casual dress is acceptable its just a case of being sensible and not going out with next to nothing on remember it is a city not a beach.

Review_Title: Great place to stay, lovely riad and super staff
Review_Text: Had a lovely stay here and agree with most of the other reviews. Marrakech incredibly chaotic but this is just the place to come back to for a rest from it all. Everywhere walkable but we took the opportunitiy to eat out in different restaurants at nigt and the staff couldn't have been more helpful either with suggestions or transport. Would definitely recommend it to friends probably best for couples rather than families.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We thought the Borjs would be good from the previous reviews but it was better than we had expected. We could not believe how comfortable quiet and relaxing it was when just out side the door the noisy chaotic daily life of Marrakech continued. The room we had was clean and very spacious and every day the cleaner arranged the bedspread and groups of rose petals in different patterns. The bed was large and very comfortable. We had air conditioning and more important on a February evening good heating. The facilities were superb the spa well equipted pool heated and plenty of very comfortable places to sit and read. The Borjs is at the south end of the Kasbah which is about 15 mins from the main central square which is very busy and where most of the visitors head for. The Kasbah is more of a locals area and we felt more welcoming. We wanted a more relaxing time so ate in the hotel most evenings. The Maitre D and staff could not do enough for you The food was excellent and the best was breakfast with home made pastries freshly cooked pancakes and eggs. All in all one of the best places I have ever stayed in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: excellent hotel but not recommended when raining!
Review_Text: chose this hotel because of the great reviews in trip advisor and it lived up to its name unfortunately when we were there we did have two days of rain. to walk to the centre involves a 15 min walk along the passageways of the kasbah which became quite an experience when they became muddy and waterlogged! would thoroughly recommend this hotel but only for the 9 months of the year when there is no  rain
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It felt like living in a little palace with attentive servants!
Review_Text: Stayed for 3 nights in this wonderful raid and wish it had been longer. The whole place is beautiful clean and excellent value for money. The Spa and Hamman were great and very reasonably priced and the food was the same. It is well positioned in the Kasbah near the royal palace and very easy to find! The staff were extremely helpful and the overall ambiance was lovely. I can't recommend it higly enough

Ok - it was my first time I had stopped in a boutique hotel but was a great find through TA. First thing to say is don't be scared of the first time you drive to the hotel. The hotel is an oasis in the middle of the chaos of the kasbah. The staff were fantastic and nothing was to much trouble. We booked the suite and was a great size and very clean. We eat in the restaurant on the first night the food was fantastic it just lacked people as there was little atmosphere. Breakfast was great and fresh omlettes / pancakes were available when needed.    Location it is about a 20 minte walk to the square but the sights and smell from the Kasbah were fantastic even though tourists stick outlike a sore thumb we felt very safe and were always greeted with smiles.    We did not use the spa in the hotel mainly as we wanted to share the Hamman together and they could not fit us both in however we walked to the top of the rue du kasbah and found Alhambra spa this was great and we spent several hours getting pampered. I heard that the Bains de Marrakech were also very good.    We also found the Sultana to eat in it is a hotel however the restaurant was fantastic and staff were great we did try the restaurant just around the corner however we were disappointed for some reason the Italian influence on Morrocan dishes did not go.    Anyway if you are looking for a hotel in the culture of Marrakesh this is the place to go.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very attractive hotel helpful and kind staff (younesmohamedsofia  the charming naoual) quiet and well decorated rooms pleasant swimming pool.

Review_Title: STUNNING all round - a gem in the madness of the Kasbah!
Review_Text: My husband and I spent Christmas in Marrakech and were fortunate enough to book into Les Borjs de La Kasbah - possibly the finest boutique hotel we have ever stayed in.    The street outside the hotel is crazy chaotic and utterly Moroccan - the atmosphere once over the threshold is soothing tranquil luxurious and utterly gorgeous. All the sites and sounds of Marrakech are on your doorstep - the Djmaa el Fna is only 10 mins walk (or a short cab ride) away and the royal palace is at the end of the street.    The rooms are spacious spotless and really comfortable - the best bed I have slept in in YEARS! Huge shower in the giant bathroom and twin sinks with soft and fluffy towels and gorgeous cosmetics from the on-site hammam.    Nothing was too much trouble for the young energetic and friendly staff whatever time of day we were asking for assistance: reception staff ensured we were heading in the right direction giving useful advice and ensuring that taxi drivers didn't rip us off. The afternoon mint tea they offered was particularly welcome after a hard day pounding the street of the souqs and the buffet breakfast was fresh delicious and always varied and interesting.    The onsite spa was fantastic - the best facial I have ever had and although we didn't have time to swim in the pool it looked very inviting.    If I could award 11/10 for anywhere on earth this would be it - we'll be back as soon as we can!!! Visit today.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I last travelled to Marrakech 12 years ago and then the hotels were rubbish. I think the whole scene has been transformed since then and the Borjs de las Kasbah (BK) seems to typify the improvement. Staff were very friendly the hotel was clean charming and a very good price. Downsides were the distance from the main square (15min walk and half hour the first night when we got lost) and the shower was in the bath and flooded the bathroom. Overall excellent though.

We travelled to Marrakech for a 3 day break in November and booked Les Borjs following the reviews on Trip Advisor. I can honestly say that it exceeded all expectations.    All the staff were friendly and helpful and we were greeted on arrival with mint tea and Moroccan pastries which we thought was a great touch. We did have a moment of anxiety as we weaved our way through the Kasbah to find it in the taxi from the airport but once you step inside it really is an oasis you can enjoy after the craziness of the city.    The attention to detail was superb and the rooms were both authentic but had all the modern facilities you would expect in a good hotel. The bathroom was very spacious and the staff decorated different patterns of petals throughout the room every day we were there.    The heated pool was fanatastic to swim in after a day in the city and although we didn't use them the spa facilities looked excellent.    Its a 20 minute walk to the main square which is an experience in itself but we felt totally safe in the area and the taxis are so cheap you can always take one if you've had enough of being sold to or cajoled to eat somewhere !    All in all we had a tremendous time in Marrakech and the hotel made the stay if we ever return we would definitely go back there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are staying for our honeymoon and a birthday. . the staff are wonderfully welcoming. Nadia is a lovely warm understated lady who made us feel very comfortable with her smile  the hotel in the heart of the Kasbah. The location was great; the Medina was walkable approx 10 - 15 minutes (depending on how efficient you are in crossing the mad roads !) It is also near the Badi Palace the Saadien tombs. The Kasbah area was less 'touristy' and manic than the Medina so to come back to the riad after sightseeing was very restful.a hammam experience to be recommended at the hotel spa.  All in all we had a fab time and would definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynn H wrote a review Nov 2009
Review_Title: Paradise in the madness of the Kasbah
Review_Text: What a beautiful Riad.. Smooth transport to & from the Airport. Welcomed by the lovely Mohammed who took time to give us the guided tour then arranged our first meal in the Riad > Moroccan evening food excellent and thoroughly enjoyed our evening entertainment. Great start to our short break.. Our suite was to die for. One of the nicest rooms we have stayed in! Huge comfy bed rose petals sprinkled everywhere fresh fruit fluffy towels & robes > tres romantic! Plentiful breakfast which kept us going to Dinner. We ate at the Restuarant again and the quality of food superb. The staff are all so friendly and attentive and can't do enough for you.. The Riad in our opinion is perfect so peaceful total relaxation from the madness of Marrakech. Everything about this delightful little Paradise ticked all the right boxes for us & we will defintely return.....

Having just returned from a week in Marrakesh I feel I must write a big THANK YOU to Les Borjs De La Kasbah.  The hotel was all it said it was and more. Nadia and Mohammad (an asset to any hotel) could not have been more helpful friendly and good humoured. Nothing was too much to ask for - from booking trips restaurants taxis and even lending us money until the banks opened!  The hotel driver was great and was there to meet us at the airport on arrival and departure. He also took us for a day trip into the Atlas mountains where we learnt to haggle very quickly and got a reasonable price for our guide to the waterfall.  Marrakesh itself is crazy with lots to see and do and the location of the hotel is very near to everything. A walking tour of the town is recommended (our guide was brilliant) Then to come back to the peace and tranquillity of the hotel and a swim in the pool was heaven. The spa treatments are not to be missed The rooms are comfortable and clean with much needed air con.  All in all a perfect holiday and highly recommended.

Lovely Nadia and wonderful Mohammed greet you at this excellent unassuming and beautiful hotel in the buzzing chaos of Marrakech. The rooms are gorgeous cozy and comfortable and there is no better hotel to give you respite from the maddening crowd (which I loved!) in the Medina and the Town Square which is like nothing else in the world. All the staff are great and the food in the restaurant are great inexpensive choices.  This is a place not to be missed.

Review_Title: Calming hotel from the madness of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Booked hotel after reading reviews from Trip Advisor and to be fair this hotel was brilliant and totally what we wanted. As soon as your through the main doors you leave the noise and chaos of Marrakech behind and this being our first visit here this was very welcomed after a few walks around town!  Reception staff were very helpfull especially Mohammed couldn't do more to help and the morrocan tea and cakes served on arrival was a nice touch.  Rooms are really very nice huge bathroom comfy bed and air con rose petals scattered in different ways daily around the bed and bathroom.  Pool area was a great relief after a day around the souks shopping although due to the layout getting a sunlounger in the sun was a bit tricky but still really nice.  Restauraunt was ok felt that for the price it was expensive for what we got (but this was a problem with Marrakech in general food if you went to decent places was not cheap at all I dont mind paying for decent food at all but felt the prices in this place were really expensive for what we got).  The one downside which slightly soured our stay was one of the daytrips we took. We paid around £40 each for a trip up to the atlas moutains and this for what we got was expensive. Yes we got our own car and hotel driver who was helpfull to start with stopping off at a couple of local shops (which we were told they were not meant to do and after seing him get a cut of what we bought from one of the shops I realised why we were there!!) he then took us further up the mountains to meet a guide who took us for a walk/hike this was really good but we had been warned by reception staff not to pay more than a certain amount for the guide so I wasn't suprised when the guide asked for a third more than the maximum price we were told we should pay so I said what we had been told and was then shocked when the hotel driver said we should not listen to what we had been told and should just pay! But I stood my ground and after some haggling got the price I wanted but the drivers actions really wound me up and on the return journey the drivers mood had suddenly changed I'm guessing the cuts he'd been getting at other shops on the route had not been as much as he expected for the mountain guide. This was a real shame.  Overall though fantastic hotel friendly staff awesome rooms dont bother with the hotel day trips and dont expect a cheap break in Marrakesh!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice hotel, shame about the service
Review_Text: My friend & I didn't want to share a double bed so had to pay extra for a superior room with twin beds; would expect a choice of standard rooms with double or twin beds.    Before travelling we arranged by email with the hotel to be picked up at the airport (at an additional charge not free). We arrived earlier than expected waited 2 hours no lift appeared. We had no option but to pay extortionate taxi fare to get to the hotel. When we finally arrived reception was unattended no staff around and all the room keys hanging up in full view! Turned out all the staff had gone to break their daylight fast as it was Ramadan. Surely they could have taken it in turns instead of deserting their posts all at once?    When the receptionist finally showed up he said straight away "our driver went to the airport but there was no flight with the number you gave us". We showed him the booking confirmation with the flight number on - it was correct! Eventually we were shown to our room - very pleasant & clean with efficient air-con which we really needed. The hotel was very quiet and in a great location within walking distance of the main sights. Breakfast buffet was ok & you could order freshly cooked stuff (omlette etc) as well. The freshly squeezed orange juice was lovely. We ate in the hotel a couple of times and found the meals quite good although not gourmet but the service tended to be slow. The poor barman did his best but if you went early he was struggling to serve drinks and man the restaurant on his own. I think all this is down to indifferent management & could be much improved.    The excursions offered by the hotel seemed quite expensive so we didn't go; spoke to some people who had expected their trip to include visiting a Berber village but only saw it from a long distance away. We didn't use the spa but found the pool area very pleasant.    Outside the hotel was colourful fascinating & a great experience. However be prepared to be grossly overcharged when you buy anything from restaurant meals to peanuts at a market stall (I'm not talking about souvenirs etc which you expect to bargain for). We found the food bland & the restaurants in the medina didn't serve any alcohol but the mint tea was great. Also recommend the avocado juice - lovely & creamy & makes a change from orange juice. Overall a good place for a long weekend but if staying longer you would need to escape the city.

Excellent. Great location excellent rooms & facilities. Helpful friendly & accommodating staff right across the board. Quiet peaceful & relaxing Dining in the Jasmin Restaurant was good too and not expensive.  Really good finishing touches & detail.    All in all a definite must for your visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A lovely riad with lovely staff
Review_Text: After a delayed flight we were ready to relax. The driver was waiting for us at the gate and patiently waited longer as we queued for cash (which never came as the machines at the airport had run out.)  Upon our arrival at the hotel we were pleased to meet the charming and good humoured Mohammed who introduced us to the hotel with a brief tour before showing us to our rooms where our luggage had been delivered. The big but cosey room was a pleasant suprise with rose petals on the bed and icy cold aircon.  The riad proved to be a soothing oasis with staff helpful but not imposing a lovely pool and clean rooms and facilities.  The walk to the medina was a little intense particularly in the claustrophobic august heat. Dodging mad moped drivers and cycles weaving in and out of streets full of busy locals it was certainly a taste of the frenetic city life of moroccans outside the touristy medina. This is really the only drawback of the hotel which would have been perfect if it was located on the quieter and more relaxed north of the medina. But we were first timers and I'm sure more experienced travellers would have no problem navigating the city streets.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting. It felt like a five star experience for a very fair price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in July 2007. Fantastic place just been converted into a Boutique Hotel. Pool was only just opened the day we arrived. Spa wasnt yet ready. First time in Morocco and was very pleased with our stay. Staff were very helpful. Food in restaurant was excellent although the meals were small portions. Had a few power cuts at night although this seemed normal. Will stay there again but at a different time of year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful haven of taste and peace in a city with such a great vibe
Review_Text: We stayed in Les Borjs for five nights (for the price of four) in August. It is a beautiful boutique Riad. We had read about it following a review in the Observer which noted that the owners had used local Moroccan artisans to convert the Riad that the staff are paid double the minimum wage and that locat herbs and lotions are used in bathrooms etc. The Riad is a haven of peace and traquility in this wonderful mad city. The staff are so attentive and helpful. The Hamman and massage facility is great. The pool was a blessing in the August heat. The only thing to consider is the 15 minute walk to the main square but you get to see some crazy Marrakech sites during this walk. All in all a completely wonderful place which we would definitely go back to.

Review_Date: Judith M wrote a review Jul 2009
Review_Title: A genuine boutique hotel- really fabulous.....
Review_Text: We arrived having spent time at 2 other Riads in Marrakech and the Borjs de la Kasbah really stood out as a special place to stay. The hotel is not a Riad as such (which means there are more than 6 rooms) instead it is a slightly larger property which means great service and better amenities. We were impressed by the beautiful pool as very few hotels in the medina have a proper pool we also loved the hammam and spa area. The patios library and lounge area add to the range of spaces to relax in. Our room was large and beautifully decorated with great air con (not always easy to find but essential in July) a seating area and lovely argan oil toiletries in the bathroom. The property has been fabulously well renovated and feels both modern and very traditional it is how I imagine staying in a converted palace would feel. We really loved this place and would definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved this place. Rose petals on the bed each night. Lovely and warm in the room when it was freezing outside. The hotel is a little way out right on the edge of the Medina but the walk to the "Big Square" is interesting and totally safe even for a sole female at night. I can highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed in Les Borjs de la Kasbah for a long weekend in May this year. The hotel is an oasis in the centre of the Medina with staff that are friendly attentive and helpful. Even the food was wonderful. With just over 10 minutes walk to the centre of the action (souks shops bars etc) it was the perfect place to stay. The rooms are beautifully decorated to a high standard with typically Moroccan details and cleaned to a very high standard with wonderful finishing touches like fresh rose petals sprinkled across your bed and sumptuous bath towels and dressing gowns laid out for your use. You don't even need to take towels for around the pool as these are laid out on the sunbeds for you. The spa is amazing - recommend the Hammam!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Set in the heart of the Kasbah this hotel is an oasis amongst the chaos that reigns in the heart of Marrakesh. From the moment of your welcome to your last goodbyes you cannot fault any aspect of this hotel. The staff are by far the greatest asset this hotel has as they work continuously to make your stay as perfect as they can.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Huge room, large bathroom, professional & friendly staff, great pool, perfect location
Review_Text: A fabulous antidote to the madness of Marrakech. We stayed in 3 Riads (incl Kasbah Bab Ourika in Atlas foothills & Villa d'Lo in Essaouira) during a 2 week stay in Morocco and this topped them all. No mean feat as they were all lovely. The best things about this Riad are the large rooms spacious bathroom the serene courtyard a refreshing pool with comfy sunbeds delicious food and friendly & approachable staff. Book this - you won't regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A charming and restful hideaway in an exciting city
Review_Text: I stayed for 3 nights in April and found Les Borjs de la Kasbah delightful. In particular the outdoor courtyard and swimming pool area provide a relaxing contrast to the bustle of Marrakech. The bedrooms and sitting rooms are charming and beautifully decorated in local style. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous.

Review_Title: In the heart of things - but still an oasis of calm
Review_Text: I stayed in the Borjs de la Kasbah for three nights in April 2009. It is absolutely delightful combining as it does a high but unostentatious and discrete level of comfort with the joys of good taste and delicacy in the way it has been renovated. I ate in the restaurant one evening and had a superb tagine. The hotel is also beautifully located in an unpretentious but convenient quarter of Marrakech with streetlife and animation all around but absolute tranquillity within the hotel precincts.

Review_Title: An oasis of calm amid the bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the Kasbah. Lots of attention to detail (rose petals arranged on the bed in a different pattern each day; Berber-style natural products in the bathroom); friendly and attentive staff who arranged our guided visits into Marrakech and the mountains; romantic setting and very peaceful. Marrakech is ideal for a long weekend away and Les Borjs is an ideal base for exploring Marrakech. I would definitely recommend it to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Borgs de la Kasbah Marrakech.  Date: April 24 2009  I have just returned from a weekend at this fabulous riad in the heart of Marrakech close to the Kasbah. I was really impressed with it for several reasons. Firstly the look and feel of the place transports you back in time with its open-air courtyards authentic tiling and Moroccan detail everywhere.  Les Borgs was originally seven houses and the owners have created a charming old-style boutique hotel with real character.  Secondly for such a small boutique style hotel - it has just 27 rooms - it has all the facilities and amenities of a much larger property. For example a relaxing and decent-size open-air pool on the rooftop and a luxurious spa.  Bedrooms are to a high spec from beautifully-tiled bathrooms to flatscreen TVs. Most rooms overlook the main courtyard and the suites overlook the pool area.  Staff have a can-do attitude which is refreshing too. They arranged a friend's birthday party and just got on with it and everything went like clockwork.  Last but not least I loved the fact that it was so discreet with a door and small sign on the outside neither of which suggests the rich interior the other side.  I recommend it highly.

Review_Title: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Recommend you stay well away!
Review_Text: We stayed here for the final night of our honeymoon. I paid extra for a 'deluxe' room. When we arrived they had no water. Instead of a king bed we had two singles pushed together (obvious from the headboards that were fixed to the wall). When I raised this with the desk they laughed at us and said "well that is a big double!". It was the most uncomfortable experience I have had in a hotel.    We also had booked a treatment in the spa. We had booked at the same time but they said we had to go one after the other. So my husband went first while I read my book by the 'pool' (if you can call it that). I then went up for my treatment. I sat there for approx 30 minutes before anyone came over. My 40 minute treatment lasted 10 at the most.    We stayed in 3 hotels on our trip. This was the worst location and I felt the most unsafe whilst here. We couldn't locate a good restaurant near by either.    Oh and the taxi they arranged for us. The driver ordered his live chicken at a hatch in the wall whilst we were in the back too. I had managed to avoid seeing the killing of chickens in public until then!    I booked this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews. Honestly I can't think of a hotel I have disliked more and felt more ripped off by. Stay away!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent four nights at Les Borjs de la Kasbah in early March 09. We had booked a premium room and although we didn't see the standard rooms we were more than pleased with the room. It was lovely and warm the bathroom had a heated towel rail which was a bit of a luxury for the cool mornings and evenings. The bed was huge and really comfortable the service was first class and all staff were very attentive and courteous. The bathroom was huge and the towels really fluffy. The two bathmats (one for the shower one for the bath) were gorgeous - heavy and thick!    There weren't many guests most of the time and even when the hotel was full on a couple of nights it was still tranquil and we hardly saw anyone. The buffet breakfast was more than sufficient (cereals croissant freshly cooked pancakes fruit toast eggs cooked in whatever style you wanted plus freshly squeezed orange juice). We ate a good breakfast and then didn't need to eat again until the evening.    The walk to the Square was about 20 minutes - there is a short cut through the alleyways half way up Rue de Kasbah. We enjoyed our daily walks up to the Square often finding a slightly different variation to our route and always noticing something different each time. It's not a quiet peaceful walk as you're walking through markets past persistent shop keepers etc but it's all part of the Marrakech experience. We didn't tend to walk back mainly because we'd done enough walking by then but could get a 'petit taxi' back for about 20 Dirhams (1.60GBP). Watch out as you can get charged 50 Dirhams - if you can't haggle one taxi driver down then let him go and try another - there's no shortage of taxis.    There was free internet access in one of the lounges and also Wi-Fi if you had your own laptop. Wi Fi wasn't available in the bedrooms but we never had any problems getting on to the one PC for occasional checking of emails.    This one of the best hotels we've stayed in - relaxing and small so it doesn't feel like a hotel. Would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights in February and had a lovely experience of Marrakech in general. Outside of the hotel it was pretty frantic but once you entered the riad it was tranquil. The staff could not do enough for you. We ate at the restaurant on couple evenings and certainly appreciated the beer that was on offer here as it was not readily available in any of the cafes in the centre. The room was small though the bathroom was huge. Our pyjamas were folded beautifully each day which was a lovely touch. Would definately stay there again if I returned to Marrakech.

We stayed for 5 nights in February and were delighted with our choice. The hotel itself is very attractively laid out and clean with great attention to detail by the staff. The room was very comfortable with a lovely view of the courtyard. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. We ate in the restaurant several times and were impressed by the quality. The spa and pool area were impressive for a hotel of this size - we experienced the hammam and would recommend it as a perfect way to relax.  Overall there was a feeling of peace and tranquility which made it a perfect place to escape from the chaos of Marrakech. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly they were simply superb. The hotel is a 20 minute brisk walk from the square but we didn't find this a problem and it was a good way to experience the street life by day or night. The only minor negative comment was the temperature of the water - could be a bit hotter although I imagine this would not be a problem at any other time of the year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brenda R wrote a review Jan 2009
Review_Text: Stayed at Les Borjs for a long weekend in August 2008 with my best friend and my 18 year old daughter. What a fab hotel and fab city!!    We arrived in Marrakech quite early and when we got to the hotel the room wasn't yet ready. We were given a cool drink and seated in a shady outdoor lounge area with some big comfy cushions to wait. They said it wouldn't be long - but in fact it did take quite a while. When we did get into our rooms they were lovely. Deep colours lovely tiled shower room and nice and cool.    As in all of Marrakech alcohol is difficult to find except in the hotels as it is obviously a Muslim country. The hotel did some nice cocktails limited choice of wine all quite pricey. We only had breakfast in the hotel which was a bit ropey - and worst of all - swarming with wasps! For someone who is allergic to these pests not ideal.    The actual hotel is delightful. All built inside a high wall like an oasis of calm in the midst of this mad city! The weather was hot and sunny so it was lovely to sit in the courtyard gardens or relax on a lounger by the pool. Everywhere clean and all the staff very nice and helpful.    Marrakech itself total madness 24/7. We tried to walk to the main square the first day - big mistake! It's such a maze of streets outside the hotel we got completely lost in five minutes even with the map! After that we jumped in a scarey taxi each time. All about 100 years old probably no mot's or even driving licences! Still cheap and fun - so who cares?!!    The square is great fun especially at night time when the food sellers come out. Where else can you see people queueing up to eat sheeps brains? Not in Oxford I can tell you. The whole place is filled with hundeds of people locals and tourists alike and apparently like that every day of every year. Beware getting caught taking photo's during the day the snake charmers and 'dentists' - don't even go there - try to get you to pay for the priviledge. The souk all around the square is extensive and you can get some great bargains. We bought leather bags and slippers glass lanterns the usual fake watches etc - all cheap as chips.    The Moroccans seem to be quite friendly - obviously haggling is the done thing - but if you do decide not to buy some of them can turn nasty. We didn't feel threatened at all even as three women on their own although my blonde daughter did get a lot of attention from the men some even asking for her photo with their children! Mostly it was harmless banter and did not feel pervy or threatening.    One day we took a taxi to Nicci Beach Resort which is out of town about 45 minutes in a cab. This is a fabulous place - very boutique hip and trendy an oasis in the desert almost. We got there at 12 noon opening time having called ahead in advance to ensure entrance. It was very quiet then with chilled out background music playing. There is a huge pool area with swim up bars and beach areas all surrounded with big wooden sun loungers with thick white mattresses or four poster beds with white canopies over - heaven! Mind you - you have to pay a minimum spend to sit in some areas so you can only sit where theyput you if you don't want to shell out a fortune.  As the day wore on the place filled up with all the beautiful people. The background music was replaced by a DJ playing the funkiest tunes and everyone was dancing - some out of the water some in. The drinks and food were very expensive - but it was all about the experience and that was great. They shut up around 6pm for an hour or two then re-open as an outdoor club in the evening. We left around 5pm and the road outside was filled with lots of very large shiney black sports cars and 4WDs.    If you get a chance to go to Marrakech you should definitely go it is a true culture shock. The only downside was the food - everything was grim. People rave about the cous cous and tagine stews. Well - maybe if you are truly starving. A big pile of tastless cous cous with a load of soggy vedg on top is not my idea of fun. Consider Marrakech if you're on a diet.    All in all a great weekend and Les Borjs a great place to stay.
